Summary: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous, inside and out, and the staff without exception is extremely professional and service focused.  The food is fantastic.  The valet is fast and efficient.  The rooms and bathrooms are first rate.  The tram ride and the Beach Club are amazing.   We did find that being Hilton Diamond doesn’t really garner much attention.  No mention of it at check in, no discussion of the benefits, no giving us that special feeling of being a valued frequent guest.  The $25/pp breakfast credit doesn’t cover most items on the menu.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: VERY comfortable and elegant stay at the Monarch Beach Resort
Summary: From the moment I was helped from my car by a couple of bellmen, I felt well taken care of. I was there for a conference and we had most of the hotel booked so the common areas felt like our own little neighborhood. Very classy decor (my room had been remodeled just 3 weeks ago - Rm 484) The bedding is cool and comfortable and changed daily if desired. Our housekeepers Alejandra and Ilina were a delight and always available for an extra towel or water. The catering was excellent - especially the sushi/ceviche bar one night. We had dinner at both Bourbon Steakhouse and Aveo (Private room which was lovely) Great service by Bruce and everything was amazing. Highly recommend the Churros for dessert! Also the Black Bean "burger" was delicious...sat at the bar and service was good and
Room tip: Rooms on first floor facing pool have firepits on their patios
Manager Response: Dear Wendy B,   Thank you for the positive review about your recent stay. I am pleased to know you enjoyed our newly renovated guest rooms, exquisite dining experiences, including Bourbon Steak and AVEO, and especially our True Waldorf Service. We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a detailed review and  we look forward to the opportunity to welcome you back for another luxurious stay in the future!  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Wonderful Location, Rooms, Gym, and Staff. But Check Your Bill
Summary: Location: terrific.  Easy to get around Laguna and parking valet service was quick, never had to wait for our car [you text them and they have it waiting].  Nearby restaurants: Coastal Kitchen was a standout, but so were Luciana’s, and for a quick lunch burrito you should check out Carmelita’s.  Wind & Sea in the harbor was nice for lunch-  with heated outdoor seating and a terrific staff. We also took the fast ferry to Catalina for an awesome meal at Brew House, bucket list hike up Hermit Gulch and the Botanical Gardens- nice day trip.   Rooms look like they were recently renovated.  Spacious, well lighted, with plenty of outlets for your electronics, very large bathroom with everything you’d need.  Staff: couldn’t have been nicer or more helpful. Everyone from the car valets,

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, impeccable service, perfect stay
Summary: Gorgeous space. Beautiful room, was upgraded to a room with a view of the pool and ocean. Hotel was super busy during the holidays but service was flawless. Housekeeping was immaculate and room service fantastic. The grounds are gorgeous. A wonderful place to relax and unwind. My family plans to make it a tradition to visit every December.
Room tip: Parking is insanely priced. It's 70 a night

Summary Heading: Amazing property (although they lost my car)
Summary: Awesome in every way except... they lost my car    First off this is a beautiful property. The rooms are large & luxurious. Everything is really nice.  Big negative – they lost my car! I ended up taking Lyft that evening and when I got back they had it sorted, but 20 minutes of standing as they first tried to get me the car and failed. (I almost gave them 4 stars for this but everything else was so perfect.)  And a pet peeve. To get ice, there’s no ice machine available so you have to call room service and then wait 10 – 30 minutes for them to bring it. And in the morning when my wife is still asleep, I have to go to the lobby and wait there 10 – 30 minutes for them to get it for me. Why do these expensive hotels not put an ice machine in the hallway so I can walk down and get
Manager Response: Dear DavidThi2,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review regarding your recent stay. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our renovated guest rooms and resort grounds. Summary: I’m writing this as I stay here. Took a one night getaway with the kids. HHonors Diamond membership is useless. I didn’t want to come by the front desk and preferred to use the online checkin- so I texted them via the app to request an upgrade- NO! They forced me to come by the desk. $25 food and beverage credit instead of a breakfast.  Dinner at AVEO was great. Room is clean. Shower is hot!  I called to ask for a late checkout given that Diamond gets up to 4pm.  I was told by the front desk agent NO! He was kind enough to give me 12 noon checkout. Too busy. How can they be too busy when all room types are available to book tomorrow? I told the front desk that it’s our anniversary tomorrow- didn’t send us a chocolate.  Going back to Marriott.
Manager Response: Dear GillnLA,  Thank you for your honest review and thank you for being a Hilton Honors Diamond member. Summary Heading: Great place to stay in the OC.
Summary: The staff at the hotel was fantastic. I checked in early and they found me a great room with a veranda and a fire pit on short notice. Axelle, the concierge was super helpful with dinner suggestions and the bellmen/valets were courteous and prompt. The hotel is the old St. Regis and has a beach club and private beach that you reach through a tram. I will definitely come back to stay here again.
Room tip:
It’s about 30 minutes from the hotel to Newport Beach and John 
Wayne Airport.  Take the 73...

What came next was something we have never experienced! Our son who is 6 has autism and is non verbal! Summary: In summary, my wife and I stayed at The Waldorf Monarch Beach for our anniversary a few weeks ago. I purchased flowers which caused a hold to be placed on our room until we arrived. After checking in, I came back to the front desk to ask for a room change, requesting ground floor access (which I had on a previous stay) so that we could enter and exit during Sabbath since we could not use the electronic keys. The representative named Daniel oddly asked me for my ID (instead of name or room number) and ultimately said to my face “we’re having an attitude problem here”. Presumably he lacked the intellect to understand my request coupled with a horrible attitude. Another rep effortlessly accommodated my request.  I returned in the morning to inform the supervisor of my interaction.

I wish that they would put a Waldorf Astoria in every city.

Highly recommended (actually we already convinced our friends who booked after a month!).

Summary: The grounds and hotel are stunning. The beach club is beautiful, and best of all the service is what you would expect at a high end hotel. We enjoyed the pools, hot tubs, the tram service to the beach, and the gorgeous beach itself.  Umbrellas were available everywhere in case of a winter downpour.  All of the staff are unobtrusive yet attentive, and so focused on you having a great stay…and nobody ever makes tipping awkward.  Everything is cared for just so.  you’ll catch quiet conversations about the fresh flower arrangements, people wiping down seats at a tram stop while confirming that yes there is indeed good fishing in this little bay, staff offering your kids toys from a treasure chest giving the adults a chance to talk to the other concierge…basically, never just one

Summary Heading: Wonderful family stay at the Waldorf
Summary: Used a free night reward plus points as Hilton Diamond Members. Was Upgraded to a fireside terrace room which was perfect for our family. We enjoyed s’mores on a rainy night.m. Our room was in front of the Christmas tree which made it so festive plus it had easy access to the pool.   Breakfast at Aveo - try the granola French toast. There is also a buffet available. shoutout to our server Kelly!  Tram access to the beach club was quick and without a long wait. The beach was glorious, especially coming from rainy Oregon :) Played volleyball on the beach; they had beach chairs and towels, as well as the Beach club for lunch and dinner. Tip: bring water! They have a station for that but walking all the way from your perch on the beach to the station might dissuade you from

Summary: We were truly impressed with our stay at the Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach. The hotel is large and feels like an expansive resort. Many of the rooms face the beach, so you are likely to have a view. Overall the setting of this hotel could not be better. It is in such a beautiful area!  Befitting a resort of this scale there are a few restaurant choices. While I thought the variety of the food could have been better (including the pool side menu), the setting of the restaurants was nice and the food tasted pretty good. We felt that the best menu was the breakfast menu at the main restaurant Aveo. Great variety and all really good!  The only disappointing restaurant was Bourbon Steak. We actually had Thanksgiving dinner here and it did not feel like it was worth the price. The

Summary: Stayed here for two nights using two Hilton free night awards that I earned with my Hilton AMEX. Between two breakfasts, one lunch, two dinners and parking, we spent ~$700. The rooms were great (we were upgraded for free as Hilton Diamond members), especially the bathrooms, large shower and tub but the pillows were too soft, you might want to bring your own if you live locally.   We had lunch at the Monarch Bay Beach Club--it was very good (fish tacos and clam chowder). Two dinners at Bourbon Steak--excellent--so much goodness on the menu beyond the steak including the kabocha squash soup and foie gras appetizers. Aveo twice for breakfast was just ok in my opinion. We had the churro waffles, pancakes, keto omelette and eggs benedict. Next time, I would grab something lite at the
Manager Response: Dear Gina D,  Thank you for your positive review regarding your recent stay with us at Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach Resort and thank you for being a Hilton Honors Diamond member. Summary Heading: Loved our anniversary stay at the Waldorf Monarch Beach
Summary: We celebrated our 41st anniversary with a 2 night stay at the Waldorf Monarch Beach.  It exceeded our expectations in every way, but especially as far as customer service was concerned.   The guest rooms have been recently remodeled and are “beachy” lovely.  Our room was very comfortable, with a balcony and great view.  Everything worked perfectly.  The impressive hotel lobby will soon be renovated, too.    We enjoyed our first night’s evening dinner at Aveo, a light dinner the second night at 33 North, multiple cocktails at 33 North, and pastries and coffee at Park and Parcel.  The food was consistently delicious and the service excellent.        The tram ride to the Monarch Bay Beach Club was easy and fun, and the drivers friendly and informative.  We had the opportunity to
Manager Response: Dear TravelLustArizona,   Thank you for your positive review regarding your recent stay at Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach Resort and thank you for choosing our property to celebrate your 41st anniversary. The hotel's beach club is a short 10-minute golf cart ride from the main entrance, but the ride is quite entertaining as the cart drivers provide commentary about all of the huge houses on the ride there. The club itself is excellent; it offers great views of the ocean and  sunset, and has reasonably priced food and drinks. We returned several times during our stay.  Unfortunately, valet parking has the ridiculous price of $70 per day. There is no self-park option and a car is virtually required because the

We ended up staying an extra day due to a medical emergency and Lisa at the front desk was very helpful and even was considerate of our situation by sending care trays to our room. It meant the world. This stay was the best vacation, even with the stress of the last day. We cannot wait to return. Thank you Lisa and Monarch Resort!!

Summary: This is a review solely on the reservation system and lack of communication. I called that morning at 10am and tried to cancel and re-book for December as we have an illness in the family and need to re-book. Someone at their location changed our booking the day before to a different room and it moved the cancellation window from the day before to 7 days before. I called Hilton to re-book and have now talked to 5 different people from Hilton and the Waldorf and the issue still isn't resolved. Summary: Excellent experience all around. We received a Diamond upgrade to a newly renovated one room suite with a partial ocean view. Room was exquisitely clean and fresh. We were also able to receive an early check in and late check out. The resort is perfect in every way. Pool area is great for lounging, the beach club was a perfect way to spend a day at the beach and the property overall is stunning with beautiful views.  Staff were all helpful, friendly and responsive. We look forward to returning!
Manager Response: Dear Culture286920,  Thank you for the glowing review regarding your recent visit to our coastal Southern California resort, and thank you for being a Hilton Diamond member. I am pleased to know that you enjoyed everything about your stay, from the newly renovated guest rooms to the private beach club, and especially the True Waldorf service from our team members. We are delighted that you are already planning to return and we look forward to welcoming you back for another perfect stay in the future!  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Favorite stay in the world…love it as a Waldorf too
Summary: This is my favorite place to stay in the world. I’ve stayed here countless times over the past 15 years and this stay again did not disappoint. Maria in Aveo remembered me from my previous stay in the spring. I feel safe and comfortable enough to vacation here solo. There is plenty to do between the spa, fitness center, beach walk, and pool. The pool has shorter hours now as a Waldorf but unless you plan a night swim it’s not an issue. The rooms are well kept and updated. Wonderful stay! I can’t wait to come home again!
Manager Response: Dear CATrvl08,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us a positive review regarding your recent stay and for being a loyal guest of our resort. Summary Heading: Beautiful, upscale property!   Feels like you are in Hawaii!
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights for an anniversary getaway.  It did not disappoint!  Check in was seamless and our anniversary was acknowledged several times during our stay.  Shout out to AJ at the front desk!  Every time we passed the front desk after check in, AJ made it a point to say hello by name to us!   Gorgeous setting, extremely comfortable bed, immaculate room, carpet and upscale furniture.  Nice restaurants on site.  Only complaint would be the $70 a night valet parking charge that seems very excessive since there are no other parking options.
Manager Response: Dear sandiegogirls,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us a positive review regarding your recent stay at Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach Resort. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to our resort for another luxurious getaway in the near future!   - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: When you arrive on· the sprawling property, with luxurious and manicured grounds all which provide stunning vista views from any spot on the resort. The Monarch possesses the grand entrance filled with many richly decorated patios, club areas and members only areas. the room amenities are lush and luxurious with the newest technologies.    The staff were amazing, attentive, helpful, polite, and most accommodating with requests. it’s is their staff that made my stay lovely and welcoming.  You have so many amenities. That include E-bikes, pedal bikes, all the beach toys, with amazing helpful staff.  Golf club with a challenging course, trolleys to and from the beach and valet service is speedy and professional. Beach volleyball set ups and Adirondack chairs around many fire pits

Summary: I arrived early the day before my conference started and they allowed me to check in to my room before noon that day. Had an amazing lunch on the terrace. The spa was able to get me in for a massage (one of the best I've ever had), and the entire experience was wonderful. Took the tram down to the private beach with is private and felt very safe. The Beach Club there is for guests, and you can eat or drink looking out over the water. They also have restrooms, showers and lockers. Hotel provided towels, chairs and umbrellas on the beach with easy access. Rooms is large with desk area, as well as a separate seating area and table. My balcony did not have a view of the sunset. You can book rooms with better views, or enjoy the sunset from one of the terraces. Bathroom has a huge

Summary: This resort is amazing.   From the time you pull in you know you are in a first class hotel.  The place is beautiful and the service is exceptional.  Bedrooms are huge.  Very comfortable bed, beautiful views from the room.  The front desk personnel are amazing.  Greatest customer service.  Highly recommend!

She also send a bottle of chardonnay and chocolates to our room when she found out that I was celebrating a birthday. That was a very nice gesture. The service was excellent everywhere. I would highly recommend this resort.

Summary Heading: Our room was not ready until 6:30pm!!
Summary: We arrived pretty early, at around 9am so we weren’t expecting our room to be ready. We went to Aveo to eat while we waited. About an hour or so we get a text that our room is ready, we go to the front desk to get our key, lug all of our stuff up to “our room” only to get the wrong room. We booked a room with double beds and the room they gave us had a king bed, chocolate covered strawberries and champagne complete with a welcome card that had neither of our names. It was clearly a mistake and was for a couple probably on their honeymoon or something.   Now, we had to go back down again with all of our stuff to let them know about the mix up. They apologized and said they’ll text us once the right room is ready. Seemed like an honest mistake, somewhat acceptable because it was

Summary Heading: VIP from the moment we walked in until we left for the airport
Summary: We stayed here for a girls birthday weekend.  From the beginning to end, we felt like VIPs and were overwhelmed with amazing service.    Room:  We chose the fireside terrace, which given the weather, we were unable to use but it did allow us to be on the bottom floor which was great easy access in and out.  Room was clean with nightly turndown service and was checked periodically for mini bar refills.  Mini bar had a S'mores package to use with the fire pit if desired.    Restaurants:  Almost all meals were delicious but Club 19 (breakfast), Aveo (breakfast) and Bourbon Steak were my favorite.  The food at Bourbon was so mouth watering amazing - from the first appetizer to the dessert.  I am still craving the Truffle Butter Rolls that I couldn't stop eating (though I tried to

Summary Heading: Gorgeous property, but check your bill before checking out!
Summary: You’ll need a few days to enjoy all of the recreational amenities at this beautiful resort - golf, pools, spa, fitness classes, bikes, and beach club. They are shared with club members who reside in the community. The beach club is reached by trams, which travel through the property on the golf cart paths. There are multiple trams, so the wait was usually short. We enjoyed beach chairs and umbrellas there during the day, and returned for a wonderful dinner at sunset. Make dinner reservations though, as we noticed several guests being turned away. We also enjoyed the golf course, but be aware there is no driving range. They have a hitting bay with nets, but could use a Trackman to make up for the lack of a range. The pool is well-maintained with plenty of chairs and a stunning

Summary: We stayed at this facility to attend a wedding for two nights, Aug 18 and 19 (Conf# 3257385669). Great facility and mostly enjoyed the stay. The frustration was entirely with the transparency in charges. Before the stay, I tried several calls to confirm the room rate, which should be $350 a night, the rate set for the wedding group. Finally got it confirmed after a long call with Sara, one of the staff. At the time of checkout I received (Folio No/Che 97533 A) the final settlement that showed a credit of $150.96. At that time I had deposited $500 with my credit card (ending 0199). I didn't get an explanation when I asked for details. After I left the facility on Aug 20, my bank statement showed two charges at $777.20 and $150.96. I called on Aug 26 asking for a clarification.

Summary: Cannot say enough positive things about the Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach. We spent a few days here after traveling from LA.   Check in was effortless and the front desk staff was excellent. She provides us with a complimentary upgrade and allowed us to check in at 12PM. Completely unexpected and appreciated on a holiday weekend.   Our room on the south wing was beautifully renovated and felt fresh and elegant. Very clean, great housekeeping with turndown service, and a very spacious balcony and soaking tub.   The Beach Club is easily accessible via free shuttles and it is a lovely golf cart ride down the golf course. Free chair and umbrella setup. No alcohol or drink service on the beach, but there is a bar up at the club. Shuttles were running about every 7 minutes during the
Manager Response: Dear A8335EMTC,   Thank you so much for your positive review and for choosing to stay with us at Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach Resort for Labor Day weekend. I was told that I could stay on and "use the facilities" even after check out,

There are many shuttles taking you to the beach. They run almost none stop. You would go through a beautiful golf area and under the pacific highway. It’s quite a ride and it takes about 10 minutes. Beach chairs and umbrellas on the beach for hotel guests to use. Water, too. The boys are very fast setting them up for you.

Our experience at other hotels is that the attendants offer to order & bring whatever we want from their restaurant or lobby, they have never suggested we go soaking wet to get things ourselves. We appreciate your review and we look forward to welcoming you back for another luxurious retreat in the near future.  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Waldorf keeps getting better and better
Summary: This was our annual trip to the property with our kids and grandkids.  The hotel rooms were recently remodeled, which surprised us as we thought they were pretty nice to start with.  But they are even nicer now, as they really did a good job.  We always wonder/worry which of our favorite staff members are still at the hotel.  The good news is almost everyone.   Danielle Fraiser and Ariel Lindsay always top the list, having between them managed just about every division with the hotel over the years.     Danielle does a fantastic job  managing the pool, which on a hot summer day with a big crowd is not easy.  Ariel is back managing reservations, where every single reservation detail is always taken care of.  I believe they are the two longest tenured people at the hotel, having
Manager Response: Dear billorangecounty,   Thank you for leaving a glowing review about your recent stay and for being a loyal guest of our Orange County resort. We are so happy to welcome you back for your annual getaway and so glad that you have become part of the Waldorf family over the years. Thank you for recognizing our outstanding team members by name, including both seasoned and new members, they are the gems of our resort and they are what make our resort so special. I am pleased to know you had yet another outstanding stay and enjoyed our newly renovated guest rooms. We look forward to welcoming you back to the resort for many more memorable getaways and family vacations in the future!   - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: My stay started off on a bad note at check in. Daniel was the person that was helping me and every request was met with a snarky “I can’t help you” type of attitude. My room was not ready at check in time at 4pm, but the other 2 rooms my colleagues were staying in were. He told us that he couldn’t put us on the same floor but we could be in the same wing, great. He also asked if the phone number we booked the reservation with was the best way to contact me when the room was ready, it was not so I gave him my cell number. 2.5 hours later still no contact from the hotel, so I went back to Daniel and he informs me that the room had been ready for awhile. He then proceeds to say didn’t we contact you at such and such a number. I informed him that he had taken my cell number and was
Manager Response: Dear lala155021,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent experience. I am disappointed to hear your stay fell short of your expectations. Please know your comments are being shared with our resort leadership as we continually seek to improve our guest experience. I would like to connect with you directly so that we can discuss your concerns. Please contact the Front Desk and ask for Elham Iskandar so that we can connect. - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: The hotel is lavishly landscaped, the rooms and lavatories are spacious and well decorated, everything very clean.  The personnel from the front desk to housekeeping to bartenders were all above and beyond.
Manager Response: Dear 81UTaustingrad,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a positive review. I am pleased to know that you enjoyed everything about your stay with us, from the spacious rooms to the True Waldorf Service provided by our team members. We hope to welcome you back again in the future for another exceptional stay at our coastal California resort.  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Should Be Renamed Nickel & Dime Beach Resort; Stay Elsewhere!
Summary: I stayed here for a business conference and all I can say is this place loves to nickel and dime you. When we checked in we were offered a refrigerator since all they had in the room was a mini-bar from the 1980's. They brought that in without comment and on our checkout bill there was $50 "Fridge Charge."   Upon checkout, I was handed a bill for one amount and then a day later there was an additional unidentified $7.00 charge. Since they have no way to contact them other than a very inefficient phone service, I had to talk to 3 people and ultimately got no resolution -- until I did a chargeback.   The whole attitude is how can we nickel & dime our guests. Will never stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear CiiSteve,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback about your recent stay. I am sorry to hear that your experience fell short of your expectations and I appreciate receiving your valuable feedback as we continually improve our guest experience. I would like to connect with you personally so that we can discuss your concerns and resolve any outstanding needs. Please contact the Front Desk and ask for Elham Iskandar so that we can connect. Also, please know your comments have been shared with our resort leadership and I hope you join us again in the future so that we can regain your trust.   - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Top Notch Staff But Beware of Renovation in Progress
Summary: There is a great deal to like about this resort, but your enjoyment of it right now will depend on how you want to spend your time. The staff are professional and polished, warm and friendly, courteous and helpful. Still, the property Is in the middle of a massive renovation. Not a change the wallpaper and drapes and freshen up the paint but a “down to the studs” reinvention replete with drills, screeching circular saws and pounding sledgehammering, oh the hammering. Reverberating through the ceiling and echoing through the HVAC vents, the hammering begins promptly at 8:30 am and work continues even on Sunday. If  your idea of a resort holiday is reading a book (or perusing social media) on your balcony or grabbing an afternoon nap in your room, then absolutely, positively wait
Manager Response: Dear jittery_eric,   Thank you for your candid feedback in regards to your recent stay at our Southern California resort. We are glad to welcome you back to our resort to experience the property as a Waldorf Astoria. In addition, I am happy to hear you had a chance to enjoy our relaxing amenities, including our fully immersive Waldorf Astoria Spa, the picturesque Monarch Beach Golf Links, our sparkling resort pools, and of course, our seaside private beach club with full restaurant and bar. Please know your comments have been shared with our resort leaders, and I do hope you have a chance to stay with us later this year to experience our renovated guest rooms and enjoy another intriguing stay at our lively Orange County resort.   - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: We have been Hilton members for well over 30 years. We have stayed at the property through several ownership changes. I never complain about prices but this hotel borders on the insane. We had coffee last night. A cup of coffee and two refills cost $27.00. $9.00 for the coffee and the same for each refill. Who priced this? Al Capone? That is not a restaurant; it is organized crime. I didn’t know whether to  ask for a manager or the mob boss. Seriously, was there a porterhouse steak hidden in the coffee cup. If they are going to rob the patrons they should have giant sign disclosing what their intentions are. There are more warnings posted about the potential danger in eating fish. Come on guys. This is ridiculous
Manager Response: Dear B832MGroberth,   Thank you for leaving a review in regards to your recent stay with us. I am disappointed to know your experience fell short of your expectations. Please know I am sharing your comments with our resort leadership and we appreciate hearing your valuable feedback as we continually look for ways to improve our guest experience.   - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: I stayed here for a long weekend, coming from New York. The hotel was fantastic. From the spa to the pool to the beach club, I loved it all. The lobby, rooms, and amenities are all spectacular. It truly felt like a luxurious home away from home. The cafe in the lobby is awesome for morning lattes, pastries, and a quick bite for lunch. The beach club was an incredible experience, do their beach restaurant for lunch or dinner, great cocktails and food. At the spa I had the best facial and massage ever. I can’t recommend this hotel enough. It was great.
Manager Response: Dear L6045UVashleyb,  Thank you for joining us all the way from New York, and for taking the time to leave a review about your stay. I am glad you enjoyed our relaxing amenities, including our luxurious Waldorf Astoria Spa, sparkling resort pools, and private beach club.  Additionally, I am delighted to know you enjoyed starting your morning at our coffee shop, Part + Parcel. We look forward to welcoming you back for another relaxing getaway soon!   - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: 5 Night Family Trip to Waldorf Monarch Beach
Summary: My wife, 1 year old daughter and I just returned from staying at this property and could not have had a better time. We celebrated our anniversary at the hotel and the staff and the grounds were nothing short of extraordinary.  As a Hilton Diamond Member we were upgraded to a fireside executive suit and the room was amazing. Room 162 had to be one of the best rooms on property for what we were looking for. It was large and very recently remodeled. Everything you would expect of a 5 star resort. The room had a patio with a fire pit which made for a perfect place for watching the sunset and enjoying room service. As a Diamond member we were also given a $50 per day resort credit.   The cleaning staff did a great job cleaning the room every day and even came by at night for
Manager Response: Dear joewG5688XF,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a detailed review about your recent stay at our Orange County resort. I am glad you chose to stay with us for your anniversary getaway and that you were exceptionally delighted with your experience, from your fireside suite guest room, to our sparkling swimming pools, private beach club, and everything in between! In addition, it is wonderful to know you enjoyed the attentive service from our team members and took time to give kudos out to these exceptional individuals, as they are what makes this resort so special. Finally, I would like to personally thank you for being a loyal Hilton Diamond Member, and we hope to welcome you back for another relaxing getaway in the near future.   - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: I would never stay at this Waldorf ever again. It was a construction zone at 8:30am( never told us) $1000 for 1 night. Sent you on a maze to get to your room. Room was worth $300 not $1000 and the noise was awful. Drills etc all day long. The most in relaxing time ever. Super snotty also about everything.   Go to the ritz down the street!!! Not worth it
Manager Response: Dear 274kimberlyv,   Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay. I am disappointed to know your experience fell short of your expectations and I hope you will come back to stay with us so that we can make it right. Please know your comments have been shared with our resort leadership and if you would like to discuss your concerns further, please contact the Front Desk and ask for Elham Iskandar so that we can connect.  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: My family (myself, wife, 9 year old daughter, and 5 year old daughter) stayed here for 3 days over Memorial Day Weekend. I'm a Hilton Honors Diamond member but I was not able to upgrade from the garden view 2 queen because we went on such a popular weekend. We were able to check in early on Saturday around 2 PM and check out later on Monday at 1 PM. It was nice to get to spend that extra time at the resort.   My daughters loved the pools and the hot tubs and they swam each day. They also enjoyed taking the tram to the beach club and had a wonderful time at the beach - it never felt crowded even though there were plenty of people there. Such a great location!  The room was nice and the bathroom was very large. We were on the 5th floor which is the same level as the lobby so it
Manager Response: Dear MichaelRinck,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your family staycation for Memorial Day Weekend. I am pleased to know you had a lovely experience at our Southern California resort and I thank you for being a loyal Hilton Honors member. In addition, I am glad you had a chance to enjoy our sparkling swimming pools, private beach club, and our exquisite dining options. We look forward to having you stay with us again for another memorable getaway!  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: My wife, baby daughter and parents had a 3-night stay here. We were very excited for our stay as the property looked beautiful online. However, to say this trip was a disappointment  would be an understatement.  1) Every single day the key cards stopped working and we had to wait in line at the front desk to get them remade. 2) They delivered us a “complimentary' microwave to use, but then charged us $50 for it. (They eventually removed charge later, although it took almost an hour to do so) 3) On our first evening of arrival, after a long day, the fire alarm was triggered. Us and our baby daughter were unable to get back to sleep. (No explanation was given) 4) Upon checking out there was a charge of over $3500 on the bill! The room was booked with points and shouldn't have had
Manager Response: Dear Shane816,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent stay at our resort. I am glad we were able to connect via email to discuss your recent experience and address your concerns. As we discussed, please contact me directly next time you stay at our resort so I can ensure your experience is seamless. We hope to welcome you back for a much improved stay in the future.    – Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Hotel was overrated, would not recommend
Summary: The stay was extremely subpar for many reasons. First of all, the rooms we got were not as shown as when we booked them online. We booked the King guest room with Terrace, and got a different room, which was on the ground level. They were not flexible with changing the rooms at all.There were multiple weddings every single day, and since they gave us a room on the ground floor, they were right in front of the patio, leaving us with absolutely no privacy and peace.   Secondly. we had to pay for a lot of things; even to use the lap pool, we needed to book and appointment at the spa  .Overall, the hotel was overrated, and just not worth it.
Manager Response: Dear fawadanwar,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent stay. I am disappointed to hear that your experience fell short of your expectations. Please know I have shared your feedback with our resort leaders and we will use it as valuable insight to continually improve our guest experience. Thank you again for your comments, and we hope to regain your trust for a much-improved return in the future.- Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Almost perfect with a really weird issue, bathrooms
Summary: The location is beautiful, the details are many, the looks are awesome.  However there's something really badly designed, the bathrooms, a bathroom door that's got openings , so there's no intimacy and can't even pass gas or going #2 without annoying others or feeling uncomfortable. Plus no fan in the bathroom, just a vent.  An additional weird opening from the main bathroom , so all the sound can go to the bedroom, wondering what kind of drug the designer was on.  Finally really difficult to move around the massive place looking for elevators, they're should be signs.  Come on, change all the damn bathroom doors ro solid ones already and put fans inside.
Manager Response: Dear DanSingSalChata,   Thank you for your very valuable feedback. We appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts about the guest room layout, bathroom design, and the idea to enhance our public spaces with more signage. Please know your comments are being shared with our resort leadership so that we can continually improve our guest experience.  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: Just returned from a one night at WA. Everything is amazing, Resort, Views, Trails, Beach, Room, Food etc. But most of all the staff. Started with email contacting me about few day earlier. Thank you so much Lucinda, your present was really appreciated by kids and adults. I'm a Diamond Member and I was upgraded to a Pool View Room. Mr. Lanza was very helpful with luggage and with the Room description. Tram to the beach was super and the man helping with towels umbrella and chairs was very kind. Overall a demonstration that the staff can transform an fantastic resort into a Wonderful Experience!
Manager Response: Dear spaxia,  Thank you for the glowing review about your recent getaway at our Orange County resort. I am pleased to know that your experience was exceptional and that you enjoyed the overall resort, picturesque views, scenic walking trails, our private beach club, spacious guest rooms, and exquisite culinary offerings. Also, I am glad to know you loved the warm hospitality from our team members including Lucinda, Mr. Lanza, and the beach team. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future. - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: My wife and I visited to celebrate her birthday and we can not recommend the Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach enough.  This was our first visit to to a Waldorf Astoria and we were very impressed with the properties great views, location with plenty of walking trails, and the town of Dana Point itself.  Even more impressive was just how much the staff cared about being sure our stay was perfect from an upgraded room at checkin and then each person’s care and professionalism along the way.  In room breakfast dining was also wonderful- we are still talking about the Acai bowl and waffle with citrus mascarpone and berry compote. highly recommend!
Manager Response: Dear LMtraveler2001,   Thank you for the kind review about your recent stay at our Southern California resort. I am glad you had a truly memorable getaway for your wife's birthday and had a chance to enjoy our scenic walking trails and a tasty breakfast at AVEO Table + Bar. In addition, I am glad to know you enjoyed the True Waldorf Service and warm hospitality from our team members. We hope to welcome you back for many more celebratory getaways in the future! - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: I can't say enough good things about this place, gorgeous setting, excellent service.  A few days before check-in, Lucina reached out and I told her the trip was to celebrate my mom's birthday, she replied and let me know she would take care of everything and make sure we have a great time.  She kept her promise!  My parents were delighted and surprised by the amenities they prepared. Everyone in the resort is friendly and helpful, from the bellman, Justin, to housekeeping to shuttle driver Steve, all wonderful.  I am already planning a return trip with my own family this year!
Manager Response: Dear MamaBellaLuca,   Thank you for your wonderful review. I am glad to know that you enjoyed the excellent service and setting of our resort. In addition, I am pleased to know you felt the warmth and genuine hospitality from Lucinda, Justin, Steve, and our housekeeping team, and that we were able to make your mother’s birthday special and unforgettable. We are excited to welcome you back for your visit with your family later this year!  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: We came in early for a few days before a conference.  This is a lovely property.  A number of the rooms have been remodeled and we were the first people to stay in our room on the 6th floor.  The room and bathroom are very spacious.    They have a great pool and beach club.  The Beach Club is a 5 minute tram away, but never had to wait more than 5 minutes to catch it.  The restaurant down there is a great place to catch the sunset.  The gym is also new and is part of the spa and they have a number of areas to workout in, swim laps, do yoga or meditate.  We did eat in several of the restaurants and thought the food was just ok for resort prices.  This might be the only minor disappointment.    The staff from the front desk, to the valet to the pool and beach were all fantastic.
Manager Response: Dear cseanmc,   Thank you so much for your positive review! I am glad to know that you enjoyed your time at our resort, including our newly renovated guest rooms, private beach club, and most importantly, the service from our wonderful team members. Thank you again for taking the time to leave us a review, and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future!  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: Food was okay. Service excellent. We didn’t like our room because there was construction and a set up for a large part outside our room. They immediately upgraded us to better room due to lack of availability.  All in all great experience.
Manager Response: Dear D5100KGrobinm,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent stay at our Orange County resort. I am glad to know you enjoyed your overall experience, especially the unparalleled guest service from our team members. We look forward to welcoming you back for another stay in the future. - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Gorgeous get away only 1 hour drive away from LA
Summary: We loved our stay! We could tell and feel that we experienced a 5 star hotel service! Starting from the reception - front desk guy was very clear and explained everything! Next is the pool is very big and not that crowded even tho there were some kinds there was still lots space. Since I am diamond Hilton member we got an upgrade to a gorgeous ocean view studio! But the main thing is a service, when you stay here you will feel it! Highly recommended 10 our of 10! oh and also Monarch bay beach club restaurant is highly recommended - food was delicious and the view is gorgeous!
Manager Response: Dear aripbekovaidos,   Thank you for your wonderful review. I am glad to know you enjoyed your experience at our Southern California resort, including our spacious guest rooms, sparkling swimming pools, and our private beach club. In addition, I am pleased to know you felt the warmth and genuine hospitality from our team members during their delivery of exceptional service. Please come back to visit us again in the future! - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: Love love love this hotel! The service is outstanding! The service is amazing! The food at the steakhouse is delicious!! My kids were so happy playing on the lawn, they have plenty of games and children activities (from corn hole to arts and craft type of activities). I do wish the craft activities were complimentary as we got quite a nice bill when checking out haha. The restaurant at the beach is also really great. We really enjoyed our stay and can’t wait to go back!
Manager Response: Dear cicixee,   Thank you for the glowing review about your recent stay. I am pleased to know you enjoyed our True Waldorf Service, exquisite dining experiences, including Bourbon Steak and our private beach club, and our family-friendly offerings and activities. We look forward to welcoming you back for another stay in the future. - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: 10 out of 5 !!!   We stayed at Waldorf 2 nights then Ritz and Montage.    The Waldorf is the best bar none.    The Monarch Bay Beach Club and Pool Service made it extra special.    The Ritz has horrible Pool and beach Service.   I’d recommend the Waldorf for Families as value is far superior than Montage and Ritz.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler27925243054,   Thank you so much for the wonderful praise and glowing review about your recent getaway at our Southern California resort. I am pleased to know you enjoyed our private beach club and sparkling swimming pools, as well as our family-friendly offerings. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future for another wonderful stay! - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Honeymoon to Anniversary romantic get away fulfilled
Summary: We brought our wedding party here several years ago.  It's hard to believe the enchanting environment could exceed every expectation from the beautiful views, cleanliness and accommodating staff. Normally, we don't think about eating onsite, but after trying Aveo our first night we were hooked.  Our entertaining waiter, Holland, introduced us to Executive Chef Jean- Pierre Dubray.  He recommended some fabulous appetizers as we enjoyed the sunset.  He was very personable and helped us to plan our meal at the Monarch Beach Club to celebrate our anniversary.  We were pleasantly surprised when he stopped by to congratulate us.  The whole trip was amazing!  You can't put a price on wonderful memories!
Manager Response: Dear sharonsR9271UQ,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your romantic getaway. It was a pleasure welcoming you back to our luxurious resort. I am glad to know you had a truly wonderful stay, including your exceptional dining experiences at AVEO Table + Bar, as well as Monarch Bay Beach Club, in addition to the warm guest service provided by our team members, including Holland and Executive Chef Jean-Pierre. We look forward to welcoming you back for many memorable stays in the future. - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: We had requested an ocean view room. When we arrived, we were told there were no ocean views available, but we were offered a “fire pit studio” on the courtyard. What they neglected to tell us was that the hotel hosts corporate events in the courtyard. As I write at 8:30 p.m on a Sunday evening, I am listening to a bass thrum through my room while the corporate event outside my room is underway. When we called to complain about the noise, the manager offered us earplugs. We accepted a room that we did not request and were never told about the noise problem. Do not stay at this hotel if you are hoping for a quiet getaway. There are other choices of luxury hotels in Dana Point. Next time we will be staying at one of them.
Manager Response: Dear RedrockMir,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I understand the disappointment you had in regards to the noise coming from an event, and I am glad our team was able to offer a different room for your stay, as well as a waived resort charge and discounted rate for your room. I apologize your recent visit fell short of the experience you were looking forward to, and if you would like to discuss your feedback in more detail, I kindly invite you to contact the Front Desk and ask for Elham Iskandar so that we can personally connect. Again, I appreciate your feedback and hope to regain your trust for a much-improved visit in the future.  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: I spent the weekend here with my partner to celebrate our anniversary and we could not have been more thrilled with our stay. The property itself is overwhelmingly beautiful and romantic — and we had the chance to see two weddings take place which was a treat. While the rooms may not be “modern”, they were still well-designed, purposeful and the perfect place to retreat to after a long day. The beach club is spectacular, with unmatched privacy and a fun vibe at the bar/restaurant. The concierge desk truly was the star of the show, along with their super handy texting service. The service is reflective of their star status, and I am looking forward to more romantic retreats in my future at this stunning resort.
Manager Response: Dear alliesI1471VF,   Thank you for leaving a review about your recent romantic retreat at our luxurious Orange County resort. I am delighted to know you enjoyed our beautiful resort, spacious guest rooms, private beach club, and the True Waldorf Service provided by our team members. In the future, we look forward to welcoming you back for another romantic getaway at our resort! - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Nice property. No Hilton Diamond benefits.
Summary: Nice property but expect to walk a long time depending where your room is located. No respect to my Hilton profile. ( high floor and gave me a low floor) No Diamond benefits. ( not even a 1PM check out) Front desk staff with attitude. I expected much more.
Manager Response: Dear Steph1073, Thank you for your loyalty as a Hilton Diamond member and for taking the time to leave a review about your recent stay. We appreciate your feedback and we are disappointed to hear that you were not satisfied with your visit. Please connect with me by calling the Front Desk and asking for Elham Iskandar so that I can learn more about your experience. - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary: This is on star considering the services you get for the money that you pay.   We were budgeting for 4k for a 2 night stay and we ended up paying $ 3800.  The services we got was half that. Location is not a real beach hotel or resort, you have to take a trip with a car to get to the beach !  The coffee table in the suite was permanently dirty and  beyond disgusting , I complained, they didn't change it ! The couches were dirty and old.  When I told the manager we got a wrong package due to their website not being  user friendly , they helped half way without fixing it, they could have fixed it , it doesn't cost too much but they were happy to give a generic PR type response!  we also asked them to charge the car for us and they promised to do so, they didn't, so we had to
Manager Response: Dear 347jayz,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback, and I apologize your recent visit fell so short of the experience you were looking forward to. I understand the misunderstanding when booking your room and am glad our team was able to extend a complimentary dining credit in lieu of our bed & breakfast package. I did learn there was a privacy request on your door at the time we arrived to repair your coffee table, and I apologize this wasn't resolved during your visit. I also wanted to clarify our private beach club is accessible via our complimentary beach tram, which departs from our main drive every 15 minutes - and I sincerely regret this wasn't better communicated to you upon check-in. If you would like to discuss your feedback in more detail, I kindly invite you to contact the Front Desk and ask for Elham Iskandar so that we can personally connect. Again, I appreciate your candid feedback and hope to regain your trust for a much-improved visit in the future.  - Elham Iskandar, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Great resort but needs a few updates
Summary: I stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights for a business meeting, and I truly enjoyed the beautiful property and appreciated the hospitality and kindness extended to me by every member of their team. The resort itself is stunning, with its expansive grounds  and  spectacular views of the sunset from the main balcony.  The easy access to the beach proved to be very convenient too. In addition to this, getting here was a breeze since it’s only a few miles away from John Wayne International Airport.  I believe that this property used to be a St. Regis and this may well explain why some of the amenities are very outdated, including the room I was assigned to. The decor was like a throwback to the 80’s and some elevators were a bit worse for wear. However, with the recent Hilton
Manager Response: Dear Denise C,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent business stay at our seaside resort. I am glad to know you enjoyed our resort grounds, proximity to John Wayne Airport, and the picturesque views from our 33 North terrace. In addition, we appreciate your comments in regards to our living spaces. We are pleased to share that our guest rooms are currently undergoing a refresh and we are excited to debut our new accommodations later this year. We hope you join us once our guest room enhancements are complete to enjoy another coastal getaway.   - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: Wow! We loved our stay at this hotel. Service was spot on and we felt very well cared for. The staff are very pleasant and friendly plus they go out of their way to help. The Monarch Beach Club is great and the beach is spectacular. We would recommend this hotel to everyone plus I want to come back! The only downside I noticed was that our meal at 33 North was very average. I recommend just heading to the Monarch Beach Club if you want a seaside casual meal.
Manager Response: Dear Joyfullylady,  Thank you for sharing about your recent stay at our Southern California resort. I am pleased to know you enjoyed the True Waldorf Service from our team members, as well as our private beach club. Please come back to visit us again soon for another seaside getaway and to enjoy the surf, sand, and service at Monarch Bay Beach Club.   - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: Amazing stay with my young daughters. Highly recommend 1st floor room close to pool for ease of access and space for kids to run around. We enjoyed making s’mores on our patio fire pit. Excellent service. Delicious and plentiful food options (warning: meals and drinks are pricey). We took tram to beach club and loved playing sand volleyball. Definitely will be back. Wonderful, relaxing stay. Don’t miss the sunset!
Manager Response: Dear Kelly C,   Thank you for your positive feedback in regards to your family getaway. We are pleased to know you and your daughters had a memorable stay, and enjoyed your fire pit guest room and s'mores kit as well as the colorful sunsets at our private beach club. We look forward to welcoming you back for another exceptional stay in the future! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: This was a lovely property, well worth a visit if you are looking for a romantic winter getaway in the area. The rooms were beautifully appointed, the beach was lovely, deserted, and had a nice restaurant. The pools and the hot tubs were well-staffed.   There were great dining options on-site, and there were sufficient options to eat outdoors for those concerned about Covid, with plenty of heat lamps and fire pits. The staff was also able to do takeout orders when outdoor dining got rained out.  Highly recommend a room with a fire pit facing the golf course, not the pool, if you are on a romantic getaway. Total solitude and a beautiful view. We would stay here again if in the area.
Manager Response: Dear AWashingtonGirl,   Thank you for joining us for a romantic winter getaway at our coastal resort. We are pleased to know you enjoyed all aspects of your stay, including our fire pit guest rooms, private beach club, and exquisite dining options. In the future, we look forward to welcoming you back for another exceptional stay. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: Had an amazing stay. Gorgeous expansive property with fantastic service. We loved our 2 lunches at the Monarch Bay Beach Club…delicious food & cocktails in a beautiful oceanfront setting. The rooms are huge…over 500sf. We were upgraded to a courtyard view which provided beautiful views of this stunning property! Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear glsrn1, Thank you for sharing about your recent stay at our coastal retreat. I am pleased to know you enjoyed your dining experience at our private Monarch Bay Beach Club, as well as your spacious guest room with sweeping views. We look forward to welcoming you back for another stay in the future!  - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: My family and I had a fabulous staycation! :)  Enjoyed it thoroughly as the staff were friendly and I felt safe to stay here with children even  in the middle of the pandemic.  The tram ride to the beach is absolutely amazing as the view both in the day and evening are  just amazing. Would love to come back here soon.
Manager Response: Dear johannshin, Thank you for staying with us for your family staycation. I am glad to know you enjoyed the True Waldorf Service from our team members, as well as our private beach club and sweeping views. Additionally, we follow the latest guidelines and safety protocols informed by the State of California, and we are glad to know you felt safe while staying with us during the pandemic. Please visit us again soon!  - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: We stayed at the beautiful Monarch Beach property for a mother/daughter birthday celebration. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we felt spoiled. We were upgraded to a beautiful ocean view room. The property is gorgeous. Walked along the path to the private beach club to catch the sunset. Not to worry if you don't want to walk back, the tram is readily available to take you back to your room. We had a delicious dinner at the steakhouse. The next day we enjoyed wonderful massages at the spa. Overall our experience was definitely 5 stars. Cant wait to go back.
Manager Response: Dear lisamM7339AD,   Thank you for joining us for your mother/daughter birthday celebration and for sharing about your experience in a wonderful review. I am glad to know you enjoyed your ocean view room, our private beach club, and a relaxing day at our Waldorf Astoria Spa. We can't wait to welcome you back for future getaways. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: I spent the weekend at Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach to celebrate my daughter’s 21st Birthday. We had a wonderful time. The staff were all friendly and professional. Lucinda Rogers in particular reached out to me days before our arrival and planned a very nice surprise. We had a memorable experience and will definitely be coming back.
Manager Response: Dear maziar9795,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent stay! I am pleased to know your daughter's 21st birthday celebration was delightful and that you enjoyed the True Waldorf Service provided by our team members, especially Lucinda Rogers. We look forward to welcoming you back for future celebrations! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: The entire staff from top to bottom was so helpful and anxious to help in making our special occasion perfect! Obviously it’s a beautiful property but the staff seals the deal on making it a complete package.
Manager Response: Dear Ashlyn H,  Thank you for the wonderful review and for sharing your praise about our dedicated team members. I am glad to know your daughter's wedding was a truly memorable celebration and perfect in every way. Please come back to visit us again in the future! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Could have been a great stay
Summary: The hotel stay could have been 5 star but sadly we ran into a problem. We went to the hot tub on the first night. About a half an hour later, my husband and I broke out in a rash. It went away within an hour.  We thought maybe it was a reaction to some fish we had for lunch. We went into the tub the next day and within a half an hour, we both got a very angry rash, much worse than the first time. It was clearly the hot tub. When we checked out, I told the front desk person. She told me that the pool manager would contact me, but I never got a call or an email. This is a health issue and very much needs to be addressed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We love that this place is kid friendly from the kids club, the heated swimming pool to the Beach Bay Club (chairs, umbrellas, towels and kids beach toys provided). They even have kid sized robes and slippers if you ask. We can’t wait to come back here!
Manager Response: Dear Travel423681,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent family getaway. I am pleased to know you enjoyed our family-friendly amenities, such as our private beach club, sparkling swimming pools, and Kids Club. We look forward to having you stay with us again for future family vacations! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: Since the acquisition by Hilton / Waldorf Astoria, there have been many changes, some good, and some less so for current members.  However, what has not changed is the exceptional service provided by the staff, notably:  Brenda, Jamie and Jason at the Spa, Trish as the personal trainer, and Jesus, Eric and Gerardo, the valet parking attendants and bellmen.  All of these employees have been with the Monarch Beach / Waldorf Astoria throughout the change of ownership and through COVID, and all consistently provide outstanding service.
Manager Response: Dear B9474BGmichaelr,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about our resort and for highlighting the warm hospitality that is provided by our dedicated team members every day. Our team members are passionate about delivering True Waldorf Service to our guests and providing authentic moments that create memories that last a lifetime. I am pleased to know you enjoy their wonderful service and we look forward to welcoming you back for future experiences at our resort. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Luxurious Place to Relax by the Pacific Ocean
Summary: Monarch Beach has been a St. Regis, a standalone property, and now is part of Hilton Waldorf Astoria.  Although the brand and management company has changed over time, many of the Staff are still there (including bellmen, valet parkers, restaurant servers, etc.) and it is THEY who make Monarch Beach the luxurious, classy, enjoyable place to relax and be pampered that it is!  What a great vacation my family just had there!  Decadent meals, world-class golf, breathtaking views of the ocean, indulgent accommodations, and plenty of space to hang out, whether in the hot tub, bar, gym, or at our own private fire pits!  All-in-all this was a wonderful alternative to the Caribbean vacation we had initially planned for this Holiday week (darn Covid!). I have stayed there before, and I
Manager Response: Dear Marc E H,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent stay. I am glad to know you enjoyed the relaxing amenities throughout the resort, as well as the True Waldorf Service provided by our dedicated team members. We look forward to welcoming you back to our coastal retreat for another relaxing getaway in the future. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Thank you waldorf and Lucinda Roger's for a wonderful honeymoon
Summary: This is a very special property with a very special staff.  Our honeymoon at Monarch Beach has been wonderful. From the 1st class treatment upon arrival to the remarkable Bourbon Steak cuisine and classy room amenities.  Most of all we want to thank the human touch of this property  specifically Lucinda Roger's  the executive experience planner whose diligence and caring made our honeymoon very memorable.  From rose petals placed intricately at the corners of each tile in the bathroom to a heart shaped white petals on the bed to a print up of a picture of my new wife and myself framed at the bedside.  We will never forget the caring of Ms. Roger's and this reflects on the Waldorf and its brand.  At the end of the day, do not hesitate to honeymoon here...it is a great place to
Manager Response: Dear ahr2md,   Thank you for leaving a glowing review about your recent honeymoon getaway at our coastal retreat. Summary Heading: Don’t waste your money on a suite!
Summary: Signature Suite was AWFUL.  Missing furniture, the couch was a stiff bench with no pillows.  There was literally no furniture in the living room besides an ugly, still bench-couch. Awful. For $1500/night I’d expect something nice.  Room was missing all niceties; no bathroom supplies, no paper/pencil, it was stark and bare.
Manager Response: Dear jamicoulter,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent experience. I understand you have been in contact with our Director of Housekeeping, Elham, and she has shared your feedback with our resort leaders. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future once our guest room enhancements are complete. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: Left a lot to be desired
Summary: At first Monarch Beach resort seemed like a high end resort and we liked our room. But, the first night, I saw two small flies in the room after ordering room service. After we came back from our first day out, the two flies were still in our room, and our room had signs of a poorly done service - crumbs from a chips bag on the counter we had inadvertently left, slippers upside down in a corner my son had been playing around with, a receipt on the floor, remote control on the floor, poorly made bed. I notified the manager on duty who apologized and sent us drinks and the head of housekeeping called. But, the next day, SAME issue. I cleaned up the crumbs that day, but I left the receipt and the slippers to see if there would be any change - they were in the same exact place, with
Manager Response: Dear shiraz20212021,   Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay. Please know I am very disappointed to learn of your dissatisfaction and I would like to speak with you to discuss your experience and how we can make it right. Summary: Overall pretty disappointed. Not only is the beach not easy to access, but the food quality was average while you paid premium prices, the room was below average, with wallpaper peeling, and the room was barely soundproof, so you could hear every conversation happening outside your door, and there was minimal effort in shutting down a very loud party that happened until 3 AM above our room. The pillows made my neck hurt, and the bed was not even that comfortable.

Summary: We stayed here recently to celebrate our marriage.  Great location, friendly staff and fantastic restaurants and bar.  We had a fabulous time!  We will certainly be back and would highly recommend this Waldorf.  So far, every Waldorf I’ve stayed at has been fantastic
Manager Response: Dear John S,   Congratulations on your marriage! Thank you for leaving us a wonderful review and for choosing to stay with us for your very special celebration! We look forward to having you visit us again in the future! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: I discovered the magic of the Waldorf @ DP last year and fell in love. Since then I've stayed countless times & had the pleasure of just going down for dinner for the day. Everything was wonderful. Each time it exceeds my expectations. From the small personal touches to the beautiful views it keeps me coming back.
Manager Response: Dear KrisTheProducer,   Thank you for leaving a glowing review about our coastal resort. I am pleased to know you have joined us on multiple occasions and had an exceptional experience each time. Summary: The staff was great and wore masks no problem there. The coffee bar gave me the wrong cuissant the line wait was soooo long and long wait again to get the right one. Now who wants to wait in the morning half asleep before your cappuccino .  No app either. The girl server could not speak or understand English which caused the problem. There was a very long table with chairs and 7 children with grandparents to handle them and screaming and crying riding scooters  in the hotel . They should get rid of the table and put a couple of lounge chairs instead and not allow scooters in the hotel only outside.  We checked out on the 24th  10 am  paid everything and get a dinner charge for that evening when we were in Santa Barbara  for a dinner at the steakhouse for over $670.00  mind you
Manager Response: Dear Zelda570000,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your stay. Please contact the Front Desk and ask for Jeffery Modaff so that we can connect. Thank you. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: Wow!  This resort is breathtaking!  From the moment we arrived on property we were impressed by the beauty of this resort.  The holiday decorations were amazing.  We arrived after a full day at Disneyland and the staff was so kind and asked the kids all about their Disney experience.  I am a Diamond member at Hilton and at check in they did recognize my status, but unfortunately due to room renovations would no be able to upgrade my room.  I did find this odd since hours before check in they were advertising lots of paid room upgrades on the app, but oh well.  Without even asking the lady checking me in offered to waive our daily resort fee ($55 per day) and our daily parking fee ($60 per day) which was unexpected and a very nice gesture.    We were in a basic resort view room
Manager Response: Dear Autumn0222,   Thank you for the glowing review about your recent family getaway at our coastal resort. I am glad to know you had a truly wonderful experience from start to finish, and enjoyed the personal touches from our team members throughout the resort. We are looking forward to welcoming you back in the future for another family vacation! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary Heading: nice hotel, slow service not quite worth the price.
Summary: nice hotel with beautiful views. hotel service was slow and not very accommodating for the price.  fun to try once, but not sure it was worth the money.   dining options are amazing. loved the bourbon steak house - food and service were both phenomenal and worth every penny.    we’ll skip the waldorf and go back to lido house for our next visit.

Summary: I absolutely had an amazing time at this resort.   Bernice Vergel the reservations supervisor and Matt our Bellman were the best at making sure our stay felt warm and fuzzy.  I felt like I was at my luxury home away from him with stellar service.  Bernice was passionate about ensuring we had the best experience
Manager Response: Dear Agoodall7,   Thank you for sharing about your recent stay. I am pleased to know you enjoyed the True Waldorf Service provided by our team, especially from Bernice and Matt. Summary Heading: Outstanding and perfect for special occasions
Summary: To say this luxury hotel exceeded all my wildest dreams and expectations would be an understatement. Perfect place for a special occasion! They have all the details of exceptional customer service completely covered. So much, that you’ll soon realize other luxury hotels are severely lacking in that department.   When you arrive, you’re greeted by both the valet attendant and a bell hop with a cart to load your luggage for you. The receptionist greeted us with a complimentary chocolate and assisted in checking us into our room, and covered all the details to make our stay memorable. I wish I’d been able to check out their gym and yoga studio.  Then, our bell hop escorted us to our room, pointing out various key points and interesting trivia along the way. He gave us a tour of our
Manager Response: Dear MBN134050, Thank you for leaving such a wonderful review! I am so glad to know you enjoyed every aspect of your stay, including our True Waldorf Service, personalized details, well-appointed guest rooms, our private beach club, and of course, the special birthday surprise that was delivered to your room. We look forward to welcoming you back for future getaways! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: I was very fortunate to celebrate my actual birthday at the Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach. It was a flawless stay as a result of the great customer service we received from their outstanding staff.    All went above and beyond to ensure the stay went well.  Although the entire staff was quite dedicated to their guests, I would mention a few stand outs:  Christian and Elizabeth at the Concierge Desk  were particularly helpful- answering questions and assisting prior to the stay, Eddie from Engineering gave me a custom tour of the Family and Adult pool area so I knew exactly where I could swim laps in the morning, Kirsten at the Beach Club was a knowledgeable and friendly server and Tyler at the Front Desk was also very helpful and on top of things.  Rooms are dreamy and we
Manager Response: Dear chomyn,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a glowing review about your birthday getaway at our Southern California resort. I am delighted to know you enjoyed everything from start to finish, including the True Waldorf Service provided by our team, especially those who you mentioned by name. I will share your kudos and acknowledgement with them. In addition, I am glad to know you loved your guest room and our memorable turn down service. Please visit us again in the future! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: This was a very special outing for us and everyone at the resort made us feel so welcomed. We were here for our 30th wedding anniversary and I was one week post surgery from 2nd surgery of  breast cancer. We had our 2 older children with us who are special needs/handicap and this was an incredible stay. We were brought comp champagne both nights we stayed and had a wonderful and spacious fireplace terrace room. Staff we encountered wore masks and we felt very comfortable staying there.  The grounds were beautifully landscaped and not we never felt crowded or too many people around. In room dining was utilized at almost every meal and was very enjoyable, especially sitting outside by the fire. Lovely place and thank you for the wonderful experience
Manager Response: Dear mrssirfun,   Thank you for choosing to stay with us for such a special getaway, and for taking the time to leave a review. I am glad to know it was an unforgettable experience and that you enjoyed the warm hospitality from our team members, picturesque resort grounds, exquisite in-room dining by your fireside terrace, and so much more. We hope you join us again for future celebrations. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: The hotel looks nice on the surface, but when I arrived I was greeted by a valet parker with no mask on, then the receptionists all had their masks below their noses.  The bartender was maskless (and unfriendly). Guests walked through the indoor lobby and went in elevators unmasked.    I was surprised that my room rate had an additional $175 of extras added to the bill including a $60 per night parking fee.  Since I think there's a good chance I got sick from the unmasked valet driving my car at departure,  that just adds insult to injury.    The room was comfortable and a nice size, but when I walked barefoot I noted the floor was dirty.  I didn't say anything because it was not heinous but once I came home and had a wicked flu, I realized that the masks and cleanliness of the
Manager Response: Dear AsISeeIt37,   Thank you for taking the time to share your candid feedback. Please know the safety of our guests and staff is our top priority and our safety protocols have been informed by the officials of Orange County, the California Hotel & Lodging Association, the Global Biorisk Advisory Council, and the public health and epidemiology experts at the University of California Irvine. As a Hilton resort, we also follow the industry-defining standard of cleanliness and disinfection through the Hilton CleanStay program. I am disappointed to learn you were not satisfied with your experience and I would like to connect with you to discuss your concerns. Please contact the front desk and ask for Jeffery Modaff so that we can connect. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: Five night family stay for 4 adults and 2 6 year old kids over Thanksgiving 2021.  With nightly room rates about $1800 for 2 room, and restaurant prices averaging $52 per person per meal for breakfast and lunch, the prices were 5 star pretenders with stale bagels and worse sandwiches. The rooms got housekeeping and new towels only 2 nights of 5 day stay. Restaurant reservation were a total mess. My son visited us 1 day and I got hit with a 60 dollar parking fee. A water bottle in each room had a $10 price tag. Unlike the Waldorf I stay at in NYC, not owned by Hilton, this Hilton Waldorf seems to specialize in charging premium prices but delivering a low rent experience.
Manager Response: Dear Larry-Amherst,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about your recent experience.
