Summary: We travel to Monarch in Dana Point at minimum two times per year….this happened to be for my birthday. It was wonderful as usual….which is why we come as often as we can. Thank you to all of your amazing team and management.
Manager Response: Dear AllyLuka,   We are glad to know your birthday celebration at our Southern California resort was a truly wonderful experience. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope to welcome you back for future celebrations! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: Loved this property and all its amenities. Very clean and well kept. Beautiful views and amazing food options. Nice clean pool area and great service everywhere. You feel welcomed upon arrival at the valet and throughout the trip, from front desk staff to maintenance. P

Thanks all the staffs

Summary: We visited over the thanksgiving holiday.  Pros:  the friendliest staff…everyone was so warm and helpful Spacious property and well-manicured.  Beautiful water views Pet friendly- we were able to take our pup everywhere Pelotons in the gym Even though it’s not required, the staff wear masks and it’s very easy to stay socially distanced  Great breakfast buffet at Aveo  Lots of great snacks and drinks at their coffee shop  Dine at the beach club on the water Loved their Christmas decorations  Attached to nice park with paths  Cons: It’s a long walk or short tram ride to the beach The rooms are a little dated, but clean.  You need a car to get around town. It’s not walkable to shops/restaurants.  Older keurig coffee maker in the room  Reservations definitely needed at their
Manager Response: Dear ja1211,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a positive review about your recent stay at our resort. I am pleased to know you enjoyed the warm hospitality from our team members, our well-manicured resort grounds, our private beach club, and our exceptional culinary offerings. We hope you visit us again in the future for another memorable stay!   - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: I would like to thank the towel guy named Paul for being very professional and pleasant. We had a great stay for two days at this resort and Paul was a highlight of our stay! The beach shuttle guy was also very nice and professional. Would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Dear MayflowerGuest,   Thank you for your kind shout out to our team members, including Paul! We look forward to welcoming you back to our resort for another getaway soon! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: What an amazing place!  Beautiful pool and jacuzzi area next to a fire pit.  Spacious elegant rooms and a terrific steak restaurant on site. That complimentary truffle butter bread at the start and duck fat fries were out of this world.  Order the roast chicken.  It’s the best we’ve had.   Exceptional service and care from staff.  We felt we were in Dubai again as we go there yearly.

Please join us again in the future for another memorable stay. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: Great experience from the moment I arrived.  Service was exceptional in all areas - the valet, front desk, all dining outlets and more.  The rooms are large with lovely views and the bed was super comfortable.  Loved this hotel.

Summary: The staff at this hotel is trained extremely well. I cannot think of a better property that provides this level of customer services, from the valet, reception, to concierge, everything was perfect. Our view was stunning, as was the view from the lobby.

Summary Heading: Still swooning from the perfect getaway weekend
Summary: Had to escape the mental illness that has taken over in Los Angeles. I won't get into the politics of how evil it is to demand proof of vaccination to dine indoors, etc. (oops, I guess I just did), so back to the property:  I stayed at the Montage a couple months ago for a wedding and have to say that the Waldorf Astoria blows it out of the water. Although I will say that the Montage might be better for a wedding imho, because the backdrop for the ceremony is the ocean; here, the backdrop is the pool area, where people are walking around and swimming (see pic). I thought that was a little awkward from where I observed, which was the balcony/outdoor area of the restaurant Aveo.   Anyhow, I had an amazing stay here:  - Valet was quick and efficient - Check-in was a breeze - Aveo
Manager Response: Dear nkim777,   Thank you for taking the time to leave such a wonderful review about your experience. I am delighted to know you enjoyed many aspects of your stay, including the True Waldorf Service provided by our staff, our culinary offerings, playing and learning golf with ocean views, stand-up paddle boarding at our private beach club and so much more. We look forward to having you back for an Orange County getaway soon! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: The Waldorf Astoria is a beautiful hotel located near great shopping and restaurants in Orange County.  The staff is exceptional and the rooms are beautiful and comfortable. Please visit us again soon! - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: The hotel is just beautiful and not overdone.  Wonderful trails and beach paths to run on, super quick service and great cocktails.  The highlight was having Santos as my room service attendant - he was professional and an overall delight! I have already been back again and will book for a future stay.  The only negative was the quality of food in the restaurant.  Very expensive and the sea bass was thin and overcooked.  Stay here - just eat someplace else :)
Manager Response: Dear coreybondbauman,   Thank you for this wonderful review. We are so pleased to know you enjoyed the walking trails around the resort, the True Waldorf Service from our staff, and our handcrafted cocktails. Summary Heading: Extortionate and Bad Value Mandatory Fees and Pricing
Summary: The daily $55 disingenuous and forced ‘resort fee’ (for WiFi and pool towel) has put me right off going back to Hilton brands. Can’t believe they jumped on this greedy bandwagon. $60 forced daily valet only parking fee? Jeez, the nickel and dining in and already expensive hotel is outrageous.  Then there’s the terribly overpriced food which was all very mediocre. Breakfast options poor. Food twice as good at half the price in local restaurants (loved the ones in Dana Point).  Conferences and weddings everywhere.   On the positive side staff customer service is excellent, and hotels and rooms are extremely clean and safe.
Manager Response: Dear 849darrenf,   Thank you for providing feedback about your recent stay. I would like to connect with you to learn more. Please contact the Front Desk and ask for Jeffery Modaff so that we can discuss your experience. - Jeffery Modaff, Director of Rooms

Summary: My husband and I got married at the Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach and could not recommend it more highly.   The entire staff and events team were incredibly good to us - from our amazing wedding point Amanda Coffey, to the bellmen, to the wait staff and even the person who drove our golf cart down to the beach for sunset photos.  We've stayed at a lot of high-end resorts, and honestly don't remember being so well looked after in our lives. As a bride, I felt like anything I could have asked for would have been met with a smile and a prompt response. It really put my mind at ease and allowed me to enjoy the day.    Our suite was beautiful, and we were surprised to find it completely cleaned and covered in rose petals, complete with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries
Manager Response: Dear V390ESkarak,   We are delighted to know your wedding at our seaside resort was the celebration of your dreams. Summary: Top notch service, amazing views, wonderful accommodations. The Waldorf Monarch Beach did not disappoint. From the bell staff, valet, front desk and all the food and beverage teams. They were all so friendly and accommodating. Very genuine service from everyone. The manager in the evenings was so friendly and even remembered my name whenever he saw me and my family. We had a blast at the pool, the beach club. Lots of activities for the kids. Very impressed. My family and I will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Adventure03267624238,   Thank you for your review in regards to your recent getaway at our seaside resort. Summary: The Hotel bricks and structure views are BEAUTIFUL  The service past the front desk the worse you will experience. The food and beverage is WAY over priced. Nothing is close by so the hotel decided to OVER charge you for everything THEN you get terrible service. Be prepared to wait over an hour for any service.

Having  been to the area quite a bit and stayed in both the montage and Ritz I was curious to see how this hotel would stack  up. Not only did it stack up but it far surpassed both  by a large margin. The views are spectacular, the public area very warm and welcoming, my studio suite was very large and well appointed, the Service spot on, front desk and especially the Bell staff  very accommodating. The in-house restaurant led by Chef Michael Mina  is outstanding and the private beach club is a must. The gym was bright airy and very well equipped both in terms of equipment and amenities such as water and towels etc. I would've
Manager Response: Dear julianrY1726QU,   Thank you for your review and kind words. Summary: Hotel is beautiful! Views can’t be beat. You get what you pay for! Luxurious hotel. Staff, room, spa, gym, dining are all amazing! Very clean. Ocean spot for dining and drinks right on the ocean. Golf is comparable to Hawaii!

Summary: Underwhelmed   When booking this hotel the photos really do it justice, and we assumed it would be a five star experience nothing short of amazing.  What we got was an overall underwhelming experience.   I’ll start with positives first: The views are amazing.  Golf course is amazing with beautiful views  Bourbon Steakhouse inside is incredible food with great service.  The monarch beach club is incredible, take the shuttle down you won’t regret this hidden place with great views and beach access.   Negatives: Service is just ok at the Aveo restaurant and pool. Not good, but not bad.  Food is also just ok for the price. Definitely did not blow us away. Same for in room dining.  The pool bar shuts down pretty early at like 4pm which is disappointing since we’d been playing golf

Summary Heading: No doubt  this is one of the best spots along the Ocean but..
Summary: My family stayed 2 night this past Summer from from 6/4/21 thru 6/6/21.. so I've been lazy to recall what I got. The scenic view from the hotel was just breath taking from every corner and private access to the beach either by a little bit long walking down the hill or hopping on a tram would be more than beautiful and specially the Sunday morning, it was such a privilege to monopolize the whole shoreline with only several  or more scattered people, quiet and peaceful.. Anyway I wanna thank Lucinda Rogers, Guest Experience Planner for making my anniversary more special even though my check in process, room and a couple of things were not meeting my expectation but overall this is definitely a must visit place.

Manager Response: Dear FarAway08546008480, Thank you for sharing about your recent stay! I am pleased to know you enjoyed your visit as well as the warm hospitality and superb service provided by our team members. Please visit us again soon! - Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

The fireworks for the Fourth of July are some of the best we have seen at any resort.  While at the resort we received a nice upgrade and enjoyed our rooms.   The resort has a nice shuttle service to the beach and beachside restaurant.  We will definitely be back when we are in the area again.

Summary: The Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach is a luxurious location with something for everybody to enjoy. The pools are separately designed for children and adults, which makes it more enjoyable for both groups. The beach is a tram ride away. You are greeted with towels, umbrellas, and chairs. The beach isn’t crowded and is just beautiful. There are plenty of lovely sitting areas throughout the grounds to enjoy the beautiful layout of the property. The resort’s staff members are unfailing pleasant and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Judy F,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review about our Southern California resort. I am delighted to know you enjoyed your experience and had a chance to relax at our sparkling swimming pools and private beach club. Please visit us again soon for another wonderful stay! - Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: We had a wonderful honeymoon trip here. Rooms and grounds  were immaculate, excellent service. Far better than the Ritz where we stayed the second half. Only downside is it’s not directly on the water, but it’s just a short shuttle to the beach. Trust me that this is better than the Ritz, which is dated and has poor service. Will definitely stay at the Waldorf again for the next visit!
Manager Response: Dear elizabethmL5507GS,  Thank you for your review about your recent experience! We loved celebrating with you during this special visit and I am glad to know you had a wonderful stay. We look forward to welcoming you back for another unforgettable visit in the future! - Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: The Waldorf Astoria is a lovely hotel.  Don't get me wrong...the decor is beautiful and the public spaces are very well maintained.  The rooms are clean, beds are comfy and it's nicely decorated and airy which is why I gave it four stars.  I suppose this all helps when you pay over $800 night with all their additional fees built in, eat an overpriced breakfast...with $8 added for a cut up avocado in an omelette!  I recommend the Ritz Carlton if staying in Laguna/Dana Point as it's right on the beach, and dare I say, their food and drinks are more reasonable! Tip: If you do choose to stay at the Waldorf Astoria, do so through AMEX platinum.
Manager Response: Dear urbanetraveler,   Thank you for your review. I am glad you had a wonderful experience and enjoyed our seaside resort. Please know your comments are being shared with my team and we appreciate hearing your feedback. I do hope you join us again in the future for another relaxing stay. - Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: Full disclosure, we have Diamond status and stayed at the property. for two nights with points.  The property is AMAZING.  Absolutely beautiful.  We had a nice room overlooking the pool with a balcony.  We had dinner one evening a the beach club and the food was good and the view was to die for.  The service from the entire staff was great.  My only real complaint is the cost -- 60 bucks per day for parking???  It's not New York.  And I hate that Hilton doesn't waive the fee for parking for Diamond like Hyatt does for Globalist.  Even with the costs, this is an amzing resort and we look forward to returning.
Manager Response: Dear Y623QCjoshb,   Thank you for being a Hilton Honors member and for taking the time to leave a review about your recent stay at our Southern California resort. In addition, I am glad you enjoyed our True Waldorf Service, provided by our team members. We look forward to welcoming you back for another stay in the future! -Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Still a magnificent property and trying their best but the staffing problem is clearly evident.
Summary: This property is and will probably always be magnificent. The public spaces in the hotel are beautiful and spacious. Their lobby area has been completely remodeled since the old St Regis days and is even nicer than before. The beach club and beach to which hotel guests have access is outstanding and one of the primary reasons to stay at this resort.  Having said that, be aware that every hotel in the country is struggling with staffing issues right now, and a lot of the older more experienced employees simply aren’t there anymore. So it will be a while before a hotel stay feels normal. For example, this resort closes its lobby bar at 10 pm, even on a Saturday night. Apparently it’s not alone and the same is true at the other top resorts in the Laguna area. It’s a staffing issue
Manager Response: Dear jongab,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts, kind words, and understanding of what our industry has faced in the last year. We look forward to welcoming you back for another relaxing getaway sometime soon! -Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: Great experience. Hotel staff were extremely nice, the food, appetizers, drinks were amazing. Nice view of the ocean, rooms are very clean. From the day we checked to the day we left everything went smoothly.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort just a little overrated
Summary: The resort is VERY family friendly. If you are traveling with children, I think this is a great place. The beach is a little far, you'd have to take a shuttle, but the shuttles are convenient. We tried to bike around the property, but got a little lost. They are still short staffed. We tried to make a reservation at the beach club on a Friday night via the concierge, but they kept saying it was fully booked, we finally took our chances and went down there to see if there were tables, and the place as pretty much half empty; we were seated right away. I also kind of hate the fact that they  have an adults only pool, but don't enforce it; so you're pretty much stuck with a bunch of screaming kids in the pool. It's a little overrated.
Manager Response: Dear rishiell,   Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent experience. Please know your comments will be taken into consideration and shared with our resort leadership. We hope you can join us again for another stay in the near future to enjoy our seaside resort. -Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: A great getaway for SoCal residents looking for Cabo-like amenities without the flight. The ceilings were thin which allowed us to hear footsteps above but otherwise rooms were great. They need more teams between the beach club and resort. They also need to make it easier for guests to have reservations at the restaurants for dining - it seemed like arguing with the hosts was the only way to secure such tables.

Summary: Absolutely perfect resort for families.  A lot of families are there with kids of various ages. The kids pool is great with a nice splash pad. The restaurant and resort overall is very nice and well maintained with amazing service.  Beat part is the beach club access with its own restaurant with phenomenal food.   Highly recommend for families.  Also recommend the first floor rooms with a fire pit.

Please visit us again soon for another family vacation! -Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: The property is absolutely stunning! The overall service was good considering that we are in the midst of global pandemic. The food is a tad expensive and I say that expecting to pay a premium given that Waldorf is a premium brand, just not that much of a premium. $230 for breakfast is expensive no matter where you stay!

Summary: From arrival to departure the experience was delightful and provocative. The staff are friendly and attentive. No details are left un noticed. A wine and anti pasta plate was served as late as midnight… and view of the hotel garden dazzled my eyes. I could only imagine I was on earth because It truly felt like heaven.
Manager Response: Dear D1tenario,   Thank you for your kind review. Summary: We've stayed here a bunch pre-pandemic, immediately after (1/4 capacity) and recently in Aug '21.  EVERY time the experience is top notch.  Yeah, it gets pricey, but we always leave wanting more. Rooms are immaculate, staff is always on point.  We use the app a lot for digital keys and ask requests - they're always generally prompt to accommodate.  We are hooked on the ground floor (we have dogs) and fire pit on the patio.  Hearing the ocean at night is amazing.   Trolley to the beach is a breeze... and again, the staff in every area is always on point and kind - it's very calming and enjoyable!
Manager Response: Dear Matthew_and_Ava,   Thank you for your recent review of our resort. I am delighted to know you enjoyed your experience, including our True Waldorf Service, private beach club, and fire pit guest rooms. Summary: Just realized I wrote a review in 2017 and those words sadly still ring true. We just took the family here for a trip and to give it a second try after 4 years away. Few staff  Property is good and the views are nice. However, that is all I can really say about this place. Room furniture and outdoor furniture shows its age, watermarks, stains, and spills. There were many mistakes with service. No matter how many times I called to request my car in advance, the message was relayed less than half the time which meant waiting and waiting before the attendants realized my keys hadn’t been pulled. Room service food was disappointing and would not recommend it.  Breakfast was brought but without any beverages (it came with our choice but someone didn’t check the ticket…)  Our dinner

Summary Heading: Like Stepping Onto A Private Island Oasis
Summary: I’m really glad I booked despite reading some of the negative reviews. This property is amazing.  Everyone we encountered provided A-1 service. The rooms are clean and well laid out.  The pool area overlooks the ocean and is framed by beautiful landscaping.  The beach is amazing, quiet and clean (though the ”trolley” ride over is a little bumpy).  How refreshing to have the umbrella professionally set up.  Bourbon steakhouse is a must! Really enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear kaybeet,   Thank you for your kind words in regards to your recent stay at our coastal resort! Summary: Couldn’t agree more on the poor COVID protocol at the resort. Barely saw any staff wearing masks both indoor/outdoor while on property. Not even at any of the restaurants or spa. When if a staff member can wear a mask while cleaning the guest room or at the spa, the hotel said they can’t ask any of their employees to wear a mask since it is not mandated by the State of California. Felt very unsafe while staying at the resort.   During our stay, there was a large conference, a concert, and a wedding that all happened during the same week. A lot of big events happening here considering we are still in a pandemic.   Also, the services were below par. No one seemed to be happy to be working there.   Would probably try to stay at the Ritz Carlton next door next time.
Manager Response: Dear F7212WCHS, Thank you for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our resort. The safety and comfort of our guests and team members continue to be of great importance to us. Please contact our Front Desk and ask for Cindy Racco so that we can connect and discuss your concerns regarding your recent stay. -Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Great property but not COVID safe
Summary: The property is lovely and it is located in a beautiful spot. However we are in a pandemic and this property is in California to state the obvious. I was truly shocked that the people who work on the property do not wear masks consistently indoors. This seems to be standard protocol in any major city and I don’t understand how at the Welcome area, they can talk about cleanliness and the highest standards of Covid protocols and then not have their own staff wear masks inside.  So, great property but go at your own risk.

Summary: Overall excellent experience.  Beach club access is a huge plus and the main differentiator vs other hotel options. Beautiful property, terrific location, super clean and friendly.  On-site corporate Conference was a negative.  We are disappointed the hotel allowed this big crowd during Covid. We expected a more controlled environment.

WA Monarch Beach team was wonderful especially the team that made us feel at home:  Guest Relations: Juainda Front Desk: Chantal R and Nicole M. Bellman: Lyle A.  Vallet Staff: Alejandro P. This Tuscan inspired resort has a refined atmosphere and its now under Hilton group and it’s managed very well.   The resort have lot of amenities like private beach club with access to your own section of public beach and helpers offering beach towels and setting up benches and beach umbrellas. A lifeguard station just right in front of beach club. They also have two beach volleyball court and you may borrow kids sand toys and all kind of balls. Other amenities are golf course, swimming pool, bike rental, giant chess, little kids activity, fully equip stay of the art fitness facility, etc.   We stayed in a 970 sqft Signature One

We had a very relaxing stay at the hotel, and then, after we checked out, we were charged AGAIN for the stay, and though we did not use all of the allotment for incidentals, there was no refund of that portion of the prepay charges, When I called to bring this to the attention of the reception, they were incredibly rude and didn't acknowledge that anything was wrong. If Waldorf Astoria prides itself on its service, then this is the kind of "service" that I never want to experience again! Luckily my credit card company has excellent

Summary Heading: The Best Place for a So Cal Beach Staycation
Summary: We just came back from a five day stay at this great hotel. We usually go abroad for summer vacations but because of the pandemic, we chose a close to home vacation. This was our first time at the Monarch Beach Resort and it did not disappoint. The staff are all very welcoming from the moment you get to the valet. We got 2 of our 3 rooms upgraded to mini suites because of our Diamond status. The mini suites are very spacious with a huge bathroom and large balcony. We ate at AVEO, Sombra, the Beach Club and the cafe. All were good but we liked the Beach Club the best. The views are stunning and food was very fresh and well prepared. We wanted to go to Bourbon Steakhouse as well but couldn’t get a reservation. If you plan to go there you should reserve at least 2 to 3 weeks before
Manager Response: Dear vangogh88,   Thank you for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our seaside resort. I am delighted to know you had a truly unforgettable stay and I am glad you had a chance to enjoy our relaxing amenities, exquisite culinary offerings, and exclusive beach club. Please visit us again in the future for another exceptional stay.    - Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing property, room condition, views and private beach access
Summary: This property probably is unique in terms of size and scale. Really nice views, big territory, private beach with nice restaurant directly on the beach. This year there was an unexpected problem with the room charges. I was charged with the rate substantially different from my confirmed booking ( and it booked my stay directly on the hotel site, and received a confirmation). The issue was resolved by the hotel stuff, but the appearance of a problem which you have to solve during the leisure stay spoils the experience. It was my 2nd stay with the hotel, and last year there was no problems. Probably, the acquisition of the property by Hilton created some difficulties, as the quality of service was not as good as a year ago. Also, hotel declares itself like dog friendly, but in
Manager Response: Dear Elena  Travel CA:  Thank you for your review and in particular for your comments about our pet friendly policies, which provides helpful perspective on that aspect of the guest experience.  We will certainly share your feedback with our team members and review that experience.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: Three night wonderful stay July 13-15, 2021 for a birthday getaway. From check in with Jonathan (he was very helpful) to a 5am check out all was perfect.  As you can imagine the service was excellent, super comfy bed, nice pools/hot tubs and beautiful property. Beach club was an easy walk or tram ride and simple to get beach chairs and umbrellas set up. Great shrimp lettuce wraps. Our first ever Waldorf stay (many Conrad stays) but will now look to stay when we can worldwide. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Dear Jeff S:  What an honor for our resort to be your introduction to the Waldorf Astoria experience!  It is terrific to hear that you enjoyed the beauty of the property and the beach amenities.  We wish you happy travels with our brand moving forward and know that you'll always receive a warm welcome back to Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Trip for my Granddaughter's Graduation gift
Summary: We had a great time. We stayed 2 nights; service was wonderful. accessibility  to food and accommodation were excellent  serve was great.  Pool was full of kids and very noisy, hard to relax.  Hot tubs were dirty
Manager Response: Dear vivtotell:  What a thoughtful graduation gift for your granddaughter and we are so pleased to hear that you had a great time.  Thank you for sharing this special celebration with us.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: Excellent hotel with excellent service. The staff will help you with anything and everything you need. They are all lovely people.   HOWEVER….  1) It IS a bit short-staffed (likely due to the pandemic / unemployment benefits)  2) There are a TON of kids at the pool. Like… a TON. Don’t plan on relaxing there. Screaming, crying, yelling, throwing footballs and splashing are par for the course. Very disappointed with that experience.  3) You’ll easily spend more than your stay will cost you.  Ex: $35 omelette. $40 tacos. Etc. It feels like highway robbery… but to be expected at a place like this.  4) The crowd is…. well… unrefined. Which is unsurprising since this is OC, but still… I’m talking about ripped tank tops, visors, board shorts and flip flops at the fanciest restaurants
Manager Response: Dear Navigate2458620768:  Thank you for your kind comment about the excellence of our hotel and the service that our team members provide.  We appreciate that you've taken the time to share your review.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: The paint in our balcony was all peeled and it was sticky, so we didn't really enjoy the outside view and breakfast as we did last year. The pool was disappointing. First, a lot of kids were jumping in the pool and no one from the staff said anything, even though there is a pool dedicated to them to give the adults some rest, and specially the ones not related to them. The  menu (pool) is still very disappointing, only few options and not healthy at all. I ended up getting a super greasy quesadilla that was at the level of a food cart in the streets of LA. My wife got a tiny salad that was just Ok. Every morning the coffee late was cold because they don't have thermos and just cover the cup with plastic (!), when I asked for a new one , they told me it will take 30 minutes. this
Manager Response: Dear 90035Gilles:  Thank you for sharing your comments, which we in turn share with our team members in our quest for continuous refinement of the guest experience.  Happy Anniversary and we do hope that you visit us again.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: The Crew are very nice here. The beach club is our favorite restaurant. Waitress Jasmin was really nice and our daughter likes her so much. She provided excellent services with high efficiency. Because of her we visited there twice during our stay. But there were some imperfections also. When we checked in we found the room not cleaned very well. We found hairs on the bathroom floor and on edge of the hot tub. And we called the room services asked for 3 things, they misunderstood one of the items. We asked for toothbrushes twice ,waited for about 40 mins still no response so we left the room. About the restaurant Aveo, food was delicious, the view is great. We visited there 3 times, 2 breakfast and 1 dinner. With all 3 visits, we found out that they probably need more servers.
Manager Response: Dear yaoyushen112:  Thank you for sharing your review and these specific comments, which we share with our team members.  We are glad to hear also that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to warmly welcoming you back for your next visit.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Very poor customer service, check-in desk does not know what they are doing
Summary: Unable to book restaurant reservation upon arrival for any of the 4 days we were there. Paid for room upgrade, signed new paperwork and was later rescinded because someone else booked the same room upgrade
Manager Response: Dear 455wnh:  We are sorry to hear about your experience and appreciate that you have taken the time to share your comments.  I would welcome the opportunity to speak with you personally and invite you to reach out to me at cindy.racco@waldorfastoria.com.  Thank you  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: The WA Monarch Beach Resort were so great to our family. The service was amazing and friendly and the grounds were beautiful. Best of all were the beds and the turn down service. We all slept like babies!
Manager Response: April W:  We are so pleased to hear that you felt pampered and that your family slept so well here!  We'll be waiting to welcome you back.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: First. this review is past due, but I wanted to be sure to sing their praise because I would have been quick to criticize if the resort was not up to par.  So I had a list of top notch resorts to select where I would send my parents for their 50th wedding anniversary in May.  Obviously I chose Waldorf Astoria and thankfully it was the perfect choice.  They had a wonderful time! There were a few hiccups with the dinner reservations, but nothing to major and since my parents were okay, I was okay.  I would highly recommend staying here. They told me that the staff was great, especially the tram driver, and the grounds were beautifully kept.    I can say that I also received exceptional service as I scheduled their surprise reservations.  I spoke with a lot off A+ staff to try to
Manager Response: Voyager782583:  Thank you so much for entrusting our team with such an important special occasion.  It was our honor to play a part in your parents' special memories and it's wonderful to hear that Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach earned five stars from you.  Thank you for your kind words.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: Very slow service and subpar food in Aveo. Poor pool service. No one to give you towels or set up lounge chaises. Stayed here last year before the Waldorf took over and despite COVID service was better and food good. Very disappointed at quality the Waldorf is providing. Not up to their quality or reputation.
Manager Response: Dear ekspen:  We appreciate that you have taken the time to share your comments with us and apologize that your experience did not measure up to our standard.  I would welcome the opportunity to speak with you personally and invite you to reach out to me directly at cindy.racco@waldorfastoria.com.  Thank you  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: We stayed at two Waldorf hotels during this trip (and several before) and I have to say, this is by far one of my favorite.  We will DEFINITELY be back.  I'm not sure what to rave about first...the pools are beautiful, the rooms are huge and wonderful with any and all amenities you could want.  We ate at Bourbon Steak and it was fantastic (as always).  The staff were friendly and helpful with all of our COVID and locality questions.  I can't recommend this hotel enough.  It's a MUST
Manager Response: Dear Michelle M:  Wow, we are so grateful to hear your rave reviews of Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach and we look forward to welcoming you back.  -Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Everything you expect a hotel to be
Summary: We love this property! Not only is gorgeous with excellent service in every way possible the private beach makes it very special. Having kids it was very easy to go to the beach. Everything you need from towels, sunblock and toys is provided. We stayed here during spring break (2021) and felt very safe with their covid protocols. We had a great time.
Manager Response: Dear ParisaG:  We love being able to share our private beach club experience with our guests and so pleased that you felt it was both special and safe!  We look forward to welcoming you for another stay soon.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: We just checked out of the beautiful Monarch Waldorf Astoria. Overall we had an amazing time and the resort was beautiful. We had food and beverage service at the pool and had incredible service. For dinner we ate at the Monarch Beach Club. They were kind enough to let us eat there without a reservation and once again had incredible service.   After, we checked in we had a very informative bellman. He told us all about the hotel and local restaurants around, He also took care of us when we left and remembered us and asked about our time.   Now, for the bad. When we checked in at the front desk we didn’t seem to get a very friendly welcome. I wish I caught her name because we had another very unpleasant experience with her at checkout. The younger blonde did not seem to want to
Manager Response: Dear emilyhR6646JM:  Thank you for celebrating your anniversary with us and so happy to hear that you thought it was a perfect stay.  We wish that your departure would have felt warmer and appreciate your notes on this experience, as we are always striving for continuous improvement.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: A tremendous place to experience the reopening of a normal life
Summary: Everything was open with great service. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a tremendous 5 day stay. The food venues are terrific, the beach facilities and golf course is the best. And the fireworks on the Fourth are the iceing on the cake.
Manager Response: Dear William A:  We are so pleased to hear that our team at Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach provided such a tremendous experience for you.  Please return again soon!  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Diamond benefits are not recognized. Felt discriminated against during stay
Summary: We had to fight for most of the due benefits for Diamond. Property made us keep calling, asking about getting our diamond benefits. Even felt unwelcome even though I’ve communicated to the property well in advance that we are celebrating important occasions… was not satisfied from the beginning. Tons of issues with diamond recognition.
Manager Response: Dear glb461:  We highly value our Hilton Honors Diamond Members and apologize that you did not receive the VIP treatment that you should have enjoyed.  I would appreciate the opportunity to understand more about your experience and welcome you to contact me personally at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com.  Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: When you hear Waldorf Astoria there are certain expectations attached to that name, and so I had such high expectations when we booked our first stay.  I hold status with the major chains - Hyatt, Marriott and Hilton, but seeing how Hilton's service has gone down in terms of  member recognition, I opted to book via AMEX FHR which advertises room upgrades, early check-in, breakfast for two and late checkout.  To make this weekend extra special, I emailed the manager and requested early check in.  We got there around 2:30PM, and was told room not available yet, no worries, we enjoyed the kiddie games on the grounds.  Close to 4PM, I went back to the front desk and was told room is not ready until 4:40PM! We had dinner reservation at Bourbon at 6PM and needed to freshen up.  We
Manager Response: globetrottingCPA:  We appreciate that you have shared these comments with us.  Guest service is the hallmark of our resort and we apologize that your arrival experience did not meet our high standards.  We would like an opportunity to talk with you about your experience, so I welcome you to reach out to me personally at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com.    --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: This was our first stay at the property since it became a Waldorf Astoria 6 months ago.  We were there for a week with our kids and grandkids.    Fortunately Ariel Lindsay and Danielle Fraiser, who I believe at almost 20 years each are the longest tenured people at this property, are still there.  I guess they both must have started when they were 8 years old or so.  They are both super stars, with Ariel managing the front desk, and Danielle currently general mgr of the pool after having managed seemingly 1/2 of the departments at the property over the years.  Ariel was so helpful in setting up our 2 room reservations for the week, and Danielle had us taken care of every time we used the pool.   These 2 are so far out in front that there is never a problem.  R In addition to
Manager Response: Dear billorangecounty:  Thank you for spending the week with us and for your strong recommendation of Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach!  Our team members work so hard to provide a memorable guest experience and are the beating heart of this resort, so nothing makes us happier than hearing individual team members praised by name.  We appreciate these detailed cudos and will be sure to share them with our team.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: We booked multiple room and suites for my son’s wedding. The venue on the north lawn was spectacular. Food servers were not prompt as few tables were attended extremely late.. Otherwise everything exceeded our expectations.
Manager Response: asad622:  We treasure the opportunity to be part of weddings and to create these special memories for our guests.  Thank you for taking  time to share this review with us.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: You have to come here to see it. Grand, breathtaking resort. The view from the lobby is one of a kind. The rooms are neat renovated and luxurious and spacious. The pool with the view is amazing. The beach club is classy. We did not want to leave. The service was truly 5-star and the text concierge was incredibly convenient! Great idea.   One minor suggestion for mgmt: allow guest to walk down to beach club instead requiring taking shuttle. It’s a nice walk and sometimes we don’t want to wait for shuttle when there’s a line and not enough space for the 1st shuttle.
Manager Response: Dear cooltraveling2:  Thank you for visiting and so pleased that you enjoyed the beach club, pool and our virtual concierge service.  We now have a walking app that guides guests on a walking route to the private beach club, so we hope you enjoy using this on your next stay with us.  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: We book a 2 day weekend get away with kids to celebrate our 13 years anniversary. We stay at other Waldorf properties with great experience so we had with high expectations for Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach Beach, but very disappointed at overall experience.   Me and my husband are both diamond members, we were told the room was upgraded to "pool view" room with great view to the pool, but only thing we can see from room 228  is grass area which is super noisy in the morning with all the kids running around, not sure how this low floor room would be any or upgrade? I regret that I didn't took the room from hilton app which is a resort view at 5th floor.   After settled in the room we immediate found that the room was not clean, dust by the tv area, left over milk from previous
Manager Response: Dear changrex42:  Please accept our apology that we missed the mark on several aspects of your stay, as you have every right to expect the best here.  Your comments are sincerely appreciated and have been shared with our team and I would welcome the opportunity to speak with you further if you are willing.  I may be reached at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com.  Thank you  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff, views but OVERPRICED and dated
Summary: We were able to use our Hilton Free Night certificates for two nights at the hotel. Had I paid what would have cost about $950 per night for a room I would have been extremely disappointed. I leave the most aggregious pricing for the end of the review.    The hotel is set on a dramatic hill overlooking the ocean. A tram takes guests frequently from the hotel, through the golf course, to their beach club on Monarch Beach. The beach club features a ridiculously overpriced restaurant, with entrees starting at around $45. We didn't eat there. The dining room was bland and, aside from the view, looked like it belonged in a rest home, not a five star hotel. The hostess was very nice. The service on the beach was excellent. They set up chairs right on the beach for you. You can also
Manager Response: Dear mikestages:  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to share your comments about the service and experiences you enjoyed while here.  We value such feedback and our team appreciates your detailed notes.  Thank you  --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: We visited the Waldorf Astoria Beach Club on a trip to Dana Point while our home was being remodeled in Ritz Pointe.  Our server was Kirston (sp?) who has been serving there for a while.  She was so welcoming and told us all about why we should become beach club members.  Soon after that we joined and haven't looked back since!  Kirston waits on us often and always goes out of her way to make us feel special.  It is our hope that the Waldorf Astoria Beach Club recognizes her for her great service and hard work.  We are in the hospitality business as well and know first hand how hard it can be to make everyone happy.  Thank you to Kirston for her warm welcome every single time we go!  We really enjoy it there and she is a big part of it.  See you at the beach! Signed- Stephanie
Manager Response: Dear stephaniemV6911YR:  What a wonderful story and we are so pleased that you decided to become Club Members.   We appreciate your kind review and comments on our Team Member, which we are thrilled to share with her.  Have a wonderful summer at the beach! -- Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: We are locals. We live just a quarter mile away from this hotel. We've been coming to the hotel since 2012, for dinner, drinks and lunch. The ownership just prior to Waldorf allowed the hotel to go way downhill by closing the Club 19 restaurant and cutting back on staff such that service became really poor, so we stopped coming over and stopped bringing friends and houseguests. We assumed that with Waldorf we wiould see a dramatic improvement. No such luck. Waldorf has changed nothing and improved nothing: all the furniture in the restaurants and bars is the same and falling apart; Club 19 - the outdoor restaurant at the golf club - is still closed and noone will say whether its going to reopen; we drove over today - Sunday afternoon, May 23 - for a drink on the main upstairs
Manager Response: Dear richrV7178JP:  Thank you for taking the time to share your review here.  We are always honored when our neighbors visit us and we truly do place great value on what you experience and the impression you walk away with.   Please accept both our apology that your experience did not reflect our standards and also our invitation for more discussion.  I would greatly value the chance to speak with you, if you would be so kind as to reach out to me personally at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com.  Thank you again for providing us with your comments.   -- Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: Really the best experience. I’ve been a couple times now. The service is great. I love the little touches like the monarch butterfly in the bedroom etc.. I love the pool and how close in proximity the beach is to walk to, not to mention how nice it is to be driven to the private beach and pampered!! Great place for kids too, I have a three year old. I attended the Coastal Circuit Boot Camp class led by Trish Sachs. She was the icing on the cake. I have never tried any kind of fitness course while on vacationing she made it such a great experience and I ended up walking away feeling good about myself and energized for the rest of my trip.  I will be returning in the future!!
Manager Response: Dear Voyager39612278743:  We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed the private beach club and all the fitness programming.  Thank you for your review and we look forward to your return. --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: I attended the coastal circuit bootcamp held by Trish Sachs and it was an amazing experience. She was an awesome teacher and taught me new exercises i can use at home. Her class really enhanced my vacation experience for sure. I will definitely attend another class of hers the next time i come.
Manager Response: Dear Passport67841790762:  Thank you for your comments about our fitness leader, Trish.  We are pleased that she provided some inspiration for optimal living and hope you were able to carry some of these tips home with you! --- Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: Sadly this beautiful property is just not maintained or staffed well. We have been coming to this property for 15 years ever since it was a St-Regis. We would come twice a year we loved it so much. The service back than was top notch. When it became the Monarch we came twice and couldn't believe how non existent the service was. They had put us in the wrong room twice and finally admitted that they didn't have the room we had booked available and we needed to stay in a handicap accessible room (which is very different than the regular one bedroom suites) From the desk check in, to the housekeeping, to the restaurants the service was disappointing. Drinks and meals took 45-60 minutes. We were continuously told "we're sorry" but at a certain point apologies don't mean anything
Manager Response: Dear jslb18:  We appreciate guests who have a long history with our resort and love being part of family memories through time.  We also highly value guest feedback and so appreciate that you have taken the time to provide this detailed review.  It is our desire that you have a wonderful experience every time you stay with us and we apologize that this visit did not measure up.  If you would be willing to speak with us further, we would appreciate the opportunity to fully understand your experience.  I welcome you to reach out to me personally at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com.  Thank you -- Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Everything you'd expect of a five star hotel (including price)
Summary: This is a textbook 5 star hotel in California.  The views are spectacular, the rooms are immaculate and beautiful, the grounds are amazing (albeit a little small), and the food is very well done.  Everything is priced accordingly.  Location:  Though not on the beach, most rooms will still have a great view of water and the golf course.  There is a shuttle to the water and the lantern district is a short drive.  Nothing to complain about here (though I believe the St. Regis might be a little more waterfront).  Diamond Recognition:  We received a generous upgrade and the breakfast perk was $50 room credit/day.    Cleanliness: Perfect  Service:   Perfect from the moment we walked in.  Rooms: Exactly what you would expect from a 5* Waldorf.  The hotel had a very grand feeling also
Manager Response: Dear Josh B:  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your Hilton Honors Diamond recognition during your stay with us and we appreciate that you have taken the time to share your review.  We look forward to welcoming you back to California! -- Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: Just stayed at the Waldorf for three nights to celebrate our six-year wedding anniversary! We had such a wonderful time, and everywhere we went the service was impeccable. The rooms were nicely updated and sanitized, so I felt very safe.  Food at every establishment on the premises was delicious, and the portions were generous.  All public areas we visited were clean and well-appointed.  People who made our stay truly exceptional were... - Arden at the front desk who not only made sure our room was perfect and comfortable, but also stayed in constant communication with me via text.  She was so kind and exceptionally hospitable, which really put me ease while I’m 6 months pregnant! - Lance from the tram, who gave us a thorough and joyful tour of the hotel grounds.  His enthusiasm
Manager Response: Dear youdiana:  We are honored to have been part of your anniversary celebration. Thank you for your comments and we look forward to welcoming you back for future occasions as well.   --Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: We stayed here because of the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor possibly made by incentivized guests, however our experience was quite different. Most rooms have little to no ocean view. The property is dated and rooms could use a major refresh ASAP.   The phone in our room was about 20 years old as was most of the rest of the room. And only having $10 bottles of water for coffee was insulting. We spent $1000 a night without much of an upgrade even though we are high level Hilton members and the hotel was empty.   We were very much looking to forward to using their world-famous spa. You can only imagine how disappointed we were that no one mentioned it was closed as we were checking in.   Oh, and the food. Breakfast was awful, just no words to describe how bad it was.   I highly
Manager Response: Dear maxsmart333:  We truly apologize that your visit did not measure up to our standards.  I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you further about your feedback and invite you to contact me directly at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com.  Thank you for taking the time to share your review and for your kind words about the quality of our staff. -- Cindy Racco, Resort Manager

Summary: My 1st visit to Laguna Beach and my 1st stay at a Waldorf Astoria property. The hotel has a fabulous location with easy beach access, trails to walk and not far from Lantern area. Staff is friendly and super nice. Covid protocols in place. I felt safe.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Catherines656,   We are glad that you enjoyed your 1st stay with us and that you had a fabulous time. Please visit again soon. Thank you!   Cindy Racco Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Please Fix the A/C - Rooms 235 and 237
Summary: We stayed at the WAMB 1st week of April.  We have stayed there as a family at least 6-7 times ... previously, as St. Regis then Monarch Beach Resort then Waldorf Astoria MB. Service in the restaurants, housekeeping and valet have always been top notch.  Service at the pool was very slow and numerous times, we've had to go up to the pool bar to order.  This is not a big deal because we totally understand hotels are hurting to hire  workers back. On our first night, both rooms a/c were set at around 65-66 and in the middle of the night, would turn off and go up to 72 ... We got up several times in both rooms to turn the a/c down.  I called maintenance the next day and the engineer came and overrode the system in both rooms.  Same thing happened the rest of the 3 nights we were
Manager Response: Good afternoon Nellie96,   Thank you for taking the time to write this review and share detailed feedback with us.  We do appreciate your loyalty and are glad that most of your trip was top notch, I would like to connect with you directly to learn further details around your stay. I can be reached at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com  Cindy Racco Resort Manager

Summary: This was not my first time here , previous visits have been for work , but this visit I was able to bring my family for spring break vacation. We had an amazing time all the way from the outgoing and friendly front desk staff including Ariel and Alexandra,  to the delicious food at the multiple dining experiences offered and the organized family fun. We love the pool and the beautiful walk down to the ocean front. I think my favorite part of all is a sunset to die for.  When we arrived I inquired about a possible upgraded room if available and they didn’t hesitate to meet my needs . Then upon departure We had to leave a night early due to a change in my work schedule and they went above and beyond to accommodate me again! We will defiantly be returning.
Manager Response: Good morning Rachelking16,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are glad you had amazing dining experiences, pool days, and walks down to the ocean. Please return for another stay soon.   Cindy Racco Resort Manager

Summary: It's been over 6 months since e we FIRST visited Monarch Beach Resort.    We came to this area for our anniversary and stayed at the Ritz down the street. Our departure day we decided to extend a night at MBR. We've been wanting to stay here for awhile and decided now is the time.  The second we arrived it was pure amazement!, because being Hawaii minded  we noticed the relax and openness with tropical lush plants surrounding.   The service from valet was excellent.    Within the first hour we noticed the difference from ritz to this. (COVID might of had something to do with it).   At check in , front desk personal Marrisa made it more special with a upgrade to pool view.  It was about as close to as Hawaii feel u can get. Checked humidity and temp in Kauai where we got married
Manager Response: Good afternoon MikeAdams23sf,   Thank you for taking the time to write this detailed review. We are so glad you had an amazing stay and we are happy that you found us to be just as relaxing as your Hawaiian vacations! Please visit again soon.   Cindy Racco  Resort Manager

Summary Heading: Pretty amazing...  This is the place to stay- even during covid
Summary: This is our seventh stay at this property. We love it, we love the staff, food, amenities, location.. This is why we keep coming back year after year. They take covid precautions seriously and I am very grateful! Room was immaculate, housekeeping requests were readily attended to, this resort is maintained incredibly well!  A few downsides... Service at the restaurants is slow and inconsistent. It's confusing. I just wonder if they haven't staffed it well enough for the deluge of guests. Tables were spaced well, not crowded. When food and drinks finally came, they were perfection. The wait was just frustrating. The pool is also another story. It was crowded and not adequately staffed. (I realized they sell day passes do this may contribute to an increase in numbers here)
Manager Response: Good afternoon Michiganonthego,   Thank you for your review and we appreciate your feedback. We really appreciate your loyalty and we hope you return for another vacation soon.   Cindy Racco Resort Manager

Summary: As a Monarch Beach member, I am at the resort frequently, usually 3-4 times per week.  The facilities are magnificent, the spa, fitness and training programs are excellent, and the customer service is always very good.  In particular, I would like to acknowledge the always excellent customer service of Spa Attendant Jason.
Manager Response: We love our members and are so thankful for your review. We are happy that you are enjoying your membership and community.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with spectacular jewelry store
Summary: A very nice hotel that I would have rated a "5," but for the fact that the bed was way too soft and perhaps needed to be replaced. I did not sleep well in that bed. Other than that, the room was fine. I had a garden view room, but there was still a decent view of the ocean and the outdoor balcony was a very pleasant place to sit.  There were hand sanitizer stations throughout the hotel which was a nice touch, but by the evening of my second day they all seemed to be empty.  Plenty of unmasked guests wandering around the hotel and sitting in the lobby if that kind of thing makes you squeamish, which it would have for me, but for the fact I'm vaccinated. Unlike the guests, the staff seemed conscientious about masking.  The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful.  Do
Manager Response: The private Monarch Bay Beach Club is a special place and we are glad it was a highlight for you. We appreciate all your feedback and we hope you return soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: A great beach resort and great recognition for Hilton Diamonds
Summary: I decided to use my American Express Hilton free weekend night award at the Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach resort when I saw that prices for a standard room were around $700 a night. I was not disappointed.  I previously had stayed here when the property was a St. Regis around 2013/14. Back then, the hotel was the epitome of luxury and high class. Since that date, the hotel has been operated independently as the Monarch Beach resort hotel and has now joined the Hilton stable of brands under the Waldorf Astoria.  The hotel certainly feels far less “stuffy” than when it was St Regis. There is a light airy breezy feel about the place thanks to pastel hues alongside white and blue furnishings in the main lobby.  I actually had a very similar room to the one I had when I stayed under
Manager Response: Good afternoon James. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay and thank you for the compliments. That is fun you noticed that we were the location for the Curb Your Enthusiasm episode! Please visit again soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent view, room, pool, property except valet
Summary: I had a high floor ocean front room on the north wing and loved it. Large terrace to enjoy the view.  All the staff was excellent. Breakfast was relaxing, enjoying the sun and view.  The pool and hot tubs are great. Once again, I enjoyed the view and well maintained grounds. Pool attendants were great  I called valet to have my car ready, 20 minutes later I show up, and car not ready. At $60 per day, I would expect better.   Resort fee of $50.  Hilton Diamond members receive $50 property credit.  Overall excellent stay, beautiful resort.  There is a tram that runs every 15 minutes to Beach, I walked both ways, 20 minute pleasant stroll, return uphill.
Manager Response: We are happy that your stay was overall excellent. We appreciate your review and your feedback. Please visit again soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice place...some learning curves...could be great!!
Summary: Just spent a couple of nights. Really nice room. Great overall facility. Customer service is very good, and most tried very hard to achieve 5 star service, although there were a few hints of people still learning the "new way" of doing things at this former St Regis. The Diamond benefits are very generous. Liked the place a lot and will stay here again. Some issues...valet service needs to fix the texting option so that it works. A couple features are a little worn and tired, like the heater/a/c tied to the sliding door being open, but heater doesn't work even when the door is closed. Nice Privacy/Service required display switch...except it didn't work. It would be great if there was a Lounge/Club level.   Overall a very good place...not quite 5 star yet, but has a pretty bright
Manager Response: Good morning Bruce,   We appreciate your review and glad that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to have you again soon.   Cindy Racco  Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: Spectacular "staycation" that felt like a true vacation
Summary: We just returned from a wonderful and romantic mid-week get-away.  We felt very safe during this time of covid.  Overall, we appreciated very friendly and helpful staff, beautifully landscaped & expansive grounds, light and airy decor all-around, spacious guest room and bathroom, and the Beach Club is an exceptional feature for relaxing and dining with excellent guest service.  We did have some difficulty reaching Reservations prior to our arrival (several un-returned voicemails) to communicate some specific guest room requests/preferences.  Upon check-in, our guest room was in the exact location we had specifically requested not to be (which the Front Desk had not mentioned to us).  However, we voiced our concerns right away to Christopher from Bell Services, and he was very
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your staycation. Thank you for your kind words and also your feedback. Please visit again soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: Best Oceanfront Resort in Southern California!
Summary: I have visited many oceanfront resorts in California including next door resort Ritz-Carlton Laguna Niguel and Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach was far the best property that I've stayed in. The resort is not only stunning with its own private beach, staying at one of the W.A. hotel did not disappoint as hotel staffs provided impeccable service which made me fall in love with the resort even more. Despite few management change during last few years  from being a St.Regis property to Monarch Beach resort, I am glad that Waldorf Astoria is finally doing it right and I will choose W.A. Monarch Beach over Ritz or Montage Laguna Beach any day.
Manager Response: We pride ourselves in our service and we are very happy to hear that our impeccable service made you fall in love with the resort. Thank you for your kind words.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: I only wish I could have stayed longer.
Summary: I was able to mix business and pleasure by meeting with an important business client at the Monarch Beach Golf Links.  It only made sense to stay at the Waldorf Astoria Monarch Beach, and it was a great decision.  This resort is new to the Hilton family, so it was nice getting Honors credit for staying at a California beach resort.  The service, the room, the dining, the golf, everything exceeded my expectations.  Everyone was friendly and always asking if they could help in any way.  I do realize that with the pandemic most hotels need all the business they can get, but every staff member was sincere and just had a great attitude.
Manager Response: We are so happy that our service, room, dining, and golf all exceeded your expectations. We sincerely appreciate your review and we hope to have you visit again soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: I booked a stay this past weekend as a treat for my son's 10th birthday. It was amazing. Teresa with guest services was amazing. She was so enthusiastic and welcoming and I had not even arrived at the resort yet. Plus during our stay she had a handwritten note and a treat delivered to the room for my son. He was elated.  Upon arrival check in was great. We were immediately taken care of and the staff was so friendly and attentive. Throughout our entire stay the staff went above and beyond, remembering certain details about us that made everyone feel special. In addition to the impeccable service, the grounds were insanely gorgeous.  It has the feel of a private Hawaiian resort but only a short drive from LA. As far as covid safety they have it down to a tee, but at the same time
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review. We are happy you chose to celebrate your son's birthday here with us. We are glad that we were able to make your escape such a special time for your family.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: The hotel is stunning, the rooms are beautiful and spacious, most staff members were friendly, but I am so sad to say that I experienced 3 star (at best) service at a 5 star hotel. Most luxury hotels go above and beyond for their customers, this is why we pay a premium. I did not receive the level of service that I expect, not sure I will stay here in the future.
Manager Response: Good morning Julia S.   We would like the opportunity to connect with you directly regarding your stay and to learn more about your feedback. If you would like, I can be reached at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com  Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: We wanted to get away for a quick weekend. We had to be on zoom on our last day but it was on our terrace. It was the best getaway we have had in over a year. The staff is top notch and the hotel is beautiful.
Manager Response: Good morning Stacie,   We are glad you experienced the best getaway in over a year with us. Thank you for the kind review.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: We love coming here. We have stayed here a handful of times before it transferred over to Waldorf Astoria and we are back again under the new ownership. The only downside is that every time we’ve stayed here teenagers (and their friends) who’s parents are members, come in droves. We were once teenagers and we get it, but the jacuzzis are constantly crowded with large groups of teens who are not guests at the hotel. Both daytime and nighttime—there are several different groups we have seen on different occasions. Their friends come and go as they are picked up by their parents...we hear their friends ask questions like “Do you ever go into the hotel and mess things up?” And clearly no respect for anyone else around them. With young kids in the kids pool area, the language and
Manager Response: Good morning JoJoChanti,   Thank you for taking the time to write this review. I would like the opportunity to connect with you directly to learn more about your concerns. I can be reached at Cindy.Racco@waldorfastoria.com  Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: As a Hilton Diamond member we’ve always been treated really well at Waldorf resorts but Monarch went above and beyond especially during Covid. My kids loved the Kids Club, pools and private shuttles to the beach!    A special thanks to Ariel, Lucas and Elana for making our stay extra special!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal Hilton Diamond member. We are so thrilled that your family loves our resort. We are glad we exceeded all your expectations and we can't wait for your next stay with us.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: Absolutely breathtaking view. We honestly felt like we were living heaven on earth. My 15 years old son’s face was priceless. The staffs were friendly and warm. They made us feel like home. We will definitely come back here again.  Excellent services. Very clean and the bed was so heavenly. We love this place! Highly recommended for everyone!
Manager Response: We are so glad that we made you feel like you were at home. We pride ourselves in our friendly and warm service. Thank you for taking the time to write a review.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: It was our 2nd wedding anniversary and we couldn’t be happier with our choice of hotels! The food at the beach club was delicious, the setting was amazing and the staff was friendly and professional. ♥️
Manager Response: Happy anniversary! We are glad you enjoyed the private beach club, had a great culinary experience, and had excellent service. Please visit again soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: Great service.  Great facilities.  Lots of hidden fees + dated tech.
Summary: My wife and I had a mini-moon at The Monarch Beach Resort during the Covid pandemic and were big fans of the property, the variety of offerings at the facility including the pool overlooking the ocean, the Beach Club where we had cocktails and lunch beachside and the ability to walk the full grounds around the golf course.  The service was fantastic and there were all kinds of generous complementary offerings.  The few things that were frustrating were: * $60/night to park your car valet.  You absolutely need your car to run for things like food because most everything on property is closed down.  Also a $45/night resort fee + all kinds of taxes.  For 2 nights it totaled $220 in additional costs, taxes and fees after the stay (work this into your cost equation). * The tech in
Manager Response: We are glad you enjoyed your mini-moon and that your service was fantastic for your stay. Thank you for the additional feedback you provided as well. We hope you return for another stay soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: Sidra was very pleasant and helpful prior to and during my stay. The check in was easy, the room was large and comfortable, and the bathroom was fabulous. The tub was large and filled quickly and along with the bath bombs was very relaxing. All aspects of the service was excellent from the from the drive to housekeeping... Thank you to all for making my stay so pleasant.
Manager Response: We are so thrilled you had a pleasant and relaxing stay. Please visit again soon.   Markus Krebs General Manager

Summary: This is one of our favorite destination during  COVID. Its very safe. We really enjoyed our walks every morining and evening . Our son enjoyed the pool everyday .Their private beach is also awesome as it not overcrowded.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this very kind review. We are glad you enjoyed the pool, your walks, and the private beach club. Please return soon.   Markus Krebs General Manager

Summary: We loved our stay so much we wrote a letter to the hotel. Here’s the letter:  To the Monarch Beach Resort Management:  I write this letter to express my gratitude to the Monarch Beach Resort staff who made our recent stay so pleasurable.  In particular, I would like to thank Teresa Cunningham.  Teresa was attentive to us before, during and after our stay and we truly felt that she cared whether we had a relaxing time.  She emailed and spoke with my husband, she made our hotel and dinner reservations, she addressed our concerns about COVID, and she sent champagne for our anniversary.  Because of the pandemic, this was the only time since March that my husband and I had gone out, and we only were able to do so at the last minute when my mom offered to take our children for one
Manager Response: We are so happy you had a lovely experience. Thank you for the amazing review. Please return again soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: Super clean rooms!! The staff really goes out of their way to keep you relaxed and so convenient. My favorite restaurant in the area happens to be at the resort. Unfortunately, due to Covid the restaurant has limited hours and was closed! I was bummed.
Manager Response: We are glad you had a relaxing stay. Please visit for another staycation soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: Monarch was top notch even during the pandemic! They take care to follow all of the Covid guidelines all the while making you feel like a valued guest. The resort and all amenities are gorgeous. The sunsets from the beach club in the evening are amazing. Hope to return!
Manager Response: We have made safety a main priority and we are glad you noticed all of our efforts and appreciate you writing this review. We are thrilled you enjoyed the beautiful sunset from the private beach club and we can't wait for your next visit with us.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: A Great Place to Relax with Excellent Service
Summary: Would highly recommend the resort! Great staff all around, making our stay an excellent experience from the moment you step out of your car until the time you return to it at the end of your trip. Even before arriving, the booking and reservations department was excellent too!
Manager Response: We are glad you had an excellent experience throughout your entire stay. Please visit again soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: We just stayed at the MBR this past weekend and had the most amazing experience! The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, the hotel was not only stunning but also impeccably clean. The food was incredible and the views were unparalleled.   We will be returning yearly! Thanks for an amazing weekend!
Manager Response: We are so pleased you had such an amazing experience! We are glad you enjoyed the restaurants and views as well. We look forward to see you again each year for your annual stay.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: Most beautiful resort, with class A+ service and amenities'. It does not get any better. I would love to go back, especially since they have great deals.  The beach services was like being treated as loyalty and the restaurant service was amazing.
Manager Response: We are so happy that you had a superb experience. Please visit again for your next staycation soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: Here for a friends wedding and it was a beautiful weekend. The wedding was amazing and we had a wonderful stay. Felt very safe and clean (COVID) comfortable rooms and beautiful grounds. We will definitely we staying again.
Manager Response: Good evening Paige,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are thrilled you had an amazing weekend. Please stay again soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Monarch Beach Resort. This is our third returning trip to the Monarch, and it always exceeds our expectations. I love the big soaker tub in the bathroom. The grounds are immaculate. The service is first class. My husband and I can’t wait to come back! #monarchmoments
Manager Response: Thank you for the very kind review. We are happy that your stay was so perfect and that we were able to exceed all your expectations. We hope you return for your next trip soon.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: I’ve had really bad postpartum depression/anxiety this year and on top of that, 2020 (need I say more?) My husband surprised me with a trip to Monarch Beach Resort for my 30th birthday. I didn’t even know where we were flying til we got to the airport, didn’t know where we were staying until we arrived at this resort. This resort has the absolute “wow” factor. The grounds are beautiful and kept. Every plant is beyond amazing, the views, the pool(s), gardens, staircases, phew. It’s incredible. Within a few hours of our arrival, they delivered a birthday surprise to the room - a bottle of champagne and the most beautiful arrangement of chocolate covered strawberries. I cried. No, I sobbed. I needed this so much and they absolutely delivered. We travel a ton and have stayed at some
Manager Response: We feel so happy that you chose to spend your 30th birthday celebration with us and that we topped all of your other vacations! Thank you for the nice review.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: You will not regret your decision staying on this exquisite premises everything is so high ends and customer Services are committed to make your staying pleasant.  They will take a beautiful 5 minutes shuttle ride thru their well kept premises to the private beach club with food, 🔥 fireplaces or you could go biking nor walking . I did my yoga and Pilates class and then went to their pools
Manager Response: We are glad you enjoyed the yoga and pilates classes, as well as your time at the pools. We are delighted that your stay was so pleasant and exceeded your expectations. Thank you for your kind review.   Cindy Racco Hotel Manager

Summary: We spent our first night of a wildfire evacuation here, booking through Amex FHR.   On the upside, our room was ready early, which gave us a place to go when we evacuated. Rooms didn’t seem any different than our stay 5 years ago, despite an expensive renovation.   But kind of downhill from there. The receptionist was cold, and really inefficient. At one point our keys stopped working and rather than fix it, she just told us someone would have to escort us to our room.   We could not get a table in the on-site restaurant so we ordered room service, which took almost TWO HOURS to arrive.
