Summary: We’ve stayed at MBR on several occasions and have always enjoyed our time here. The property is immaculate and thoroughly enjoyable.   Our most recent visit was actually what compelled me to write this review and it’s solely because of your PEOPLE.  Specifically, Teresa Cunningham is a stand out employee. She made the booking process thoroughly enjoyable. Teresa goes above and beyond to ensure her customers are happy—BEYOND happy. She truly made our anniversary celebration one we will never forget. We initially booked just one night, decided last minute to extend and she jumped through hoops to get it done. Not only did she get it done, but she secured our same room which was AMAZING!!!  The pool staff was also exceptional. Matt Spector specifically was a shining star. Every
Manager Response: Happy anniversary! Thank you for your review and for highlighting our team members who made your stay extra special. We really appreciate you and are looking forward to your next visit.   Markus Krebs General Manager

Summary: I think this property has significant issues. I had a bad experience at the food service place on the beach today.  There were countless open tables...a woman and man were conferring back and forth...it seemed as if she found a way to get us seated, yet he kept saying no....I could hear what they were saying. It was VERY uncomfortable so we left.   I called the Concierge for help with Dinner. he suggested the Beach House cafe on the property and said it had casual food you could take away or eat there.  He said they were open until 9pm.  So at 7:30pm we took our grandkids down to find this place. When we arrived they said they were not serving tonight as they had a special event.  How does a concierge not know what restaurants are closed at his own hotel???   They suggested I
Manager Response: I appreciate that you’ve taken the time to share your comments with us and am so sorry that our dining service did not meet your expectation during this busy holiday weekend.  I can understand that the experience must have been frustrating for you, particularly given that you had two hungry children to care for.  I would welcome the chance to speak you with further, so please feel free to contact me directly at 949.234.3433.  Thank you. Markus Krebs General Manager

Summary: Best hotel ive ever stayed at. Excellent service. Excellent food Great location It was a dream! Marcel helped us with our luggage, checking out.  He was friendly & a pleasure to meet. I recommend this hotel to anyone & everyone!
Manager Response: We are happy to be a part of your dream vacation. Thank you for your very kind review. Please visit again soon.   Markus Krebs General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at many five star resorts around the world, and the Monarch Beach Resort is easily one of the best. We stayed six nights. The service was impeccable throughout the hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We loved the two queen beds overlooking the ocean. There was plenty of room for our two teen daughters and ourselves. I loved how the room had many drawers and shelves to make it your home away from home. Food was amazing. A must is to eat at Bourbon Steak inside the hotel. Both the wagyu rib eye and the filet were delicious! You have to eat the beignets for dessert. So fluffy and an absolute delight to eat. Loved the pool and beach side service. We also used the car service to a local restaurant. We left the Monarch relaxed, happy, and well fed. Thank you to
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your ocean view room at Monarch Beach Resort and your meal at Bourbon Steak. We agree that the beignets are amazing! We really appreciate your review and we hope you return for another visit soon.   Markus Krebs General Manager

Summary Heading: Ariel, Danielle, membership team  and Aveo staffs highlight 5 star resort
Summary: We just completed a 1 week stay with  our kids and grandkids at the Monarch Beach Resort.  Our reservation was made in January, before we knew what a mass scale lockdown even entailed, for a late-June check-in.   With the hotel closing in mid-March our reservation became more and more doubtful, but front office mgr Ariel Lindsey and the entire Membership Team stayed in constant contact during the lockdown, which made our attempt at planning so much easier.  When we did actually check-in, they constantly checked during our stay, to make sure everything was perfect, which it was.  The Hotel went to great lengths to ensure every Covad-19 safety regulation.  I also wanted to single out Danielle Frazer, who in our opinion is an All Star at the Hotel.  She has managed various areas
Manager Response: We are so pleased you had the time of your life! We appreciate your detailed review and we hope you visit again soon.   Markus Krebs General Manager

Summary: The Monarch Beach Resort property is superior to its more famous neighbor down the beach, the Ritz-Carlton Laguna Beach. However, the service and hospitality at Monarch leave a great deal to be desired. Upon check-in I asked if any larger rooms were available (hoping for an upgrade but willing to pay). They offered a "discounted" small suite for an ADDITIONAL $1,500 per night! So don't expect any upgrades. And there were plenty of available rooms, as we were told occupancy was less than half full for most of our time there. The restaurant was not ready for prime time at all. The kids menu offers several common cereals ($8/bowl) and they had zero cereals either morning. They also had no bread. You would think someone could run to the supermarket and pick up a few things even if
Manager Response: Dear Ncinaz:  We appreciate the time you've taken to share your comments here and glad that you feel our property is superior.  This service experience, however, falls short of our standard and I'd appreciate the opportunity to discuss this with you if you would like to contact me personally at mkrebs@monarchbeachresort.com.  Thank you Warm regards,  Markus Krebs, General Manager

Summary Heading: Stalked At Night By Hotel Staff
Summary: Warning: Do not let the glamorous pool or the fact that it’s on the beach fool you. This hotel is not what it seems it is.   There is only one good thing about this hotel: it is close to Disneyland (30 minute drive).   The service at this hotel is horrible and I don’t understand why anyone would stay here. I was coming back from a long day at Disneyland, and I arrived at about 3 am. I went to my room and then realized that I left my room key with a relative who took the stairs. I turned around and saw that one of the security guards followed me in a separate elevator and was watching me try to get into my room. He then started questioning me about why I was here, so I told him that I was a hotel guest. He didn’t seem to believe me and kept questioning me. Then, I told him about
Manager Response: Good afternoon. I would like to extend our apologies on behalf of the team here at Monarch Beach Resort. I know that our Director of Rooms had been in contact with one of your family members and expressed our sincerest apologies for the misunderstanding. The server’s uniform was stained with food and as he showed me the menu (ignoring my husband completely) when he finished he took the pen that he was using to point to the areas on the menu and he tapped it strongly on my menu - as if to add emphasis that he was finished.  The younger men serving the food and drinks were all very polite, but this older gentleman, Sam, just seemed to be so chuffed with himself.  Really it was strange. This was so opposite of all the other encounters we had at the Monarch Beach

The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the housekeeping staff did a great job of keeping the room very well maintained. Overall a very nice experience.

The Beach club was very memorable, we had dinner there and if we would have been there longer, we would have dined there more than once. Definitely on my list of favorite resorts and look forward to coming back again!

I arrived late & starving and room service brought me maybe the best BLT I've ever had within 30 minutes.  It is a less than 10 minute drive to downtown Laguna Beach, and a short walk through the golf course to a beach near property that was loaded with surfers .  My only complaint was that it cost me $40/day to valet and park my rental car - an expense that I found annoying.  There was no option to park the car on my own...

Like any other destination resort, everything is way over-priced in terms of food and drink, but you have to expect that going in and remember that settings and views like this aren't cheap.  I did not have have one negative thought/complaint/criticism while I was here.  Highly recommended.

Parking is overpriced and so is most of the drinks/food at the resort.  Overall it was a fun staycation.  I am only writing the review to support some great employees who help with our stay.  Logan the Bellman – he was energetic and full of information.  Lobby Bartenders – All of crew treated us like family.  James at Concierge – Really took the time to make sure we had things set up.  Travis the Car Manager – Great guy who expedited our transportation needs.

First, we were promised a daily delivery of a newspaper, in our case, the WSJ.  It never came.  Next the service at lunch on the terrace was terribly slow.   When we asked the waitress, she seemed put out.  The pool areas are beautiful and the main pool is clean, but some basic pool rules did not exist or were not enforced.   A woman was in the pool with a wine glass.  Broken glass in a pool is a disaster.  Most pools will not allow glassware around the pool for this reason.  Also, a number of infants including one in a diaper was allowed in the main pool.  Again, a disaster waiting to happen.   Most pools will not allow for obvious reasons.

Summary: I felt like I was in Hawaii without all the travel and trouble. Perfect for our quick girl's getaway. Food was perfect, staff expert and just the right amount of service without being too intrusive, room was lovely, view great, pool great, spa is nice to have and the local for shopping at South Coast Plaza is great too! The boutique on the property also had wonderful items at normal prices - and that's not the norm!  I bought a rare Camilla dress there - who would have expected. Great beach walk for exercise or beach fun. The beach club restaurant is perfect lunch. Golf course is lovely too and situated on the water. A real find and big surprise! I'll be back with my husband because this is the easiest total escape with an easy flight into John Wayne.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous and immaculate property! Fantastic service!
Summary: My wife and I came to enjoy our last hurrah before we adopt a little girl and are so glad that we chose the Monarch Beach Resort! The service was exceptional from the very beginning. I got an email a number of days prior to our stay from Danny Kennedy, the resort's VIP concierge supervisor. She took care of all of our spa and reservation needs and even went to the trouble to surprise us with a special Indian treat and champagne to commemorate our upcoming adoption of a little girl from India when we first walked in the room. The grounds, the view, the facilities, and all common areas were absolutely beautiful. We loved all of the fire places, including in our spa rooms for our treatments (which we also exceptional). Bottom line: we loved our time and will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Dear jungerecht,  Many congratulations and thank you for the incredible compliment!  We look forward to having you and your family return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Markus Krebs General Manager

Summary: We stayed here over our wedding weekend (we got married close by in San Juan) but this was our hotel to stay at after the wedding. Monarch never dissapoints. The service was amazing I especially loved turn down service. Everyone was super nice and accomodating. I also liked the buffet breakfast on the 4rd floor (called Aveo?). I am a coffee snob and did not like the Starbucks at their cafe on the lobby level. However, I found the coffee in the room delicious even though it was Kruig. Just a great place to relax, even if you are local to Orange County.

The Suittes are absolutely stunning!

Summary Heading: Stayed for a wedding; beautiful place

When we landed and checked in, our third party provider hadn’t processed the reservation although we had received an email confirming our reservation. Summary Heading: Great resort on the whole but silly prices
Summary: Firstly let me say the staff are friendly and helpful, if a little ‘Stepford wifey’ (desk team could show a little more personality and less corporate personality), The hotel itself is immaculate and facilities are really well done.  2 things let the resort down in my eyes 1) The absolutely ridiculous costs.  Whilst I think resort fees are a rip off I could expect a $30 a day fee but $50 is beyond silly.  Secondly, and this is what disappointed me most was to find valet charges of $50 a day on top and this was not transparent when I booked and you literally have no choice you cannot self park.  These should be included in the resort fee. Also $10 for a bottle of water and silly prices in the in house restaurants.  2) Housekeeping was massively inconsistent.  Tea and coffee not
Manager Response: Dear Bren145,  Thank you for taking the time to detail your experience at Monarch Beach Resort. Summary Heading: Amazing and disappointing at the same time
Summary: 5 star location, 5 star amenities, 3 star service. If you're looking for 5 star service, this is not the place for you. If you lower your expectations and dont need much, this place is wonderful. Despite being set back far from the ocean and needing a tram to get to the beach, the location and resort grounds are INCREDIBLE. The stretch of beach the beach club sits on is world class. The golf course is new, modern, and beautiful. The rooms were renovated and fantastic. The spa is a perfect ten. The facilities are perfect, the yoga and fitness studios are legit next level, and locker room is perfectly maintained and they keep the saunas and jacuzzis nice and hot. The service in the spa is wonderful. The beach club is ran by a guy named Paul who has been at the property for 33

When my husband tried to explain that it was our 10 year anniversary and wanted to ask for suggestions to make it special, he was dismissed and continued with check in. We were given very generic customer service. Also, when I tried to make reservations through concierge, he was very short and seemed annoyed to have to help. One person is forced to reach across vanity and drip water on your belongings as the soap sits in wet holder and gets mushy. Manager Response: Dear piseas,  We intended for your visit to be extraordinary and we sincerely apologize if we let you down in any way. The wedding guests were rude on pretty much every account. We had excellent staff for most of the trip, however, there were a few staff members (one at the main bar) that was useless and unhelpful. We are planning a week long spring trip and we might stay here again, but next time I’m calling ahead to make sure it’s not during a wedding. We might end up at a different place though. We really wanted to enjoy the resort and it wasn’t possible this time, but it is a great resort nonetheless.

Summary: Property is beautiful. No question the view is terrific. Employees are nice and on the ball. Having said that, I don't plan on returning. As beautiful as it is, i did not find it worth the price. The food is over-priced and, what made that even worse, there are no cost effective options available on-site. Even an hamburger at the pool was half again the cost of what it is at other 5 star properties. The room was nice enough, but the only water provided was provided at a cost of $10 per bottle. Typically when I pay $800 a night for a room a bottle of water is provided. The movie system in place defaults to a gimmick that i have seen before. For any hotels using this, I think it is simply preposterous. Hotels charge for everything, there are plenty of hidden costs, so to bilk

Summary: This is our second stay at Monarch Beach. We loved it, and are planning to return. The rooms are spacious, quiet, and very clean. The service is impeccable and the food is delicious! My husband entertains customers at Monarch Beach Golf Club several times a year. We enjoy seeing the families at Monarch--very family friendly--and hope to bring our entire family some day. There are so many great activities for all ages that are professionally supervised. The workout room has the highest quality machines and athletic equipment that we use while there. The spa offers many relaxation and meditative opportunities.

However it's ideal for people who want a laid back vacation lounging by the pool sipping cocktails and spending a fortune for it. It is also great for a destination wedding or a weekend getaway for a group of friends.

We really enjoyed the beach club with oceanside dining and complimentary lounge chair and umbrella service right along the water.   We're from LA, so we go to the beach often, but the resort's own section of the beach was much nicer and less crowded than our beaches at home. We walked to the beach from the hotel both days, which is a lovely 20-30 minute walk. There is also a shuttle service from the hotel that runs frequently.   Our hotel room was great. We appreciated the balcony and the view of the property. I took advantage of a good workout classes and a meditation session. The pool area is also very nice with

That said the rooms are immaculate and the service is impeccable.  The grounds are beautiful.  Did not use the golf or tennis courses or the athletic or spa facilities. The pool is a little small for full occupancy.  The beach was nice and relatively private (as opposed to other far end which is highly occupied). Our hummus appetizers had carrots that  were limp and celery that was wilted and brown.  So we decided not to order anything else- seeing that they could not even get appetizers right. The beach club itself was nice, but the private beach had a horrible view of rotten kelp sitting at the sand with tons of flies.

In addition to all of the activities, the room Service, plus the steakhouse and a lobby bar made it tempting to never leave the resort, but there is a quaint town within 10 minutes of the hotel. I would recommend visiting the shops and restaurants.

Amenities include an on-site gym, pool, hot tub, spa, a bar and a steakhouse with private dining, not to mention extensive rooms for holding conferences.    The staff is considerate and efficient. The beach is in a cove so that makes it pretty near private.  California beaches are public by law, but getting to this one would be difficult without the access provided by the hotels. In the morning we went to breakfast but there was a 45 minute wait and it looked awful in that people were swarming around greedily cramming their plates at the buffet. So we left and went to the 'in house' Starbucks which is brilliant and ate our breakfast on our rooms lovely balcony. Overall it really is fabulous hotel.

This hotel fedex'ed it to me two days later. But more recently under the new ownership, I was there for a week this past Labor Day. Right after I had checked in, I had gone to the gym and then the spa. I had left VERY valuable watch in my spa locker for two days before I had realized it. When I went back to check, the hotel security Chief Shane Buschini called my room with wonderful news. They had found the watch and kept in a safe while trying to figure out to whom it belonged. They returned it to me and I was ecstatic. Thank you so much for your honesty and making my stay at this beautiful resort

My room was not available for check-in 45 minutes after the available check-in time, the coffee cups in my room look barely washed, the staff barely seemed to smile, I had to beg for service by the pool, and the inconvenience of the shuttle down to the beach spoils the fun. Summary Heading: What you see isn't what you get.
Summary: This resort is beautiful, and the rooms are comfortable and well appointed.  I was a little disappointed in the food. The restaurant meals seemed overpriced and the one institutional meal I had, which was served to our group on the big lawn, had shade for less than half of the guests, the rest had to eat in the blazing hot sun.  So hot that the silverware couldn't be held without a napkin, the cold drinks quickly got very warm, and the dessert melted.  In my opinion, the most egregious practice, however, was the growing hotel habit of adding "resort fees" to quoted room charges, which are quite high already.  This hotel adds $35 per day as a "resort fee" without ever describing what is included, a $40 per day charge for outdoor valet parking, even if you just park your car there
Manager Response: Dear 50lawrencet,  Thank you for your valuable feedback on your recent stay. Summary: Conventions. Families. Very busy. Far from beach. After the room rate they add many extra fees. A fee for "porterage". A fee for gratuity for the maids. So what you pay is substantially more than what they charge. And be careful. My room wasn't ready at 3pm when I got there. Yes it's a 4pm checkin. But if I paid for a better room I could have it. The better room I took had a view of the parking lot! I noted that on their online checkin review and they took away that upcharge. A colleague didn't get room till 5pm!

I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: This is an absolute stunning resort. Service was great and the location is seriously amazing. It literally feels like you are right at the waters edge. You are not very far from Laguna Beach or Newport and it is a beautiful drive along the coastal highway. It is only a few minutes down to the beach on their complimentary beach tram through the golf course to Monarch Bay's private beach club. The private beach is beautiful with a small private restaurant down there. Sunday the beach was busy but still enjoyable, Monday there was hardly anyone down there so we had the beach to ourselves. The food at the Stonehill restaurant was excellent for dinner and their Sunday brunch buffet was worth it. I recommend the fireplace terrace room which includes a kit for roasting smores on your
Manager Response: Dear Alanna J.,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: the best stay experience i have ever had and will looking forward to our next trip.  the service was exceptional and we were accommodated with everything we needed. I strongly recommend staying at he monarch again to all of my friends and family
Manager Response: Dear sbdonovan1,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary: Selected for an annual business meeting. Only thing preventing a top rating is that they forgot to replenish Kleenex in our room. By the time we noticed it was too late to call. Fresh fruit and meals were outstanding.
Manager Response: Dear llibeloc2014,  We are delighted you enjoyed your experience at the Monarch Beach Resort. It was a pleasure having you join us for your conference.   We look forward to your return.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: My husband and I were celebrating our 5yrs anniversary. We wanted to relax but stil be near our home, MBR is just the perfect destination! Located in Dana point, this property not only offer quiet r&r time they also have a few fine dining restaurant on the property, along with the beautiful well manicured 18 hole golf course over looking the ocean. We had dinner at Aveo everything was delicious from the fried squid to the steamed clams. Our server was very gracious and polite almost every working staff (from their front desk associate, bell hop, restaurant servers calls me by my last name I felt right at home! ) will definitely be returning in the near future!
Manager Response: Dear ponchik88,  We are honored that you chose to celebrate your anniversary at our Beach House. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part our team.   Thank you for your kind words and we hope you will visit us again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Great getaway close to home. Food was fantastic but need a reservation for Sunday morning breakfast at all options. Nice amenities and the Monarch Club on the beach was fantastic. Tennis was ok...courts could use an upgrade but location was great. Would definitely visit again.
Manager Response: Dear Sarena T.,  Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience. We indeed recommend making a reservation for our Sunday Brunch as this has been come our guests and locals favorite. Please accept my apology for any frustration this may have caused.  Thank you again for your review and we hope you and your family stay with us again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary: The property is AMAZING. Staff was very kind and accommodating. We could not swim in the ocean as there was a coast wide alert for great white sharks, which gave us hours of entertainment from our balcony watching the coast guard chase them! It was so relaxing and the perfect location.
Manager Response: Dear joyflores135,  I am thrilled to learn that you have had an exceptional stay with us and that we were able to exceed your expectations during your return visit. Great whites have been spotted off beaches from Dana Point to San Onofre State Beach, that is correct.  Thank you for your wonderful review and we look forward to having back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Amazing hotel. From the moment I arrived the staff were extremely accommodating and helpful. Rooms are  immaculate. The hotel is spread over just 3 or 4 floors so it is easy to walk around, giving it a much friendlier atmosphere than the normal high rise hotels. Grounds and pool are great but pool can get busy at weekends. I would suggest getting a car, the hotel food is good but pricey. Dana point is a 5 minute drive away with some great places to eat.
Manager Response: Dear jeremyagreen,  Thank you for your compliments. I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcome back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Paradise! Staff, property, and location are all absolutely perfect.  If it was more affordable i would stay for weeks on end!   There were some small housekeeping issues that were resolved by calling front desk.  Loved the fee yoga classes.
Manager Response: Dear MayMcMahon,  I truly appreciate you taking the time and posting  your review. Thank you for your compliments, and I am glad our team assisted with the issues in your room.  Thank you for choosing the Monarch Beach Resort, and we hope to welcome you back for another wonderful stay in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Had a Fantastic visit. Hole up on premise and have a great time at pool or it's restaurants.. or in your room. Splurge for a room with a view- you'll be glad you did.. it's just a 5 min tram ride to their private beach. Do getaway to town of Dana Pt , especially Craft House restaurant.. Shwack Grill is a casual spot w good eats. 2 blocks due south of Shwack is a cool, short little bluff trail with great harbor view. It connects to a paved trail for another 1/2 m or so. Take that til it ends and head down steps to water level and youre at the harbor. Grab a ride to Laguna Beach -great shopping and eats and drinks. Nice beach vibes there.   Dana Pt and San Clemente are rich w surf history. We liked that. 🤙🏻
Manager Response: Dear Troy D.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay.  During the summer months, visitors can enjoy convenient and complimentary transportation throughout the Dana Point area on the charming PCH Trolley, which offers daily service. Stops include Strands Beach, Doheny State Park, Dana Point Harbor, Laguna Beach and many more.  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us, and look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Our recent visit to the Monarch Beach Resort was outstanding and made special by the staff. We were staying at the hotel while our granddaughter was having heart surgery at Cedars Sinai Medical Center and the entire staff was aware of our circumstances and went out if their way to speak with us and offer any assistance.  The caring by every member of the staff helped us during a stressful time.  I cannot thank the entire staff enough for their genuine caring.
Manager Response: Dear 1Golfcrazy,  Thank you for your positive review about your stay at the Monarch Beach Resort. I am thrilled to read about your great experience and that our team was able to make feel comfortable during this difficult time. We certainly hope that your granddaughter is recovering nicely and doing well.  Please let us know if we can ever do anything for you and your family.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: The resort is a great location to unwind, relax and splurge. It had amazing views of the Pacific Ocean, picturesque setting for golf, great food options including Michael Mina restaurant, healthy lifestyle offers in the form of yoga, Pilates, spinning, etc and the Miraval spa. However the thing which separates it from other luxury resorts is the exemplary level of service and eye for detail. The private beach is a short tram drive from the hotel. Sam at the Monarch Beach Bay club is a great server and has great recommendations for wines. The Scottish salmon was excellent.
Manager Response: Dear Wunderluft,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you staying with us again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary Heading: The value just isn't there for the price
Summary: The Monarch's hot tub scene is worth it, and the food is good, but the details were off. From the daily sign up for WiFi to the lack of hot water in the morning, as well as the long line for check in and check out, the Monarch just failed to deliver the value that should go along with its pricetag.

Summary: As a frequent traveler, and in the hospitality industry, I am still blown away! From Lyle making our check in/bellman experience amazing, to Brandon at the pool every single staff person at the property was top notch. The grounds are amazing, the renovation is breathtaking and every inch of the property is 5 stars! We will be back!

Summary: Resort has many amenities and you won't spend much time there.  I had a King suite that did not have a pool/court yard view.  It didn't make a difference to me because I didn't spend time there other than to sleep.  Very friendly staff.
Manager Response: Dear mtfanning,  Thank you for posting about your recent stay at the Monarch Beach Resort! I am happy to hear you enjoyed your visit and our amenities.   We hope you will stay with us again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary: This hotel is lovely, but my main gripe is with their lack of customer service.  For being a 5 star property, I would have expected better.  I had no hot water for 2 days and talked to the front desk THREE times before it was fixed (and when it was fixed, they just replaced the shower head- why that worked, I have no idea).  The other problem had to do with the tram.  You must take the tram to get to their private beach.  We waited over 30 minutes both ways for the tram - ridiculous! It feels like a fairly remote location as well.   Some nice things - the plantings and grounds are beautiful.  The pool is very nice as are the rooms and bathrooms.  Food was very good.  Drinks were also very good but very expensive. Doubtful I would return on my own dime.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer W.,  Although I am happy to hear you enjoyed your overall stay, I am truly sorry that it was not an entirely flawless stay. Please know we take this feedback seriously, and I reviewed your experience in detail with our team. We strive to exceed expectations, and feel genuinely disappointed when we fail to deliver such service.   Please hang on to my contact information and let me know when your travel plans bring you back to Dana Point in the future (949-234-3301).  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent property.  Great staff, amazing golf course great meeting venue.
Summary: This hotel is a hillside piece of heaven.  Great views, delightful staff and amazing grounds, including the beautiful golf course and beach access on property.  The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean.  The entire experience is one you'll remember and want to revisit with others.
Manager Response: Dear travelersh90,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful location and accommodations; AVEO restaurant disappointed
Summary: The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The resort is located on a beautiful piece of property overlooking the ocean.  However, I was very disappointed in the meals that I ordered at two of the restaurants, AVEO and Part & Parcel.  I expect when I order a $59.00 meal (Surf & Turf) that it would be really delicious.  However, the filet mignon was overdone and very dry and the lobster tail was extremely small in size.  I could have done better at my local Sizzler Restaurant for a lot less money! Overall, we had a good stay.  The pool and jacuzzi areas were lovely.

Summary Heading: Service, style, Amenities were first class!

He explained a whole bunch of features to enjoy at the hotel.  Everyone was very helpful (especially Taylor Alpert!). Room service, pool service, everything was first class!  Even the fish at the pool were good - ate them 3 days straight.  Many different dining and bar options at the resort.  Views were amazing, golf was first class as well.  Complementary bottled water and fruit on the course.   Very convenient tram takes you from the hotel to the beach (another restaurant) for beach fun and sunsets.  24 hour room service and bars closed at 2am. Manager Response: Dear Grant W.,  Thank you for staying at Monarch Beach Resort during your visit to Orange County, California. Summary: A  real respite from the crowded pace of life around there.  Very nice grounds. Ken, a staff engineer, twice saved the situate by ingenuity and energy.  Commendable.

Summary Heading: Top venue with top service and ammenities.

The resort is complete with it's own spa, golf course, pools, hot tubs and Beach! You could simply not ask for a better all around resort. All you need is good weather. We visited in early April. Although it was not hot the weather was seasonally spectacular (70 degrees). Service was outstanding. Food was excellent. Only 60 miles from LAX but closer to Orange County airport.

Summary: From the moment we entered we were in an enchanted world. We were there for a 30th Anniversary Business Party and stayed overnight. The lobby is on the 5th floor and looks out over the beautiful hotel ground and the attached golf course, while the sun was setting at the end of our view. All the staff smiled, nodded and said something pleasant as they passed by. The front desk staff, I wish I could remember the name of the lovely woman who checked us in, was so kind and courteous. Learning that it was our first time at the Monarch they upgraded our room and said, "Breakfast on us."  What an introduction. You need to be slightly patient if you stay here as some things occasionally take time. E.g., took us about 2 hours to get our food when trying to do a quick dinner with our kids, but overall great  Other: nice touch with trolley service to the beach and back

Summary: Living in LA this resort is a short trip for us.  Although close to home this still served as a wonderful escape and romantic getaway. We appreciated the room upgrade and the consistent high level of customer service we received throughout our stay. The hotel and grounds are beautiful, very clean and well kept. Good food and drink options were plentiful without leaving the resort. The spa facility and massage were excellent. The pool area was large with a beautiful view and although busy the area was well laid out and not overcrowded. For us being "local" and living by the beach, the location of the property was not removed or as different from our day to day surroundings as we would have liked. That being said this is a luxury, elegant, well-run resort where everything is done

The view from the pool is breathtaking and the sunset is amazing.  The spa is very nice and the outdoor fire places are a nice touch on cool evenings. The golf course is okay  (I don't golf) from what I was told.  The beach looks great but it was very breezy in May so we didn't spend much time there during this trip.

Also Genevieve at the pool was amazing. She was so kind and made every effort to make sure we were comfortable and happy.  She is a great example of great customer service.   The Friday am TRX class was outdoors and was great . I wish I could remember the instructors name - she was awesome.  The am Yoga class was very good as well.   We saw a cockroach crawling on the chair by the window next to the clothing store and spa.  We just moved over to the next table. Otherwise the hotel was clean.   We

Summary Heading: One of the nicest resorts I have stayed at.
Summary: We stayed at the Monarch Beach Resort for 4 days May 2-6, 2017. We were there with a large group for a reward trip.  The resort is a 5 star vacation paradise. Immaculately clean, the rooms, pool and common areas are all inviting and decorated tastefully. You can find lots of nooks and crannies around the pool area if you want to quiet time or sit out in the sun and be pampered by the attentive pool staff while they lay out your chair towels and bring you some cool drinks and delicious food.  The rooms are large and new. You will want for nothing. Even the rooms without an "ocean view" are stunning.  The restaurants are wonderful. We had a lovely meal at a the Tavern; the name is a misnomer because it far from a tavern. The food and wine are high end and we enjoyed every minute

We loved everything, and didn't want to leave. We will definitely return soon!

But after that there seemed to be issue upon issue.   1. Immediately went to the pool and was notified the large pool was closed and when we walked by it was seriously green.  2. That evening, went to the spa and waited for a long time to be brought in because they forgot us.  So ended up missing my dinner reservation in town.  3. Woke up early for an 8am surfing lesson for my son.  They took us down to the beach in a cart and the lesson was great.  However, the beach facility itself is closed completely no bathrooms, water or towels or anything else until 11a.   4. Then again both pools were completely closed for the day.  They
Manager Response: Dear pkeller714,  Thank you very much for your review.   Needless to say I am very disappointed to read your comments. Please know we take this feedback seriously, and we reviewed your experiences in detail with our team here.   I truly apologize for letting you down. We would sincerely appreciate an opportunity to regain your confidence, I ask that you contact me directly on the occasion of your next trip away so I may personally assist with making arrangements.  SIncerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what was expected for a Luxury Resort
Summary: Although hotel cannot control this be very wary of the weather at this location.   In March we had dense fog everyday and you could barely see the resort.  If you drove 1 mile in either direction the weather was clear and beautiful.  The way this resort is situated it appears fog is common problem.   The room were nice but not spectacular.  The tennis resort across the street had limited option for guest to play other than 1 time each day.  The resort is quite spread out and service at many of the restaurants was beyond poor.  The food was just average.  I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear thereebs,  Thank your for taking the time and posting your review. The marine layer is a typical occurrence along Orange County’s coastline during this time of year. We wish we could control this - there are days and weeks our area is not affected at all.  I would like to apologize for the mentioned service issues during your stay. Please know we take this feedback seriously, and I connected with our team for their review.   thereebs, we  hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: A four night stay at this hotel was probably the best trip of my lifetime. The room/bathrooms were huge with a robe, daily free filtered water and bedroom slippers. We were with a group of 600 so all of our meals were buffet/served. Every single item was delicious...leg of lamb, salmon, hamburger, etc. The bed was also delightful. I was on the second floor and my view was of the neighborhood houses. Outside my lawn each night, a family of bunny rabbits would come to graze. I enjoyed that private time during my non-sleeping, east coast time zone hours. My only complaint was the ice machine was hidden and only accessible by bellmen. I used the private driver several times and Austin was delightful. I also visited the Ritz nearby and preferred the Monarch by far. A Ralph's grocery
Manager Response: Dear Isky,  We are delighted you enjoyed your experience at the Monarch Beach Resort. It was a pleasure having you join us for your conference, and it sounds as if you were able to sneak in a little R&R too!   We look forward to your return. Summary: I contacted the Monarch Beach Resort to set up a proposal.  I was referred to Taylor A. to help coordinate everything and she was absolutely amazing!  I planned the entire evening with her from across the country and she was able to make everything as seamless as possible.  I arrived a day early to do a walkthrough and make sure everything was as I hoped it would be and sure enough, it was.  The resort is stunning and the views of the ocean are breath taking.  The entire staff I came across was very welcoming and those who knew the reason I was there made it even more special.    Not only is this resort phenomenal but the experience you have with the staff and food really takes it to another level.  If you're debating on planning a proposal or event there, I highly recommend

Summary: We decided to get away for a fun girl's weekend. This was the perfect place for just that! The service and attention you receive from each worker is outstanding. From when you first get there and are greeted by the valet (Cale was very professional and welcoming) to those who worked at Part & Parcel Market. We enjoyed relaxing at the beach along with spending time by the pool. Overall we had a great stay and can't wait for our next visit!
Manager Response: Dear prenee3,  I am thrilled to hear you and your girlfriends had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary: From arrival to departure and everything in between.  The most well informed and courteous staff we have yet to encounter.  We upgraded our room on arrival and received our perfect suite, overlooking the golf course; and a great ocean view. As this was an anniversary holiday we were treated with many amenities and everyone knew who we were. A special thanks to Shefali Sharma, the food and beverage manager, as she went way beyond in service and a little extra.
Manager Response: Dear Rex G.,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary: We always enjoy Dan Point, and this time was no exception. The Monarch Beach Resort (first time we've been back since it changed from St. Regis) always has the best welcoming committee. From the time you arrive at valet, to the time you walk up to the front desk. And the breathtaking view as you move through the lobby and out onto the back balcony, never gets old. We went in town for a bit (Austin at valet services was great btw), but stayed poolside for the majority of our stay. The hiccup was the main pool being closed for the day. Other than that, the service and staff were amazing. We can't get enough of this place, can't wait to return.

Summary: This was absolutely the best hotel I've stayed at. Friendly, courteous staff willing to make your hotel stay outstanding. The property is breathtaking and the walk along the Monarch Beach Trail, wow! I wish I had the opportunity to use the other facilities on-site.

This was one of the best venues that I have attended. Kudos!

Summary Heading: Spectacular property! Attention to detail and guest service was outstanding!!
Summary: Loved this place! I am an Interior Designer and a spokesperson so, I can obsess about flashy and the smallest of things. If you don't appreciate the small things in life and need tons of fireworks and a parade to perk your attention, skip my review. This is one of my top places I've ever stayed. From the butterfly left on the pillow in your room, to the amazing towels, gourmet food, comfy bed and pillows, large bathroom, cleanliness, and recent remodel.... I struggled to find ANYTHING I would change. This place has views of the ocean, pools with the nicest people and customer service, and is kid friendly. Beautiful scenery, landscaped grounds, friendly check-in too! The check-in lady chatted with me for 20 minutes and genuinely took an interest in my husband and I. I can't say
Manager Response: Dear cjohnson112017,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the Monarch Beach Resort. I truly appreciate your kind comments. Conveniently located to ocean, walking/running trails, tennis courts, pools, off-site shopping and dining venues.

Didn't have a chance to visit the spa, but I'm sure it was great as well. Next time we will visit in the summer. April, was a little to cold for us to enjoy everything.

Without hesitation they brought us a few small items to hold the kids over. We had breakfast at Aveo and Sal took amazing care of us. We had dinner twice at Aveo and Jason was our server and was wonderful. The food was excellent as well. Janis at the pool bar was very helpful and provided great service. This resort truly is a 5 star experience and I will be returning. Even the checkout was a breeze and Bernice was extremely helpful. I loved my time here. Thank you!

The rooms are spacious and beautiful with clean, crisp bedding, all the furnishings you could need for work or pleasure, and no noise from neighbors or the hallway. The resort food is delicious, everything I had was great. Pools were warm, plenty of loungers and towels, and  the beach club was lovely and relaxing.   I would come back in a heartbeat!

The decor is beach chic and tastefully done. The Aveo restaurant is beautiful - I ate breakfast here everyday. Sadly, I was not impressed with the food on the resort..Aveo, the restaurant on the beach, or the room service. It wasn't bad, I just had higher expectations.   Some other notes: The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The spa is lovely and I enjoyed all of my treatments.  My favorite part is that the hotel uses Le Labo bath amenities.   I'll definitely be back here - It's a great place for business, couples, friends, or families.

The food and service was outstanding, I ate out at the pool for lunch and in the dining room one day for another lunch time meal and it was all really good. The shade was a little cool but the waiters gladly placed a heater close to the table and it become warm and cozy. I love all the seating spots around the hotel, grab a coffee and pastry for breakfast and head outside to enjoy the views.

I will definitely look forward to staying here again soon!

Summary: My fourteen-year-old son and I stayed here for the one "treat-ourselves-right" night of our five day surfing tour of Southern California.  I had stayed at this property three times in the past, when it was still under the St. Regis flag.  I'm happy to say that the new ownership has maintained or increased the level of excellence that we've come to expect.  The hotel and grounds are beautiful, and the service is truly exceptional-- we were greeted warmly upon arrival, and also each time we returned-- as a father-son surfing combo, we are probably not the typical guest profile, but the staff made us feel like valued guests and old friends.  It's a great property, which I highly recommend.

I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Incredible hotel, service and the vistas are second to none on the west coast.  The pool, ocean club and bar at night were big highlights. The rooms are very well acquainted and are right in line with a five star hotel.

We were there for a wedding and wanted our hair to look nice nothing fancy just smooth and frizz free . We didn't even make it through the lobby and our hair looked like we came from the pool rather then the Dry Bar. Bring your own hair products and do your own hair they stylists are not the "A" team. Other then the resort is great.

It was my birthday weekend and one of the resort managers heard it was and a bottle of champagne and some great treats showed up in our room. We ate at the beach restaurant which has a stunning view and great food. We also dined at the Michael Mina restaurant, Stonehill Tavern. It also was wonderful. The entire experience was perfect. We will be back

Nothing is too much trouble. It must be living in California!!! Rooms are lovely.  Food is very good with decent options from the stunning beach view and fab hotel options.  The golf is beautiful with the best views I've ever seen in some holes. I seriously recommend this place.

The resort is totally family friendly.  At the same time, it was serene and relaxing. There is a tram that is required for use to get to the beach front restaurant. Service there was lackadaisical and not friendly, plus since they're linked to the golf course, you are automatically charged 18% tip for that such service. When it came time to leave the Valet said "There's a problem... we lost your key and broke your windshield." WTF!!!! Then they refused to give us the security report. When we asked to speak to the manager, they said he's too busy. It took us 3 months to get them to reimburse us for the cost of the windshield never mind the cost of the replacement key and for ruining our evening. How does the Valet lose the key and break your windshield at a high end luxury hotel, unless, they were doing something they shouldn't have been doing???
Manager Response: Dear GsWandering-Soul,  Thank you for providing your feedback. Feel rest assured that I will review your comments with our team. If you would like to share more, please feel free to contact me directly at 949-234-3301.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Spectacular room, complete with a butler!!  We chuckled because we really weren't to sure how to use the services of a butler.  With that said, the butler and the entire staff were incredibly helpful and warm.  The marble bathroom was stunning.  It had a spectacular angled shower.  Access to the beach was effortless and very beautiful once you were there.  We also had dinner on the premise and thoroughly enjoyed it.  We would go back in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Dear vickicp,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. No matter what the hour of the day, our Resort Host ensures that your preferences are known and addressed flawlessly. This is a complimentary service for Premium Suite guests, and I am thrilled you had the opportunity to experience this one of a kind service.  Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary: The service and staff were amazing always helpful. The property is stunning, and the rooms luxurious.  My only complaint would be that the noise privacy in the toilet room is not good, due to all of the slatted doors.  Be aware, everything is very expensive.
Manager Response: Dear gail p.,  Thank you very much for staying with us and providing your feedback. Summary: One of my favorite resorts in the US! The remodeling made it even better! They could make the brunch buffet like it used to be but is still good! Can't wait to come back and visit again! The restaurants on site are awesome and the one Indian girl that works in the restaurant was so sweet and helpful!
Manager Response: Dear heather g,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! Good news, we just recently perfected and re-launched our Sunday Brunch. It's truly one of a kind and all-new experience.  I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Resort But Not on Beach
Summary: Great hotel and property my only complaint is this hotel is not on the beach itself.  My room was nicely renovated and had a great fire pit outside on the patio.  The food was delicious at the various restaurants.  The staff was always friendly and helpful.  I was there for a conference. The last time I was here it was a St Regis.  I did not notice any difference since it changed ownership - if anything I liked the addition of fire pits and what seemed like a change to the pool setup a bit.
Manager Response: Dear michael14ny,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay. I am pleased to hear you had an exceptional stay with us appreciate your kind comments.   You are correct, we are ocean facing but not ocean front; we are about a mile and a half off of the shore, which is a 6 minute drive with one of our private resort trams.  Thank you again, and I certainly hope we will have the pleasure to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for a meeting 3 years ago when it was the St Regis and again this past month. Something was different - maybe it started with check in? We asked if it was a "good room" (we had a room with loud construction outside on our previous stay) and the front desk agent said "it wasn't one of her favorites" but we could upgrade to a suite for $80 a night. We weren't really interested in a suite - just wanted a slightly better view.    We were pleasantly surprised after the description. It wasn't the greatest view but certainly wasn't a reason to set our expectations so low with it not being a "favorite"!  The bed was great - liked that it was elevated but they need to make sure to clean around the base as ours had some trash around it.  The bed linens were lovely but some

We intended for your visit to be extraordinary and we sincerely apologize if we let you down in any way.   If you would like to share more, please feel free to contact me directly at 949-234-3301. Summary Heading: Excellent hotel and staff that goes way above and beyond
Summary: Stayed here for a conference for 4 nights with my 2 kids and a husband. The hotel room was clean, spacious, first floor allowed a direct access to outside and a fireplace was a nice touch to make s'mores. We took a tram to the beach where very friendly stuff helped us out with chairs and umbrellas plus towels. Pool for kids is great to play in. Big thanks to front desk Anthony and customer service Dana. I will definitely come back.
Manager Response: Dear Nina S.,  I would like to thank you for joining the Monarch Beach Resort, and providing us with your valued feedback. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our resort, and I appreciate you taking the time to tell us about your experience. We have recognized our team for taking care of you so well.  Thank you again for choosing the Monarch Beach Resort, and we hope to welcome you back for another wonderful stay in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Recently stayed here for the first time and was extremely pleased with the level of customer service we received. I worked closely with Christina Boucher in reservations and she was outstanding!  She was attentive and immediately responded to my requests. There are many details to be handled when organizing a large group and she helped make my job easier!  We will return!
Manager Response: Dear HappyMamaThree,  I am thrilled to hear that you and your group had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary: My mom and I visited the Monarch Beach Resort for a girls weekend, and this was a beautiful resort! The staff was very friendly and helpful.  And I wanted to give a special shout-out to Alex at check-in and Austin, the Monarch Beach Resort car service driver.  They were both so nice and accommodating.  The rooms were very spacious, and having stayed across the street at the Ritz Carlton Laguna Niguel a few weeks ago.  The rooms at the Monarch Beach Resort were a lot more spacious, and they included a jacuzzi tub, which the rooms at the Ritz did not have.  It may be because the Monarch Beach Resort is 10 years newer.  Overall, great weekend and I will definitely be back!!!
Manager Response: Dear Allison S.,  I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our resort, and I appreciate you taking the time to tell us about your experience. Summary: This resort surpassed my expectation! The location was beautiful and the hotel staff were very accommodating. Our standard room was quite lovely in it's appearance and size. The bathroom with the sunken tub was a surprise! I loved the plush towels, the bath salt (they smelled heavenly and made the water turn into a beautiful blue color!), the slippers and robe that were provided.  In addition to cleaning the room every afternoon, the Monarch staff come and offer you a turn down service every evening. If we weren't in the room, the staff came in, turned the covers down and left a little chocolate on the pillow in a nicely packaged box with a Monarch butterfly on the top. I love the details!!!  The chaise by the window had a little table that held a bowl of salt water taffy that

Summary: Our trip to Monarch Beach was fantastic. We were there on business and they made sure we were happy every minute. Employees go above and beyond to make sure your day is happy. Food at Stonehill Tavern - best of the best. Property perfect - views outstanding.
Manager Response: Dear Ellen C.,  I am delighted you enjoyed your experience at the Monarch Beach Resort. It was a pleasure having you join us for your conference, and we hope you had a chance to sneak in a little R&R too!   We look forward to your return.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: I had a lovely stay at the hotel. Eric Liwski, the waiter behind the bar who served me lunch on the last day, was particularly kind and helpful. The view and the amenities were off-the-charts! The one recommendation I would make is that this hotel needs to provide more options to vegan diners. I tried to order a salad replacing fish with tofu the day I checked in and the restaurant didn't have any tofu. No tofu at a resort in California? This review form requests information about environmentally friendly practices; offering vegans plentiful options is an important environmentally friendly practice. Except for this one shortfall, everything else was perfect.

Specifically, a crib for our 3 month old and a microwave and fridge had been requested when the reservation was made AND the day prior to arrival (our stay was 10-12FEB2017).  When it did not arrive, it took not 1 but 2 calls the next day before the items arrived.  Same thing with newspaper delivery service.  It took multiple calls/requests before the morning papers arrived.  However, 2 individuals did stand out.  JEREMY, a bartender at the AVEO Table + Bar was so wonderful with our 3 year old.  While Dad was enjoying his refreshing drink, the son asked for a smoothie which JEREMY created to my

Summary: I visited the Monarch Beach Resort for a work event. The hotel and grounds are stunning. My room was amazing- large, comfortable, and meticulously maintained. We spent too much time in meetings and not enough time enjoying the resort, but I can say that the meeting space was lovely and all of the meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) catered by the hotel for our event were very good. We had 2 vegans in our group and the hotel accommodated with very delicious vegan alternatives. The hotel is not directly on the beach, but there is shuttle service. For running/walking it is easy to get to the beach walk which is a paved path that goes along the beach and then up past the golf course- it was a great place to take a walk after a long day in a conference room. I hope to have the chance to

Summary: Had an excellent time. Views were spectacular! Staff very friendly and helpful, particularly the valets. Given recent downpours the golf course was in excellent shape. Highly recommend it! The restaurant was very nice, food quite good. Golf staff were very accommodating, particularly for our last minute tee time that we made.

Summary: I wanted to love this resort.  Beautiful setting, comfortable rooms, well known locale.   I just couldn't get over the indifferent staff and ridiculous pricing.   It started out well, with a wonderful person at the front desk and a kind man showing us to our room.   Turns out that was the peak of the experience.     The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are well appointed & comfortable, and the location is within walking distance to the beach.  Should have been perfect.  For me though, the resort seems like a cold, business-type place, best suited for corporate functions, rather than a couples or family getaway.  Aside from the staff we met at check-in, nearly everyone we encountered was cool and unfriendly.  When I asked a front desk person about a trolly bus I read about that
Manager Response: Dear David H.,  Although I am pleased to hear that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay and that you enjoyed the resort, I am disappointed that it was not a flawless stay for you. Summary: This was our 2nd stay and we are already going back two months later! The renovations turned out spectacular. Monarch is a posh resort without having a pompous feel from the staff! Five star luxury from the entrance, rooms, pools, beach to restaurants and staff. We always stayed in WeHo and Beverly Hills in years past but are likely never going to opt for another hotel / resort in SoCal.    First of all a very special thank you to Taylor! Taylor helped my husband plan a beautiful family Christmas / Hanukkah trip and assisted us further when we decided to bring my parents along last minute. Thank you Taylor for all the hard work you did to make our time so special. What an asset to the hotel.   It was so great to see Mike & Giuliana again. They remembered us a year later which

Summary: We have stayed here multiple times.  The last 2 visits were for the DMB concert in Irvine. We have had a great time every time.  The service was exvellent, the resort is  amazing to look at and the grounds were immaculate.  Location was great for OC. Easy to get around from and lots to do in fhe vicinity.  We will return again this year.

Summary: Our two toddlers loved the private beach and pool areas. We didn't use it as much as we wanted to since it was a bit chilly, but the pool is heated to very comfortable temperature. Service was great all around. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear j2chan,  Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. I am so pleased that you and your family had a wonderful visit despite the fact that the weather wasn't on your/our side.  Thank you again, and we hope you will visit our coastal playground again soon!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: Can't imagine a better resort experience
Summary: My 4th stay here. Now that the renovations are complete this place is incredible. Service, room quality, views, food, facilities all first class. Staff can't do enough for you here. My room was large and had a view of the golf course out 1 window, the ocean out another and the pool out a third. Huge HDTV on the wall and spacious bathroom. Room was spotless and luxuriously appointed. The outdoor facilities are really spectacular after the construction. The room rate isn't cheap here but you really do get what you pay for - a genuine luxury experience.
Manager Response: Dear rikwynn,  Thank you for your loyalty and incredible review. We could not agree more: "a genuine luxury experience", this is exactly where we are positioning ourselves. Summary Heading: Amazing Experience For My Sister's Wedding
Summary: My family chose the St. Regis Monarch Beach for my big sister's wedding this past January. She only had 100 guests so we selected the Botanical Garden for the ceremony and Club 19 for the reception. Both locations were beautiful. This review isn't about the beauty of the venue though - anyone who has visited knows how lovely it is. This review is about the service. The Sales Manager assigned to us from the venue was Laura. All I can say is - AMAZING. We loved her from the start. Friendly, genuine, flexible, accommodating, professional, responsive...the list goes on. I want to have my wedding there just so there is a chance we can work together again. She made us feel taken care of from day one and I couldn't have imagined the experience with anyone else. It doesn't end there

Summary: Of course,this place is beauiful and in a gorgeous setting.  I am not comparing it against the average area hotel, but the other top notch places such as the Ritz Carlton, which is right down the street.  The room rates are similar but the cost of food and beverages within the resort was outrageous.  $26 for scrambled eggs.  A bottle of Napa Cellars wine $16 at the gourmet market across the street, $46 at the resort store.   Service was also spotty.  We had back to back reservations paid for separately and thus a bit confusing.  Discussed this with the front desk staff four separate times and were still locked out of our room one afternoon.  They just couldn't get it straight.  Also had a bad experience with a server in one venue.  We had some good experiences and loved the

Summary: This place is nothing short of amazing! From the moment we drove up to the valet, to the check in staff, to the bell staff, restaurant staff, pool staff,  we are treated like friends. Warm, courteous and happy. The grounds were impeccable! The pool beautiful! The very cute old-surfer-woody van took us down to the beach to catch a perfect sunset. The restaurant food was excellent, as was the service. We did the breakfast buffet, and I had the best egg-white omelet I have ever had (think large shrimp, smoked salmon,  bacon, feta cheese, guacamole).! Yes, it's not a cheap place to stay. But you definitely get your money's worth! Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear Marc K.,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back at the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary: As a local in the area it is a challenge to find places to host lunch meetings with out of town clients that has that wow factor. Monarch Beach Resort has that and so much more. Lunch at Aveo is a fantastic place to enjoy the ambiance, view, service and food. The concierge Melissa took the time to make reservations for me at a great table, greeted me by name as soon as I walked in and personally escorted us to the restaurant!  My clients were impressed to say the least!! The hotel is beautiful with amazing views and the staff is attentive without being in your face. My clients asked Melissa for recommendations in the area and she made great suggestions for children's activities that my clients later experienced and enjoyed with their kids. If you need a place in our area to host

Summary: We recently stayed at the Monarch Beach Resort, our room was beautiful, the view of the pool and ocean was gorgeous, especially when the sunset. Our suite host team, Julianna and Mike were so very friendly and could not do enough for us. They were very professional and excellent at what they did. We also went to Aveo for dinner.  Coral, the manager on duty greeted us when we were seated, she came over to make sure everything was fine. We have been to many restaurants and this was the first manager that I have truly been impressed with. Thank you Coral for a wonderful experience. We will be returning to Monoarch Beach again. Thank you for a wonderful time and fantastic service.

Summary: Let me first give you a little background on my parents. They are Beverly Hills natives and my dad in particular is "hard to impress" to say the least. So, unsurprisingly, when it comes to planning their trips, yes they happen to think I'm their personal travel agent, I always struggle to find hotels up to my dad's high standards. My parents have been all over the world and are used to staying at the Ritz and Waldorf, etc. My parent's had been here when it was the St. Regis, a couple years ago, but to be honest they were not impressed enough to return.   However, over this past summer, they received advertising in the mail about the renovations and take over by Monarch Beach so they decided to try the hotel again and they did so in July. They could not have been more pleased! I

Summary: I love the remodel of this resort - it was much needed! The new décor and overall property looks so much better and fantastic with its "beachy modern" aesthetic. So far, so great with the café and restaurant I've tried a few times.  Only disappointment is there is no more Christmas tree in the outdoor area overlooking the ocean. I'm a native and my friends and family often visit the local resorts, especially during Christmas-time. This year, we were excited and curious to visit the MB Resort to see how it was decorated with the remodel. Unfortunately, the traditional upside-down Christmas tree was not part of last year's festive decorations. It would be really nice if this decorative element was brought back. Otherwise, The Ritz Carlton will be our "go-to" during the holiday
Manager Response: Dear NativeOrangeCo,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Summary: You cannot beat the views and setting at this resort.  It is an absolutely stunning property.  It is quite recently renovated and no longer a St. Regis, Starwood resort.  Many of the staff are poorly trained and for the prices charged to stay at this resort, it is disappointing.  I will not go into details about our experience, but did discuss our disappointments with management who promised to take action in further training.  We will definitely return given that the beach here is one of the nicest in the southern OC area.  The beach club house is open only to hotel guests and private members and it a very nice facility to enjoy right on the coast.  It is very rare in OC to find such a facility.  However, it requires access via a hotel tram so is not that conveniently located

Although I am pleased that our team was able to connect with you, I would like to apologize for any disappointment you experienced during your recent stay.  When your travel plans bring you back to Dana Point in the future, please call me directly at (949) 234-3301, and I would like to personally see your experience through from the very beginning.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: From the moment you walk in to the Monarch Beach Resort, you're made to feel welcome. I love what they did with the recent upgrades. The colors are soothing, the succulent plants are vibrant, the new restaurants are beautifully appointed, all A+. Though the best asset here is the staff. Every single one makes you feel comfortable, welcome and at home. They also hosted the cutest Hanukkah events recently. which the whole family, and many others, thoroughly enjoyed. For those who keep kosher or have other food related needs, the staff in knowledgeable and very accommodating. As I mentioned, we love this property and look forward to returning.

Summary: We wanted a special somewhat local place to stay and have a great dinner for our 20th. Using our Amex Fine Hotels program we selected the Monarch Beach Resort. It used to be a St. Regis but while we had eaten at their flagship restaurant the Stonehill Tavern we had never spent the night. A heads up if you are going for your first time, it is not on the beach. In fact you have to drive away from the beach if you were on the Pacific Coast Highway. Our room was on the 6th floor #652 and we had a view of the ocean and a great sunset. First let me say our room a Studio Suite was beautiful. We loved it. The service was great including our Front Desk Agent Oana Puiu. Overnight valet parking is $40 and I believe self parking is $30. There is a resort charge of $35 one of my pet peeves.

We look forward to creating many more unique memories for you in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Excellent service. Lots of attention to detail and very friendly staff. Facilities and room are also very impressive. Best turn down service I've ever seen. Onsite gym is awesome too. I would go back again if I am ever back in Dana Point. I had a conference in the Ritz Carlton down the street and the facilities were not as impressive as Monarch!

Summary: I spent a fabulous 3 nights over New Year at this hotel, having last stayed 6 years ago. What a great modernisation. Everywhere is a huge improvement in both the public areas and rooms. The staff are terrific, especially Taylor Alpert, our Guest Loyalty Coordinator, who could not have done more to help and was there instantly to arrange everything and resolve any issues that arose.

Summary: The hotel charges a high resort fee per person which currently includes a free gym class, lowered greens fees, and a tram that takes you to their beach location.  The gym is a decent size and has ample equipment.  At the beach, there are towels, chairs, a restaurant and bar, and a fire pit.  The golf course lies between the hotel and beach and you can walk to the beach in about 20 minutes or take the tram. Our room was well appointed, very comfortable and had a private outside fire pit.  Read the instructions carefully to start the fire, which is very cozy.  The staff was professional and accommodating for the most part.  Food and drink were a bit disappointing at the main bar and Stonehill but the views were nice.  The hotel has the appearance of five star luxury done casually.

Summary: There is just one word for this resort.....fabulous. This is how a resort should be, welcoming, friendly, service first, comfortable, imaculate and most of all its not pretentious, there are no bad things to say here. We've stayed in many resorts along the California coast but none are anywhere near as good as Monarch Beach.
Manager Response: Dear shrop,  Wow, this truly made my day. Thank you this wonderful review about your recent stay. I look forward to having you return for many years to come.'  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: My family and I have stayed at several other properties in Dana Point and Laguna but Monarch Beach Resort is by far the best resort we have stayed. We were welcomed by an amazing reservation attended Bernice, who was so delightful and helpful with our check-in process, we were also given bottles of water and Champaign upon arrival.  We decided to pay the upgrade fee for a one bedroom suite since we also had our two sons ages 7 and 9 with us.  We were not disappointed, we had the most gorgeous ocean facing room with plenty of space and privacy for us and the boys.    The activities we really enjoyed were: The beach club- do not miss this-   the trolley

Summary: We have stayed at the Monarch Beach Resort while it was still under SPG umbrella and called St. Regis Monarch Beach. What a beautiful resort, fantastic service, delicious dinning... We stayed during their renovations and worried we'd be affected by noise or level of service. We almost didn't even notice the difference. That is how amazing this place is. The Monarch Beach, which is only a few minute walk away, is absolutely stunning. Every inch of this resort is well kept and manicured. We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Dear Eddie A.,  Thank you for your loyalty over the years and recent review on TripAdvisor. I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit.   The now fully remodeled resort looks stunning and I hope you and your family stay with us again soon to visit the 'new' Monarch Beach Resort.  Happy New Year,  Ian Pullan Vice President General  Manager

Summary: Such a beautiful property, amazing service, and peaceful atmosphere. We will definitely be back! The view in our room was perfect, there was clean rooms, and good food. They have a hiking trail golf beach spa. So much to do around here, it's perfect for a weekend getaway.
Manager Response: Dear aura N.,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Happy New Year,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary Heading: Old st Regis even better now
Summary: Impeccable staff. Very nicely done remodeled rooms. Great theme and story carried throughout w the monarch butterfly effect. Simple elegant and friendly. I got a pool view room and could still see ocean so may not be worth the extra money to get an ocean view

Summary Heading: This was a great, elegant and relaxing place to stay.....
Summary: this was an amazing place.  super attentive and polite staff, outstanding service, beautiful grounds (including a top notch golf course) beautiful spa, great food and one of the best concierge teams we've encountered.  rooms were modern and well sized with balconies.  the hotel and property are very well maintained.
