Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General  Manager

Summary Heading: 5-Star Resort with Excellent Service to Match
Summary: We came the weekend of Christmas. That can be a tough holiday for anyone to work when everyone would rather be home enjoying food and spending time with family. I wouldn't know it though, because every staff member treated us with the highest level of service.   The front desk kindly gave us a late checkout without issue. James at the Mirada Spa gave me an incredible massage on Christmas Eve and Gustavo at the poolside restaurant kindly brought our food to our room fire pit when it was too cold to sit by the pool. Small touches like this make a huge difference in a patron's stay.   We truly appreciated it!
Manager Response: Dear KM B.,  Thank you for staying at Monarch Beach Resort during your visit to Orange County, California. I am very pleased to learn that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay. Thank you for the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your feedback with our associates.   I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to our beach house soon!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: This hotel is great. It has two great pools and two waterfall hot tubs. The garden area is very nice and the ocean in the background of it all makes this Resort 5 Stars. The hotel has 6 hotels and the lobby is on the 5th to capture the amazing view of Dana Point.   Let's start with the lobby and gym. The lobby is very nice and large when entering and hey serve hot chocolate from 5-7pm daily. The terrace overlooking the oceans and the grounds is breathtaking. The lobby has beautiful wood floors and marble desks. The bar and restaurant in the lobby are also nice. The gym is very large and overlooks the ocean and hotel grounds. The gym has lots of equipment and several exercise classes.   Now to the room. Originally, we had two rooms. 1 Oceanview King and 1 Pool View 2 Queen room.
Manager Response: Dear Zach S.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the Monarch Beach Resort. I am pleased to hear of your exceptional visit and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming you back in future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: We had the pleasure of staying at the Monarch Beach Resort hotel for one night. It is a luxurious property with a beach like feel to it. I believe it was recently renovated. The rooms are spacious and quite impeccable. The decor of the rooms is one of my favorites thus far.   Customer service was top notch. We were upgraded to one of their premium rooms. We were also offered complimentary valet parking, which was very much appreciated. The staff at the front desk provided excellent customer service.   A couple of minor issues were that the wifi kept cutting out and we also found the food at the restaurants to be very expensive compared to other similar types of resorts.   It was raining the day we were there so did not make it out to the beach. This hotel is not on the beach but
Manager Response: Dear SapphireBC,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the Monarch Beach Resort. I truly appreciate your kind comments. Our staff has a commitment to each and every guest to deliver one-of-a-kind beach house hospitality.   I am pleased to hear of your exceptional visit and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming you back in future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent service and great Anniversary get-awayexpeierence
Summary: For our 5th year anniversary we decided to spend 3 days at Monarch Beach resort. They recognized our event with welcome gift of wine and plate of chocolate strawberries. We had a nice pool view with of ocean from the balcony.  The beach/ocean is a bit from the hotel and a shuttle runs every 10-15 minutes. It has a nice restaurant/bar and quasi-private beach. They provide chairs and umbrellas in addition to seating at their bar/deck area. It was Thanksgiving week, so we mainly did took some beach walks and short break at the beach. We also used the pool area as it had two heated spas.  We ate at the Stone Hill Tavern, had lunch at Aveo and the Bay Club.   I felt the Tavern and Bay Club were good, but Aveo was a bit overpriced for lunch options (go to Bay Club instead). The resort
Manager Response: Dear  H S,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us for your 5th anniversary. It was an honor celebrating with you! I am pleased to learn that our team went above and beyond to make up for the change in hours of operation of our coffee shop ‘Part & Parcel’ and that you had a wonderful stay. We look forward to creating many more unique memories for you soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: My family and I were in town for a wedding and after debating about where to stay--we chose the Monarch. The resort is beautiful. The staff is great. The beach however is not within walking distance--there is a shuttle that will take you there. The view is great. Especially the staff. The pools are heated.
Manager Response: Dear jpatrickDallas,  Thank you for staying at the Monarch Beach Resort during your visit to Orange County.  The resort's private beach and exclusive Monarch Bay Club can be reached by a short Woodie tram ride, which runs every 10 min and takes about a 6 minutes. Summary: the customer service at this establishment has exceeded my expectations. the staffing here really tries hard to make your visit here exceptional. they are extremely helpful and demonstrates professionalism. We had angela from the front desk, rick helped us out to our room and gave us great overview of this place, to sam from valet parking. we are definitely coming back soon!
Manager Response: Dear phong n.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at Monarch Beach Resort. It was an honor celebrating with you!   We look forward to creating many more unique memories for you in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Recently stayed at Monarch Beach Resort as I am a fan of Miraval Spa and they have branch here.  First class property. 15-minute walk to beach (or shuttle) but preferred the exercise and right next to lovely park which takes you to Dana Point village. Pros: superb rooms, staff attention and location.  Love the on-site DryBar(blow-out studio.) Smaller version of Miraval class schedule but still fun, although missing the "zen factor" in Tucson. Cons: Pricey, but you get what you pay for. Also, wish better recycling for all those plastic water bottles!  Special thanks to Jacqueline Kilduff, food & bev. director, at Part & Parcel (on site take-out deli) for taking time to send me recipes I requested.
Manager Response: Dear Southerner12,  Thank you for your review. We believe that the Monarch Beach Resort is the one place with all the right elements to capture the affections of anyone who has ever had a love affair with beach, and to create a strong bond with Miraval's focus on mindful living and dedication to inspiring Life in Balance.  I hope we will have the pleasure to welcoming you back to in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: The Monarch Beach Resort is just beautiful.  I loved every minute of my stay and I have to say it was hard to leave. This used to be St.Regis but I like it much better now, as it is not as stuffy as it used to be.  The arrival experience is stunning, I just love the new lobby and the gorgeous Christmas decorations.  The lobby looks great- the colors are perfect for the locale. I love the open space and the firepits on the lobby balcony.  It reminds me of Terranea now with the architecture and layout of the property and the vibe is similar- maybe a bit less formal, not as fussy as the Montage (which is a great property as well).  The Room:   My room was perfect. I give it a ten out of ten.  It has everything I need in a hotel room- roomy closet with a safe, nice big tv (not easy
Manager Response: Dear globetrotterrr,  Thank you for the incredible compliment!. I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit. Summary: Stunning view from the Lobby! Champagne on arrival nice touch🍾 Room service incredibly expensive with additional delivery cost, building works taking place before 9am (pneumatic drills), main pool could be warmer, I have no idea where children would eat in the evening and families feel comfortable, pollution in the creek and the beach needs a really good clean very disappointing!!!!! Good points, infinity pools, valet parking cost taken off due to building noise and some very bubbly staff in 33 North.  Magical point seeing dolphins from the beach 🌊🐬 x

Summary Heading: Best customer service on the planet!
Summary: This was our first visit, and we understood the resort had been recently rennovated.  Our room was gorgeous, with an amazing view of the golf course and ocean and a spacious balcony.  Most impressive was the customer service.  Although they seem to have a primarily high-end clientele, we were still treated like gold when wandering around in our t-shirts and ball-caps.  Every single staff member without exception made us feel like a valued customer.
Manager Response: Dear katestake,  Thank you for the compliments! Our staff has a commitment to each and every guest to deliver one-of-a-kind beach house hospitality. I am pleased to hear of your exceptional visit and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at the Monarch Beach Resort. The entrance is grand, but not ornate, almost minimalist and I like that style. The staff was friendly and eager to please. Our room was large with a king bed and balcony over looking the pool and golf course (room 206). The bathroom had a separate large tub and shower stall. The spa service was amazing. I had the 80 minute personalized massage. The massage therapist was very experienced and really helped ease my aches and pains. I also had a facial which was very good. The facialist did not try to push product which I appreciated. Everything in the hotel felt fresh and clean. If you like a large hotel with good sized rooms, a contemporary aesthetic, lovely staff and lots of amenities, this is the place for you.
Manager Response: Dear allison m.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review.  Not only did we fully re-imagine our resort, focusing on the coastal and more relaxed feel; we also implemented the Miraval “Life in Balance” philosophy into our daily resort operations. I am thrilled to read about your overall experience at the resort Spa - Miraval Life in Balance Spa offers an such an expansive spa experience that help guests achieve balance in their daily life.  allison m., I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: We had a fantastic experience but do have a feW things to note.  We arrived and were greeted with prosecco and a very friendly staff.  Our room wasn't ready so we went down to Aveo for lunch and had a fantastic meal.  The ravioli were delicious.   We then went to the Miraval Spa for the "relaxation couples package" which was an 80-minute experience.  BEWARE...  a 50-min massage is $200 per person.  This package was $290 p person. We though we were getting more massage and that the "bath ritual experience" was going to include something like a foot massage or some special bath salts or whatever. Instead, for an extra $180 what we got was just a 20 minute stay in a bath tub with a few bubbles.  It was highly annoying since the spa has a hot tub in the men's locker room as well as
Manager Response: Dear michelita27,  Thank you very much for staying with us and providing your feedback. Although I am pleased that your overall experience was a wonderful one, I am disappointed that it was not entirely seamless. We intended for your visit to be extraordinary and we sincerely apologize if we let you down in any way. If you would like to share more, please feel free to contact me directly at 949-234-3301. I would welcome the opportunity to speak with you any time.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for a corporate event over the Summer.  We stay at a lot of top notch hotels and we could not find a hole in the service here.  The room was beautiful and very well maintained as were the grounds.  The view of the majestic pool and then the Pacific ocean was spectacular.  The restaurants and professional service from ALL staff was excellent.  The only tiny issue was you have to take a shuttle or walk to the beach, which was also perfectly beautiful.  However, I can't imagine why you would ever leave the pool area.  Maybe top ten in the world, for beauty, snacks and drinks.  They dropped the St Regis affiliation and seem to have not missed a beat.

Here is what we liked: - Our rooms were fantastic, and on top of the promotion that we used we were upgraded big time - Taylor Alpert was "assigned" to us, she greeted us when we arrived and worked her magic for us the entire weekend. Last minute consecutive spa appointments, dinner reservations, whatever we needed she did it all for us and was available at any time. Thank you Taylor! You made our stay very special. - The upgrades that have been made were beautiful. We particularly enjoyed the new lobby area and the changes in the pool area  What could have been approved: - The only thing that needed improvement was the service in the pool area although I

Summary Heading: Still nice, but not quite what it used to be
Summary: This has always been one of my favourite hotels.  I stayed here 3 times before when it was a St Regis.  Now, as an independent property, there have been some changes. It is still a great hotel, but not quite what it used to be.  + still one of the most beautiful settings of any hotel (photo attached) + Michael Mina restaurant on premises was great quality and value - staff are very young and inexperienced; service standard is not the same as when it was a St Regis (eg errors made on room service order) - room decor has been updated, but feels "cheaper" (less opulent than before)  This was actually my first time at the hotel on business (all other trips here were on vacation). The conference facilities were actually great.  The breakfast food wasn't great, but perhaps was the

Summary: I attended a conference and was amazed by the grounds, interior lobbies, and the views. I was not happy with the service.  We arrived a day early and had breakfast on a terrace overlooking the pool, golf course, and ocean.  I was very disappointed with the service based on when we first sat down for breakfast. My colleagues were given menus and I was ignored like I didn't exist. The server took 10 minutes to return and take our order. We dined outside on a veranda with a view of the pacific which was amazing but the service was very slow.  From a conference perspective the facility was fine but the signage was weak which made it difficult to get around and was very easy to lose your way.
Manager Response: Dear Dan P.,  It was a pleasure having you join us for your conference. Although I am pleased to learn that you enjoyed the resort, I am disappointed that it was not a flawless stay for you. I will share your feedback with our team for further review and training.  Please hang on to my contact information and let me know when you make reservations for your return; we look forward to welcoming you back to our beach house in the future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: Monarch helped me celebrate a near Perfect 20th Wedding Anniversary!
Summary: Talk about pulling out all the stops! From Check In to Check Out, our visit was outstanding!  I think we owe it all to Bernice at the front desk. Because she cared enough to ask what brought us there, we were able to share that we were celebrating our 20th Wedding Anniversary. For the 4 nights/5 days we stayed, each day brought about little treats and surprises to make our visit very special.  Over the years, we have taken little staycations and out of town vacations for our anniversary and have stayed at some nice places, not quite this level of 5 star. Sometimes we get acknowledgement,  a note, dessert on the house, extra decoration, and once a room upgrade . . .some a little more outstanding than the next. No sense of entitlement from us just appreciation in any case. The
Manager Response: Dear MrsKimE,  I have to say that this is one the nicest and most moving review we received in a while. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of our one-of-a-kind beach house hospitality family.   It was a true honor celebrating with you and we look forward to creating many more unique memories for you in the future.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan   Vice President & General Manager

Summary: The Monarch Beach Resort is a beautiful property.  I absolutely loved every minute of my time spent there.  The rooms are spacious and very very comfortable. There is turndown service which is so very nice at the end of the day.   The only reason that I have given it a rating of three is its downfall is the CLOTHING BOUTIQUE on property.  I do not recommend shopping there.  I spent over $400 on a pair of Tom Ford sunglasses.  Not more than 2 weeks later my sunglasses fell apart, the lens fell out and the nose piece broke at the same time.  After calling the boutique to ask if I could return them, the manager relayed that I would have to “go through Tom Ford".  The manger didn’t even speak to me; she relayed this through an employee and did not even offer a phone number or
Manager Response: Dear Dee B.,  I am happy to hear that you had an overall wonderful stay with us and enjoyed our ‘new’ resort and amenities. Please accept my sincere apology and reach out to Ms. Michelle Frye at 949-234-3936 or myself at 949-234-3301 so we can assist with either replacing the sunglasses or offering a full refund immediately.  I look forward to hearing back from you.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: We stayed here specifically for a conference, the grounds and location are awesome! the food IN THE restaurants was great! The food quality of the conference lunch was the classic "rubber chicken" meal, it was cold and was not very good..  The shuttle service to the beach club was taxing at times as their standard answer was it should be here in 3-5 minutes and 15 minutes later we were still waiting multiple times!
Manager Response: Dear nvlandguy,  Thank you very much for staying with us and providing your feedback. I hope your overall experience was a wonderful one. Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: Best OC Exclusive Resort (Monarch Beach Resort)
Summary: We had booked the Ritz but before we left we checked the Monarch and they had a "Rediscover" package with a better room and pricing. Having just spent 4 nights at the Monarch Beach Resort, we will be coming back! This resort is fabulous: the newly remodeled resort has all the amenities for an the active couple, gym & spa with all the latest equip and great instructors, the setting is excellent with views to the ocean, restaurants, shops, places to walk, just relax and golf.  The staff are the very best from the valets, to the front desk, to the hostesses & waiters. Everyone has a smile on and is helpful and polite. (Very consistent experience throughout the resort). As residents of Pebble Beach, we highly recommend this as the place to stay in sunny OC.
Manager Response: Dear DS M.,  You truly made my day! Thank you for writing such a wonderful review about your recent stay at Monarch Beach Resort. Summary Heading: Beautiful Property and Top Notch Service
Summary: I spent 3 night at the Monarch Beach Resort for a conference at which I was a presenter. The property was absolutely gorgeous and I had a room overlooking the pool area with the ocean in the distance. The room was beautiful but I would have been delighted to sit on my balcony for 3 days and stare at the scenery. It really was idyllic. (1st level rooms had fire pits which were a great touch at night.)  Nightly turndown service (complete with a chocolate and slippers), was a nice touch. So were the ceramic coffee mugs, glass barware and other touches throughout.   Service was great from the time I pulled up with the valet, met the bellhop, was greeted and checked in at the front desk and even caught the shuttle down to the beach club. All of the severs at the restaurants

We look forward to welcoming you back to our coastal playground in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: This is a class operation...recently remodeled beautiful location and facilities (used to be a St. Regis).  The resort offers many amenities including multiple pools, golf , restaurants, spa etc.  We had 3 suites with balconies.  The rooms, the bathroom and the balconies were all spacious.  The beds were comfortable but they do not look like they were all replaced when they did the remodel (one was lumpy but the hotel quickly offered a room replacement).  The breakfast restaurant is bright and has a nice view and the buffet was good.  I really do not have anything bad to say but want to add that this place is expensive especially when you add the $45 parking $38 breakfast, $200 for a 50 minute massage etc.  So to stay here you need to be comfortable at these price levels.  I

Summary: My room was located to the back near the golf course. We had a one bedroom suite with amazing ocean views... The sunsets were breath taking. My family and I have been staying at this hotel for years and since the remodel and new owner ship the safe and hotel is still breath taking. I have to say Sandy, Eric and Saul at Aveo where over the top amazing!! Then there was Carlos, Saul, Terry and Megan at 33 degree N who I can't stay thank you enough too... Also Chris the bellboy and Eric at valet and Austin  the hotel car driver... Also the many men and women who worked on Thanksgiving to give my family and I a great day! But a big thanks to Francis Cruz, next we are there we need to get a drink...  Who ever hasn't visited yet needs to go!!

The rooms are well appointed, but I found the beds uncomfortably stiff and too high (I'm only 5'3") .  The "firepit" rooms are just regular rooms and the firepits are not real, they are freestanding heaters, FYI. Convenient to walk to pool though.  When we arrived the place was just about empty (see photos), nevertheless, not enough staff around anywhere. This was especially a problem at dinner. There was one party in the rear room,

I am the one that sets everything up, so I have a lot of interaction with the reservations and front desk staff.  These people make my job so much easier, handling  every single detail which makes the stay so much more enjoyable.  Specifically Francis Cruz in reservations is so knowledgable and helpful, and has such an outstanding  attitude that I fear the day he ever leaves, which hopefully won't ever happen.  In addition, front desk professionals Ricky Uribe and Oana Puiu were couldn't have been nicer in handling every single request with a smile during our stay.  Separately we attended Thanksgiving brunch at the new Aveo

Last year was a bit of a disappointment, not only because of the remodel, but because they trimmed the food offerings, eliminating the Asian food.   This year, we were so excited when our waiter, Dan (who was awesome by the way), told us that the sushi was back! We all enjoyed the sashimi as one of the many delicious plates at our table.   Thank you and I can't wait for next thanksgiving!

I absolutely love it here and will be back. Keep up the good work everyone!

Summary Heading: A lovely retreat on the Southern California Coast

The balcony is a great place for wine in the evening or coffee in the morning.  The bathroom is a true treat - the oversized bathtub is the perfect place to unwind after a long day.  Restaurants The first day we enjoyed lunch at the Monarch Beach Club.  This is a private club only open to members and resort guests.  The food was very good and you can't beat the views - right on the ocean.  The main restaurant

I arrived just in time to check-in and make the last appointment with visiting Miraval specialist Andrew Wolf. He was empathic, knowledgable, and just an all-around lovely guy. Everything went downhill from there.  It took 2.5 hours for the valet to get all of my luggage to the room.  In their defense, I had to leave my key with the manager because after 10 minutes of waiting, I couldn't

Sandy was in incredible server.  She took great care of our party and we all had a great time.  The "donut" dessert was to die for - not a crumb left! Sandy really made our night special.  She was attentive and accommodating and incredibly friendly!   Great job MBR and Aveo!!

Summary: The Monarch Beach Resort, formerly the St. Regis, is reopened under new management and provides the same or a higher standard of service and resort experience. The setting is spectacular. Today at breakfast I sat looking out over a deep blue Pacific with islands visible in the far distance. The Aveo restaurant is nice and the terrace view described above is phenomenal. The Stone Hill Tavern is a great fine dining experience. You can also take a golf cart powered tram down to their private beach and beach restaurant. I highly recommend lunch on the patio of the beach restaurant, breakfast on the terrace and dinner at Stone Hill Tavern by Michael Mina. They have a nice cafe called Parcel and Post serving Starbucks and selling sundries. The new Miraval Spa is a step up from the

If you are looking for a romantic get away or with family, definitely a place to consider.

I would stay again anytime.

Their dedication to Customer Service was inspiring as I am in the customer service industry. Each person, from the cleaning staff, ground staff, food service, pool service, to the beach service was genuinely ready to make sure I had the best time ever.  I would definitely come back to this resort!! The room was comfortable and the turn-down service was unexpected and excellent.  No detail was left unattended to.  A lot of genuine smiles and service!! Eric at the pool bar made the best margarita ever, BTW!

The resort staff pay such special attention to detail- they provide such amazing service.  Breakfast at Aveo a few times. Service was stellar, view was gorgeous, food was outstanding. Poolside lunch was fantastic and perfect.  Beach and pools were dreamy and relaxing. Rooms were incredibly spacious, well-kept, clean, and very comfortable. My only negative was the room service food itself- the service was outstanding but the food itself was unimpressive and expensive. I wouldn't do that again, but we would do every single thing at this resort again and again and again. We can't wait to return!

They also provided a salad buffet where salads were freshly mixed on the spot.  The staff quietly and efficiently kept everything clean and refreshed frequently.   We had a great evening.

The pool which is being redone always has a good mix of people and families all having a good time.  The lobby and bar always has some action going on around dinner time and its easy to meet people. It has more edge and fun than the Ritz, less price than Montage and always hits the mark.  Long been one of my favorite spas.

Everything from luggage to making sure we had a restful stay was covered. We had some knowledge of the area but wanted some new ideas and help with our next destination and the concierge, Melissa Miles was awesome. So personable and helpful. She went above and beyond to keep us on track. I say "on track" because it's very easy to stay solely on resort. It's that great. It's gorgeous ( I mean a housewife got married there!). Jay Leno popped in to an hour of stand up for a cooperate event that was being

Summary: As a family we had a lovely stay at The Monarch Beach Resort. The restaurants are nice (breakfast service though was sometimes slow and the beach restaurant needs a facelift) and the new pool area is very nice. The private beach is also great but I would have preferred it if the shuttle bus service between the beach and the resort was more frequent. My only real complaint was that as a hotel guest you are still required to pay an additional and extortionate charge for using the gazebos and even the large sun loungers.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and staff, beautiful location, but I dont like the "fine print" games
Summary: The room and hotel staff were great. I cant say enough about the view and how clean the property was. From a hotel stand point I would stay here again. However upon checking in they gave me a "Grand Opening Special Invitation" for the spa. It was for $50 off a spa service.  When I called and booked a service I said I had received a $50 off coupon when I checked in that I wanted to use. She (Melissa) asked what service I would like and booked a manicure. The manicure was nice and there were no issues. However when I went to pay, I was told the coupon was no good. There was fine print at the bottom that said, "Excludes Lippmann Salon Services". Like I have any idea what that means!?! They knew what I had at the time of booking and said nothing. Totally felt like a bait and switch.
Manager Response: Dear Robert G.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay. The amazing staff will fire up the heaters, bring you a cozy blanket, whatever will make your meal a wonderful experience.  Each staff member was so helpful and genuine.  Kudos to our concierge who was always there to help with each step of our visit.  This one is a winner.

She was great at listening to what we wanted to do for dinners and activities then emailing me all the contact information... so detailed it even had the time it would take to get from place to place... so helpful.... The rooms are spacious, clean and well furnished. The ladies who undertake the daily exercise classes are both very knowledgable and friendly as are all the staff. The pool area is very nice, the beds plentiful & comfy and lunch with a few cocktails in the afternoon was a delight. I have nothing but praise for this hotel and its staff ie bartenders, concierge, front desk etc etc and would highly recommend it to anyone.

We got upgraded to the Suite overlooking the beach and pool and had front row seats to a killer wedding band on Saturday night as well as an amazing fireworks show.  Congrats to Michael and Michelle on your wedding (I think that was your first names -- we were a bit drunk drinking the complimentary champagne on the balcony listening to all your speeches).  This hotel is on par with the Montage and a bit nicer than the Ritz.  Highly highly recommend!

Summary: My wife and I spent four incredible days at the Monarch Beach Resort in Dana Point, California.  From the minute we arrived, there was water handed to us, and check in was a breeze.  We upgraded to a suite and it was unbelievable.  The size was in excess of 1500 square feet.  The suite had two full bathrooms and included French roasted coffee every morning, shoe shine, and pressing of clothes.  My wife had hurt her back and the staff brought her ice on many occasions.  The patio was great, she and I sat out there for hours and looked at the ocean and worked.  On a one to ten scale, I would rate this property a fifteen.

We got a cabana by the pool which was serviced all day long with perfect drinks and yummy tacos.  We have a new destination when we need that easy escape from the grind.

The one downside if you'd call it that is the food - it's uninspired at the breakfast and lunch restaurant.  Dining at Stonewall is the exception - fabulous. We had breakfast at Aveo each morning as it was included in our stay. The food was very good and the views spectacular.   We did a couple of the Miraval spa activities including a fun cardio drumming class and beach yoga. While the hotel isn't on the beach they have a shuttle running back and forth between the hotel and the beach club (lunch there was also good). The shuttle takes about 5 minutes.   The staff was amazing.  Everyone was very friendly and very capable.   I highly recommend this place.   While we didn't have children with us, it seemed very family friendly. There were lots of kids there.

Sabrina sent a thoughtful birthday sweets treat, it was very heart warming.   Steve (Steven?) at the Front Desk was very accommodating. He accompanied me to where the piano was, moved it, and took photos for me with my baby, that is service at it's finest. Summary Heading: Very nice...but it's not the St Regis.
Summary: I took my wife here for 5 days that included July 4th. We had a great time but not the luxury resort I was expecting.  When I made the reservation it was for the "St. Regis Hotel". The hotel recently changed hands and in-between making my reservations, it was renamed the Monarch Beach Resort. Since we had already paid for the trip, we went anyway, and kept open minds. The hotel grounds, our room and the lobby areas were kept clean and are updated. The elevators are kind of far from the lobby but not too bad.  The staff was great and very accommodating. The beach restaurant has a limited menu that can get expensive, so be prepared. Overall a well run, clean and updated resort.

Club service for drinks on the beach is slow, overpriced and the included tip is insulting and shouldn't be necessary.  The beach club must be selling memberships to not only residents, but anyone able/willing to pay a fee.  The clientele on the beach was surprising loud, drunk and disruptive.  Not at all exclusive anymore.  The tram

Manager Response: Dear filup945,  Thank you for providing your honest feedback and please accept my sincere apology for the frustration and inconvenience you experienced. Separate spa pool for laps is nice with an outdoor co-ed jacuzzi. There is also a spa cafe. The meals were uneven. Service time from Aveo was long. Took an hour to get cold oatmeal and a muffin. Part and Parcel was quick but the seating area is too small. Best is taking the tram down to the beach where the Monarch Bay Club has both good
Manager Response: Dear dziran,  Thank you very much for staying with us and providing your feedback. We hope your overall experience was a wonderful one. Summary Heading: Relaxing getaway at MBR (with some fine tuning)
Summary: Overall enjoyed our long weekend stay at MBR. In terms of pros...the grounds are very well kept (plants & flora beautifully arranged, fountains, small botanical garden--make it nice for quiet or romantic stroll around the property), open lobby, restaurants & lounges have nice areas maximizing sunset ocean views. The renovated rooms were comfortable and tastefully decorated. There were some ants in our bathroom that seemed to increase each day (I think there was a crack in the floor). We did notify management on last day and they did say they would address. The tram was convenient to get to/from the beach. Location of property itself was convenient to downtown Dana Point area (recommend getting breakfast in town!) and Laguna Beach. The store in the lobby was good for snacks or
Manager Response: Dear RockScissorsPaper,  Thank you for staying at Monarch Beach Resort  We are thrilled to hear that you had an overall wonderful stay with us and enjoyed our ‘new’ resort and amenities. It is vitally important to us that we provide the best customer service to our guests and are always appreciative to our guests when they provide us feedback when we don’t.   Thank you for your detailed comments - I will connect with our team to further review and training.  I hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back to our beach house!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed 4 nights in a quiet room with our own fire pit! The room was large, towels thick and bath products wonderful. The bathroom has both a shower and a tub.  One of the things we loved was the breeze at the pool. You are a bit on a hill and while at the pool you overlook the ocean. I did not have the opportunity to take the shuttle to the beach but friends said it was very nice. Food was good and the chef even was willing to prepare a salt free chicken dish for me. Would definitely go back!
Manager Response: Dear angela2336,  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: Very large resort.  Recently remodeled and taken over.  We had a lovely stay in a suite. We were provided a butler.  The lobby is open air and breathtaking.  There is a starbucks in the lobby.  The beds were super comfy.  There is a wonderful supply of luxury bath products provided including sun block lotion.  We'll definitely be back.
Manager Response: Dear Rudypup,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary: I cannot say enough about the resort and the staff!  From the moment we walked in until we drove away we were taken care of the entire weekend!  The change in ownership was seamless!  Thank you all!  We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear teejaebee,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at Monarch Beach Resort. I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan Vice President & General Manager

Summary Heading: New ownership, newly renovated lovely with a few quirks and growing pains.

As our driver pulled into the property the grounds and fountains are beautiful. As you approach the lobby you look straight out over the grounds, pool, bluff and see the ocean.  You will find yourself stopping to admire that beautiful view.  The property had just finished going through a $40M dollar renovation. The front desk person was polite, friendly and efficient although my room was not ready  She took my cell phone number and advised they would call when it was ready. I flew in from the east coast and was tired and hungry.  The choices for a" late

Summary: 6 star service. Beautiful rooms. Many excellent restaurants and the Miraval Spa. We could not ask for more. AVEO restaurant is wonderful for both lunch and dinner. Miraval offers great massages, I recommend a personal massage with Maria or Debra and the Ultimate Ayurvedic treatment with James.

Summary: Been to this lovely property several times before under St Regis management- always a treat.  Now, since renovation and with new Miraval management it is EVEN BETTER!  6 nights here without 1 single negative to report.  Every employee- from pool staff, valet, front desk, bell staff, concierge, restaurants, and event team has been professional, delightful, friendly- perfect.  Truly!  Even the "banquet" breakfasts have very nice with excellent and attentive staff.  An outdoor buffet patron the great lawn for 600 was wonderful- food was delicious and plentiful and served right up to the ending time (no empty platters or disappearing staff).  Every detail seems attended to- with the guests in mind.  I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough (and I'm lucky enough to stay in fine

Summary Heading: Stay somewhere else in Dana Point; Ritz Carlton or Montage Resort is better
Summary: This is the first resort  we have  stayed at where we have not been happy with the  service and overall attitude .  We checked in with a very rude hotel staff member. We supposedly got an ocean view upgrade ,where you had to stretch out at least five feet from the balcony to remotely see the ocean in the distance.  You CANNOT pay for anything CASH on property.. If you have friends over from the area , you basically have to charge everything on your tab.....  The overall attitude is poor on the property. American Express  made our travel arrangements , and upon check in we were given totally different room  rates.... Lost part of the afternoon arguing with them about this. Not happy with the Monarch Beach Resort at all. If you want to get your eyes gouged out, stay here for poor
Manager Response: none

Summary: The grand old resort is fantastic.  The view as you walk in is breath-taking.  The rooms are a bit dated, but the rest of the resort shows it's recent $40 million overhaul. The rooms themselves are clean and well kept, and the marble bathrooms with separate showers are top notch!  I'm not a golfer, but the course looked fantastic and was quite busy.  Try for the midweek summer special as it offers the best prices in the area!  From the bellboy, to the maid, to valet, to office staff: all the employees at the hotel were spectacular!!!
Manager Response: Dear RZ_STL_1,  Thank you for posting about your recent stay at the Monarch Beach Resort! Summary: Spent a small fortune to stay here for a long weekend. Close to 5 stars, but there were some disappointments.    First, the aspects that were absolutely amazing. The property and rooms are phenomenal. Dinner at Stonehill Tavern was one of the best fine dining experiences we've ever had. Loved the spa.  And then, the letdowns. My Mom had called the concierge one day prior to our checkin to surprise us with a gift card and a note. Hotel charged her card, but no gift was delivered. Kind of ruined what was supposed to be a nice, unexpected gesture. After some back and forth, they delivered the card to our room with a small flower arrangement as an apology. Not a deal breaker by any means, but not a shining moment for their guest services department. Valet parking was chaotic and the

Summary Heading: Dishonest and unprofessional staff mainly the front desk assistant manager

This was going to be offered as long as the room was not booked again! On the day of the ck in I was told it was not booked and I mentioned our 6pm check out and no one told me that was not possible! So 1st day went fine but not as perfect as they said it would be some of my promises was not fulfilled but I did not complain. Came 2nd day they called me and ask when will I leave the room and I mentioned since the room was not booked for the next day my deal was to stay till 6 pm! Long story short they said they can't do that and I said why if the room is not booked why would it matter? The girl left and came back

Summary: I stayed at this property for 3 nights for a work event. I can say it was one of the nicest hotel properties I've experienced.   The Pros -The sunsets! Seriously some of the most beautiful ocean sunsets I've seen. The lobby bar is situated perfectly to watch the sun sink.  -The staff are attentive and go out of their way to serve. The front desk made an effort to remember my name. A staff member walked me to my room (which wasn't close) because they were undergoing construction and he didn't want me to get lost.  -The rooms are large and luxurious! I especially enjoyed the spacious bathroom.   The Cons -The room service menu was quite overpriced (even for a hotel of this caliber). I went to the cafe near the lobby and it was a fraction of the price.  -At the time of my stay, the
Manager Response: Dear cchikergirl,  Thank you for your compliments and indeed, we are very proud of our "million dollar" views from our newly renovated main lobby and lobby lounge, 33 North! Summary Heading: Scenary of the Pacific Ocean, great accommodations, top quality food, nearby events like sailing
Summary: Scenery of the Pacific Ocean, great accommodations, top quality food, nearby events like sailing on a 90 year old Schooner The Curlew soaked in history... kid friendly, relaxing, it is one of the best resorts of many I've been to on the California coast. What a wonderful place to take your special loved one, where the upgraded rooms are so impressive with massive bathrooms and incredibly comfortable king size beds.You can't go wrong at this resort if you appreciate quality... and at a reasonable price.

Summary: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel when it was the St. Regis, and we stayed recently with new ownership. This isn't the St. Regis anymore!  And not in a good way.  The hotel is beautiful, and the renovations that have been done are lovely. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and immaculate.   The shuttle down to the beach area is nice.  The beach area itself is great with chairs and umbrellas provided.  The restaurant down there has a great view, sit on the patio. Where this hotel falls down under the new ownership is the service.  The service in several areas was appalling for a luxury resort facility. The restaurants definitely had staffing and management issues.  One example, dinner in the Aveo restaurant took over 2 hours to get our food!  There were several other
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fabulous property in the middle of the Dana Point Coast!! The staff is over the top friendly and competent. Rooms, at least the rooms we stayed in were perfect over looking the pool and a lovely grassy area! Restaurants in the hotel offer a nice variety also soooo many in in the nearby area as well. I was traveling with my 5 year old granddaughter, at first I thought wow this place is so nice perhaps it's not kid friendly. Well, she had the time of her life! One of the pools is geared to kids a total kiddie pool just deep enough to jump in in fact she gained so much confidence swimming it was amazing. There is an additional pool for adults, and I'm sure some kids as well. They kindly take you down to the ocean/beach that is quite close. The staff is amazing the feel of the place

Food was excellent, drinks were cold, but what makes it stand out are the staff.  The bar/restaurant (both hotel and beach) staff were so friendly and welcoming, it was actually quite sad to say goodbye to the place.

Summary Heading: It ain't the St Regis anymore!
Summary: I produce conferences at five star resorts all over the world and I have never seen a place in such disarray. Ever. This once regal property is an unmitigated disaster. It appears to be run by fresh-faced 19 to 24 year olds who haven't a clue what they are doing. The food is terrible. Watching valet is like watching a comedy. Lost keys, frantic valet guys, the manager doesn't know what's going on, and listening to the radio is entertaining. "Crackle, crackle, uhhhh...we have an upset guest, can you tell us where their keys are?" Answer, and the guest can hear, "No, not a clue". Room service? Well, they'll just have to call you back in 20 to 30 minutes because they can't handle more than 5 people at a time. Seriously, this is just bizarre. I used to love this place. I'll never be

Summary: Our family has had at least 15 prior bookings at this resort when it was managed and part of the St. Regis resorts. The new management team KSL RESORTS is the new owner. They have taken it upon themselves to replace almost all of the resort employees that worked there during the St Regis years. The result is that this resort has a long way to go to train its new staff. I want to say up front that the staff at the resort is extremely nice people. However most of them are either still in training or just out of training. So while they are nice people, guests should not expect trainees when they are paying top prices. Loved that the beach is private and that the hotel doesn't charge extra for chairs/umbrellas.  The tram down to the beach was easy and rather charming-I like the drive around the golf course and monarch sanctuary.  Very sweet.  The grounds are beautiful and the weather was magnificent.  We have greatly enjoyed the wonderful spa and now have a dry bar (hair blowout) addiction.  A vacation away from having to do my own hair is delightful.  The

We had dinner on the patio at the Aveo restaurant and it was absolutely delicious and service was fantastic.  Our serve Saul was so caring and fun and Aveo Chef Laurent really made it an exceptional meal.  I wish I could have the paella for dinner every night. Manager Response: Dear Laura B.,  Thank you for your compliments of the Monarch Beach Resort and kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your good feedback. Also, the pools are much nicer, with better food.  The one thing that remains the same is the fantastic service.  Giuliana Rivera brought room service every morning to our family.  She's been at the hotel for many years and we always remember her engaging personality.  She treats us so well.  Thanks for another lovely stay!  See you in 2017!

The food is fresh and delicious, the decor is stunning, and the new pool is wonderful. A huge thank you to Sabrina John ( assistant to the GM ) and to Max ( pool ) and Holly ( pool ) for making us feel so special and welcomed. We can't wait to come back!

It's a great place with lots of areas to explore and enjoy. Can't say enough about this place! Thanks for a great visit!

This property was formally known as the St Regis. The new owners invested $50 million in renovations. One would expect problems, delays, issues with the food service, but we didn't experience any issues.  In fact, the staff was very attentive and called us by our names. The newly remodeled rooms were very plush and roomy. My only criticism of this property is the strange layout. There were a couple of times where I had trouble navigating the hotel to find an outdoor venue location. Can't blame Monarch for this problem because it wasn't designed for them. I would highly recommend this property.

Summary Heading: Great hotel during our long weekend
Summary: If you are reading the recent reviews you need to take into account that they just went through a $40M renovation and changed hands June 1st.  There will be some hiccups.  My wife and I really enjoyed the entire Monarch Beach Resort.  Great new pool area and beach club.  Yes, the beach is quite a ways away, but a tram will get you there in under 5 minutes.  We had some great meals.  Stonehill Tavern is a Michael Mina restaurant and it was a impressive.  We had really good service from the front desk, pool service, room service and all of the bars and restaurants.  Beds are VERY comfortable and the bathrooms are spacious.  If you are going to book from May to the middle of June keep in mind that Southern California can be cloudy and cool (high of 70) during this time.  Locals say

Summary: It's a decent hotel of course in the luxury and expensive category   Booking process was painful and I was transferred at least 4 times   Location is a mile away from the beach and NOT beachfront. There is a tram or golf cart that can get you there in 5-10 mins   Staff is very helpful and friendly. Room service and cleaners are very good  I got a room that someone had smoked in. The room that they changed me to (284) overlooked a lawn garden area where they had lots of events so was very noisy till late night. Don't take rooms that whole section. Rooms are good sized well laid out.  Decent pool and hot tub. But if you want to use the lap pool you will have to pay spa fees. Gym was decent average for that price range.  It's famous for its golf course which I didn't use.  It's

Summary: I attended a conference at the Monarch Beach Resort, two weeks after the change over from an SPG property.  I noticed some of the other complaints from SPG members, but for me, the change wasn't a big deal. The accommodations, dinning and service was still lovely.  It's one of those hotels that notices the little things;  a welcome gift in your room when you arrive, wonderful turn-down service, an extra bottle of water in your room on a particularly hot day... And while I didn't take advantage of the pool, it looked lovely!

The maid did a great job of cleaning and organizing our room.   The reason for the 3 star is because we had some incidents that occurred that is just not acceptable.  For one, I had made dinner reservations a week prior to arrival and upon arriving, they did not have it.  At the spa, I had book a treatment for my friend, only to find out that they gave the spot away. I am not sure if it is a computer glitch or if it is human error.  They didn't even fix the situation and only apologize for the error.  Really?    Perhaps because of the changeover to the new ownership KSL, things have not been running

In room dining was expensive and lame compared to before. I'm now going to stay at the Terranea Resort in Palos Verdes..closer to home and better.

We had to wait 1 1/2 for the room to be inspected even though it was clean. whatttt! I expected way more from this hotel as far as service and quality. The pool service lacks. The food at the pool is bad. The Beach service lacks. Let me rephrase, there is no beach service. The chairs at the beach are only regular chairs and do not recline so you can layout. The music at the pool is horrible. Their restaurant Club 19 is a big waste of money! We ate breakfast there and food was cold. We were the only table in the restaurant. Now I know why! Don't try it. The rooms are nice, especially the bathrooms. I would

Summary: We stayed at the St. Regis for a few nights during a week-long CA trip and it was the highlight of our vacation! We arrived late after a long day at Disneyland and were greeted with a welcome note and snacks in our room for the kids- they were thrilled! The pool was still under renovation during our visit, but I'm not sure we would have even used it- the private beach was exceptional. It's a short golf cart ride, but the staff is very accommodating- setting up chairs, towels and an umbrella for us on a nearly empty pristine beach. The restaurant on the beach was fantastic, for grabbing drinks as well as sitting for an early dinner. AVEO was still in need of some polishing during our stay, however. Overall, an exceptional visit and we hope it continues even without the St. Regis

There is a shuttle that takes you down to the beach where you have access to beach chairs, towels and umbrellas. A plus when you are traveling with children and have your hands full.   We can't wait to return!

SO, you never feel like you have to leave the resort to do anything. The restaurant and bar are up high so the patios for happy hour and apps is a must for sunsets etc. We had a large group for business in a private room for dinner and the staff never missed a beat. The spa was my favorite...a glamorous cocoon with many options for relaxation. there is lots of good walking areas in and around the hotel. Did i mention the shops inside the hotel? Pricey but the jewelry was my favorite. Treat yourself!

Unfortunately, I discovered that there is nothing 5 star about St. Regis Monarch Beach during my recent stay.  PROBLEM 1: There is construction going on at the pool area in the hotel. I was shocked to find out when I checked in, but I guess it was my fault for not conducting thorough research on the property before booking. I was okay with not being able to swim, but NOT OKAY when CONSTRUCTION NOISES WOKE ME UP

But on to the the issue...the pasta was dry and not at all palatable.  So we paid $50 for six grilled shrimp!  I was willing to overlook the food until the real problem started for us the day following checkout we had a charge of $1800 pending on our credit card in addition to the $1200 that we paid for the reservation total of $3000 held on my card for a one night stay! The next day after I called the front desk, accounting removed $1200 of the unexpected charge but $600 is has now

They have sliding shutters for doors (annoying) and no separate door for the toilet area.   3.  The restaurant Stonehill Tavern is very loud, and we didn't care for the menu options.  The food we did order was nice, but not great for such an upscale, "famous chef" type of restaurant.    We went to the other dinner restaurant Aveo but left because if was also very loud, too bright, and had a coffee shop

When we checked in, the front desk staff (who was very nice) said that they would not be able to accommodate a late checkout as the hotel was full.  I told them I was a Gold SPG member but somehow, it did not show up on the computer system (it was probably American Express Platinum's error).  In any case, they would not allow even a 1pm checkout since my Gold SPG status did not show up at the time of check-in (or else I would be eligible for a 4pm check-out).  I called American Express and SPG from my room and they were able to change

But since it would take 20 min to prepare, our waiter offered a salad on the house to tide us over. But we weren't especially hungry, so declined and then he offered to not charge the corkage fee. Summary: Was pretty hard on them last time as they were under massive renovation. Happy to report most of it complete but for the pool, which is finished by next weekend.  The new lobby area is much better, though don't care for the hard white bulbs in the fixtures, (they do make soft white in LED now yo) but the lobby area and bar and lounge all feel young and fun yet very high end.  The new pool will be great, gone are the garish fountains in place of clean lines and less obstruction of the view.  The Part and Parcel is a nice touch but they need much more seating, I feel like those tables and chairs in the hall area are probably coming. Service needs some refinement, probably adjusting to remodel. I just returned from FOUR SEASONS WAILEA and St. Regis isn't quite there.  The Valets

Just a wonderful place for   family vacation, couples get away or for business meetings ..       I would suggest the menu get jazzed up somewhat however, it wasn't very appealing so we drove elsewhere for lunch.

The room was beautiful, spacious and had a huge, upscale bathroom with a large walk in shower, separate Roman style soaking tub and dual sinks. We loved having coffee in the morning out on the balcony.   Several days we took the complimentary tram to the private beach to take in the sun and beautiful sunsets, one day  grabbing a to go lunch at the restaurant at the beach for an impromptu beach picnic.   If you are looking for something extra special, without

Summary Heading: Wait until construction is over before you book a trip here!
Summary: Wow, they have a lot of construction going on here and it doesn't look anywhere close to being finished.  Our room on level 2 (uninspired) was on the back of the hotel overlooking what was basically a construction mud pit.  I woke each morning to the sound of earth moving construction equipment.  Those engines are loud and relentless.  No pool is available.  Both under major construction.  I get that renovations need to happen and eventually this will all be wonderful, but do not spend this kind of money on a place during this transition. They should alter the price tag of the room or make sure each guest is aware prior to final booking.  Even putting out some coffee in the morning would be good, but nothing to make the insult a bit softer.  BEWARE!

Big remodel going on trying to compete with Ritz and Montage which are both close and great 5 stars choices. Real deal killer is KSL is kicking Starwood (Soon to be Marriott) to the curb so no more STARWOOD points or Platinum Preferred benefits.   KSL is probably looking to ”pump & dump” the property... Summary: I stayed here for a conference.  Great service, beautiful hotel.  The rooms were good size and appeared newly remodeled.  This is a true luxury resort.  We took the tram down to the Monarch Bay club for dinner.  The club is a little more dated, but is right on the ocean with great views.  The pool area was under construction, but is expected to reopen Memorial Day weekend and looks like it will be gorgeous, with additions of a new restaurant and cabanas.  Overall the hotel is certainly higher end and priced as such, but you get what you pay for, which is first class service, beautiful location, views and updated luxurious accomodations.

Summary: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel over the weekend. Rooms are brand new and in perfect condition, as well as the lobby area and restaurants. My only issue was that their pool was closed, but in an effort to makeup for that, the hotel waived their resort fee each day which was nice... But still would have loved a dip in the pool. Other than that, the hotel staff went above and beyond to make our stay perfect- they recognized us by name, the car was already ready when we called for valet, room service was wonderful, and AVEO was a very nice new restaurant with great views of the water. Truly a five star experience and worth the spend - great for a relaxing weekend or a romantic getaway. Will most definitely be back to experience the hotel in full once the pool opens.

Summary Heading: Best hotel we've ever stayed in - service was amazing!

Every employee we encountered was amazing. Brilliant with our young kids, smiling, happy and helpful!  We've stayed a few times over the last few years and the updates are stunning. Such a bright warm modern feel. The hotel feels so much closer to the ocean now that we can see it through the main lobby (the grand lawn structure has been removed). Manager Response: Dear 25LoveToTravel,  Thank you for your feedback and taking the time to post your comment. I am pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed our resort and grounds. Facility: it was being renovated during our stay, with almost 90 percent of the work done. it is a nice facility, but definitely not superb or wow, for the following reasons:     a. Rooms are not sound proof, we could easily hear conversations in other neighbouring rooms     b. Elevators are terrible and old, it is somehow scary even to take the ride, especially with all the rattling and cracking noises you hear     c. Lounges are nice, but basic, nothing fancy as you would expect from a 5 starts resort in one of the nicest places on the west coast  2. Services: Terrible, Terrible

There were a couple of snags in our stay but not a result of hotel directly but rather

The staff was incredibly friendly, the valet guys were always so easy going and easy to talk too! We loved the Post & Parcel shop, the women working there were great! The s'mores gelato is a must try!   My only complaint is with the products.. for such a nice hotel they need to upgrade their shampoos & lotions, I felt like I was washing my hair with mouthwash. It had a very masculine feel and wouldn't lather!   Otherwise, I would absolutely recommend.

From the concierge, to waiters, to bar to passing people in the hallway; everyone is incredible nice and helpful. People who work there are always smiling and it seems like a great environment.  The resort renovation is gorgeous.  The pools when finished will be spectacular.    We had an ocean view room.  We book that our a coastal room.  The resort is across the golf course from the beach so both work.  The restaurants on property were great and gave a lot of variety.  We loved the Beach Club and Aveo.    We are bringing our girls back this July and cannot wait.

The renovation is spectacular, rooms amazing, restaurants Aveo and Stone Hill world class, as is the new Miraval spa, but the staff here makes this property (a rare 5 Diamond AND 5 Star title holder) feel like home- granted, a very high end and magnificent home. I can say that I am very well travelled (if you read my prior reviews) and will not write a review unless there is something special to mention. I received an email stating that they were under renovations

Summary: Stayed her a few times. This year I arrived just after the redecorated lobby area opened. A big improvement. They are doing many upgrades to the resort so you have to be a bit patient - but overall the employees work even harder to be sure u have a nice time. I had a corner room this time that was beautifully appointed and huge and looked out on the golf course and the ocean. No extra charge. Spectacular views from the balcony. If you want a stay that is relaxing and gives you nothing to complain about this is it.

Summary: I was a little worried before our trip because we visited during the remodel but we had a great experience. I would love to go back when it is complete because it seems like they're doing a great job. We had a room on the 6th floor that was really nice. All the staff were friendly, professional, and attentive. They even left us some beautiful chocolates to make our anniversary special. We loved the private beach. Access was easy (the trams run every 15 min or so and it is probably about a 5 min ride). I thought it was just going to be a beach so I didn't really want to go down there but I'm glad we did. There was a green lawn with tables and chairs, a place to get towels, a restaurant and lounge with indoor and outdoor seating, and, of course, the beach itself with lawn chairs,
Manager Response: Dear SarahMynah,  Thank you for your compliments and indeed, we are very proud with the outcome of our public space renovation and the "million dollar views to the ocean" from our newly renovated main lobby and lobby lounge, 33 N and restaurant, Aveo Table + Bar!  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our "Beach House on the coast" in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We stayed here with some friends for a couple nights away from the kiddos. Rooms were very cheap due to renovations to pool/lobby etc. This did not bother us much as it was too cold to hangout by pool anyway.  The room was the nicest I've every stayed in save maybe the Grand Del Mar. The bathroom was amazing with separate shower & tub. The bed was great and everything else about room was very nice and accommodating.  The grounds were very well maintained and rest of resort was very luxurious. The Montage and Ritz properties are on the water, but the St Regis is a quick cart ride down to the beach and restaurant.   Overall it was a great experience. We will be staying here again hopefully soon.
Manager Response: Dear achilders512,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay.  We unveiled two new dining options in January of this year – 33 North, where you will enjoy inventive cuisine, handcrafted cocktails and live entertainment and Part & Parcel Marketplace, featuring fresh coffee and gourmet grab-and-go offerings.  Plus, we just opened our new Miraval Life in Balance Spa. The treatment rooms along with the new retail store and the Spa Café look stunning. With the main pool & Grand Lawn to finish last, we anticipate all work to be complete by the end of May.  Thank you again and I hope we will have the opportunity to have you at our "Beach House" again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: A Hodge Podge of a Renovation that Improved the Views
Summary: The hotel has been immersed in a soft goods renovation for the last few months. The lobby has been redone, the main reception areas, the spa, etc., and they are still working on the pool area. It all look stunning, with patterned wood floors, lots of white and ocean blue (grasscloth?) wall coverings that give a very attractive coastal feel. The view is no longer blocked, so the new walls of glass allow distant ocean vista meets your eyes as soon as you walk in.  However, there is still some of the old marble on the floors, the old staircase railing, etc. All has not been redone, and it looks a bit of a hodge lodge. As you enter the low ceilinged corridors for the guest rooms, it appears that only the carpeting is new. Some of the chandeliers are old.  In the deluxe ocean view
Manager Response: Dear Cinderella_Dearest,  Thank you for your loyalty and detailed review on TripAdvisor. We believe that the St. Regis Monarch Beach is the one place with all the right elements to capture the affections of anyone who has ever had a love affair with beach, and our public space renovation promises to create an even stronger bond with it as well as our resort guests, members and the greater community.   We appreciate all feedback we can get and I will review and discuss your comments regarding our Sunday Brunch at Aveo Table + Bar with our team.   Thank you and I look forward to having you and your family return for many more years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the excellent valet staff, our stay here just got better.  We were greeted by Monique with a glass of champagne.  She was very helpful with some information on the area.  We were checked in by Rigo who made sure we were taken care of with a very nice room.  While waiting for our room, we had lunch at 33 North which is their bar/lounge.  Hallie was a great server.  Our room was not a suite, but was very larger and had a nice view of the ocean.  Although the hotel is still undergoing some renovations and the pool/spa was not complete, we still had a wonderful stay and look forward to returning.
Manager Response: Dear ph69vette,  Thank you for posting about your recent stay and the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your good feedback with our associates.   Our new Miraval Life in Balance Spa opened its door this past weekend and the treatment rooms along with the new retail store and the Spa Café look stunning. With the main pool & Grand Lawn to finish last, we anticipate all work to be complete by the end of May.  Thank you again and I hope we will have the opportunity to have you at our "Beach House" again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I would have given it a 5 but I realized that the rooms are not very sound proof.  But if you put a towel under the door it really helps a lot.  The property is undergoing a major remodel but that didn't matter at all.  I love the rooms, the bedding, the bathrobes, the bathroom and especially the fact they give you a bathroom scale.   The staff is amazing.    To eat there is very expensive - a 8 oz. coke is $3.00.  So, they will tell you there is nothing in walking distance but they are wrong.  Walk through the path along the golf course to Pacific Coast Highway and when you get there, head north.  Up the hill is a shopping center.  It has an amazing grocery store which has a wonderful deli and tables to eat there or take back to your room.  You can eat for 1/3 of what you can
Manager Response: Dear Boisenb.,  Thank you so much for your positive review. We have fully re-imagined our resort and the five-star amenities focusing on the coastal & relaxed feel and blending in the signature St. Regis Butler Service and its culture to identify and position us within our area. By the end of May / beginning of June the renovation is complete, and I hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back in the near future to experience our final and new product .  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: fantastic, first class and great value
Summary: My wife and I stayed for our wedding anniversary in March 2016, while the hotel is going through some remodel work it did not bother us as we were not planning on laying by the pool.  The hotel is so clean and in first class shape.  The restaurant was great with great wine and food. Fantastic grounds, easy and nice walk to private cove.  A great lunch can be had right on the water.  Go!!!
Manager Response: Dear westcoaster92067,  We are honored that you chose to celebrate your anniversary at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our "Beach House" on the Coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Our family spent the weekend and had such a nice time. The service was excellent, friendly people, the Easter Egg hunt was great for the kids and the brunch was an amazing feast and we love the new restaurant it is beautiful.   Thanks again for a great stay.
Manager Response: Dear Rochelle L.,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful Easter Holiday with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel, One of the Best
Summary: My husband and I stayed at your hotel and were very impressed with the amenities and the Service.  The St Regis is one of the best hotels to stay at & would highly recommend it.  The pool was beautiful and not crowded and the Service is out of this world.  We were celebrating our anniversary and the St Regis made our stay one that we will treasure.  Our room was beautiful and looked out onto the beautiful gardens and pool.  When going to the ocean, there are people to carry your umbrella and towels making it very easy to walk across the sand.  My husband and I are planning another trip and will be staying at the St Regis.  We have nothing but great things to say about this hotel and have recommended it to our friends and family.
Manager Response: Dear Debbie R.,  I am  honored that you chose to celebrate your anniversary at our Beach House. on the coast. Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review and I hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Stayed here on a business trip and was so impressed with the renovation. The property is stunning. We stayed a the Montage down the road a year ago and I would say the St Regis comparable, especially considering the price difference.   The restaurant was particularly outstanding, we had a beautiful view of the sunset with outstanding food.   At the end of March only the spa was under construction inside, the pools still had quite a bit to go. But the noise was not an issue considering how beautiful everything else was and they stopped pretty early in the afternoon.
Manager Response: Dear mattrogerstx,  Thank you for staying at The St. Regis Monarch Beach . I am thrilled to learn that you have had an exceptional stay with us and that we were able to exceed your expectations.   I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for two nights to celebrate our 4th wedding Anniversary.  We stayed here after staying in LA and on our way to San Diego.  We were so excited about visiting San Diego for the first time until we stayed here.  We did not want to leave.  This hotel is first class all the way!  Since I booked the reservation with Amex Platinum, when we arrived we were immediately told our room was upgraded.  The room was amazing.  It was huge, the bathroom was huge and the view was amazing,  The hotel is undergoing some renovations, so the pool was closed with lots of construction underway and the spa was being completed, but the hotel is very up front prior to booking about the construction, so I cannot complain and they offer better rates due to the ongoing construction.
Manager Response: Dear Evan M.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: Excellent and courteous staff. Excellent property. Enjoyed every minute! I forget the name of the staff at the monarch bay club but he was excellent and did his job with passion. He welcomed us warmly and gave us the history of Dana point. He even took photos of me and the kids and recommended great views. We went here for the children's spring break and I must say we will be coming back again!
Manager Response: Dear themrs_annalad,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. . Thank you for the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your good feedback with our associates.   I hope you and your family stay with us again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: What happened St Regis, Monarch Beach?
Summary: It was disappointing to see the change in the St Regis, Monarch Beach. I felt like I was stepping into a W Hotel and not a St. Regis. When you think of St.Regis, you think of refined luxury. Not DJ's in the lobby, couches with no back support, OR tables that have plaster casts of feet for legs.   The new rooms were decorated very nicely. I also like the new Part and Parcel Market next to the lobby. As well, The Monarch Beach Club is always lovely.   I did not like the fact that your new gym and your soon to be opened new spa is basically right at the valet. Why would these two main features of your hotel NOT have a view of the pacific ocean?   My takeaway from the new change is that you are trying to appeal to a much younger, tech-savvy guest.   I've stayed here several times in
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a top-notch resort with everything you expect. While there's construction through May 2016 or so, they make every effort to minimize the impact.  We enjoyed the Monarch Bay Club for dinner and then lunch the next day - stunning oceanfront dining with the best possible service from Jennifer at dinner.   It is a difficult choice between the Ritz, the Montage and the St. Regis in this area. Each offers something different, but all are an experience not to be missed or forgotten.
Manager Response: Dear Craig B.,  Thank you for staying at The St. Regis Monarch Beach during your visit to Orange County. I am very pleased to learn that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay.    I hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back to our Beach House and gathering place on the coast in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Gorgeous property, excellent service and amazing views
Summary: This was my first time visiting Dana Point and about a week before I arrived the glorious service started! Brittni Sneyd was my Guest Liaison and she was fantastic in every way. She asked questions to make sure my arrival and room were perfect as well as sent me dining and activity information to help me plan my trip. Upon arrival the valet and bellman were gracious and showed me where to go for check in and made sure I was aware of the layout of the hotel given how expansive it is. Check in was quick and I was upgraded to an Ocean View room which was spectacular. I was very well aware of the construction in advance of my booking so I didn't mind any of the construction trucks or equipment that were right outside of my room. I never heard any noise related to the construction
