Thank you for your kind words and we hope you will visit our beach house on the coast again soon.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: From the moment we arrived to the very end of our visit, the hotel staff was very attentive, friendly and knowledgeable.  Even before our arrival, Brittni made arrangements for dinner at the hotel and a rose petal decoration of our room the first night.  The Stonehill tavern on the hotel premises is a culinary delight and service is first rate.  Our waitress, Lydia, provided exceptional service.  All in all, a truly remarkable and memorable experience!
Manager Response: Dear Mark W.,  I am very pleased to learn that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay and thank you for the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team.   I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We visited the St. Regis for our anniversary.  From upon arrival till the moment we left we felt the staff, valet, front desk, concierge, waiters, and house keeping attendants treated us like royalty. Friendly yet professional with sincere concern that our stay was a special one.  Special thanks to Brittni Sneyd who went "above and beyond" to make our get a way so special.
Manager Response: Dear Margaret C.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of the St. Regis.   I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: You literally do not need to leave this property
Summary: It was my first time visiting this property and eventhough it was going through renovation, it was one of the most amazing hotels I've visited so far. Everything from the amazing staff like Rigo and Ricky from the Front Desk, Alfonso from Housekeeping, to the spectacular views, private beach (yes!), the adorable trams, the lounge bar, and the classy in-room dining experience with Maria. I can't wait to go back to this property after the renovation is complete. I can't even imagine this place being more gorgeous!
Manager Response: Dear MissNataliaSilva,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Like the title said, staff were super friendly and professional.  My wife & I were there in mid-Jan for our anniversary.  Of all the nice staff we met, one in particular was super.  That person was the tavern staff Kayla, she went out of her way to make sure we had a pleasant time.  Thank you!
Manager Response: Dear screenlin,  We are honored that you chose to celebrate your anniversary at our beach house. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary Heading: Exceptional Service from an Amazing Staff
Summary: our recent stay at St Regis, Monarch Beach was amazing, from the friendly and very profesional  reservation attendent  Francis to the guest services representive Brittni who made sure our weekend Celebration was memorable experience , The room was beautiful and the food was exquisite , Thank- you for the great weekend
Manager Response: Dear David J.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review. I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our beach house on the coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: The perfect get-away with a new personal touch
Summary: We used to visit the St. Regis Monarch Bay regularly as it was the perfect place to recharge, celebrate an anniversary and take a break from the kids (without being too far away).  As our kids grew older we found there was less time for ourselves -with all their extra curricular activities.  As time went by we forgot about all the wonderful activities, trails, restaurants, dancing, etc that were readily available at the beautiful St Regis.  We were recently reminded about the St Regis as our friends invited us to join them as they celebrated their anniversary.  Our 19th anniversary was almost the same week so we decided to join them.  As we booked the room we noticed there was a lot of renovation going on (thru the St Regis website).  The St Regis has always been proactively
Manager Response: Dear Rob P.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of the St. Regis.   I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We spent the weekend at the resort to recharge before our daughter's wedding reception. The staff took great care of us!! Nicole at the front desk went out of her way to ensure that our weekend was well planned, even checking in with us during our stay. Mike on the Butler staff also went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. In fact, Nicole and Mike helped rescue us from what could have been a disastrous moment the morning we checked out. Needless to say, I am both impressed and thankful for the commitment both demonstrated as they went above and beyond the call of duty!
Manager Response: Dear NorthTex,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of the St. Regis.   I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: My favorite place in the world
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in December during the lobby renovation. I was excited to start getting a sneak peek of my favorite resort undergoing some new enhancements! Service was excellent as usual and the concierge made great recommendations for restaurants. I also chatted with Colin at the front desk who greeted us on our last visit in the summer. We enjoyed watching sunset from the Monarch Bay club. I will be back again soon, my St. Regis family. All of you are wonderful!!!
Manager Response: Dear CATrvl08,  Thank you for your compliments. We are very proud of the progress and outcome of our renovation so far; especially the "million dollar views to the ocean" from our newly renovated main lobby and lobby lounge, 33 N!  I look forward to hearing your feedback after the renovation is fully completed in May.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan

Summary Heading: Gorgeous beach views and monarch butterlies
Summary: What a spectacular spot even during a renovation. Wonderful dining in their restaurant , great golfing, beach walk, wonderful beach.  We stayed just two nights but would have loved a longer visit. A real treat in the Laguna area.
Manager Response: Dear Calvin1435,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you returning soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: I was here for a meeting so I didn't get around much. The staff was great. They go out of the way to make you feel comfortable. The rooms were very clean and everything was perfect. The pool area was under construction but it looks like It will be great once it is done.
Manager Response: Dear alexandreus,  I am pleased to hear you had an exceptional stay with us and hope that you had the chance to enjoy the resort during your business trip.  I look forward to welcoming you back to our beach house on the coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: This hotel overlooks the beach! You can see Catalina Island from here!
Summary: Can't beat the location! Its close to Dana Point. They also have a restaurant overlooking the beach by the way Monarch Bay Club, its view is impeccable! Stayed for 2 nights here. This hotel offers complimentary hot chocolate with small marshmallows! Rooms were newly updated, decor makes you feel relaxed. Bed and pillows are very comfortable. One of my favorite feature was the roman bath. Our room included the balcony with almost a beach view. My boyfriend and I are foodies! The time we stayed here, we ate at the Club 19 for breakfast (they offer a small shuttle to the restaurants as well as the beach. The waiting area is located near the valet area). Club 19 overlooked the golf course and the beach, I had the Classic Egg Benedict the boyfriend had the steak, it was good but
Manager Response: Dear Maryvx,  Thank you for your valuable feedback on your recent stay at the St. Monarch Beach. I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and hope we will have the opportunity to welcome back to our beach house on the coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Empty Promises & Extensive Renovation, Not Accurately Indicated When Booking
Summary: First, this hotel is not on the beach. It was difficult to decipher this from some of the other reviews. You have to wait for and take a golf cart (can be a 1/2 hour process give or take). November 2015 my sister joined me on another getaway. We tried keeping our trip reasonable by staying the Courtyard San Diego but wasn't the experience we were looking for (lots of noise and too city-like) so made an impromptu change to the St. Regis Monarch Beach. We were so excited for our second St. Regis experience on the heels of our first experience in Bal Harbor but were very disappointed.  I am SPG Gold and decided to use points for one night and bought points to pay for the other night (same price as paying out of pocket but saved on taxes). When looking online to make the reservation
Manager Response: Dear Candice F.,  Thank you for your feedback and taking the time to post your comment. We clearly missed the mark with providing you with an exceptional experience in many areas. Please accept my sincere apology for falling short of showing you the value you deserve when staying with us.  Please allow me the opportunity of discussing your comments further so that we can examine the issues which you have noted and make sure you receive the SPG points promised to you. I may be reached at 949-234-3301.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Property - This place is Aces!!!
Summary: When you walk in, the first thing you see is the view of the ocean.  Everyone was out on the veranda enjoying a cocktail and watching the sunset - Don't miss this!  Rooms are really clean and have a fresh feel.  The added amenities are super cool.  They have shoe horns, umbrellas, slippers, robes, real glassware (Champagne flutes), razors, toothpaste, etc.... I didn't want to leave the room for my dinner reservation.  The pool and spa are being renovated which was a bummer but what could I do.  Took a tubby after dinner - big tubs to fit all of you.  Also, nice walk down to the beach through and around the adjacent golf course.  Great views.  This place is Aces!  Can't wait to come back and see what they've done with the pool and spa.  Coffee shop was also very nice and offered
Manager Response: Dear  Mickele C.,  Thank you for your compliments and indeed, we are very proud of our "million dollar views to the ocean" from our newly renovated main lobby and lobby lounge, 33 N!  I certainly hope we will have the pleasure to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Really enjoyed my experience at St Regis -- beautiful room with an amazing view of the golf course, ocean and sunset, great service and attention to detail, excellent location. While SPA and pool were not available due to construction, not much of a disappointment as I would not had time to enjoy it. In any event, there was minimal disruption due to construction. Overall this was a great experience!
Manager Response: Dear Marie-NYNY,  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our beach house on the coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Grand Disapointed , not a Grand Hotel...
Summary: I don't have much negative reviews but...  Maybe I had high expectations ... so I arrived to the hotel pretty late 5pm after having a long trip but unfortunately I had to wait 30 min for my room ... which was facing to a parking lot and with bad smell of food .  I asked the front desk to change the room as the smell was really annoying , the front desk manager told me that he is sorry but he cannot move me tonight but he will call tomorrow morning to change... In the mean time he sent a ventilator !!! to ventilate the bad smell , and the day after he didn't call to change the room or say anything.  I also Tried  the room service , which was not good as well , i asked to return one un-eatable item , lady from room service said the manager will call to discuss which never happen
Manager Response: Dear  salvax239,  Thank you so much for staying with us recently and I am sorry your stay was not what you had hoped it would be, this is certainly disappointing to read and I hope you will accept my most sincere apologies for this.   Your feedback has been shared with all leaders at the property to go over how we can improve moving forward, and I hope that should you wish to come and stay with us again in the future that you will see the improvements made by our team.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: This is a 5 star resort at it's best. The service is first rate as is the hotel itself. My room looked out towards the golf corse and the south. It was so quite that I could just sit and relax on the balcony all day. The room is what you should expect from a St. Regis property, the bed was awesome, the pillows great selection, the bath was so nice. If you want to get away for a bit or your in or near Dana Point for work this has to be the place you stay.
Manager Response: Dear thecolonel1215,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: The resort decor looks like someone (not a professional) went in and bought things from Big Lots or Ikea.  The furniture is very tacky and the paintings look like a 3 year old made them.  The bedroom wallpaper is very poorly done, and I stayed in two rooms so far and it is the same.  I understand that most resorts need a remodel every once in awhile, like painting and fixings.  Nevertheless, the St. Regis is suppose to be an Italian/Spanish type of resort.  The Hotel Del Coronado in San Diego has all of its glory and history to the resort still intact over 100 years.  I only wished that St. Regis's team will reconsider and remodel accordingly.  The chandaler is so hideous it looks very cheap!  Were they thinking when the did this remodel, I laughed at how they put their new gym
Manager Response: Dear Resort Advisor H.,  Thank you for your feedback and taking the time to post your comment. I am disappointed to hear that you dislike the style and design of our remodel . The choice of style and design for The St. Regis Monarch Beach is to compliment the resort's new personality - equal parts sophisticated, approachable and intimate to enjoy and rewind in the laid-back luxury of beachfront living.  We hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming you back after the remodel is fully complete in May 2016 to see the final product.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: My girlfriends and I stayed here the first weekend in Feb. The lobby renovations have been complete and it's beautiful. We sat outside on patio all afternoon enjoying food and drinks. Although the pool isn't done there is still plenty of wonderful things to do. The gym has just be completed, there is a beautiful golf course and a beach club. The food is fabulous as well.   I will say one of the best things about St. Regis hotels is the people who work there. For us our stay was really made perfect by our butler Steven Rosales. His Level of service and attention to detail was amazing. He helped us pick activities and restaurants. He answered all our questions and had some great suggestions. We definitely will return thanks to Steven and the rest of the staff.
Manager Response: Dear Allison M.,  Thank you for your compliments and indeed, we are very proud of our "million dollar views to the ocean" from our newly renovated main lobby and lobby lounge, 33 N!  Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of The St. Regis.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel and Amazing View but not on the beach- Great for golfers!
Summary: I LOVE this hotel. The view is really breathtaking and although they do have their own "private beach", you have to take the tram to the beach or a 20 minutes walk. It's super convenient to get down there so it's worth the time. Unfortunately when I went this last time they were doing remodeling so the pool was closed. I wish I would have known in advance but the staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. They have a restaurant by the beach which is great for drinks. It's a little old and needs to be remodeled so maybe that's next but the bar and the restaurant in the hotel are great. Expensive but delicious food. It's everything you expect from a St. Regis and with the remodel I am sure it's going to be even better.
Manager Response: Dear NilooG,  Thank you for your loyalty and posting about your recent stay. Indeed, we have fully re-imagined our resort and the five-star amenities.  We have just unveiled two new dining options – 33 North, where you will enjoy inventive cuisine, handcrafted cocktails and live entertainment and Part & Parcel Marketplace, featuring fresh coffee and gourmet grab-and-go offerings.  Plus, we just opened our new Health Club Facility, furnished with state-of-the-art fitness equipment.   The renovation is scheduled to be complete by May and I hope we will have the opportunity to have you stay with again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: nice property,  Beautiful room but impersonal
Summary: Can't put my finger on it but there seemed to be a forced level of service which was a bit impersonal and off putting.  Maybe that is what these luxury resorts are all about.  I don't get to these places often. Everything was right and the room and bath were great, but it seemed some how that the guests were intruders in the staff sanctuary of luxury.
Manager Response: Dear ORD1963,  Thank you for posting about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We value our guests and our team is dedicated to delivering personalized service tailored to your lifestyle and needs while on vacation or during your business trip. This service should however never feel forced or unnatural and I will discuss this with our team.  ORD1963, I  hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Love this place!  Can't wait to return!
Summary: The bar/terrace is a wonderful way to watch a beautiful sunset over the ocean with Catalina Island in the distance!  The rooms were very clean and well appointed.  The service was attentive.  A wonderful stay!
Manager Response: Dear Kathy S.,  Thank you for your compliments and indeed, we are very proud of our "million dollar views to the ocean" from our newly renovated main lobby and lobby lounge, 33 N!  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Best place to celebrate a birthday in style
Summary: We stayed at St Regis in November of 2015 and February of 2016 to celebrate my birthday and my sons 5th birthday. The St Regis goes above and beyond to make sure you feel celebrated and they include your other family members as well in their celebration. The hotel was/is under renovation but the rooms, service, private beach, view and private club are incomparable.   The beds and rooms are modern, comfortable and the bathrooms are luxurious and relaxing. Every detail is thought of when staying here and I've never felt more at home in a hotel like I do at the St. Regis.   My children were welcomed as well by the staff and catered to, which, is not always the case when staying at a luxury resort.   We also love the location and proximity to the beach and walking trails, there is
Manager Response: Dear Lmsbender,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. I appreciate your kind comments and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming you back to our beach house on the coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Arranged a birthday weekend getaway for two couples both SPG members. Brought a bottle of wine & craft beers to enjoy in our rooms while opening gifts before dinner. Upon our arrival, we put them in the fridge to chill while we went out for lunch. Upon our return, discovered them missing from fridge. Called housekeeping, informed them of same & was told, "we wouldn't do that". They eventually found them & returned them to us w/an apology. Now warm, we requested ice as we attempted to get them chilled.  Unfortunately, didn't have time to fully chill before gift giving time. Had birthday dinner at Stonehill Tavern. Received wrong menu information online, on phone & on site. Will review separately. Returned from dinner and found turn down service was prepared for one guest even
Manager Response: Dear Iwannago2,  Thank you so much for staying with us and I am sorry your stay was not what you had hoped it would be, this is certainly disappointing to read and I hope you will accept my most sincere apologies for this.   I would welcome an opportunity to discuss your concerns with your further if you wish, and may be reached at 305-993-3310.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: My wife and I decided to take a quick trip down south....in need of some R&R, since she is five months pregnant. During our first meal our server, Katerina, brought us some complimentary olives.  My wife just LOVED them.  She mentioned to Katerina that she thought they were delicious.  The next evening we ordered Room Service to our room and when the sever arrived he had a gift for my wife.  A large jar of olives and a very nice note from our new friend Katerina!!!!!!!   This kind gesture truly made our weekend.   Thanks to her, we will definitely go back to this wonderful resort .
Manager Response: Dear Steve V.,  Thank you for your compliments. Indeed, our associates define who we are and I am proud to read about to your experience.   I hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I have stayed here a few times now and i cannot say enough.  The grounds are so elegant.  The staff is really accommodating and top notch.  The service is excellent.  The beach club is a great way to waste an afternoon.  Golf courses, activities, just down the street from Laguna and all of its terrific restaurants...Love this place.  Probably one of my top five places in the world (I have been to 40 countries so far).
Manager Response: Dear wetraveler73,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope you will visit our beach house on the coast again soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary Heading: I dream of St. Regis Monarch Beach
Summary: Palatial yet welcoming.  The best service we've ever experienced.  Our stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach set the standard for all other hotel/resort experiences.  In fact, we came home and upgraded our bed and bedding to match our room's bed at the St. Regis.  We will most definitely return one day.
Manager Response: Dear MyDogForPresident,  I am thrilled to hear you had a wonderful stay with us and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: From the moment I stepped out of my car I was assisted by a multitude of polite and friendly staff. The check-in process was extremely quick and easy- I was up to our room in no time!  The room was beautiful, spacious and they obviously took great consideration to every detail. Having to travel a lot for work, this bed was definitely the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Whether it was directions to a local restaurant or extra raw sugar for coffee in the morning, the friendly staff was always eager to help.   The hotel is incredibly dog friendly, providing a very nice sized lawn area to play in and one of my favorite parts of the property was the access to hikes and walks along the beach, that Pippa and I did every morning.  Overall, we had a wonderful weekend and can't wait
Manager Response: Dear Cassie M.,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! We look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for our wedding night and Brittni and the team at St Regis really pulled out all all the stops making sure we had a special stay!!  They were welcoming (even at the late hour we arrived) and were extremely helpful.
Manager Response: Dear NicholasSchenck,  Congratulations on your recent marriage and thank you for choosing to celebrate this milestone in your life at our beach house. I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Treated us like royalty.   Stayed three nights. The whole staff some how knew we were there for our 30th wedding anniversary and treated us like newlyweds. Its staff members are as beautiful as the hotel is. Thanks for the great memories. Will return for our 31 anniversary.
Manager Response: Dear dennisbrady00,  Congratulations! We are honored that you chose to celebrate your anniversary at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of The St. Regis. Thank you for your kind words and we hope look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Most everything about our stay was spot on!  Valet, reception and bell staff were terrific.  The lobby and bar area is just beautiful and our room was perfect!  We were treated to a very nice fruit bowl and large bottled water once we reached our room.  Interesting that we had turn down service on our first night but not on the second.  Not a huge deal but seems a bit off.  Really my only complaint is about the Monarch Beach Club restaurant.  I wish the hotel staff had been a bit more forthcoming about the distance of the restaurant from the hotel and the fact that it is really a residence club restaurant.  For the prices charged just enjoy the Mina restaurant in the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Julia M.,  Thank you your review and for staying with us as we make property improvements. We looking forward to welcoming you back to the St. Regis Monarch Beach, where happiness is written in the sand.  Sincerely,   Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I have been to this location twice in the last 13 months. It is spectacular in every form from room to golf. Service is excellent and the food is above my experiences at other SPG properties. By far my favorite hotel in southern Cali. They are under going a renovation at this time but it did not effect my latest experience.
Manager Response: Dear Stanley G.,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank for your loyalty and sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: Just got back from an amazing 4 night stay at this gorgeous resort! WOW! My husband and I are from NYC and travel on business every month to the West Coast. When in the Orange County area we usually stay at another resort, however this time around we wanted to try something new... SOOOO glad we did! The St. Regis is absolutely beautiful. Yes, they are undergoing some major constructions, but that never bothered us. The service was what you would expect at a St. Regis, the rooms were gorgeous! We stayed in a "grande deluxe room" and it was pretty amazing! We had our puppy with us, and this property is super pet friendly! In fact, we saw more couples with dogs here, than we have seen in many of the other resorts we have stayed at. We loved it! The grounds are also very beautiful.
Manager Response: Dear 426melissar,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. I am pleased to hear of your exceptional visit and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming you back in future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the beach
Summary: My wife and I had a special stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach back in 2012 - so when we found ourselves back in town this month, we jumped at the chance to stay again.    Some common areas in the resort are currently undergoing renovations (as of January 2016) - but the resort did a great job of keeping disruptions at a minimum, and we hardly noticed.  Highlights of the stay:  - Needless to say, the room and bed are impeccable and what you would expect from a St. Regis.  (The finishes in the room also appear to have been slightly refreshed since the last time we visited.)  But my favorite touches were the little tech-friendly ones - for instance, a TV with a on-screen guide and menu that actually works and is responsive.  - The beach.  Even in January, Monarch Beach has
Manager Response: Dear direct2d,  Thank you for your compliments and indeed, we are very proud of our newly renovated guestrooms as well our "million dollar views on the ocean" from our newly renovated main lobby and lobby lounge, 33 N!  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: The hotel is undergoing renovations. The rooms are brighter. The lobby has a sleek, clean feel. More modern. The spa should reopen in April and I believe the pool area will reopen just before that. The resort fee was waived. The staff offered superb service. There's a golf course and a private beach. Great location to take in San Diego, La Jolla or Laguna.
Manager Response: Dear Rosemary M.,  Thank you for your compliments of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. I am pleased to hear you had an exceptional stay with us and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Too Short of a Visit...Looking Forward to My Next Visit
Summary: I stayed at The St. Regis for a total of two separate night's, as I went over to Catalina Island for one night in between. The ferry is down at the bottom of the hill in Dana Point Harbor which makes it very convenient. I had a great experience with Christopher, one of the Bell Captain's who assisted me on both stays along with Nicole at the front desk who checked me in and Brittni S. who worked to make sure I would have a great visit prior to my arrival, during my stay and after my visit. Even though the Resort is undergoing substantial renovations, they have structured the work in such a way to minimize any disruptions to guests. I personally experienced no such issues. When all the upgrades are finished it will look superb! I stayed at the St. Regis several years ago prior to
Manager Response: Dear SCOTT1VA,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of The St. Regis. Thank you for your kind words and we hope you will visit our address again soon.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Jose in the bar was amazing! Very knowledgeable. He's technically a server Motif which was under renovation during our stay.  William the Shuttle supervisor was so friendly and helpful.  Richard the concierge was extremely awesome and the best at helping us figure out what to do and where to go.  Ricardo, front desk agent, was such an informative person and made us feel at home the second we walked through the doors.  Even though the resort was under renovation at two of their restaurants, their lobby, spa and pool you would have never known. Most wonderful stay and can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: Dear Jesse S.,  Thank you for the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your good feedback with our associates.   I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: What an amazing experience we love coming here! Brittani from the concierge was phenomenal before hand and made our romantic trip that much better with beautiful complimentary champagne and chocolates. .We can't wait to come back!
Manager Response: Dear Gabriela D.,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We stayed for two windy, rainy days, and the staff really tried to make up for the weather.  Nice golf cart drive down to the private beach club, nice entertainment in the evening in the lobby/bar area.  Lobby, with just opened renovated space, is gorgeous, and the rooms were fantastic - everything you'd want, and great decor (wish I had taken a photo of the print over the bathtub - really nice!).  The spa and pools were closed, but we were informed about this on arrival, and with the weather the way it was, we did not miss the pools anyway.  Overall, a top notch experience, a 'whole other world' of casual luxury and enjoyment - met every expectation.
Manager Response: Dear FranknDebbie,  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Booked this last minute while visiting San Diego- my sister and I decided we wanted more of a luxury/ resort feel and left San Diego and booked the St Regis the same day we arrived. Absolutely gorgeous resort undergoing extensive renovations at the time.  Service was great- Shuttle to the beach always available.  Beach club they share with was filled with kids and teenagers - not sure if that's the norm?  Staff always going above and beyond for us.  Would love to visit again when renovations are complete.
Manager Response: Dear caracap,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: We stayed as a family of five (kids were 17/16/7 at the time) for part of our Spring Break CA road trip. I am new to writing reviews so this comes a little late...we were there in 2014.   This is a wonderful property overall, nice common areas and rooms. We had an Astor suite which was just fine for the five of us. The kids were spoiled rotten (awesome welcome amenity, hot chocolate via butler in the mornings, etc) and loved the experience. The hotel is set back from the beach, but as it was quiet when we were there the beach shuttle guys were incredible and ferried us to the waves at Salt Creek...they potentially made the trip!  We also had a nice chat with Kurt (the manager on duty) who reached out to us to thank us for the "gratitude" message we left for the butler staff.
Manager Response: Dear WonderWanderNearFar,  Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit.   I hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: The St. Regis, Monarch Beach was our destination for the annual golf trip with my family this year. As you may know from other reviews there is construction going on at the hotel, but it didn't bother us at all. All of the rooms just got renovated and the lobby was just finished on January 1st.  They are just working on the pool now which will be done in a couple of months. We stayed in the Astor Suite which was a very nice room with a view of the courtyard where they host weddings. We were lucky enough to see a wedding during the sunset and it was a beautiful ceremony. Steven was our personal butler and he was outstanding. He made sure that we were all settled in when we unpacked, brought us an ice chest for our food and drinks and French pressed coffee every morning. The golf
Manager Response: Dear maui4buss,  Thank you for your compliments of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. I am pleased to hear you had an exceptional stay with us and that Butler Steve went above & beyond. I will make sure he is being recognized.    Should your travel plans bring you back to Dana Point in the future, please call me directly at (949) 234-3301; we would love to make our beach house your preferred destination for your annual family golf trip.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Why did the hotel cross the road?
Summary: There is no doubt that this is a nice, fancy hotel.  It is certainly expensive.  Unlike Laguna Niguel and the Montage up the road, St. Regis built on the opposite side of the road from the Pacific, in an upscale neighborhood of Monarch Beach.  The hotel property is pleasant, once you adjust to the fact that the ocean is across the road.  Rooms are large and well appointed and bathrooms are particularly nice.  Restaurants are fine as well.  I did not love this hotel.  I knew it was away from the ocean, but I expected to like it more. Rating reflects the fanciness - I cannot call a hotel this upscale "average."  I am glad I went on business and so it was not on my nickel.  Oh, and it is challenging to get in and out of the neighborhood.  Without GPS this would be a scavenger hunt.
Manager Response: Dar Aen W.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review; I am pleased you enjoyed your stay.You are correct, we are ocean facing but not ocean front and about a mile and a half off of the shore. We offer a complimentary tram service that is able to take you to and from our private beach – about a 6 minute drive away from the entrance of the resort. Most of our guests enjoy the fun tram ride and the many stories our drivers share about the Dana Point and the resort.  Aen W., I hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future. Please feel free to reach out my office directly if there is anything we may be able to assist you with (949-134-3301).  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I love this hotel. Gorgeous all the way around. A room with a view is a must. A great family hotel with lots to do. Access to beach is on a shuttle. I thought it would be an inconvenience but it was fun for my daughter. Gives you a tour of the property. And the beach is a fabulous private beach. Staff is wonderful. Concierge is helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Jagsas,  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our beach house on the coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Incredible service and memorable, highly personal attention!
Summary: My boyfriend and I came down from LA to the St. Regis Monarch Beach for a relaxing weekend getaway and were just blown away by the highly personalized service and attention we received from the moment we checked in to the moment we sadly had to leave. Brittni Sneyd, the hotel's Guest Historian, and her colleague Judith, could not have been more professional, attentive and helpful in making our stay memorable, despite the fact that the hotel was undergoing renovation and had certain facilities closed like the spa, pool and several restaurants. We barely felt affected by the renovations and instead were extremely impressed with the service and exceptional dining experience at Stonehill Tavern, the hotel's Michael Mina restaurant on property, and the gorgeous new lobby and guest
Manager Response: Dear Etty L.,  Thank you for your compliments of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. I am pleased to hear you had an exceptional stay with us and look forward to welcoming you back to in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: The St Regis at Monarch Beach is one of our family favorites. When you factor price, location, access to beach, family activities and most importantly service there are not that many Southern California spots that rank highly and meet our expectations in all these categories. Beware there's major renovations underway until early April or June of 2016. Until then no pools, no spa, and noise of construction crew at 8am. But this summer a great family favorite will become an exceptional family favorite. I just hope service doesn't suffer since Marriott bought them!
Manager Response: Dear Adventuregirls90210,  We look forward to your next visit to experience the "new" Beach House on the coast, the St. Regis Monarch Beach. I could not agree more; a great family favorite will become an exceptional family favorite and I look forward to hearing your feedback.  Thank you for your loyalty and wonderful comments!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We just stayed one night here for our 21st anniversary. From the time I booked the room until we checked out we had amazing service. Even though the hotel is undergoing renovations, we were not affected. We got upgraded to  Grand Deluxe Ocean View room, did not really hear any construction noise at all. We're given fruit basket and champs when we came back from dinner. Would definitely stay here again even with the construction. I love the renovations they have completed so far and hope to go back after its completed.
Manager Response: Dear Desirusso,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach.   We plan to have our public space renovation fully completed by May and hope you will visit us again to experience the final and finished product - the "new" Beach House on the Coast.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Family and friends gathered in the lobby to watch the entertainment, Doll and Dallas. They were exceptional. We used valet parking for free and purchased drinks from the bar.  Louis, our service was friendly and efficient. Everyone we met was pleasant and made our evening perfect.
Manager Response: Dear Tapetseb22,  I am thrilled you enjoyed your visit to our new lobby lounge, 33N and that our team provided you with exceptional service.   Please come back soon to enjoy our magnificent ocean views and one of the most beautiful sunsets in with us.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: This hotel has it all!  Great restaurants, golf, pool, comfortable rooms with amazing views and a restaurant ON THE SAND!  You can't beat the first-class service and attention you receive as soon as you arrive.  We will continue to make this "our" hotel!
Manager Response: Dear cyndiwright,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: Stayed 2 nights here. I wish it had been longer. Fab hotel, fab location, fab service. Definitely 5 star.  Arrived late the first night about 10pm. I asked our porter was it possible to eat somewhere so late. He wasn't sure but thought we may be able to eat in the bar area. On the way to our room he asked another porter we passed and asked him to confirm back to him. By the time we arrived at our room about 2 minutes later our porter confirmed - yes it was possible to eat in the bar/lounge area. I was flabbergasted he knew so quickly and I didn't see him on a phone. I think he knew by my face - I didn't realise he had a hearing device in his ear and his colleague had radioed to advise him. Now that's service!!  We were there with our 2 kids but it was our anniversary. When we
Manager Response: Dear conors-kangaroo,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. We do take all comments seriously and appreciate all feedback we can get. Thank you for your feedback, I already addressed your comment regarding the kids toys by the beach.  I hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our “Beach House” on the coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: Important to account for major renovations underway at this property. Expected completion date is mid May so before you book please notate that the gym, pools and spa will not be available for use. They do offer access to local tennis club across the street for use. Normally the rooms facing the pool are highly coveted this time we were placed in a room overlooking the grassy knoll by the conference center. The lobby debuted while we visited over New Years weekend.
Manager Response: Dear calitravlerone,  Thank you for your review. In January, our main lobby and new lobby lounge, 33N re-opened followed by the new coffee shop, Part and Parcel, in February. In March the new main restaurant AVEO, new Fitness Center and new Miraval Spa will all reopen. The main pool and Grand Lawn will reopen by the end of May 2016.  As mentioned in your review, we have secured access for our guests to use the lap pool, tennis, and fitness facilities at the Monarch Bay Tennis Club directly across the street from the resort.   Our famed Michael Mina restaurant, Stonehill Tavern, is in full operation during the renovation as is Club 19 at the golf course, the Monarch Bay Club at the beach and In Room Dining. The beach and golf facilities are also unaffected by the renovation.  Calitravlerone, hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I am in the process of building a home in the Strand at Dana Point.  I am in town often and started staying at the St Regis.  Currently we live in a world where "lack" of customer service is tolerated. I however, will not stand for it neither in my own company, nor any company I do business with.  I was so pleased to find the Outstanding Customer Service with the St Regis starting from the phone & reservation manager Judith Farris to the guest liaison Britain Sneyd to the front desk personnel to the room stewards to the parking attendants.  Everyone is on their game, personable and truly make you feel special.  I have committed to staying here every time I am in town during the next 2 years while I'm building my home.  I have stayed in a room on the lower floors and on the upper
Manager Response: Dear Philpenn8,  On behalf of The St. Regis Monarch Beach and its entire Team, I would like to welcome you to the neighborhood!  Thank you for choosing our "Beach House" as your temporary "home" in Dana Point until you become a permanent resident.  I would welcome the opportunity to personally connect with you next time you are here, and my be reached at 949-234-3301.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan, General Manager

Summary: My husband has just returned from a 6 month deployment and I wanted to make his homecoming special. We stayed  one night at the St. Regis. The guest liaison  team was amazing especially Brittni Sneyd. She helped to coordinate everything from  a welcome home sign in our room, to booking spa services at the Ritz Carlton(St Regis was under construction so their spa was closed). She was very professional and  kept in constant contact via email to help me plan everything. The hotel staff went above and beyond. They comped our parking, upgraded our room, gave us free butler service, and left a handwritten note with complimentary champagne for us as well. It was an amazing experience, one my husband and I won't soon forget! Thank you Brittni and the team at the St. Regis! We will
Manager Response: Dear Queenofsamba,  I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit. Thank you for the kind words you bestowed upon Brittni; I will share your good feedback with her and our associates.   We hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our beach house on the coast in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Three-Night Visit!!! No problems related to construction/renovations.
Summary: We recently stayed at the St Regis, Monarch Beach for 3 nights--our first stay at this resort. Even though the resort is undergoing renovations, it did not negatively affect our stay. Our room was a Grand Deluxe Ocean view corner room on the first floor. The room was so spacious I would describe it as being closer to a suite than a room. The room and bath were fabulous - - luxurious yet very comfortable. Most important of all, it was spotless. We're a bit on the 'OCD' side when it comes to clean hotel rooms so we were thrilled with our room. In advance of our arrival, we requested feather free bedding due to allergies. Unfortunately, our room was not ready at check-in time, 4 pm, so the gentleman at the front desk suggested we wait in the hotel bar, Stonehill Tavern, and offered
Manager Response: Dear GinaPhxBound,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for detailing your experience, and , and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: The best way to start the New Year
Summary: We landed here on a last minute whim when the hotel we planned to stay at was not as advertised. I quickly searched nearby properties and we drove (quickly) to find a mini paradise. The outdoor bar had just opened and offered million dollar views to the ocean. Drinks are to die for and between the ocean and the liquor you won't even notice the major construction going on below.  The room was nothing spectacular, but we also didn't pay outrageous rates. The walls were thin and we could hear a lot of plumbing noise and footsteps above. But we spent a lot of time out of the room. Took the shuttle down to the Beach club restaurant and dined fireside in the bar. And returned to find slippers next to our bed and chocolates on the nightstand. This is how I'd like to prepare for bed
Manager Response: Dear Melissa S.,  Thank you for your compliments and indeed, we are very proud of our "million dollar views to the ocean" from our newly renovated main lobby and lobby lounge, 33 N!  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming back to our coastal beach house in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Change Is In The Air...But Quality of Service Remains
Summary: We have been coming to the St. Regis Monarch Beach for the last decade.  While ownership of the property has changed hands a number of times, the friendliness and accommodation of the staff and the quality of their service still stands out as among the best our family has received from any hotel. This holds true from the front desk and concierge to the valet and hospitality teams. We have stayed in nearly every type of room, and they are all spacious, receive plenty of natural light, and have views ranging from the Pacific Ocean to the rolling hills and bluffs of Laguna Niguel.   The new owners are undertaking a major renovation as of this writing, and it appears the property's "resort" amenities will be out of commission for some time.  This makes the stay less grand for the
Manager Response: Dear RH0s,  Thank you for your loyalty and wonderful review.   Our main lobby and new lobby lounge, 33N reopened on January 1, 2016. The new coffee shop, Part and Parcel, will follow in February and the new main restaurant AVEO, the Fitness Center and Miraval Spa will reopen in March . The main pool and Grand Lawn is expected to be fully finished by the end of May 2016.  I look forward to hearing your feedback after everything has been finished this spring.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Holiday Vacation even with Renovations
Summary: We stayed at the St Regis 9 nights and had a phenomenal experience. I am actually quite amused about people claiming not to have know about the renovations in previous reviews. I am not sure how this is possible as is it all over their website and we got several emails detailing exactly what was being worked on / closed at the time of our stay. With that said, we were well aware and had no problems unlike people complaining for the sake of freebies.   The service was exemplary and continues even after departure to our positive surprise. My husband was in contact with Brittni prior to our arrival to coordinate a few surprises and she emailed us after we got home to ensure we had a pleasant stay. Very nice touch.   The front end staff: valet, bell hops and check-in was always
Manager Response: Dear Its_Tina,  I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. Thank you for the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your good feedback with our associates.   I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I booked 3 rooms for a night just before Christmas so my husband and I, along with our two teenage sons, and my parents could all spend some time together and see the beach.  The property is under massive renovation, however the hospitable staff MADE our stay.  Our rooms were all beautiful, and since it decided to downpour during our stay, I'm so thankful we had such warm comfortable accommodations.    I took advantage of the special rates during renovations and booked 3 rooms.  we had a Standard Garden room for the boys, an Astor Suite, and Grande Deluxe room for my parents.  All of the rooms were lovely and provided top notch amenities, with oversized bathrooms & soaking tub in each. The Astor suite with butler service was icing on the cake!  Our butler, William K., was
Manager Response: Dear Heather H.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of the St. Regis.   I am thrilled to read about your exceptional stay and that we were able to exceed your expectations.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We enjoyed our stay. The room was nice and spacious. The staff was attentive. Found out the hotel was undergoing renovations which was not that bad. The hotel lobby, a few restaurants and the bar had just reopened which was nice. The valet parking was great, we did not have to wait long for our vehicle.  Just wished we could have enjoyed the pools and spas. Maybe next time.
Manager Response: Dear Twanisha W.,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: We arrived right after they re-opened the lobby area and it was beautiful. This property will be absolutely stunning once the pool/grounds renovations are complete. We were thoroughly informed of the renovations and scope before arriving so we were prepared -- but the construction did not impact our stay.  We stayed in a resort view room (faced away from the pool area, which is undergoing renovation) and enjoyed it. It is a good size, very clean and the bathroom is large. The Keurig coffee machine and complimentary bottled waters were nice. The balcony is small but accommodated two chairs and a small table -- would be nice to sit outside in warmer weather.   The beach is about a 10-minute walk away -- a perfect way to start the day. The concierge provided a map and directions
Manager Response: Dear travel_blurbs,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of the St. Regis.   I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Although the property is goon g thru renovations, it is still an amazing property. The rooms are very well appointed and the updates seem to give the hotel a modern feel.  👍🏻.   As it relates to the service, everyone of the staff was amazing, from the girl at check in to Jacquelyne at the bar who was so much fun.
Manager Response: Dear Breddie,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach.   January 1, 2016, the main lobby and new lobby lounge, 33N reopened as are now back in service. The new coffee shop, Part and Parcel, will follow in February and the new main restaurant AVEO, the Fitness Center and Miraval Spa will reopen in March . The main pool and Grand Lawn is expected to be fully finished by the end of May 2016.  I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Wait to go until they are done renovating
Summary: To start with they are under construction, there is no pool, no hottub , we spend new years eve here and when eked about the pool , they said we could use some across the street but they close early , meaning there's nothing to do but stay in our rooms. Even the restaurant was booked reservation only . We ended up staying in our room the whole night . The bar and lounge opened the next morning , but there wass no pint since we were already leaving .  We called for coffee that never came , and  the only upsides were a spacious bathroom ,a fully stocked fridge (pricey not free)  and small details I liked about the part of the hotel that was still intact. Im sure if I would of waited until renovations it would've been a much more pleasant experience , shame really I was looking
Manager Response: Dear Grace N.,  Thank you for your review and I am disappointed your stay was not what you had hoped it would be. Please accept my most sincere apologies for this.  I hope we will the opportunity to have you stay with us again after the renovation is finished and experience out new and finished product. Please feel free to reach out to my office directly: 949-234-3301.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Was not informed of renovations. At all. And they are extensive.   Made a booking, invited clients, scheduled meetings and a round of golf at their Monarch Bay Golf property - only to get there, check in and only then, informed of said renovation.   No bars. No restaurants. Nothing is open.   To make it worse - when we got there at 3pm they informed us our rooms were not ready and that we needed to wait. For What? Where? To do what? There is no bar. No restaurant and nothing to do.   It was so dead and empty one wondered how on earth they could be so full that our rooms, unavailable. So we simply handed our keys back, asked them to call this all off and drove home. Rather not throw good money after bad.   What a joke. And my first bad experience with St Regis. Normally this
Manager Response: Dear HutchinL,  Thank you for providing your honest feedback and please accept my sincere apology for the disappointment you experienced. We are deeply sorry that we failed to communicate and inform you prior to your arrival.  I would like to have the opportunity to turn around your impression of our hotel and brand.  As gesture of goodwill, and in an effort to restore the faith in the brand, please feel free to reach out to me directly upon your next visit and I would like to personally see your experience through from the very beginning. I can be reached at 949-234-3301.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the St. Regis as part of a corporate event and could not have been happier with the location, grounds, and the friendliness of the staff. The pool is amazing, the view and setting of the property impeccable and can not wait to have a return trip to this beautiful hotel.  Wanted to stay longer!!!
Manager Response: Dear Sharlene W.,  Thank you for your recent review and I am pleased that you had a wonderful visit at The St. Regis Monarch Beach in California. I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Top notch even despite the renovations
Summary: The renovations are definitely noticeable but the staff and overall feel of the rest of the experience more than made up for it. Everyone was super helpful (especially Richard at the concierge desk) and they did a good job of communicating the renovations in advance of our arrival. They had a number of holiday events that made the 5 nights we stayed with them each seem special and exciting. Plus the typical St. Regis cookies, coffee, hot cocoa and service you have come to expect make this a place I will be returning to for sure.
Manager Response: Dear Dan G.,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Despite the in process renovation the hotel is fabulous.  Our room was remodeled and was large and beautifully decorated.  The mattress was firm, one of the nicest and functionally designed bath rooms with an amazing shower with the best water pressure. Complimentary coffee and hot chocolate is a nice touch and a friendly and accommodating staff.
Manager Response: Dear dab57,  Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit at The St. Regis Monarch Beach in California.   Starting January 2016 the main lobby and new lobby lounge, 33N back will reopen, followed by the new coffee shop, Part and Parcel, in February. In March the new main restaurant AVEO, new Fitness Center and new Miraval Spa will all reopen. The main pool and Grand Lawn will reopen by the end of May 2016.  I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: The service at this hotel is so superior than almost any property I have stayed at in my life.  Brittni Sneyd and Ariel Lindsey went above and beyond to make our Christmas holiday stay amazing.  And the rooms, recently renovated, are simply sublime.  Bravo - and can't wait to see the entire property when the renovation is done.  See you next year...
Manager Response: Dear Steve S,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of the St. Regis.   We look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We came here on a weekend wedding in February.  After staying here for only two nights we wish we had more time! The rooms were nice and comfortable with great bedding. The lobby has breathtaking views with beautiful outdoor seating. The only real con was the distance it was from everything else so I recommend renting a car if you stay here.  I would definitely return for a longer stay.
Manager Response: Dear Dana K.,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comment and I am very pleased to learn that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay.  Our public space renovation started in November 2015 and we will be finished by the end of April 2016. On January 1, 2016 we will reopen the main lobby and new lobby lounge, 33N followed by the new coffee shop, Part and Parcel, in February. In March the new main restaurant AVEO, new Fitness Center and new Miraval Spa will all reopen. The main pool and Grand Lawn will reopen by the end of May 2016.  I hope you will stay with us again to experience our new product.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I really enjoyed staying at this resort, the adult pool in the spa was a big plus. I really liked the golf cart ride to the restaurant in the private beach. The restaurant view was amazing. Very clean grounds,  front desk staff costumer service can be better but as a SPG Gold I received a good costumer service. Overall I would stay at this resort again.
Manager Response: Dear Michael I.,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review about your recent stay. As a valued SPG Platinum member, we truly appreciate your feedback.  I am pleased to hear your overall experience was excellent and I look forward to sharing your kind comments with our staff and leaders.   It will be my pleasure to welcome you to our address again very soon.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the St. Regis for 4 days as a last minute trip with the family.  We were able to upgrade to stay in a suite with a personal butler.  We did not find the construction to be bothersome as we didn't spend a lot of times outdoors although you could sometimes here the construction noise outside in the am.  The service was phenomenal and our butlers were fantastic.  I can't wait to stay there again once the renovation has been completed in the spring.
Manager Response: Dear Eiszel L.,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: I'm sure this will be a splendid property when the renovations are complete, but do not stay here while it is under construction.  It is unusable for anything other than sleep and make sure you don't want to sleep after 8am.  The lobby now resembles a temporary wedding tent and the grounds are off limits due to construction.  They offer the use of the facilities across the street, but its not as close as you might think, which makes working out or using facilities not that convenient.  Also, keep in mind that the beach is about a 1.5mile walk from the hotel.  You can take a tram, but....
Manager Response: Dear Crticalone,  Thank you for staying with us and I am sorry your stay was not what you had hoped it would be, this is certainly disappointing to read and I hope you will accept my most sincere apologies for this.  Between November 3, 2015 and April 30, 2016 the main entrance, lobby and lobby lounge as well as the coffee shop, spa, fitness center, the main restaurant Motif and finally the pool and Grand Lawn are under renovation.  In January, these areas will start to reopen with the main lobby and new lobby lounge, 33N back in service first followed by the new coffee shop, Part and Parcel, in February. In March the new main restaurant AVEO, new Fitness Center and new Miraval Spa will all reopen. The main pool and Grand Lawn will reopen by the end of May 2016.  In the interim, we have secured access for our guests to use the lap pool, tennis, and fitness facilities at the Monarch Bay Tennis Club directly across the street from the resort. Our famed Michael Mina restaurant, Stonehill Tavern, is in full operation during the renovation as is Club 19 at the golf course, the Monarch Bay Club at the beach and In Room Dining. The beach and golf facilities are also unaffected by the renovation.  Crticalone, I hope we will the opportunity to have you stay with us again after the renovation is finished and experience out new and finished product. Please feel free to reach out to my office directly: 949-234-3301.  Sincerely, Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Stayed here in mid November as we were able to get an excellent rate because of construction.    We were hesitant because of the aforementioned construction as it involved the lobby, the pool and outdoor patio.  When we arrived there were white tents set up as temporary registration and concierge areas, and we were met with valet service.  The checkin procedure was smooth and pleasant and the staff member was very understanding of my pre notification of room requirements.    We had a lovely room that overlooked the gardens, fountains, patio's and peek-a-boo views of the ocean and wonderful sunsets.  The room was luxurious even thought it was a standard room.  The amenities were wonderful, from robes, slippers, huge bathroom with both a jacuzzi tub and large walk in shower.
Manager Response: Dear  Mily4,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are excited to have our completely renovated Front Desk, Concierge Area and Lobby Lounge "33 N" back open the first week of January 2016.   I appreciate your kind comments hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming you back and experience our new and finished product.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Travel warning don't stay here until June
Summary: Hotel under massive construction. Expedia and other sites didn't warn of this. The hotel lobby, restaurant Motif, spa, gym, pool are all closed. No good rooms are available and careful if you have kids or seniors there is construction dust in the air. Not good -poor judgement for the hotel to be open with such massive construction.  They offer a lame condo complex gym as an alternative. I would not want anything out of their kitchens either with the dust flying around.   I moved to Ritz Carlton whom have massively improved their hotel and service.
Manager Response: Dear Tomk626,  Thank you for your loyalty and choosing the St. Regis Monarch Beach as your "home away from home" when travelling to Orange County. We appreciate your honest feedback and please accept my sincere apology for the frustration and inconvenience you experienced.  Our public space renovation, which involves the lobby area and lobby lounge (check-in is temporarily relocated to our Arrival Pavilion until mid-January), the pool and spa as well as our Motif Restaurant and the coffee shop, will be fully complete by spring 2016.  I would welcome the opportunity to welcome you back and experience our new and finished product. Please feel free to reach out to our office directly and I would like to personally see your experience through from the very beginning. I may be reached at 949-234-3301.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I really love this property. Before my arrival, a guest historian reached out to help me personalize my stay. I was upgraded to a Grand Ocean Suite, which was wonderful with a nice size balcony, amazing bathroom with giant soaking tub, all with a fantastic view. I was entertaining clients one evening and phoned the Stonewall Tavern on site to inquire about a private dining area I had seen on the SPG channel. They were more than happy to accommodate my request and we had a FANTASTIC dinner for six. The staff here, all of them, are anxious to please and really work to make your stay memorable!

Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Luxurioous resort with a private beach and golf course
Summary: What else can you really ask for? There's a golf course on the premise with a bus that takes you down to the private beach every 30 minutes. The hotel is beautiful inside and out. The restaurant is pricey so I would suggest eating elsewhere for the price.
Manager Response: Dear Donaldinc,  I am thrilled you choose to stay with us and that we were able to exceed your expectations. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful views, lovely rooms, exceptional staff!
Summary: Treated my husband to a night at the St. Regis to celebrate his birthday while visiting my family in California. I had been there once before for lunch and had fond memories of how beautiful it was...in spite of ongoing renovations, it did not disappoint! The guest rooms are beautiful with every amenity you could imagine....but beyond anything else the staff from the reservation process to check-out were amazing, and made us feel welcome and special. Among the stand-outs were Brittni, (who reassured me that the hotel was really not a hard-hat zone as I had once dreamed) to Collin at check-in and Mitchell the very friendly tram driver, who took us to the beach for dinner....I can't say enough good things about the service here....they were smiling and accommodating which can't be
Manager Response: Dear Mitsu114,  I am very pleased to learn that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay and thank you for the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your good feedback with our associates.   We hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: If your looking to getaway with a  loved one than this is your place.. every room has a balcony that faces the ocean.. the higher floors have the better view.. the property is very well maintained and the staff was amazing.. thanks to Ricky at the front desk for going the extra mile in customer service...  the property is located away from the beach... you have to take a 8 min tram ride to the beach club which is very convenient... the beach club is a private club for members and guests of the hotel... here you can enjoy laying by the beach or having a very nice lunch or dinner in a beautiful setting while watching the waves and the sunset... overall the St Regis has impressed once again... you might even run into a "real housewive of orange county" and a plastic surgeon(:
Manager Response: Dear dflores1123,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. I appreciate your kind comments hope we will have the pleasure to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Even though it is under renovation, the hotel is a great place to stay. The rooms are large, the staff are excellent. I only stayed one night but i can imagine this would be  great location to unwind. The breakfast was delicious, the room service fast and accurate. The Westin SCP was sold out so this was a great second choice if you are in the SCP area
Manager Response: Dear Sregdab28,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: We stayed at the St Regis Monarch Beach resort for our company trip.  It was an excellent experience.  In all fairness this was my first time staying in a property that had butlers and turn down service.  However, from my perspective it was a beautiful property, the rooms were amazing.  Comfortable, spotless, with a great view.  I loved coming back to the room and knowing it was going to be just like we stepped in for the first time, every time.  We celebrated my loves 40th birthday at one of the restaurants and the services was outstanding right down to hiding the cake and making sure that we had balloons.  It really made for a perfect day.  We ate at all but one of the restaurants on the property and found them all to be delicious.  Loved the crab cakes at the Monarch Bay Club.

Summary: As always a St. Regis is an exceptional property but this place is superior even by their standards. The beach club is the icing on the cake and the staff there, Paul specifically, is fantastic.  Thanks for a great end to my trip.
Manager Response: Dear KWG1625,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

We were told of the remodel while checking-in. Although we were immediately checked into our rooms, we were not informed that one of the rooms would be a handicapped room and would not have a door to the water closet/toilet room. Not very pleasant when you are sharing a room. You will hear the bulldozers,and jack hammers outside of your room starting at 8AM and one night went on till 6:15 and have a lovely view of the same. There is no spa, no fitness and no POOL facility operating while the renovations are going on. Nice, polite staff, but what good is it when there is nothing to do at the resort? They do not

Should your travel plan bring you back to Dana Point in the future, please call me directly at (949) 234-3301, and I would be happy to ensure that you have a flawless stay with us. Summary: I read the hotel was under renovation and I agree with the reviews that comment on the impact this has.  I stayed here on points so I was ok, sort of, with the condition. I had stayed before years ago and the hotel had a huge impression on me, ranking among the most beautiful I've been at - and I've been at a lot !   But during the renovation the amazing lobby isn't accessible at all which is part of the appeal.  We were upgraded to a resort view room which didn't impress me especially since the view was of jack hammers and construction. I had hoped they would go a bit further to keep a regular happy.   The rooms here are elegant and nice and all the staff I dealt with were polite and efficient.    The breakfast overlooked the jack hammer work going on too and added up to 80

Summary: We stayed at this resort a week ago.  Beware there is a lot under construction and not everything is open.  However the service is above outstanding.  We arrived early (11:00 AM.) hoping to check in early as we are platinum members, we were told we could not but would be called as soon as the room was ready.  Further it would only be a short while.  Thus we went to the beach had a drink, then a leisurely lunch but by 3:00 there still was no call. (We specifically did not leave the property thinking we would be able to get our room, unpack get air suites and go to the beach.) We again went to the front desk as they were busy booking other guests in, to no avail. We finally spoke to the manager who was very professional.  We explained how we had been waiting all day (it was now
