Summary Heading: Great Potential But Chaotic and Missing the Details
Summary: When they say its under construction, they're not kidding.  I made reservations directly with the hotel and they described the construction as being around the pool area and didn't mention anything else.  Receiption is a tent in the parking lot and is very chaotic.  Minimum space for arrivals and departures and a certain times of the day feels like a Greyhound terminal rather than a luxury hotel reception.  Check in consists of one desk with just two computers so again, be prepared for a lengthy wait and to have to stand outdoors in the open door in the line.  Front desk staff seemed overwhelmed and forgot to call us to tell us our room was ready--we had had to stand in line twice to get our keys.  The details of getting our paper, the amenity and bed for our dog, and ice to our

Summary: I can review this hotel quite comprehensively. Stayed twice a month, about ever month. Over 20 stays in a year.   Placement of hotel, just back from the coast line views of the coast. Resort provides amazing views. The resort facilities, gardens,  golf corse all five star - first class.   Based on my experience at this Resort,  there is no guarantee of the exceptional service. This service  used to set them apart from all other hotels. I would therefore encourage people reading this review to consider the Ritz Carlton.  It is in the same Dana Point area location. It is on the actual Bluff, you will wake on the coast. There are  rooms that have views of the Coast. The Ritz  is now part of SPG StarWood too. It's merged with Marriot group. I am platinum with StarWood, apparently
Manager Response: none

Summary: Amazing room. Amazing service. Awesome food.  The hotel is in the middle of MAJOR renovations, so only 3 of the on site restaurants are open and the pools are closed as well.  Because of the renovation the rooms have been discounted substantially.  We went with the deluxe room and we're shocked by the quality.  We paid around $300 a night for what should be a $700-900 room.  It was perfect for us as we spent almost our entire stay in room.  The staff was very accommodating (we wanted a cheese plate brought up to the room that was no longer on the menu...).  Can't recommend this hotel enough.

Summary: This was my third stay at this property and having loved it in the past is why we chose it as our accommodation for my daughters wedding. Shout out to Ricky Uribe  at the front desk and Nick Morris who managed to retain our reservations even after we considered changing to another hotel when learning of the upcoming renovations, and I'm so glad we didn't cancel.   They have managed to make the renovations minimally intrusive and are making up for the lack of amenities like the lobby, pool, spa, bar, and restaurant as best as possible. Yes, food and drinks are very expensive here, but

Due to my partner's status with SPG we were upgraded to a St. Regis Suite with an amazing ocean view.  I called the property the day before to let the hotel know that it was my anniversary and Collin explained that the property is undergoing renovations currently in the public spaces and he was very apologetic yet his level of service and attention to detail out weighed any sort of issue created by the public spaces of the hotel being closed/renovated.  He also told me that he will put us in for an upgrade due to our special day.  When we got to the hotel the next evening, our check in agent, Lucy, congratulated us

Summary Heading: A First-Class Property with Breathtaking Views!

After flying all morning, then driving a GMC Yukon XL from Sacramento to Dana Point, my good friend Emily and I were worn out. As soon as we arrived, the valet opened the door, welcomed us to the St. Regis Monarch Beach and guided us right inside to the front desk to check in. Another valet took the initiative and grabbed our bags out of the back and then brought them inside for us, it was the most amazing service I have ever experienced.  The front desk agent found our reservation quickly, thanked me for my loyalty and elite status with Starwood, upgraded our room, and asked if there was anything else he could help us with. I was highly impressed. Check-in was quick and efficient,

Summary Heading: Beautiful and luxurious property in Dana Point
Summary: The property is definitely up to Saint Regis Standards. Great service, facilities, rooms...Now, and as we were staying there on a week-end, the hotel was completely full, with people everywhere, long queues at check-in, overcrowded swimming pool area making it really not the relaxing and quieter experience you would normally find in a luxury property. Having said that, the hotel staff was doing their best to accommodate the crowd and deliver the luxury experience. Note that there is a lap pool next to the fitness room which is quite deserted, the fitness facilities are great, and they offer all sorts of classes including Yoga, which took us to the nearby beach.

Summary Heading: A nice  sprawling beach resort hotel best for a few days stay
Summary: St.Regis is sprawling Beach resort property which is best enjoyed if you intend to spend a few days at the property. The resort is tucked away in the midst of Residential district and away from Commercial Activity and shopping centers. The nearest convenience stores  are about a 15 minutes walk  away.  The rooms are of good size with rich, warm décor  , lavish bathrooms and spacious balcony.  The property with its pools , sprawling and manicured lawns  seems to be maintained well. The F&B outlets are nothing extraordinary and the food does not impress. While the resort is serene , very quite and relaxing ; it lacks excitement  and gives an  impression of a slightly dated property. Overall Service from the check-in experience to Check-out experience is courteous , efficient but

Summary: Let me start of by stating I visited whilst the renovation of the lobby was under way so my first impression on arriving was poor ... The temporary lobby was very sub standard and lacked much . Even the hallways looked barren and deserted . We had a king room , the bathroom was large and spectacular the room itself was decent . The service was shoddy toile half an hour for items to arrive . The bel hop you dropped my bags asked me if I would like something, I asked for some ice which sadly never came . I bought tickets through the concierges leaving my cc for the purchase , when I went to fetch the tickets there was another lady at the desk and she had no idea of what I was talking about . There was an envelope sitting on the desk I assumed it would be mine , I had her open it

Summary: My sister and I spent a fabulous weekend at the St. Regis Monarch Beach this summer when she came to town.  The property was large and lovely, the pools were gorgeous, and the restaurants were wonderful.  Check-in was a long, slow, hot process, and is the only reason I rated the hotel 4 instead of 5.  Service, other than slow check-in, was excellent.  Our pool and partial ocean view room had a nice lanai, and the beds were extremely comfortable.  We had a fun girls' weekend at the St. Regis!

We were understandably upset, and Maria did her best to ensure that we still had a good experience, our room was decorated for our honeymoon, and the staff was especially helpful. This is most likely a 5 star property that is getting a 4 star review because we did not get to experience the pool, spa, and fitness center and there were a few small issues:  - We did not have champagne and strawberries ready for us upon arrival, even though this was a part of our package - The temporary gym across the street at the Monarch Tennis Club is pretty dismal, and not

Public areas seem a little tired and out of date, but hear they are gearing up for a renovation.  Beautiful views and grounds.  It is a larger hotel than expected and it is clear they attract a lot of meetings and groups.  Would def, go back.

Summary: Not just beautiful; beyond it! Stellar yet far from stuffy, professional yet personable customer & guest service. Immaculate views and accommodations. I live in LA so it's an hour drive away, yet I felt worlds away from work, hustle and bustle. .. just lots of Zen and abundance of woooosaahh ♥

Summary: St Regis is one of our favorite resorts to stay at.  The property is beautiful and always well cared for.  Many amenities like a few different restaurants (great food and service), 2 pools (kids' and adults'), a beach club, golf, and fitness center.  Rooms are lovely and spacious, beds are scrumptiously comfortable, huge bathrooms, and nice turndown service.  Even though it seems fancy, it's near the beach, so more low key and down to earth.  Service all around the hotel is superb!  A few things to know: This hotel is not right on the beach.  The property is across PCH and you take a golf cart shuttle down to the private beach club.  It does take some time to get down there, but a nice little drive and worth it when you arrive.  Nice little beach restaurant, bar setup for
Manager Response: Dear Hotelsnobb,  I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit at The St. Regis Monarch Beach in California. Summary: Room product stunning (rooms recently renovated), large bathrooms/2 sinks..hotel is about to undergo a renovation of main restaurants, pool and will be stunning. I saw the floor plans and artist renderings! Golf on property perfect for golfers.  Beach is a 5 minute shuttle ride away.

Summary Heading: Avoid--go to the Ritz 1 block away
Summary: For years, I've enjoyed other locations of the St Regis; mainly on the East coast. This location should just be avoided at all costs. We very likely became ill due to food served at this resort. The GM Ian didn't even have courtesy to personally return multiple phone calls especially after we had a very expensive dinner--very expensive. And, frankly, as someone that's been fortunate to visit some of the best restaurants in the USA and Europe--St Regis food was marginal at best, uninspired, and, frankly one of the worst dinners I've had for many years. The rooms are nicely appointed; yet, the so-called ocean view is marginal. If you go down one block--the Ritz-Carlton has a far superior ocean view rooms, the overall ambience is much nicer, great views from some dining and bar

Summary: Beautiful property with pretty good service but spotty. Asked for an ocean view room. DONT PAY FOR IT.  You can only see the ocean from the balcony so the reality is that it's a balcony view room. Gross misrepresentation.  Good food. Waitress Katy at the beach front restaurant excellent!  Came back to get my room keys and was pointed toward the hall way to head to my room. Weird since it was not obvious.  I'm not thrilled and probably won't come back

Summary: We love this hotel for everything it has to offer. The location is great as we love Southern California. The hotel is great from the moment you pull up. The service is top notch no matter if you pull up in a compact rental car or a Ferrari. The restaurants are great and have great service. We love the rooms as they are huge and have a large bathroom and deck. I have played the golf course once and really enjoyed it. There is not much to not like about this hotel. I have stayed at both this hotel and the Ritz across the road and they are both great hotels but there is no comparrison the St. Regis is head and tails better in pretty much every catagory.

The rooms are beautiful (I believe they went through a recent renovation), as are the public spaces including the restaurants and pool area.  We golfed and had a wonderful experience at the resort course.    I can't wait to book a longer stay and bring my entire family along -- the resort has everything from pool to golf to beach to tennis to great restaurants and amazing attractions nearby. Definitely a luxury hotel with amazing service, but not intimidatingly so -- everyone was so friendly. A great find!

Summary Heading: A hotel that understands service in the most classic sense
Summary: We stayed on a Sat/Sun night for a quick getaway and found our stay to be excellent. This hotel stands out above many of their competitor high-end properties, such as the Ritz and Four Seasons. It is clear that a significant amount of time is spent training all staff levels the importance of service and pleasantries. The rooms were well appointed, quiet and the beds were amazing. A private tram takes you to the beach. The beach was nice (yes - seaweed is everywhere, but this is the Pacific ocean, not the Atlantic) and not remotely crowded. Water temp was over 70 degrees in Oct., so we spent plenty of time in the water. We would certainly consider returning again for a resort stay.

When I called twice to see if they had forgotten my order I was told it was "on the way" and "it will be there momentarily" only to wait another 20 minutes... I would have expected goodwill gesture on the part of the hotel - free drink or whatever... Instead, the person who delivered the meal said that "she will pass the message about the delay" to her manager... Never heard a word after.. Not quite the service I would expect from property of this standard.

The hotel concierge could only get us in at 8:30pm.  Because we wanted to eat earlier, I called my AMEX concierge and they were able to get us in at 7:30pm, a much more preferable time. Manager Response: Dear FiscalConservat... S.,  It was such a pleasure meeting you and thank you for your incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Almost impossible for two to eat breakfast for less than $50 in the restaurant).  Resort fee is $30 and valet parking is $40 per day.  Our room was outstanding! It was huge, very comfortable, quiet and clean. The room was the best part of the hotel.  Common areas were nice too but pretty standard for a luxury hotel.  We enjoyed breakfast each morning in the outdoor terrace area. The only problem is the tables and chairs sit low and you can't see over the greek styled posts/wall toward the pool and ocean.  Seems like a significant design mistake. Such a beautiful view that is missed due to the wall around the terrace. Oh well.  Service was very

Summary: I stayed here for far too short of a time. 5 days was not enough! I've never had such amazing accommodations.l Huge rooms with a bathroom suite to rival all others. What made my experience even better was the exceptional, amazing and lovely service of the staff. From the valets to front desk to butler service and housekeeping. Every single person you encounter here is a pleasure. From lovely St. Regis waters to the piped in signature scent of the spa, this is a hotel that's enjoyable from start to finish. I'll definitely be back and could not recommend this hotel enough. Spoil yourself and come for a visit. Absolute perfection! Well done, to the entire staff.

Hard to enjoy a quiet cocktail unless you're outside watching the beautiful sunsets. The spa was lovely, the gym well equipped, the beach walk awesome, restaurant on the water very good and breakfast in Motif very nice.

There is plenty do to here - 3 pools, spa, high end fitness center, golf, beach club (which is great), and many places to eat.    If I were just rating the hotel and property, I would give it 5 stars, however, the service, while good, was a bit spotty for a hotel brand of this level. Manager Response: Dear ncg1983,  Thank you for staying at The St. Regis Monarch Beach  during your visit to Caliornia. They have patio dining and the food was good. Nothing mind-blowing, but the family enjoyed what we had. Sadly, I must take 1 point away for something that is no fault of the hotel's but matters to patrons that are kind, good people. That said, the resort view is also a great option as the rooms look out to the property, albeit not the ocean. One word of advice: try for a room on the 3rd floor or higher. The first floor is convenient for circumventing the grounds quickly but does not offer the open feeling of the higher floors. The 2nd floor rooms are fine, but since it costs no more to be on a higher floor, the 3rd floor and higher offer much more expansive views.

Overall the hotel is very well located, the room was confortable and with all the amenities you would expect from a hotel of the "caliber", but there was no spark. Sometimes overcrowded because of the events (especially marriages), on many occasions you'd have to stay in a queue to get your car...crazy!!! one of the things amongst others, that I really like to appreciate is breakfast, but in this case there wasn't much to appreciate, very poor, lack of variety ...it was a big, big disappointment. The good thing with that  was that we were "forced" to find alternatives outside the hotel, so it was a good experience to be able to find new

Summary Heading: The best vacation I've ever had.
Summary: Great service is hard to find, that is unless you're staying at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. My wife and I recently spent a week there on our honeymoon and I can say with the utmost confidence that I have never experienced the level of quality service I experienced here. Every single staff member greeted us with a smile, was abundantly helpful in meeting all of our needs, and made our stay absolutely fantastic. Because it was our honeymoon, we received complementary dessert and/or champagne at each meal as well as chocolate covered strawberries and rose petals waiting in our room. To me, it was the little things that set the staff apart like remembering my name ("welcome back, Mr. Post"; "is there anything else you need, Mr. Post"; etc.) and making it seem like I was the only
Manager Response: Dear Ryapost,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: If I could do 4.5 stars I probably would have.  Excellent service, rooms are recently updated and have everything you could really need, service was great. I actually thought the pool was great though they will be updating that and all the grounds beginning in November for a major facelift.  Views, even oceanviews aren't all that as they are across the street and set back pretty far.  Resort views are nice though and supposedly when done will be even nicer. Pool is 24hrs and transportation to the beach runs regularly.  Really nothing to complain about, it just takes me a lot to give something a five star rating, more so as the years go on though this comes very close. Plus, I've seen 2 others in the area that are just a tiny bit nicer which makes it harder to warrant a true 5.

Summary: My fiance attended a company meeting at the St. Regis and I was lucky enough to attend and enjoy some rest and relaxation at the pool and beach. The Hotel is on a beautiful property and is nicely manicured. We enjoyed one day at the adult pool and the second day at the beach.  The staff were so friendly and attentive - we had a poolside server (Katrina) wait on us for two days and she was so sweet and so attentive! We were thrilled when we saw she was working the second day of our trip!  We really enjoyed our stay at the St. Regis and hope to be back for a long weekend during the winter months.

Summary: We just spent a few days at the St Regis Monarch Bay outside of Laguna Beach and the resort was nothing short of fantastic.   The hotel and its staff have created a enclave that's much like a pocket in time. From the second we entered the grounds we were whisked into a time that was more genteel where people behaved better and service was a profession done with pride not simply a job.    Before our weekend even began Kori Walker Director of reservations worked with us to make sure we had a great weekend at the first Annual Wine and Food Festival hosted by the Hotel. Her efforts were nothing short of fantastic securing us a room that fit our needs perfectly.   The chief butler assigned Juan Carlos to assist us who literally met us at the driveway. This young man exemplifies

Summary: from the rooms, to the food and beverage and the amazing event the hotel hosted, it was all fantastic!  The pools are amazing and the BEACH is just the perfect touch. If you are looking for a great vacation this is the only spot you need to consider

Summary: I recently stayed for 6 days with my fiancee.  This property was beatiful, elegant and very luxurious,which is expected from any st regis. But the hotel staff made our trip unforgettable. They all were very attentive, proffessional and courteous. Id like to thank Haidi at the motif restaurant, the bartender at the restaurant by the pool, Mark from the phillipines, Marcel who works as a bellman, and tomas from stone hill. They all were amazing. But there were two staff members who treated us like family and made us feel so special, ricky from front desk and patrick from the st regis bar, i would need another review to talk about them, all i can say is that they both created a magical first impression for us. They offered flawless , bespoke service, and they anticipated our needs

Summary Heading: Here for business, but got a mini-vacation as well
Summary: The entire place was stunning.  The grounds were beautiful, complete with gorgeous landscaping and fountains.  The rooms were well appointed, clean, and comfortable and included a balcony with views of the pool and the ocean beyond.  We ate all meals there and all were excellent.   Our meeting space was at the golf course and worked perfectly for our needs.
Manager Response: Dear Steven G.,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: This has to be the nicest resort me and my lady has ever stayed at! We came here for a little getaway from San Diego, and this was a short 1 hour drive up the coast in Dana Point, which is super close to Laguna Beach. It was me and my lady's 5 year anniversary and so I wanted to book the nicest resort in the Orange County area. I heard about this place from a family blog I follow, called the TAZA'S. They're the most gorgeous family in the world and they stayed here for their 8 year anniversary, and so I figured if it was good for them, it should be good for us, haha here is the link: http://lovetaza.com/2015/06/a-weekend-at-monarch-beach/ They even have a youtube video from their stay, which I will have soon when I get time to editing it. I saw this resort and the Ritz Carlton

Warmest Regards,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: The hotel is huge, lovely and spacious.  The prices are huge and not-so-lovely. In addition to the room rate, the daily resort fee + valet parking + other incidentals and taxes = $80+ each night.  Breakfast was unreasonably expensive - $22 for fairly ordinary pancakes. $500 for a firepit set-up on the beach - a decadent service at a decadent price.  And the shuttle to beach is a bit inconvenient.  Overall, if cost is not a concern, this is a beautiful hotel. If value is a priority, this may not be the right place.

Summary: Of course even when you are somewhere like Dana Point for business pleasure always happens.  Very nice hotel with clean comfortable rooms and great service.  Great views of the ocean.  Easy access to the ocean via hotel shuttle all on their property.  Close to art district in Laguna Beach.  I know this is a 5 star resort but still thought their drink prices were way too high.

Summary: Came down here just for a day and it was a delightful one! The staff, restaurants, live music, kids play, beach and everything was exceptionally nice. The only problem was that we couldn't get to check out later.. Too busy even if you're platinum SPG member. Anyways, got extra Starwood points for inconvenience.  Trolley to the beach is fun too BTW!  Thanks for a wonderful time team St Regis !

Summary: Took our family for a fabulous vacation. The property is gorgeous. The staff is attentive and incredibly service oriented. From the bell staff to the concierge, everyone was top notch. The view at sunset from the lobby bar deck is breath taking. Wonderful place to bring the entire family to dissapear and relax. Thanks for a wonderful week. Will be back soon!

Summary: Lovely place and great location. Highlight was Frank at the golf shop who made such a fantastic effort to make my teenage sons so incredibly welcome. Thank you Frank! Also: Pool staff were excellent. Very helpful - especially Nathan, who again could not do more. One gripe though: the buffet breakfast was substandard for a 5 star hotel so order a la carte. That said, after 7 days they still couldn't get 2 poached eggs on toast right - giving me separate plates for each! Bizarre. That said, overall it was an excellent experience - albeit not inexpensive.

Summary: I just spent two nights at this resort with my husband and two kids ages 8 and 11.  I was not expecting the resort to be as beautiful as it was. You can remain on the resort without leaving.  This is a very child friendly property. The beach is beautiful, lots of restaurants, coffee shop, gym, spa, several pools and golf.  The rooms were just redone and they are large and nicely decorated. We loved the beach club.  The tram is quick and efficient.  It is not a big deal at all being shuttled to the beach. My only complaints with the resort would be the cost of food is expensive ($30 for berries and yoghurt for breakfast) and the gym is not that big considering the large size of the property.  I would not hesitate in returning to this property and I could easily spend a week here.

Summary Heading: Paradise is an hour from LA!
Summary: Last Thursday, I decided to take my young son away for a "night at the beach" for that weekend. Kori Walker, St. Regis' Reservations Director, deserves special recognition for helping me book an incredible room. My son and I loved the pools, the beach, the restaurants and the warmth of the staff, not to mention the huge tub in the room (suitable for floating). This is the absolute best alternative to Hawaii, and I look forward to returning soon!
Manager Response: Dear KG90027,  I am thrilled to read your review. Thank you for your kind word, and indeed paradise is only an hour from LA!  I look forward to welcoming you and your family back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: A favorite of mine in the past I had noticed a slippage of service around the time the hotel was for sale.  In a long talk with the manager he had said the new owners were going to be all over the service and WOW he was right.  The remodel: It seems to be complete.  The rooms are quite nice, with large bedside tables with built in plugs and new wall paper and carpeting.  Nice and more subtle than the rather dated rice screens of the past. Valet: issue that had plagued the hotel is fixed.  Proper greetings welcoming guests to the hotel, texting ability to retrieve car (though t mobil and Verizon don't have great connection at this property) fast and efficient and polite.  Also special requests like having car packed with bags and parked in front awaiting me as I had to drive back

Summary: You will feel like a movie star here. The people pamper you and make you feel like the only guest.  Everyone is extremely friendly on the staff.  They have everything right on the property, you don't have to take your car out of the lot. It has a private beach and provide everything you need.
Manager Response: Dear Jildac,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Everything about this hotel is lovely, except for one thing.  First the good points--setting couldn't be lovelier. Staff is friendly--almost excessively so--I don't need to be validating their good service at every turn.  Spa is great.  Food is good. Rooms are very well appointed and comfortable.  The shocker comes when the bill arrives--not the price so much as all the little stuff that gets tacked on--$40 a night valet service-- really???  Tips for staff--I think this showed up because it was negotiated by the conference I attended, but $15 for porters when I schlepped my own bag?  really???  And then taxes galore.  I would be so much happier with an all-inclusive price, especially since there was nothing I could do to affect any of the fees.  This place is very

Summary Heading: Outstanding hotel resort; excellent staff, well designed & maintained
Summary: The resort staff always try to exceed expectations and provide great service; the setting overlooking a beautiful golf course with the Pacific in the distance is lovely and relaxing; the grounds are well kept; the interior is handsomely designed and well maintained; golf Club 19 restaurant has a beautiful view and very good food; the Stonewall Tavern (Mina's) has excellent food and service, but can get noisy.  Of course, the resort is pricey but you get what you expect and more

Summary: This was my first stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Had requested an early check-in, but when I got to the front desk, they said my room was not quite ready yet and took my number to call when it was ready. Was easy to leave bags with the bellmen and decided to go to the pool to wait for room to be ready.   When I got to the pool with my friend, there were not two open chairs available. The butlers there were able to find two chairs and set them up together. However, what I did not realize was that they set me up direct in the pathway of where the staff take their large towel containers through. I was bumped into, and at one point when I was almost asleep, they had me get up out of my chair and move my chair. That was really frustrating and inconvenient. The butler staff was

Summary: My husband and I just returned from our LA/Laguna beach vacation and staying at the St. Regis was the highlight of our trip. Every part of this hotel, from the grounds to the pool to the beach area are gorgeous. While it's not beach front, there is a quick tram down to the beach area. It runs very frequently and there are plenty of amenities down at the beach. It is amazingly breathtaking down there. The main part of the hotel is up in the cliffs and is equally beautiful but I will admit the best part was the hotel bed itself. It was so comfortable I had difficulty getting up every morning. Our only regret was that we even spent any time in LA. Next time we will skip the city and go straight to Laguna. We will definitely stay at this hotel again too.

Summary Heading: Continued Luxury in Our 15th Consecutive Year
Summary: As a family, we have been visiting this resort every year since they opened in 2001. As someone who frequents luxury hotels around the globe, I feel qualified to say that this property captures the essence of perfection at every level and is without a doubt our favorite escape in Southern California. This trip we had had the pleasure of staying in a St. Regis suite which was incredibly appointed with incredible service from our butler, Giulana, who could not have done a better job.   Mosaic, the more casual restaurant at the hotel, has revamped their menu recently and now serves incredible farm to table food.   One of the best things about the property is the ability to both have a relaxing day at the pool or beach. Because of the way the coast s set up, the beach is essentially

Summary Heading: Can't beat St Regis for couples getaway!
Summary: We celebrated our 10th anniversary here 7 years ago and have returned every year since. What keeps us coming back? Obviously the stunning grounds and beautiful private beach, but more than anything it's the quality of the staff. We especially look forward to seeing Clark (who is straight out of Central Casting) at the pool bar and Flora (formerly of the business center, now hostess extraordinaire at Motif restaurant). We are already counting down the days til next year!

Summary: The St.Regis at Monarch beach is delightful-  a truly magnificent property.  It's what one would expect from the St. Regis and it did not disappoint..the detail and style put into every section of the hotel is thorough, and the kindness exhibited by the staff is up to par-  I do wish that they had some food/drink service down on the beach.  It was easy enough to go to the bay club right there, but just thought it could be helpful to not have to run up there for a beverage.  A good tip involved the pool.  The pool was mobbed with children, and if your not into that, then you won't be into this...we were told that the lap pool in the spa was quiet and it was...so that was a great escape.  The spa in general was the highlight of my stay.  I could have been satisfied just living

Summary: After several vacations at the Pelican Hill, Montage and Ritz Dana Point we tried the St Regis for 6 nights with the family - a  disappointing experience. This place is run for corporate events and weddings primarily. Almost every day there are events which partly reduce options for regular guests. Hallways and rooms look already tired for a five star hotel and have this old smell. Restaurants are average with very high pricing : a poor Cappuccino at breakfast $9; Small Filet Mignon at Dinner over $60 (plus side dish, tax, tip). You need a print out : 10 min. computer usage $6 incl. four pages print out. The beach and beach service are great ! The place is also almost fully run by college kids who are not all professional trained but very friendly and engaged.

Summary: 5 star hotel and service , on the golf course and near ocean , 10 min drive to Laguna town where u find good restaurants and local shops . The rooms are very nice and up to date , food by the pool side is so so and pricey coffee machine in the room is great ,I love this place Laguna it's relaxing and fun , enjoy

From morning muffins, lunches onsite and by the pool, to drinks at the beach club, service is top notch. Beautiful spot, great architecture, with lots of space and a unique golf cart ride to the beach.

We will never stay anywhere else again in Dana Point

The Spa is top-notch with friendly staff, the hotel is personable yet in a grand elegant way. Sat outside on the upper deck watching the sunset while drinking beautiful wine, and enjoyed a complimentary bottle of champagne one night.  A few glitches on the admin side of things stops me from giving this an excellent rating but certainly a very memorable stay and I look forward to returning.

The butlers were very kind and friendly and not in the least stuffy!  They also included a few small pastries on our tray each day which was very appreciated. We didn't ask for any other butler services, but I'm sure they would be equally efficient.  Other staff in the hotel were also amazing.  The front desk, parking attendants, housekeeping and porters were all friendly, efficient and knowledgeable about the hotel and local area. We enjoyed dinners in Motif and Stonehill, both of
Manager Response: Dear satonthebeach,  Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. Summary Heading: Lifestyles of the rich and famous...
Summary: I've been a guest of the St. Regis Monarch Beach twice, and have had two very different experiences. The first visit was pleasant...I really only camped out at the pool. The service was great, from the valet to the pool attendants, so I had no complaints. It's a more quiet area, and you won't hear kids screaming or yelling...so definitely recommended for a more tranquil experience (although it is very kid and even dog friendly). The second time, however, was an almost surreal experience. The pool staff informed our party early afternoon that the whole resort would be shutting down in about an hour. It seems like the information was not circulated even to the staff, as they were previously told that only food service would be shutting down. After some research, I found that there

Summary Heading: Great... if you have kids!  Not for a honey-moon!!!!
Summary: While the service at the St. Regis is wonderful and we had wonderful encounters with Yair in the restaurant and Robert by the pool, both making our honeymoon special, the stay to me just felt average... We were there for our honeymoon and for a romantic getaway, I would NOT recommend the St. Regis.  There were kids EVERYWHERE -so if you are looking for a family getaway, this is the perfect spot.  We even went to the hot tub and there were 4-5 kids there.
Manager Response: Dear LALauren27,  Thank you for your valuable feedback on your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Although I am pleased that you have shared some positive comments about your experience, I am disappointed that it was not a flawless stay for you. Please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly if there is anything I may be able to assist in the future. I can be reached at 949-234-3301.  Warmest Regards,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: My wife and I went here for our anniversary/last hurrah before our baby arrives. We live in San Diego so it was only an hour or so drive but it felt like we were in our own beach side paradise. Everything about the hotel was great from the rooms to the pools to all of the amenities. We went to an incredible dinner at Stonehill Tavern and then the next morning ate breakfast on the patio of our room that overlooks the property and the ocean. Simply an amazing place.
Manager Response: Dear Joshua O.,  Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit at The St. Regis Monarch Beach in California. I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: My Family Stayed here during the week of July 4th.  The location is amazing and the fireworks display at the hotel was incredible.  The room and resort property was perfect!  I cannot say enough positive things about our experience here.  I feel like the best thing about the hotel was the staff.  The valet staff were so kind and personable and great to offer dining tips without making us feel like we were being a bother.  The front desk and check in went so smoothly.  Also, the staff at the concierge were so accommodating when our son cut his foot, they were kind enough to give us a whole box of band aids so we did not have to go out to a pharmacy!  We are looking forward to another opportunity to visit Dana Point and the St. Regis!
Manager Response: Dear KGMClevelandTN,  Thank you for staying at The St. Regis Monarch Beach during your visit to Orange County, Califonia. I am very pleased to learn that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay. Thank you for the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your good feedback with our associates.   I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Warmest Regards,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: A hotel so nice it's making my son rethink his career path
Summary: "I really need to think about what I want to be when I grow up dad.  I want to be able to stay in hotels like this one!"  Pretty much everything from the valet parking to the pillows was excellent.  Huge rooms.  Fantastic views.  A bustling, but not ridiculous, pool scene.  The restaurant was outstanding.  The bar was fun.  Really no complaints at all.  The beds are outstanding.  The bathrooms are big, clean and modern.  I don't think I saw scrap of trash on the property the entire time we stayed.    Really an excellent experience.
Manager Response: Dear Lou M.,  Wow - that truly is one the best compliments we ever received. Thank you for sharing and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: Only an hour away from LA, it's great for a quick weekend getaway and R&R. It's in a very quiet area of Dana Point and you won't find anything within walking distance. You'll have to drive out if you actually want to see civilization, and that's what makes it quiet and totally relaxing.   Access their private beach, restaurant and bar by the resort shuttle. I found the pool to be noisy and full of kids, so the beach was spacious, quiet and perfect for relaxing.
Manager Response: Dear Jenny P.,  Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. I truly appreciate you taking the time to detail your experience, and I am so pleased that you had a wonderful visit at The St. Regis Monarch Beach in California. I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Had a surprise birthday here!  My husband surprised me at Stonehill with my family and friends.  The service, food and ambiance was incredible!!  I'd love to have another party here!! The hotel is breathtaking.  The views of the sunset are priceless!
Manager Response: Dear Duchess1982,  Happy belated birthday! Thank you for your compliments, I am thrilled to learn that you have had an exceptional experience!  I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Everything was great from check in to check out. Luggage guy gave me a little tour on the way to my room. Took me out on balcony and showed me a few spots to check out. Trolley ride through golf course to dinner was fabulous. Saw dolphins on the beach in the morning.   Room was immaculate. Toiletries were the best I've ever had. Literally the best. Couldn't have asked for a better business trip!
Manager Response: Dear spearman2015,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay. It will be my pleasure to welcome you to our address again very soon.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Great hotel. Only issue was that the bathroom had a bad smell to it. I wont go into detail, but I was surprised that we got a bad smelling bath area in such a posh and expensive hotel. However the views are stunning and the amenities great. Also, they have a nice friendly staff.
Manager Response: Dear Honymoongoer,  Although I am pleased that you have shared some positive comments about your experience, I am disappointed that it was not a flawless stay for you. I am deeply sorry for the bad smell in your bathroom, not acceptable by any standard. Please know that this has been shared with my team.   I certainly hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the future.  Please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly if there is anything I may be able to assist in the future. I can be reached at 949-234-3301.   Warmest Regards,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: This resort is so beautiful and top notch.  The staff caters to your every whim. Poolside, we were brought complimentary watermelon to keep us refreshed. The beach is private to the St. Regis and one of their 4 restaurants is located on the beach. The vistas from the upper indoor/outdoor bar with appetizers is a MUST every sunset. There are 2 pools, one is more active with families, younger kids and music. The other pool is more relaxing for couples.  Love this resort! I'll be back very soon!
Manager Response: Dear Stacy P.,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members are so proud to be a part of the St. Regis.   I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I accompanied my husband on a conference at St. Regis and it was wonderful! The hotel is beautiful and the service is great. Very friendly staff. Rooms are spacious. Nice pool, great beach. Trails to walk or run on. Golf course is pretty but I did not play. I rarely make it to other conferences but this one is a must.
Manager Response: Dear myctraveler,  Thank you for your compliments of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. I am pleased to hear you had an exceptional stay with us and that you had the chance to enjoy the resort during your business trip.  I look forward to welcoming you back to the best address in the near future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I spent a weekend in this resort with my wife for a special occasion. The hotel looks nice from the exterior and the interior. The rooms are sizable with private patio. The view over the hills with the golf course then the beach is amazing. Additionally, there is a shuttle service which takes you near the beach where there is a restaurant a and bar over there. I highly recommend this hotel even for kids as they have a nice pool and a kids club too.
Manager Response: Dear almazroua,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: Having stayed at both The Montage and The Ritz-Carlton,we can't really say enough about the St. Regis-Monarch Beach. The staff gave the best service that I can recently remember,with special thanks going to Nick Morris in reservations,Gundulla at the Concierge and everyone working at the front desk. This hotel staff sets the bar. Our room was of average size, nicely appointed,wonderfully comfortable beds,deep tub, modern bathroom but nothing that re-wrote design history or took your breath away. The upgrade to a coastal view was a bit of a strain on your neck, but I knew the ocean was out there somewhere (although not beachfront, like some properties). No matter. The entire group headed for the pools, all beautiful, salt, so the feel of the water on your skin was like silk.
Manager Response: Dear B7516QSdavidk,  I am thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us. Thank you for the kind words and lavish praise you bestowed upon our team - I will share your good feedback with our associates.   I hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel - not happy with front desk mgmt
Summary: I come every year for a meeting hosted here. After the economic downturn the property needed attention - and it's gotten it. The halls look fresh and so do the rooms. The staff are plentiful and generally good. The spa still needs some TLC but all in all, great job. As a Platinum I did not receive any courtesy at all from the management who told me that because my conference had a negotiated rate I was not paying enough to  receive any acknowledgment - no upgrade, welcome note - nothing. It was pretty outrageous. My first room claimed a resort view and faced a concrete stairwell. When I complained - loudly to 3 people - the manager moved me some rooms down the hall where we saw the pool. It was pretty poor customer service. But I brought my wife - no kids - so we let it go and
Manager Response: Dear Jeff B.,  Thank you for your loyalty and for taking the time to review your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. As a valued SPG Platinum member, we truly appreciate your feedback.  I have met with my team regarding this matter to ensure this will not happen again. Please feel free to reach out to me directly in the future so I can personally look into your reservation - my direct line is 949-234-3301.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: A Day and Night to Remember!
Summary: My wife and I just stayed at the SRMB to celebrate my birthday and it was truly a day and night to remember! The resort has so much to offer and we definitely tried to enjoy as many activities and experience as we could. We laid out by the beautiful pool (a few too many kids for my taste but it was ok), had an amazing lunch at the pool restaurant, spent some time at the hotel's "private" beach (they have beach valets that set you up with chairs and umbrellas), spent some time in the beautiful spa & swam in the sublime workout pool, and ate an excellent breakfast at the Club 19 overlooking the golf course (the Hangar Steak is to die for). And ... I know we were just scratching the surface of what this amazing resort has to offer !!!  The service was excellent throughout the
Manager Response: Dear AlanFromHermosa,  Happy belated birthday! I am pleased to hear you had an exceptional stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience, and I hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary: This was our second time at the St Regis Monarch Beach, but the first time to go in the summer.  Let me start by saying, I love kids, & I understand you must take them with you on vacation, but have something for them to do.  The staff had things to do for smaller kids & they have a separate lagoon pool where most of them stayed, but the teens were left to run around the place.  They were in the workout facility (which is very nice), splashing everyone at the pool, & running the halls.  It would have been great if they had set up some stuff down at the beach for them to do.  The rooms are beautiful & the beds are comfortable but not what I remember at all.  They have definitely cut back on the bathroom products.  The hairdryer was little more than a fan & not what you expect to
Manager Response: Dear Shelly M.,  I truly appreciate you taking the time to write and provide your feedback, you raise some very valid points. I sincerely apologize for a number of the issues you describe, not acceptable by any standard.   I would welcome an opportunity to discuss these issues with your further if you wish and can be contacted at 949-234-3301.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: The Front Desk Staff is exceptional!
Summary: Nicole Macina is wonderful!  We stay at the St. Regis a lot and we have had the pleasure of interacting her with a couple of times and she is phenomenal!  She made our son's vacation and treated him like a king!  She made him feel so important by letting him make his own hotel key and giving him the most precious teddy bear.  The service from the St. Regis Monarch Beach is stellar and Nicole Macina put it over the top!  We can't wait to come back and stay again and either can our 3 year old!
Manager Response: Dear Springob,  I am very proud and happy reading your note, thank you! Hearing feedback from guests such as you is one of the many reasons our staff members enjoy being part of The St. Regis. Thank you for your kind words - I will definitely share your kind words.  I hope you will visit our address again soon.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We're locals and enjoy visiting SRMB.  The resort has 3 pools.  A great workout pool, a resort pool, and the family lagoon pool.  I love that my kid can have a great time at the pool without disturbing adults that are relaxing on the resort side.  I do wish that the hotel would consider a separate jacuzzi for the families.  Staff at the family lagoon pool have been great.  In particular, Genoveva has the patience of a saint.  She's been fabulous every time we visit!  We've also enjoyed visiting during the Christmas tree lighting, Thanksgiving buffet, and the Easter Egg hunt (the Easter Egg hunt has been on a break for two years, hopefully it will return next year).  We love the SRMB, it's our home away from home!
Manager Response: Dear ccocco92,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General  Manager

Summary Heading: Joined my husband on business... stayed for pleasure
Summary: I somewhat jokingly refer to this place as the. ST. REGIS COMPOUND. It has lovely pools, excellent restaurants, a private beach and amazing golf course. I like the fact that there is a life guard on duty at the beach and you can have alcoholic beverages. The complementary chairs and umbrellas at both the beach and pool make it so conformable to spend the day by the water, protected from the sun.   My husband and I thought the resort was very successful at meeting the needs of the business conference and families on vacation. My biggest complaint was that when it came to the rooms we constantly felt that we were looking at beautiful water views but at the same time fighting dampness. The robes felt heavy, not fluffy and plush. The bed sheets never smelled squeaky clean or felt
Manager Response: Dear Shelley W.,  I am pleased to hear you had an exceptional stay with us and that you enjoyed our beach amenities and had the chance to mix business and leisure. Thank for your feedback and comments regarding our guestrooms and bathroom amenities., I will meet with our team to discuss this further.  Please feel free to reach out if there is anything I may be able to assist you with in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: The hotel is nice, however, we were expecting a lot more. The hotel is beautiful and the beach is nice. What disappointed us was the staff and service level. There should be drink/food service on the beach, this level of a hotel you would expect more. They seem to employ a lot of young locals that are spoiled and seem lazy. I asked the girl working the outside food tent at the beach to clean some tables because they were filthy and I got quite an attitude. They also seem to advertise they are kid friendly when in fact they seem quite the opposite. I asked the concierge about the daily kids activities and he acted like they were just ok, he totally didn't make me want to sign my kids up to participate. We had to ask every restaurant for a kids menu instead of them providing it
Manager Response: Dear Kristen K.,  Please accept my sincere apology for falling short of showing you the value you deserve when staying with us. We clearly missed the mark with providing you with an exceptional experience!  I would welcome an opportunity to discuss your concerns with your further if you wish, and may be reached at 949-234-3301. I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Warmest Regards,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: The service, from the beginning to end was impeccable. Also, the meals, for 300 people were impressive, as they always are at St Regis. The grounds were beautiful and you're basically in Paradise. The chai tea lattes at the coffee bar was on par with best coffee houses, the sundry store was perfectly stocked with all the necessary things, they thought of everything....
Manager Response: Dear ljasminek,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach.   I am pleased to hear of your exceptional visit and hope we will have the opportunity to welcoming you back in future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Staying here as part of a large conference. The location and facility itself are fantastic.  Front of house staff are first rate. they go out of their way to help and are incredibly friendly.   the rooms are spacious, comfortable and very comfortable bed.  the wifi is on par although im surprised its an extra cost, its a commodity now so should not have an extra cost   the HUGE letdown is the food and beverage staff. catering staff very inattentive and non happy. lobby bar takes 20 minutes to deliver drinks and you have to order at the bar as they ignore you   mini bars not refreshed and advised 90 minute wait on room service  im surprised they have had a lot of good reviews as the pervasive view is that the service on food side is horrendous   the new owners better get this
Manager Response: Dear Dean G.,  Thank you for your valuable feedback on your recent stay at the St. Monarch Beach. I am deeply sorry that we were not able to meet your expectations during your recent visit to our resort.   We do take all comments seriously and appreciate all feedback we can get. I will share your feedback with the involved departments, for further investigation, review and training.   I would welcome an opportunity to discuss these issues with your further if you wish and can be contacted at 949-234-3301.   Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Corporate Hotel; Bad Vacation Hotel!
Summary: St Regis Monarch Beach is, by my estimation, occupied with 75% corporate guests who will likely not be paying their own bill.  This must be how St Regis get a way with a level of service below that required of a 5* resort.  20 min wait at check-in; one restaurant closed, one fully booked and a 2 hour wait for room service.  Shortage of juice at breakfast and items unavailable off the pool menu.  15 min wait for breakfast before we received any attention. Walked out after 20 mins!  Furniture and fittings in public areas worn out or broken.  Looks like St Regis pampering to their shareholders more than their customers.  In fairness, our room was immaculate and housekeeping was outstanding, but the overwhelming impression was to squeeze every $ from guests. On my final bill, after
Manager Response: Dear CPH0_0,  Thank you for your feedback and taking the time to post your comment. I am pleased to hear that you like our recently restyled guestrooms as well as our signature restaurant Stonehill Tavern.   We do take all comments seriously and appreciate all feedback we can get.We clearly missed the mark with providing you with an exceptional experience in many areas. I will share your feedback with the involved departments, for further investigation, review and training.   I hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: First of all, I would rate this property a 3.5. For beauty alone, and the nice rooms/bathrooms, I gave it a 4, but a 3.5 is more reasonable...here's why.  Located in scenic Dana Point, the St. Regis has the makings of a five star property.  Beautiful Mediterranean architecture, gorgeous views, lush grounds, luxuriously appointed rooms, and a golf course on site all make for a property that warrants, and in fact deserves, the prestigious St. Regis name.  All this being said, once we got below the surface, the facade began to crumble.  Service:  Our biggest issue with this property was service.  Throughout our weekend vacation, we experienced not just slow service, but virtually non-existent service.  To be fair, the hotel hosted two weddings that weekend, but to be fair to us,
Manager Response: Dear sybarite4,  Thank you so much for staying with us recently and I am sorry your stay was not what you had hoped it would be, this is certainly disappointing to read and I hope you will accept my most sincere apologies for this.  Your feedback has been shared with all leaders at the property to go over how we can improve moving forward, and I hope that should you wish to come and stay with us again in the future that you will see the improvements made by our team.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: My daughter and just returned from a beach getaway weekend at this resort.  The grounds are beautiful, and the service was impeccable.  The hotel has a private beach that is reached by a short tram ride.  Once at the beach, the hotel sets up chairs and an umbrella at a spot on the sand for you - very nice touch.  We ate at Motif for lunch once, and did room service for all meals after that.  My daughter is a somewhat picky eater, so the cuisine was completely lost on her.  No matter - room service meals were delicious.    The hotel is very pricey, but not more than what you would expect for a 5 star resort, although $40/day valet parking was a little high.  The only negative thing from our trip was the maid service.  We left the "make room-up" sign on Sunday at 9:00am, and spent
Manager Response: Dear Kimba403,  Although I am pleased to learn that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay and that you enjoyed the hotel, I am disappointed that it was not a flawless stay for you. I will share your feedback with our housekeeping team, for further investigation, review and training.   I hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.  Warmest Regards,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Our family get-away was simply amazing....rooms for 30 family members were beautiful; we held a celebration dinner for my husband's 80th birthday in the lovely Motif Private Dining Room. Marisol Lazo-Tasic, the restaurant sales coordinator did an exceptional job for us.....Hotel staff is very friendly and made our family feel so welcomed.  Monarch Beach is BEAUTIFUL!!  Family enjoyed the white,soft sandy beach and swimming in  the lovely, cool waters....this location has to be one of the best in the U.S.!!!!
Manager Response: Dear R G B,  We are honored that you chose to celebrate this milestone at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. Thank you for your kind words and I am very pleased to learn that our team provided you with exceptional service throughout your stay. I will share your good feedback with Marisol and our associates.   I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: We wanted a romantic weekend and got a nightmare of poor service with management overbooked and understaffed.  Restaurant 3 hour wait to dine, room service 90 minute wait and food was cold, late and not what I ordered.  Called night manager still waiting for a call back!  Wedding hotel that does care about non wedding guests.
Manager Response: Dear Craig B.,  Thank you for your feedback and taking the time to post your comment. We clearly missed the mark with providing you with an exceptional experience in many areas. Please allow me the opportunity of discussing your comments further so that we can examine the issues which you have noted. I may be reached at 949-234-3301.   Kind regards,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: I had a business trip to S California and needed to take my two daughters with me so I chose the SRMB hotel which enabled me the proximity for my meetings and provided the ammenities for my daughters to enjoy while I was working.  Our stay was extraordinary - from the moment we checked in unitl the moment we pulled out of hte driveway.  Of particular note were the friendly, professional and creative front desk staff: Lindsay and Colin.  Both helped me find a room that worked for our situation, checked in with us daily to make sure we were comfortable and provided milk and cookies for my girls during the evening as a thank you for my patronage.  Everytime we walked up to the front desk, they knew my name, including my daughters.  As someone who travels significantly for work, I
Manager Response: Dear ZunkerFamily,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review about your recent stay at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. I appreciate your kind comments will share your kinds words with Lindsay and Carolin and our entire team.  I hope I will have the opportunity to welcome you back to the best address in the near future!  Warmest Regards,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: The hotel is just divine and it is worth the time to just visit and wslk around. When you go for brunch valet is validated. The food was delicious and the service, provided by Enrique who was friendly and very helpful with anything we could possibly need.
Manager Response: Dear cmosier123,  I am happy to hear you enjoyed our "famous" Champagne Sunday Brunch at motif Restaurant and thank you for your kind words about Enrique! I will definitely share your comments with our team!  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary: Every Christmas for the past few years my family has vacationed at the Monarch Bay St Regis. Outstanding property.  Sumptuous and spacious rooms, good dining on property, great staff.  While it can be pricy (not really for the area), I feel we get our value out of the total experience
Manager Response: Dear Ed F,  Thank you for the incredible compliment! I look forward to having you return for many years to come.  Sincerely,  Ian Pullan General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice, but not over the top
Summary: we enjoyed the beautiful location, the lush grounds, very nice facility, and the extremely competent staff. Wine selection was great, but the food fell short. Many nice restaurants near by so it isn't a huge issue. We felt the layout was confusing and the signage lacking. Some of our family members stayed here & we visited everyday, we stayed at a nearby top rated hotel that cost less and was nicer overall in our opinion.  The Dana Point location is wonderful.
Manager Response: Dear EG54,  Thank you for your feedback and taking the time to post your comment.
