Summary Heading: Beautiful Property - Didn't Want to Leave
Summary: From the moment you walk into the lobby and look through the floor-to-ceiling windows and see the view of the gardens and the ocean, you know you're in for a treat. I enjoyed the convenience of having coffee (and almond milk!) at the on-site coffee bar, and the service at the spa (I got a massage) was sublime. Very cute apparel and accessories in the spa's retail shop. The fitness center is state-of-the-art and super clean. I also highly recommend the strap yoga class on Sunday mornings. There were two weddings going on when we were there, so it was fun to see those events take place - even if we weren't invited. And they weren't disturbing at all. Finally, the Champagne Brunch is like heaven on earth. SO many options and you'll never look at another brunch buffet the same.
Manager Response: Dear Katie J,  Thank you for your recent stay and for sharing such a fantastic review! We are so pleased to hear that you were able to enjoy many of our amenities which we offer, including our popular Strap Yoga class in Spa Gaucin! We hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: This is one of my favorite hotels anywhere.     I have visited the hotel before, but recently stayed for 4-nights for a business conference. We were lucky enough to have unusually perfect and warm weather for November. Here is what I love about the hotel: gorgeous, dramatic layout, from atop a hill, with great ocean views from lobby, dining areas, bar; large, well-appointed rooms, great dining (either high-end, at Stonehill Tavern, or at the pool or golf course); great location for beautiful walks along this perfect stretch of California coastline; fantastic pools for adults and families; elegant bar for either a sunset cocktail or an after-dinner glass of champagne. Dinner at Stonehill Tavern was particularly memorable and beautiful.  A few slight negatives. The rooms that do
Manager Response: Dear iowaguy,  Thank you for share a review of your stay with us! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time at the resort and appreciate the kind comments about our dining options and overall resort experience. We are please to share that all of our guest rooms now come with in-room coffee and tea, so on your next visit you will be able to enjoy your cup of coffee as soon as you wake! We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

Summary: Went to see a local 80 s band Flashback Heart Attack, had a great time, the St Regis is a beautiful hotel with great atmosphere. Really was nice to bring in the New Year at this venue and with one the funnest bands you will ever see live
Manager Response: Dear James K,  Thank you for choosing to ring in the new year with us! We appreciate your kind review and hope that you will join us again next New Year's Eve!

Summary: Where do we start.  I travel around 90 days out of the year. This is the first time ever I chose to add a bad review.  -There was a nail in the car tire and they failed to notify us until we were leaving.  -took over 18 days to get back to us with just an appoloy  The resort is first class...but I have had better service at motels! Its a shame but my friends and I wont be back.
Manager Response: Dear sdjrose,  Thank you for your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the incidents which took place  and hope that you will reconsider visiting us again in the future.

Summary: Beautiful resort.  Staff can't do enough for you.  We were there for a wedding and just wished we had more time to enjoy the resort!  The property is lovely, and the food delicious.  Nice rooms with comfortable beds, can't wait to go back and stay longer!
Manager Response: Dear QUEENIE54004,  Thank you for the kind review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your visit to our resort and we hope to welcome you back again!

Summary: I have stayed here over four times.  The best rooms are in the South building, facing the pool w/ a balcony, as high as possible.  We've stayed at the far West end (closest to the Club House) but felt isolated as our balcony looked over the golf course and not the pool (where the "action" is) - this is a great location if you're looking for serious privacy.  Do NOT expect to be anywhere near the ocean - it's a "blue water" view at best.  We took the shuttle down to the beach but found it a hassle.  The pool is SPECTACULAR - the Cabanas are great and the service is perfection!  You'll be sad if you're expecting "beach front" - but that's pretty much standard for Orange County beach resorts.  Although I never took my children, it appears that the hotel is extremely "kid friendly"
Manager Response: Dear J D,  Thank you for sharing such a kind review and for your continued patronage of our resort! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoy your time spent with us. We look forward to welcoming you back again!

Summary Heading: Luxurious.... but beware of the giant dust bunnies
Summary: We came here to celebrate New Year's Eve so we could feel like we were international. The pictures were simply marvelous. When we arrived, the service was spot on! Employees were so nice and congenial. The property was gorgeous; my favorite part was down at their private beach. I've stayed in many hotels, some 5-Star, some less. St. Regis is supposedly a 5-star resort hotel. The rooms we stayed in (specifically 235) have been neglected by their so-called cleaning staff, we had a connecting room; one king, one double. The king room was beyond filth. They must have had about 3 inches of dust behind the television, as well as behind the bed! I wanted to believe this 5-star hotel was just missing a couple of spots but their lamp(s) and curtain were yellow, the chaise had 3-5 white
Manager Response: Dear agapilexi,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us over the New Year holiday! We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback and will be sure to share your comments regarding cleanliness with our Director of Housekeeping for immediate addressing. We hope to be able to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary: The great: Property is absolutely beautiful; rooms very well-appointed with luxurious bathroom and wonderful turn down service. The pool is worth the stay, perched overlooking the ocean with breezes and fantastic service. Very elegant hotel.  The good: Private beach for guests and at the time we stayed, many couples celebrating milestone anniversaries for week-end getaways.  The "could be better": No coffee in the room means a walk and wait in line with everyone else to a not-so-quick cup in the morning. Also, popular wedding destination which means a nightcap at the bar will be shared with the "entire wedding party" and good luck getting your car out of valet if the wedding guests are pouring in. But, this is probably a seasonal issue and you can easily avoid it. All in all, we
Manager Response: Dear DKMsocal,  Thank you for taking the time to share feedback regarding your recent stay with us! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our resort and the amenities which we offer. We also appreciate your feedback regarding coffee in the rooms and are pleased to share that starting next month all rooms will come equipped with in-room coffee and tea. We look forward to welcoming you back again!

Summary: Beautiful hotel, we stayed over the week between christmas and new years and had a great stay.  The property was decorated beautifully for the holidays, there was a 1 ton sand sculpture in the lobby and another chocolate sculpture that was made in house by the pastry chef staff.   We dined at the Motif sunday brunch - it was delightful both for adults (sushi, raw bar, bloody mary and mimosa) and children ( make your own pancake and crepe station with treats to put in pancakes).    Paul at the monarch beach club was really outstanding - he went out of his way to set up my daughter and I with a surfing lesson.   The weather was a little cold and he made sure we had appropriate wetsuit, gear, and everything to have a great surfing experience.   It was probably the highlight of the
Manager Response: Dear Matt S,  Thank you for your recent stay and for taking the time to share such a wonderful review! We appreciate you and your family choosing to spend the holidays with us. We look forward to welcoming you back again!

Summary: This hotel is stunning - the rooms are gorgeous(provided you take one with a balcony) There are some that face the parking lot, and those are really not worth it. The view of the pool and courtyard is stunning. They have thought of everything. You will need to take a shuttle bus to the beach - but it is worth it. The beach is expansive and peaceful with a great restaurant (sit outside), and plenty of beach chairs. I can't wait to visit again. It's an easy choice to book.
Manager Response: Dear prissyp1212,  Thank you for the kind review! We appreciate the feedback and look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary: This property is simply gorgeous!  We had an ocean view suite on the 3rd floor (room 361).  It was a bit of a trek from the elevators, but worth it.  Our room was great.  My husband had told the staff when making reservations, this trip was to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary.  Upon our arrival, we had a bottle of St. Regis bubbly and a lovely display of chocolates.  The butler service is OUTSTANDING!  The coffee shop gave me a muffin instead of a scone. When we told our butler who delivered coffee, he promptly had a scone delivered directly to our room.  One minor complaint, there is major construction happening on-site.  The hammering and other noise began promptly at 8:00 am on each day of our stay.  Considering we are from the Central time zone, we were on a 2-hr time
Manager Response: Dear StephKD,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us for your anniversary! We appreciate you taking the time to share feedback regarding your stay and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the resort overall. We will be sure to share your feedback with our executive team. We hope to welcome you back again!

Summary: Everything is this place is absolutely beautiful! Great views - no wonder so many weddings take place here.   Service in every way was exceptional. They even made some accommodations for us that were not their standard.   Spa service was wonderful!  They have a relationship with a private beach club so it was great to use that and watch the sunset by the water.   Amazing experience. Would come back in a heartbeat!
Manager Response: Dear Natasatx,  Thanks for the wonderful review! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time at our resort. We too think our spa services and sunsets are amazing! We hope to welcome you back again.

Summary: Stayed in June 2014, had adjoining rooms with the kids in the room next door. The hotel is simply stunning. Grounds are gorgeous, setting is gorgeous and the surrounding area is great for exploring with the family. We enjoyed the Monarch Bay Club and the beach with the kids, the lobby lounge was inviting in the evening. We will definitely come back!
Manager Response: Dear TexanUK,  Thank you for the kind review! We are so pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed our resort and facilities. We hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!

Summary Heading: Great!! Can't write all in here
Summary: My wife and I visited St Regis Monarch beach for our friends wedding and we had great time.  This building is absolutely gorgeous and scenery around hotel is great. When we booked this hotel we questioned about the price, but once we arrived here all those questions were answered.  Room was nice with small balcony, bathroom was great with big tub and double sinks, and bed was very comfortable. Decor and layout of room was excellent.  Only down part is everything inside resort is little pricey.  My wife order Earl Grey Tea and they charged us $21.  Other than that it was fantastic trip and we would love to visit here again.
Manager Response: Dear prezhong,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your experience with others online! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time at our resort. We hope to welcome you and your wife back again soon!

Summary: Stayed for 4 nights with another couple for an 25th anniversary celebration.  What a gorgeous setting and great service.  Grounds, restaurants, pool, and golf course are some of the best.  Spa and gym facility are tops too.  Look to prepay for 3 nights and you get a 4th free.  Watch for the "June Gloom" weather if you go in late May/ June.  a bit as well.  Lots to do in throughout Orange County and not far from New Port Beach.
Manager Response: Dear HawkeyeDSB,  Thank you for writing such a kind review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time spent with us. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary Heading: the Saint Regis is average at best.
Summary: The St Regis is average at best , more in the lines of the Sheraton than the Ritz. We checked in with American Expresses fine resorts and hotels, we had to ask about upgrades and benefits, the girl at the front desk offered no information. She mumbled and we could hardly hear her. We received an average room with no upgrades, even they were not full. No one spoke to us, not so much as a good morning and we were there over Christmas. It might be worth it if you  play golf, but I would still choose the Ritz or the Montage.
Manager Response: Dear Renaldo T.,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback from your recent stay. We value our American Express customers greatly and apologize that your stay was not up to our normal standards. We hope to welcome you back again so that you can experience our legendary five-star service and facilities.

Summary Heading: Amazing! Can't wait to go back.
Summary: Visited in 2007. Had an impeccable oceanfront room with butler service. They went out of their way to treat even the kids like royalty. The restaurant and beach are accessible by golf cart, but both are worth it. There was even an art exhibition with art etchings for sale by world class artists. I was blown away.   The monarch butterfly release was magical, with white-gloved staff presenting a fun story and then doing face painting for the kids followed by roasting marshmallows over fire pits on the beautiful, manicured lawn beside the sweeping stone stairway.   We witnessed one of the most beautiful weddings we have ever seen and even the guests were affected by the kindness of the staff - interacting more than usual and carrying smiles everywhere they went.   The casual
Manager Response: Dear tjobi,  Thank you for the kind review! We hope we can welcome you back again this summer to create more memories for you and your family!

Summary: Recently travelled around America visiting New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Orange County. By far this was the best hotel I stayed in during my trip and up there with the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff are exceptionally friendly and attentive. After a long drive from Malibu we arrived late at night and were greeted by the valet who unpacked our car and escorted us to reception. The very friendly receptionist gave us a compliemntary upgrade to a butler serviced suite, much to our surprise and delight. We were then taken to our room by a member of the concierge team who spent around 30 minutes telling us about all the facilities of the hotel and all the activities on offer in the surrounding areas. He was super friendly and offered some great recommendations
Manager Response: Dear Scott G,  Thank you for your recent visit and kind review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to welcoming you back to Southern California again soon!

Summary Heading: Because of my butler, I was in hotel heaven..
Summary: This resort is the most marvelous escape you could ever imagine.  First the property is beautiful.  The rooms are gorgeous, with fabulous beds, linens and ammenities.  But the finishing touch for me is Bill the Butler, as I lovingly refer to him.  I live 25 miles from this St Regis and can't wait to get there every year for my annual girlfriend get together.  You feel like you have arrived in another world witth the professionalism that is displayed from check in to check out.  I love how I am always remembered (I have been coming here every year for 8 years).  I love the attention to detail from Bill the Butler..Love the way he dresses and the  GLOVES! Summary: Held our annual meeting for 350 people here in early Nov, 2014. The management, staff, amenities golf course, beach club, rooms, banquet halls are all very good. This hotel nicely decorated, has fantastic views and a real WOW factor to it.

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the St Regis Monarch Beach last year over Christmas after we decided not to visit family.  We had an amazing time.  The location/scenery is amazing.  It is a short walk to a beautiful beach and the views of the ocean from the hotel are spectacular.  The restaurants and bars are great - especially the Monarch Bay Club which is on the beach.  We returned last week with our 5 month old for a "satiation" and had a great time.  My wife loved the spa and I enjoyed relaxing in the room and at the pool bar to watch a game.  While traveling with a 5 month old is somewhat of a challenge, the staff were great and did everything they could to make our stay easy and relaxing.
Manager Response: Dear Peter M,  Thank you for your recent stay and kind review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time with us. We hope to welcome you and your family back again soon!

Summary Heading: Nice resort, gym needs to be larger
Summary: I have been to the St Regis Monarch Beach a number of times on business and have also utilized the gym and spa.  The rooms are very nice.  Have always stayed in an executive suite and they are a nice size.  Bathroom is amazing.  love the Remede bath products.  Large closet.  Small balcony but nice.  Balconies on ends are more private than the rooms along the hallways.  Love the butler service especially the French press coffee in the morning.  Room service items are few but decent choices.  Salads are very large!  The spa is amazing.  Nice amenities in the locker rooms.  Only complaint is that the gym is quite small considering the size of the resort.  There seems to be plenty of room to expand and am surprised it hasn't been done.
Manager Response: Dear MinnGirl2010,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for taking the time to write a review! We appreciate your continued patronage and kind words regarding our resort. We hope to welcome you back again, whether it be for business again or for leisure!

Summary: Simply put - This is one of the very best hotels in the United States.  We enjoy staying in 4 and 5 diamond hotels from time to time.  This was our third stay.  All of the stays have been great! Keep up the great service!
Manager Response: Dear Stillwater54,  Thank you for your recent stay with us! We appreciate the kind words you shared and look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary: The hotel is sumptuous and very accommodating.great place for a wedding  Restaurant by Michael Mina famous chef is wonderful out on the terrace..little restaurant down below the hotel on the golf course go before sunset you can see Catalina island  and watch a great sunset
Manager Response: Dear Bernice S,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding our resort! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoy the resort and the amenities which we offer, including Michael Mina's Stonehill Tavern. We hope to welcome you back again!

Summary: My family spent Thanksgiving night at this hotel.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  The rooms, especially the bathroom, are wonderful.  The pool was nice.  We didn't go to the beach.  The beds were very comfortable.  Only negatives, we were on the 5th floor and there was a LOT of stomping going on above me.  I'm not sure what was going on but it stopped close to 10pm.  Drinks at the pool took a ridiculously long time on Thanksgiving, but the day after it was fine.
Manager Response: Dear soleilciel,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for taking the time to share your comments with us! Summary: Great hotel, beautiful grounds, amazing service, attention to every little detail and pleasant staff. We stayed with children and our 2 queen bedroom was very spacious.  Kids and us enjoyed ocean pools. Loved our bathroom with fresh orchid and all necessary things. Great selection of restaurants and convenient cafeteria on main floor. Monarch beach is beautiful. This was very relaxing stay and St. Regis staff made every effort to make it so.
Manager Response: Dear Alena-voyage,  Thank you for your recent stay and for sharing such a wonderful review! We are so pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your time with us. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary: This was my second stay for three nights or more.  It is a very good hotel with breath taking ocean view.  Make a note it is not waterfront but a mile of walk to beach.  I walked with my wife and friends and it was very pleasant view around the golf course.  Pool and other amenities were good.  Room was as expected for the grade and staff was decent.  Basic wifi was free.  I had very good experience and pleasant services on this trip.
Manager Response: Dear UpperCapeResident,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and for taking the time to share your feedback! We are pleased to hear that you have enjoyed your past two trips to our resort and look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary Heading: Loud construction, shoddy beach, aloof staff.
Summary: My "garden view" room actually had a view of what appeared to be a strip mine. Trucks beeping loudly and incessantly at 6 am were enough to make me close the curtains and wish I was in serene Times Square. It looks like construction on something big is just starting, so proceed with caution if you get a "garden view" room. To avoid the uninhabitable room, I went to the beach, advertised as "private" and "pristine." It was private. In fact, it's a mile or so down a windy trail from the hotel, accessible by golf cart. But pristine it was not. It was covered in rotting seaweed interspersed with trash. Service at the beach is basically nonexistent. We were offered 2 folding chairs, both of which were covered in bird dung, a tiny sun umbrella too small for even one person, and a few

Summary: My wife and I stayed here in November as part of a weekend trip up/down the LA coast. I am an SPG Platinum member so have stayed in many SPG properties globally. This property is beautiful and has many positives. Couple of insights for those looking for options along the coast and comparing the Ritz Laguna Niguel.  A great location for... - Golf. Nice golf course right outside the rooms of the property - Pool. Nice pool, cabana, hot tub, and smaller private pool - Spa. All of the amenities - Beach. The St. Regis has a beach venue (tram needed to get down to beach) and provide chairs, umbrella, etc for the beach. The beach has a nice walk down to and past the Ritz. - Surfing. Tons of surfing at the beach given the right conditions.  As we walked in and experienced our rooms, it

Summary Heading: Nice Property - Showing Signs of Age & Inconsistent Service
Summary: We recently stayed here for a weekend trip to Laguna Beach for a wedding at the neighboring Ritz Carlton.  The property was very nice - good location, spacious, open lobby, warm welcome, nice views, etc.  I'd even venture to say that the St. Regis was nicer than the Ritz Carlton despite a slightly lower price tag.  However, the property is showing signs of age and the service was inconsistent.  For example, the lobby was beautiful and well kept, but the furniture in the rooms and by the pool was very warn out and dated.  The same could also be said about the Monarch Bay Club and the restaurant at the golf club - tons of potential given the scenery but in much need of an upgrade.  As for the service, the front desk staff was great but it lacked by the pool and at bars and
Manager Response: Dear Brian D,  Thank you for sharing feedback regarding your recent stay with us! We appreciate your patronage and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the resort overall. Summary Heading: Wonderful Property for a Romantic Weekend
Summary: This is a beautiful property with truly spectacular scenery.  I highly recommend it for a couples weekend.  I'm not sure I would bring the kids because it is fairly isolated, and there's not much for kids to do.  But, this is a great place if you're looking for a quiet, classy, getaway.

Summary: From the moment we arrived, the service was outstanding in every possible way. My Wife and I spent 3 days at the St. Regis Monarch Beach in November and can't wait for our next visit.  Special Thanks to Jeff a at the Concierge for taking such great care of our requests.

Summary: Beautiful hotel, fantastic service with incredible attention to every detail. Rooms are large, as well as the bathroom. The view of Catalina island from the lobby bar was awesome. The pool service was top notch, and the golf course was very enjoyable. A wonderful stay, I would go back in a heartbeat!

Summary: The St. Regis Monarch Bay is a delightful retreat in Dana Point.  Accessibility by road is excellent.  Rooms are spacious and come with most amenities. Only thing missing was coffee in the room.  The pools are pleasant and the grounds very beautiful.  We found the service very good and attentive.  The hotel provided good support for our meetings.
Manager Response: Dear Marty911,  Thank your for your recent stay with us and for taking the time to write such a kind review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our vaious amenities, including meeting facilities. We look forward to welcoming you back!

I was really surprised that I did not have a coffee maker in the room.  I had looked forward to a cup of coffee on my balcony but to do that, I had to either pay $10 for a pot from room service or get dressed and go way down to the coffee bar and pay for it.  At the price of the rooms, a cup of coffee should have been provided in the mornings.  2.  This is really my biggest concern.  I have a nice pair of higher end earrings - they are pretty trendy and popular, recognizable. Summary: I was here on a business trip with an exceptionally large group. In most situations, you expect a tired hotel  where you can't wait to escape the corporate or business feel of the place. Not the case with the St. Regis – it is a gem no matter how you slice it.. Here is a place I would love to spend a long time with my family fully embracing all the amenities.   In fact, I'm planning a return trip to do just that.  The room was exceptionally large, Well appointed, elegant and clean. The service throughout the hotel including the butler service was top-notch. Food at the resort, both at the five-star restaurant and at the breakfast buffet knocked it out of the park. The spa and gym exceeded my expectations. The lobby bar was a great place to unwind and take in the breathtaking
Manager Response: Dear Steve H,  Thank you for your recent stay and for taking the time to share such a wonderful review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time while with us. It was spacious with all necessities available from bath robes, slippers, etc...  starting the weekend on the right foot As far as food was concerned, the coffee shop offered great coffee & exceptional croissant at reasonable prices (for a hotel). The room itself seemed to be very clean until i got a closer inspection. The headboard was covered in some past guest's fluids or whatever unhygienic that comes to mind which i felt should have been replaced awhile back. Summary: If this is not the top hotel in Dana point, I can't believe it.  Extraordinary in every way, beautiful view of the harbor, golf, and secluded beach.  Saw Reba mc entire while there and other personalities including Shaquille O'Neill stopping by one night in the lobby.  Top class service and amenities
Manager Response: Dear John A,  Thank you for leaving such a wonderful review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time while at our resort. We look forward to welcoming you back again!

Summary: Had a St Jude Gala and a wedding at the St Regis on the same weekend, so I decided to make it a relaxing weekend getaway/staycation. Being a SPG Gold member would normally get a room upgrade, but they were almost at 100% capacity that weekend. Nonetheless, the deluxe room was still spacious clean and bright. The service was attentive and friendly, from the valet, bellmen, lobby lounge cocktail servers, to the waitstaff at Stonehill Tavern, one of my favorite restaurants in the area. The lobby area was recently renovated (about a year or two ago), and still looks fresh and classically hip. I didn't get a chance to relax at either the pool or this beach this stay, but have always enjoyed their great facilities in the past. Will come back again for another relaxing local Staycation!
Manager Response: Dear miro1602,  Thank you for taking the time to share feedback regarding your recent stay with us! We are so pleased to hear that you had an enjoyable weekend with lots of celebrating! We hope to be able to welcome you back again so that you can spend time down at the beach.

Summary: I would say four and a half stars for my rating of this hotel, but that was not a choice.   About three hundred of us were pampered at the St Regis for a weekend of meetings (plus fun) for the partners and pure fun for the partners' partners.  Although not right on the beach, the ocean can be seen past the golf course and the views are very nice.  Though you can walk or run, a trolley makes the short trip down to a private section of the beach and the cozy beach bar/restaurant with inviting terrace. The beach is very nice to walk along.  Typical of the area, there are not many shells hiding in the masses of bulbous sea weed, but the sand feels good between the toes and there is lots to see.  Out in the bay, the waves first carry the surfers and then, once they gently roll up on

Summary: This was booked for our wedding weekend and we booked 3 rooms for us and visiting family.  The staff were all very helpful and amazing while we were there, and they accommodated rooms for our family so that they could be next door to each other as well.   The room was beautiful and had all the amenities we would want--I especially like the lined drawers (it's a nice touch).  The balcony had a view overlooking the courtyard, which was impeccably maintained and comfortable outdoor furniture to relax and enjoy the view. Members of our family were able to entertain themselves on premises while we were preparing for the event.  Walks around the premises, the pool, and the beach were all easily accessible by wheelchair as well.  The hotel is not directly on the beach, but shuttles
Manager Response: Dear Grace Y,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us while celebrating your wedding! We are so pleased to hear all of the kind comments you've shared regarding our staff, the rooms, the grounds and our spa. We hope to welcome you back again for another celebration soon!

Summary Heading: Take me back to The St. Regis!
Summary: This was one of the most pleasant and relaxed stays in a hotel I have had in a very long time. I tagged along with my daughter who was there on a business trip...so there was no work time involved for me. The staff was very responsive to any question or request I had. We had been put into a smaller room than requested and within minutes they had moved us.. The room was very nice with a lovely balcony. The hotel view of the grounds,pool and ocean was beautiful. I enjoyed being able walk to the botanical garden on the property. Since I was on my own during the day, I appreciated the tram driver(Nick?) who took the extra time to give me a tour of the grounds and clubs on our short drive to the Monarch Beach..I was surprised at how few people were on this grand beach. The little
Manager Response: Dear Lynn O,  Thank you so much for sharing such a kind review of your recent stay! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed the time you spent here and look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary: I expected luxury at the St Regis because it is a St Regis.  Part of that experience is a restful sleep.  We were in room 183, pool level (lobby is on the 5th level as hotel is built against a cliff).  The first night we could hear plates clattering.  That's when we realized that the doors at the end of our hallway (about 3 doors down) led to a kitchen.  It must've been a huge kitchen as the plates kept clattering for several minutes.  We called the front desk to complain and they said that they're about to finish cleaning up after a banquet and that the sound would end soon.  They apologized too.  It didn't end soon enough.  We flew in from the east coast that day so a not-so-late California night was actually quite late for us, especially after waking up early for the flight.

Summary Heading: What can you say... just perfection in every detail
Summary: It is not very often that I give a 5/5 or use the word perfection, but then it is not very often that I stay at a hotel like the St Regis. Every single detail has been thought about and the staff are so courteous and respectful. There is a calm over the whole hotel, the facilitates are faultless and the whole experience is just perfect, but I guess that is reflected in the price. But I really can not fault a single thing with my 4 night stay.
Manager Response: Dear denirokeane,  Thank you so much for your recent stay with us! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time at the resort. We hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: The St. Regis Monarch Beach is a great place to stay in Southern California.   The service is true 5 star.   The rooms are decent sized, and have a nice feel to them. The bed is one of the best hotel beds I have ever had. Being adjacent to the golf course and a short tram ride (hotel provided) to the beach was nice. Having access to the Private Beach Club for lunch while at the beach was a big plus.  The food in the restaurants was good, but if your staying for several nights it would be nice if the menus had a little more variety.  I would recommend the hotel for a business retreat or a couples weekend.
Manager Response: Dear Fredbvegas,  Thank you so much for your recent stay with us! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time at our resort and were able to experience the various amenities which we offer. We hope to welcome you back again soon for another wonderful night's sleep!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with below average service
Summary: My husband and I celebrated our 1-year wedding anniversary at the St. Regis Monarch Beach this past weekend. It's a beautiful location and Stonehill Tavern is delicious with great service, but the hotel's service leaves much to be desired, especially for a 5-star luxury hotel.  I should have realized customer service is not their top priority when I emailed the St. Regis Butler Service twice with the same question a few weeks before our stay and received NO response (the second time was to follow up a week after my initial email). I then reached out to the concierge and received a response quickly (phew!). I pushed my worries aside and figured things would be better when we arrived.  We arrived late on Friday -- everything went smoothly with our check-in, and there was a lovely

The rooms were very spacious although some of the furniture was a little bland.  The marble bathroom included every amenity you could think of. Summary: Was there for a conference for 3 days. Very luxurious, very big rooms, hotel is huge i.e. need to walk a lot. Great pool, friendly staff, but for me felt a bit without soul and too corporate. Although facilities are top notch. Hotel also far away from everything, i.e. need a car (and overnight parking 35$) for everything.

Summary: We stayed 5 nights in an ocean view suite (room 363). The service was 5 star all the way.  I won't repeat everything said by other travelers but rather provide some helpful tips.   -Turn down service done every night -Every tioletry available in room (tooth paste, brush, razor, etc) -Ocean view room isn't necessary due to distance from the ocean.  -This hotel does have frequent meetings, weddings, receptions, Etc.   -The lobby bar is fantastic with individual fire places at most outdoor seating areas.  -Sunday brunch is amazing and easily the largest  and most extravagant brunches available anywhere. Summary: I chose to stay here versus the Ritz Carlton at Laguna Niguel, as I was wanting to experience a St Regis for the first time and their rates were about $200 less than the Ritz Carlton with expectation of a similar stay.     First off this Hotel/Resort is NOT on the beach, contradictory to it's name.  It's situated just off the beach but is not easily accessible.  It's a typical high end resort with all the amenities and service as expected. Rooms were clean and well appointed as well as the lobby and other areas.   Service falls short of what is experienced at a Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons.    Check in process was slow and there are no lines for SPG gold/platinum members.  No initiative from staff to help or offer anything in regards to room/stay. I would have paid for an upgrade

Jason our banquet bartender was exceptional! While visiting make surpe to walk the three mile trail around the beautiful golf course! We would stay at the Monarch again in a heart beat

Summary: This resort gets most of it right from a service component. Everyone was extremely helpful with a positive attitude. Was not sure was to expect.  Rooms were nice and comfy grounds were well kept up.....

Summary: This is an ocean view hotel, so I was surprised to find myself mesmerized by the night view of the hotel itself, the turquoise brilliance of the pool and the Pacific-facing colonnade just beneath our suite. Everything we needed was provided and the    staff was both friendly and efficient.  The automobile valet service was excellent (expensive) and provided very fast service.  The restaurants were excellent. While we did not use the pool, it is beautiful and a restful place to just relax.

A shout out to Ariel at the front desk who was so accommodating to us.   We had mentioned that we were celebrating a birthday and later on that evening we were surprised with a desert in our room. The grounds are beautiful and pristine. Make sure that you look at a schedule of the daily classes and activities that are a part of the workout center. My memories of that trip: It was the most beautiful hotel I had ever had the opportunity to stay; Somewhat secluded; close to Laguna Beach; I would never be able to afford to stay at a place like that...  Well, circa June 2013, it turns out I could afford to go back and what a great excuse - to attend one of my favorite professional meetings.  I like to park my own car and was able to - that's a plus. But the process of ticket validation is cumbersome and off putting. Why not charge a flat rate 24hrs in/out whenever you want instead of all the nickel

She treated me like a King and went far beyond my wildest expectations, in a hotel that always meets my expectations.   She alone has won my business forever.  This is by far my favorite resort because of it's setting and sheer beauty but when service like this happens it simply makes you feel welcome and important like you are the only guest they have.

Rooms are ok (I am from the Middle East so I am used to luxury, most U.S. hotels pale in comparison, so does this St. Regis). Service is polite but too much focused on sucking that tip out of your pocket. Valet parking is too expensive at USD 35 per night, given that this is almost a rural location here. Breakfast is unspectacular - as a SPG Platinum I was offered continental breakfast for free (a USD 20 value). At the St Regis I found the receptionist who answered quite snarky and questioning why I would want such a thing. Finding that I truly did want one, she replied it would cost an extra $35 if she could locate one. I replied (I must admit) in a similarly snarky way that I would consider her request keeping in mind the "value" pricing for rooms set by the hotel. Summary: The St Regis is certainly a nice hotel and I am glad to have visited. Here are some tips to help you 1) Staff - everybody was extremely polite and eager to help. Summary: We stayed at the St. Regis for 3 nights 9/12-9/15 and the experience was excellent. We arrived on Friday and were taken to our room quickly. Everyone on staff at the bell desk was helpful and things went smoothly. The hallways and grounds were pretty impeccable and classy - not too untouchable and not stuffy at all. We ordered room service that evening and enjoyed eating in the room. The rest of the trip we spent at the main pool which between the weather and the drinks, was perfect. We also had dinner at the Beach Club, which is phenomenal. The beach is actually very easy to access and you should enjoy the walk - you're here to take advantage of the surroundings. The tram is cool - you can use that too. Having coffee on the patio overlooking the grounds or just on your balcony

We're local and live in Orange County, so we know just about all of the nicer resorts and have spent the day or night at all of them. I prefer this location over the Ritz Carlton in Laguna Niguel for overnight stays. If you're an out of town guest, I'd suggest this highly. If you can, get a room with a butler. The butler service is part of this hotel's charm.   If you're looking for family access to the beach, then you should be aware you need to take a resort shuttle to the sand. It's so bright green and a great contrast to the sand. The rocky surrounding reefs around the edge make a great photo op next to the smooth sandy beach in front and the water was actually pretty warm for California. Some people complain about the shuttle ride to the beach (it's five minutes and really

Summary Heading: Fabulous event at a beautiful property!

He and his team made us all feel welcome and made us all want to check in!  The food was outstanding. It was the first time I attended a banquet at a hotel that served pork- such a refreshing change!  My friend was given the vegetarian option and it was outstanding. The beach is lovely, with fast and friendly chair service.  Even on the busiest summer day, this beach doesn't feel crowded and has rocks and tide pools fun for exploring. Summary: I was here for a work conference which was delightful.  Staff were great from check in to the porter.  Rooms were as shown in photos.  The hotel is not on the beach so you take a cart to the beach - which was very cute - like disneyland!  The service at the beach was great, with the staff setting up our chairs and umbrellas wherever we pleased.  The pool area was nice, but it was very busy - perhaps because there were a few conferences going on at the same time.
Manager Response: Dear Stan Y,  Thank you for taking the time to share your review of your recent stay with us! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time at our resort. We look forward to welcoming you back, whether it be for business again or for pleasure!

Summary Heading: Losing its luster but still a great hotel
Summary: This is my 5th stay at this hotel during the past 3 years. The staff all have 5 star attitudes but they are overwhelmed. It took me 30 minutes to check in. No big deal but a slight set back at the start of a weekend getaway.     The cart shuttle to the beach is a disaster. It took 20 minutes for the shuttle but there were so many people that I walked Down to the beach restaurant which was a 20 minute walk. People were very disgruntled and tempers flavored. One lady told another person in an accusatory tone that they were cutting the shuttle line.  I thought relax people we're on a beach vacation. Too much drama so that's why I decided to walk. I blame management for poor scheduling.   I still had a great time.  Food was solid, if not fantastic, and staff try their best. It's
Manager Response: Dear Daniel K,  Thank you for your recent visit! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time at our resort. We will be sure to share your feedback regarding the shuttle service to the beach with our Executive Management team for further consideration in regards to staffing. We hope to welcome you back for another wonderful beach vacation soon!

Summary: We have been guests of the St Regis Monarch Beach since 2008 and we have always had exceptional service. We have traveled the world and stayed at many different hotels. The St. Regis Monarch is in our "Top 5" most beautiful properties.  We've always had a positive and relaxing experience. The GM, Johnny So, and his team are unique in the hotel industry. They make each guest feel special; couples, families and large groups. They know their guests by name and they know their preferences down to the most minor detail. They know how to make the guests feel special. If you arrived on a busy holiday weekend, try them again, you will be glad you did.  One night at the St. Regis is like being on vacation for an entire week at any other hotel or destination.  The Best Sunday Brunch!  The
Manager Response: Dear HollieDP,  Thank you for the extremely kind words! We love hearing from guests who have enjoyed our resort over the many years. Thank you for letting us be a part of your family traditions since 2008. We look forward to welcoming you back for your next visit!

Summary Heading: Very nice, but comes at a cost
Summary: Ok, I get it. You've got money and you like to spend it. Awesome. However, I paid $40 for a club sandwich. Not even a good club sandwich. The hotel is beautiful, the pool is gorgeous. Great gym and a very nice spa, but I'm still not sure that it was worth the heavy price. That being said, if money is not an issue then you will probably love this place just for the fact that you'll be rubbing elbows with rich people like you.
Manager Response: Dear Marcus A,  Thank you for your recent visit and for taking the time to write a review of our resort! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the resort, pool, gym and spa while staying with us. Your comments regarding our food and beverage costs will be shared with our management team. We hope to welcome you back again in the near future!

Summary: My family and I were scheduled for Hawaii which Iselle and Julio scrapped for us. After scrambling we were able to secure two third floor poolside rooms at the St. Regis.  Normally, I love the Ritz and the Montage, and as a couple I still might be tempted by the Ritz ocean views. But with our four children, wow were we lucky to go to the St. Regis.   I have always enjoyed the St. Regis for business, but its resort excellence shows when you are there for leisure. The Service is impeccable, particularly at the pool and beach where all attendants address you with respect and polish. The beach is private for the St Regis and has a full service indoor outdoor restaurant within steps of the sand. The waves are sized just right for our 6-14 year old kids who loved boogie boarding and
Manager Response: Dear 4MGOBLUE,  Thank you for the wonderful review! Although we are huge fans of Hawaii as well, we are so very pleased to hear that you will be considering us for your annual family vacation moving forward. We look forward to welcoming you and your family back again next summer!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, great stay with family!
Summary: Just stayed here for two nights and three days with my wife and two daughters (13 & 10). Had read many reviews before we arrived and had mixed emotions. We arrived on a Wednesday around 1:00 pm, it was fairly busy. We were greeted by the valet (Brandon) and checking in moments. There were several people in line and immediately several agents appeared to check everyone in. We are SPG platinum and although we were not expecting very much (think that's the key). We were given an amazing room, 10% off card and a $40.00 credit per day at Motif. We all get that we are spending a fortune on our vacations but every little helps and makes us feel good! The women (Ariel) at check in was truly engaged and seemed glad to have us visit. This is truly a spectacular hotel and the staff was
Manager Response: Dear ExtendedVacation,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for being a valuable SPG member! We appreciate your review and will be sure to share your positive comments with Brandon and Ariel. We have a true Five-Star team at our resort and we are so pleased to know that it shows to our guests. We hope to welcome you and your family back again for another memorable vacation in the near future!

Summary: Simply put, this is not a typical St. Regis. For the people who have traveled the world and have stayed at great hotels (and by that I mean excellent SERVICE), you would understand.  It is ran by amateurs.  We have stayed here a lot because we are Starwood members and get good rates. But before each visit, my husband and I tell ourselves, don't ask for anything and do not expect anything.  Sometimes it feels like the staff is reading from a manual (like an outsourced company).     This place was also in BK before so there you go.  I think people stay here because the Montage and Ritz are more expensive and perhaps due to real housewives show lol?  Not asking for the Pierre but come on, hire better staff and don't over occupy so that you have some wiggle room to accommodate
Manager Response: Dear Dana V,  Thank you for sharing feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We are disappointed to hear that we did not meet your expectations of what a St. Regis resort should be. Your comments will be shared with our Executive Management team for addressing. If you feel there is anything further which we can do, please feel free to contact our Executive Offices at (949) 234-3301. We hope that you will re-consider staying with us again in the future.

Summary: It started with a long line at check-in. Think Vegas without the rope trick. It was extremely crowded and I think the staff struggled with the crowds. Waited 30 minutes for my bag and when it finally came I requested assistance with the remote. All I wanted was CBS. No such luck from the bell staff.  Thought the common areas were a tad bit worn...handed a wrist band at check-in for some areas of the resort. How many 5 star resorts hand these out at check-in?  Had a couple meals. One I hosted for clients. Meal average and service was painfully slow. All in all...thought they just did not deliver and might have been due to the crowds. Would suggest The Ritz down the street.
Manager Response: Dear BTrun78,  Thank you for your recent stay and for taking the time to share your feedback. We sincerely apologize that your experience did not exceed your expectations! Your comments regarding check-in, service and food quality will be shared with our Executive Management team for addressing. If you feel there is anything further we can do, please contact our Executive Offices at (949) 234-3301.

Summary: This hotel met my expectation for a 5 star hotel.  I stayed here as part of a company conference and the room, food and grounds were excellenct.  Of particular note was the INCREDIBLE service provided by the staff. Well done... I wish I can name them all.  Golf course was beautiful.
Manager Response: Dear Thecuz1,  Thank you for your recent stay and for leaving such a wonderful review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and the various amenities throughout the resort. We hope to welcome you back again, whether it be for business or pleasure!

Summary Heading: Yikes : Service has tanked since June. St. Regis you are gonna lose your five star rating.
Summary: OK St. Regis, my fav place in Laguna vicinity, service needs an overhaul and fast.  I have written two fairly elaborate reviews in the past mostly very good to excellent. I am a frequent guest.  But this trip is not going well. Service has tanked.  OK lets start with the Valet:  "Are you staying a short while"  as I pull up. Huh?  Shouldn't it be "Welcome to the St. Regis are you checking in sir?".  Imagine inviting someone over and you open the door and say, " are you staying a short while:?  Then onto the front desk.   A bit of a line and finally a gentleman says, "Can I help you" and I say, " I am checking in." Then this portly fellow says, "I just starting my day, someone will be with you soon". HUH? WHAT? Then why talk at all?  BTW the gentleman that did check me in was
Manager Response: Dear Rachel R,  Thank you for being a loyal St. Regis Monarch Beach guest and for taking the time to share your feedback. We sincerely apologize for the service level which you received, as these incidences are not typical of a stay with us. Please rest assured knowing that each any every comment has been addressed with the appropriate management teams. We hope to welcome you back to the resort again so you can experience the true Five-Star, Five-Diamond service which is usually offered. Again, thank you for providing this feedback!

Summary Heading: St. Regis at Dana Point is among the finest beach resorts in California
Summary: Having stayed at the St. Regis at Dana Point several times, I decided that it was time to write a review on this property. The St. Regis is an expansive hotel and resort south of Los Angeles with tremendous views of the Pacific Ocean. It is also surrounded by a beautiful golf course. The first time I stayed at the resort I mixed business with a family weekend getaway. The rooms are elegant, large, and thoughtfully laid out.  I observed that every time we have stayed there that the beds are not very firm, and not all that  comfortable. There are juliette balconies, patios, decks, and rooms without any of these options.  We stayed on the ground floor with an inside view of the gardens.  There was plenty of room for my husband and two sons to spread out, and the bathroom with
Manager Response: Dear 1HotNana,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for leaving such a kind review! We are so pleased to hear that you an your family were able to enjoy all of the various amenities which our resort offers. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with others online and look forward to welcoming you back again!

Summary: This is a beautiful property and has amazing service. That being said, it definitely caters to conventions and weddings. When we were there, bar was closed off for a convention group and the Michael Mina Restaurant was also closed off for private party. The only other dining option was the Motif restaurant - very disappointing for us!  If most of the facilities are closed off for private groups, why bother staying? Will not be coming back.The beach is quite far and frankly is not that nice. They offer shuttle service and the beach staff is impeccable but the beach itself is not worth it.
Manager Response: Dear CAlove_to_travel,  Thank you for taking the time to share feedback regarding your stay with us. We are disappointed to hear that your time spent here did not exceed your expectations. Your comments will be shared with our management team to ensure that restaurant and bar closures are appropriately shared with our guests ahead of time. We hope that you will visit us again!

Summary: This resort is not for those who are afraid to spend money for it is pricy.  The grounds are beautiful, service extraordinary and food delicious. The golfers in the group had a great day no matter their score. We ate two dinners at the cozy beach front restaurant after taking a tram down the hill. The mac and cheese was the best I ever tasted!  I loved the poolside service complete with towels, sunscreen and food and beverage service.
Manager Response: Dear timetraveler95337,  Thank you for taking the time to share feedback regarding your recent stay with us! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our grounds, service, food, golf, Monarch Bay Club and our pool! We love when guests are able to enjoy so many of the amenities which we offer. We hope to welcome you back again in the near future.

Summary: Property is outstanding, level of cordial, friendly service unrivaled; access to dining at monarch bay private beach only further enhances the possibilities for dining without having to leave property. Rooms are sumptuous, think of everything.
Manager Response: Dear artf1717,  Thank you for sharing such a wonderful review! We appreciate your positive comments, especially of the Monarch Bay Club, and look forward to welcoming you back again in the near future!

Summary Heading: This luxury hotel lived up to it's reputation
Summary: We have stayed in the Ritz right down the street as well.  So that is the hotel that I keep in mind while writing this review.  The St. Regis has superior customer service.  We first entered the hotel and while we were checking in guest services came out to our two children and handed them buckets and shovels.  They say that first impressions are important....well they nailed it with that first impression.  Our children were certainly impressed.  We then went to the gorgeous room with the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in.  In fact we called the hotel back to find out the type of mattress they used so we could go and purchase the identical mattress.  They have a butler service at the beach that sets up all of your chairs for you and they are so friendly.  I have read
Manager Response: Dear Nicole S,  Thank you for sharing such a wonderful review of our resort! We truly appreciate your patronage and are so pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your time with us. We strive to offer Five-Star, Five-Diamond service in all areas of our resort, including our tram services and beach areas. We hope to welcome you and your family back again for another family vacation!

Summary Heading: Stay at the Ritz, Montage or Surf & Sand Instead
Summary: We've stayed at several of the resorts in this area and while the St. Regis has its beauty and great service, we would opt for the the Ritz Carlton, the Montage, or the Surf & Sand instead.  The St. Regis attracts a lot of meetings and weddings, and the lobby and grounds always seem to be filled with wedding parties or conventioneers.  The lobby seems like Grand Central Station at times -- not conducive to a relaxing get-away.  My biggest disappointment was with the room design.  In the standard rooms, there is an opening between the bathroom and the main room, blocked only by shutters.  Perhaps they were thinking that you can open the shutters and see the view, or TV, from the bath tub.  In reality, it just means that every sound (and I mean every sound) anyone makes in the
Manager Response: Dear SoCalTMac,  Thank you for taking the time to share feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We appreciate the comments and will be sure to share them with our Executive Management team to ensure that they are addressed properly. We hope that in the future you will stay with us again so that we can showcase the Five-Star, Five-Diamond property which we always strive to be!

Summary: When we checked in we waited over 20 minutes just to reach the check in counter.  That made us feel like we were entering another Las Vegas convention center hotel, but of course we were not. What we entered was wedding paradise!  This must be a wonderful place for weddings, as the line held many people talking about weddings that weekend.    The rooms are  large with fine quality bathrooms, all kept very clean and the extra service of the nightly "turn down" service, does the little extra's of a fine property.  The staff is very attentive and polite.  We found to food in one of the restaurants to be very good along with very pleasant service.  The extra charges detract from the quality image.  $39 for valet parking each day plus a $25. "Resort Fee" each day is simply too much,
Manager Response: Dear Barry L,  Thank you for taking the time to leave such a wonderful review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us - especially the nightly turn-down service which we provide. We hope to welcome you back again in the near future!

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights with 2 kids and husband.   The moment you check into hotel you can feel the serviceable staff.   From valet parking to front desk and concierge everybody pays attention to your family name and want to treat you in a special way.    We had a pool view 2 queen beds.     The view was amazing and the bathroom was big and gorgeous.    They have 2 pools, one for adults and one for families.    Beautiful property.   A tram which brings you through the golf to the beach where there are free chairs and towels with surf boards and balls and toys for the guests to use.    At the beach there is the private members only Monarch beach club for residences but because you are a guest at the St. Regis guests can have a drink or eat there.  The last tram leaves this beach
Manager Response: Dear Nancy L,  Thank you for taking the time to write a wonderful review of our resort! We appreciate your kind feedback and are pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your time at our beach and Monarch Bay Club. We hope to welcome you back for another family vacation in the near future!

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the St. Regis.  From the moment we arrived we were made to feel we were important guests.  We only stayed for one night but enjoyed time down at the private beach and in the pool.  The pool was terrific --- both beautiful and warm.  The private beach is a short shuttle ride away.  The shuttle only holds about 10 people, so on a crowded weekend it might take a while to get a ride, but we had no problem at all.  We loved the attention the staff paid to every detail in making sure our needs (and more!) were met.  We were pleasantly surprised when one staff member noticed us taking pictures and offered to take a picture of the both of us.  This is not our typical choice in hotel and was definitely a splurge, but it was fun while it lasted!
Manager Response: Dear familytravellers4,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write such a wonderful review! We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to welcoming you back again.

Summary Heading: Still Gorgeous after all these years
Summary: The minute you walk in and you are "wowed" with the views and the space. The rooms are really kept well. Mine had no view, on the pool 1st floor. It was still charming. Usually I get a view of the ocean. Quiet, comfortable, romantic, special, clean . . . everything to love. The spa is great - not as clean as it should be in the wet areas, though. Great staff. Downsides? Food and beverage are so overpriced you feel insulted ($4.50 for a can of coke, for example). That's it - the beach, the running paths, the workout area, the overall ambiance  . . . it's all wonderful and special.
Manager Response: Dear Jeff B,  Thank you for your recent visit and kind review! We appreciate your continued patronage and hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay and play
Summary: The St. Regis, Monarch Beach is a beautiful hotel, with spa, golf, pool and beach amenities. The service is top-notch and the rooms are beautiful.  We especially enjoyed the workout facilities, which were well-equipped and within their spa so there was access to full lockers, etc.  Their on-site dining and bars are in general beautiful and several have fantastic views.   Our favorite, however, was their beach-side restaurant, which was down near the Pacific water's edge. (You need to take a shuttle bus there.) It is right on the beach -- for nice pre and post dinner walks -- and the food was excellent.  I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear B R,  Thank you for your wonderful review! We appreciate you choosing to stay with us and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed many amenities within the resort. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary Heading: One of my favorite resorts in the world
Summary: I have nothing but favorable impressions, wonderful memories and an outstanding recommendation for the St. Regis Monarch Beach. The staff is ultra-attentive as you would expect and check-in, check-out, help with activities and any possible request are handled flawlessly. I have stayed there 3 times over the last 6 years and the experience is always the same --- memorable and outstanding. I have also hosted a corporate meeting there and can say the same experience extends to even planning.  The grounds of the resort are superb. Plenty of walking trails, a nice botanical garden, adult and open pools, and spectacular balcony views of the ocean. I recommend paying more for an ocean view, but I have stayed in rooms without one and it was not a big deal because you will spend lots of
Manager Response: Dear George Y,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review of your recent stay with us! We are so very pleased to hear that you were able to enjoy all of the various amenities which we offer. We agree - the beach and Monarch Bay Club are not to be missed! We hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary Heading: Inattentive service, profiling by staff and no recognition of SVP 5 Star Platinum Status, poor maintenance in room
Summary: Been coming to St Regis Monarch Resort for over ten years. Just returned from a four night stay. When I checked in Tuesday, I asked Front Desk to arrange for late Sat checkout after 2pm as my family was joining me and I hold 5 star Platinum elite status. No problem he said. I asked to apply Starwood suite upgrade awards. Was told St Regis would only upgrade room for cash. A/C in room functioned intermittently. Informed housekeeping. It was never dealt with. Safe in closet did not work. Informed operator. It was never dealt with. Picture hanging on wall by bath had broken frame. When I hosted a 2pm Friday lunch in Motif for three foreign officials, waitstaff was barely attentive. When my son and his wife arrived Friday for the night (in their scruffy car) valet staff would not
Manager Response: Dear John V,  Thank you for your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize that your stay encountered so many issues as this is not typical of our service standards. Your comments about your check-in experience, room issues and associate encounters will be shared with our General Manager and addressed accordingly. If you feel there is anything we can do to change your mind about a return stay with us, please do not hesitate to reach out to our Executive Offices directly at (949) 234-3301. We hope you will consider visiting us again, so we can change your perception of our resort and truly exceed your expectations.

Summary Heading: St. Regis Monarch Beach is #1 for Upscale Traveler
Summary: If you considering yourself to be an upscale traveler who enjoys the finer things in life, you need to experience the beautiful St. Regis Monarch Beach. This gem of a hotel is located 30 minutes south of the John Wayne Orange County Airport in one of America's most picturesque beach communities, Dana Point, California.  The St. Regis Monarch Beach offers one of the best spas in Southern California, a challenging 18-hole golf course that overlooks the Pacific Ocean, a huge pool and with plenty of lounge chairs, incredible sunsets, and everything else you would expect from a 5-star resort.  While the St. Regis Monarch Beach caters to upscale corporate and incentive meetings with its excellent meetings and plentiful banquet space, it's also one of the most sought-after locations
Manager Response: Dear Tom H,  Thank you for the wonderful review of our resort! We appreciate all of the kind comments regarding the hotel, amenities and staff. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: This place is excellent. Excellent service, excellent grounds, excellent amenities, excellent rooms. We opted for the executive suite with, yes, a butler. And, we took advantage of the opportunity. My husband had his clothes pressed and his shoes shined. French press coffee on the veranda in plush robes every morning. Decadent. The best part was they found out it was my birthday and had champagne waiting. He even walked all the way out to the hot tub to tell us we had secured our dinner reservations. He let my daughter name him. So sweet. I cant say enough about the food and kindness of the staff. There is a drink with Gin and Lavender that you just must try.  The beach club was also incredible. They have a bar outside, set up your umbrellas and chairs, and really are very nice.
Manager Response: Dear Tracy H,  Thank you for much for your recent stay with us! We appreciate your kind words regarding the resort and your experience, yet apologize for the incident with the shuttle and will be sure to address it with the employee. Should you like to address the issue further, please feel free to reach out to our Executive Offices directly at (949) 234-3301. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: The reason to give this hotel five stars in the service.  Honestly, there are better views of the ocean at nearby hotels. But no one outshines this group in service.  From the moment you enter the property to the time you exit, the staff could not do enough or provide more smiles or friendlier attitude. The resturant should also not be missed, outstanding food and wine pairings.  Great golf course and easy walk or ride to the ocean. We will be back.
Manager Response: Dear Ahg2,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our resort! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed our legendary Five-Star, Five-Diamond service! We look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary Heading: Spa amazing, rooms not St. Regis caliber
Summary: As someone who has stayed in many St. Regis around the world, I was excited to stay in another USA property. My wife and I are huge fans of the brand, ever since our wedding night stay at the St. Regis NY. For better or worse, we always compare every St. Regis to the one in NY, and the Monarch beach property does many things wonderfully well, but fall short in a few others. First the accolades. First class greeting at the door by the valet staff. They were always available to help, and Matt our bellman was very attentive to our needs, and always acknowledged us, even as we were entering and exiting the hotel during the course of our stay. The concierge staff is bar none the best I have worked with. Gundula and Marty could not have done more to go out of their way to accommodate
Manager Response: Dear Bobbyz51,  Thank you so much for your recent stay with us and for taking the time to share your review. We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed so many aspects of our resort and will be sure to pass along your kind words to Matt, Gundula, Marty, Miguel and Ariel! Your comments regarding the room readiness and cleanliness will be shared with our housekeeping management team to ensure that this type of experience is avoided in the future. We hope to be able to welcome you and your wife back again!

Summary: If you are looking for a relaxing luxurious vacation spot, this is it.  the grounds are beautiful, the rooms are great, and the pool is exquisite.  The spa is small but adequate.  it is not cheep, but luxury comes at a price.  if you have the extra cash, rent a cabana by the pool.
Manager Response: Dear mkhoro,  Thank you for your kind words about our resort! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay with us. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: An absolutely beautiful hotel.  Very accomodating staff, beautiful room, grounds.  Truly enjoyed my stay. 3 highlights to share.  They are not directly on the beach, but have a nice shuttle service to their private beach.  Very nice beach accommodations.  I enjoyed multiple sunsets from the outdoor patio in front of the fireplace.  They have many hummingbirds.
Manager Response: Dear Alan J,  Thank you for your recent stay and kind words! We appreciate the positive feedback and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the resort while here. We hope to welcome you back again soon to enjoy another one of our captivating sunsets!

Summary Heading: Best Resort Experience in Southern California - HANDS DOWN!!!!
Summary: I stayed at this resort last week for 6 nights to attend a conference and mix in some family time at the beach.  It is quite honestly, the best resort we have experienced in Southern California!  While we have traveled around southern CA during the summer to escape the Summer hear in AZ, we have completely fallen in love with this property.    The Service is EXCELLENT!  The rooms are impeccable.  The amenities with access to first class pools and the associated Beach club are outstanding and gives you the best of what S. CA has to offer.    It will now be a part of our summer adventure for many years to come - convention or not!
Manager Response: Dear jfoster1268,  We are so pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us! It sounds like you were able to enjoy all of our amenities, including our pool and beach. We look forward to becoming a part of your familiy tradition for years to come!

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the St. Regis in May of this year and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel.  The room was spacious and very nicely appointed, the staff were great, and the onsite restaurants were phenomenal.  Loved the service and food by the pool and the easy access to the golf course.  This is a fantastic property that is worth the visit.
Manager Response: Dear Ernest H,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a lovely review of your recent stay! We are pleased to hear that you and your wife enjoyed your time at our resort and hope to welcome you both back again soon!

Summary: The property is beautiful. I felt like I was in Hawaii. The service was impeccable. The Sunday brunch was the best I ever had. My boyfriend and I had stayed at the Grand Del Mar as amazing as that was this hotel beats it by a hair. My boyfriend went downstairs to get me a coffee this morning and they greeted him by his name at the coffee shop. .I'm  impressed. This place did not miss a beat. Thanks for a wonderful time. We will be back
Manager Response: Dear Squalls,  We are so pleased to hear that you and your boyfriend had a wonderful experience at our resort! We hope to welcome you both back again in the near future!

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel with an amazing view
Summary: I attended a conference here and was really impressed by the hotel and the property. Many of the rooms have a view of the ocean off in the distance (over the golf course) and the property is just spectacular.   The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very automated and the technology is really impressive. I look forward to an opportunity to visit again.
Manager Response: Dear AdamParks,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time at our resort and look forward to welcoming you back, whether is be for business again or for pleasure!

Summary: My stay at the St Regis was just perfect. When first walking in the Hotel the Valet and the Bellman were very nice, Ariel at Check In was very helpful and so pleasant.  Staff is very smilly, the SPA was a great experience, Tyler at the restaurant took a very good care of us. I would like to thanks Kimber the Front Desk Manager that send us some very nice aminities that we enjoyed facing the Sunset. I would definitly recommand this place for a very nice get away from the City and for people that are looking to relax. Make sure you enjoy the sunset from the Bar around the fireplace, it is great !
Manager Response: Dear stephanieleriche,  We are so pleased to hear that your stay with us was perfect! We will be sure to share your kind comments with Ariel, Tyler and Kimber. We look forward to welcoming you back again!

Summary: We stayed here for 6 days & had a great time.  Beautiful room (We were upgraded to pool view due to our SPG Gold status & were also granted a late checkout)! My only complaint is with the concierge. She told me that I had to call for my own spa & salon appointments.  I also asked her for restraunt reservations once which got completely messed up. However, we would stay here again in a heartbeat!
Manager Response: Dear neuromri,  Thank you for being a loyal SPG member and for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your stay with us! We are disappointed to learn that your experience with our Concierge did not meet your expectations. Your comments will be addressed with the Concierge team accordingly. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: What a beautiful location for a Wedding.  Ashley and Ray's Wedding was beautiful!  The food was excellent and so was the staff with the White Glove Service.    The resort has many beautiful water fountains, stair cases, terraces that allows you to look directly out at the ocean. The inside is just as beautiful as the outside with an inside waterfall located in the spa area along with an adult private pool that have underwater music.   The St. Regis Suite with the ocean view and the butler service was another way to enjoy the resort.     Some of our wedding guests are so excited about this resort that we are planning another event so we can all stay again.  Don't forget the private beach...

Don't forget to take the shuttle golf cart down to the beach front restaurant but be warned the service is not so great down there, yet the view is fantastic - maybe have a drink only and hen come back. There are some great walks down to the beach and then up the next hotel and back, watching the surfers. The area is beautiful.

Otherwise, the Ritz is by far the superior hotel. The Ritz offers plenty of ocean view options, the best the St Regis offers is a partial (and I mean, real partial, like over the golf course, across the highway, over the multimillion dollar homes- partial view). Also, he St Regis furnishings seemed old fashioned and a bit stale. We ate at the Stonhill Tavern, they were accommodating of our dog eating with us outdoors. The bathrooms were also large - separate room for toilet, 2 sinks with lots of counter space, large, glassed-in shower, nice deep tub (that filled very quickly - nice perk), and even a separate shelf/counter/cupboard. I could've done without the louvered opening between the bathroom and bedroom though. The only interesting point was the lobby lounge. We went up for a couple drinks and the manager smelled like alcohol and was being very obnoxious. We were having a great night so we didn't mind I was just surprised to see something like that at the st Regis!! Anyways overall we had a fantastic trip. Will definitely come back

I did note this to management and they did respond, but given the high rates……And there’s a required $15 bellhop fee, which I have never seen before and seems a bit steep. Lastly, the hotel promotes its “private beach”,  although it’s actually a private restaurant on a public beach. And it's a bit of a walk (or you take a tram) vs. other hotels nearby that are on the beach.
