Summary: We were amazed at the service. Every staff member was out to make sure you were well taken care of and every staff member knew about the hotel and could get whatever you needed. If you asked, it was done - professionally, timely, and kindly. The rooms were fabulous with beautiful views (and we were there in the rain). Definitely go down to the restaurant/bar at the beach and enjoy the casual comfort there. Just a really nice place to get away and enjoy some quiet. (There is a golf course too!) It would be an amazing place for a wedding (in the sun).
Manager Response: Dear Bow2Wa, Thank you for your kind comments regarding our resort and your recent stay with us! We hope that you are able to visit us again soon, hopefully when it's sunny!

Summary: My husband and I have planned to travel back to Dana Point, for our 10th anniversary, since we got married.  We met in Dana Point and got engaged there!  We made our reservations 14 months in advance (in June) because we had a limited window to travel and wanted it to overlap not only with our anniversary but with our son's birthday.  When we made our reservation we asked to use our SPG points from our AMEX card.  We were told that we couldn't apply them that far in the future but to make the reservation and call back in a few months and they could do so easily.  We happily made our reservation and began planning our trip.  We purchased flights and planned a vow renewal ceremony including friends and family. We called back in November and were told once again that we should call

We sincerely apologize for the challenges you are experiencing. Please reach out to our Executive Offices directly at 949.234.3301 so that we can rectify the situation.

Summary Heading: one of the best hotels I've stayed
Summary: This is a beautiful resort and great for a wedding venue.  We stayed only for a few days, but it was a memorable experience.  The service was great and very friendly, and the St Regis Astor suite is spacious and luxurious.    Spa Gaucin is amazing and well worth the money.  Can't wait to go back ...
Manager Response: Dear Ksenya, Thank you for your review and your recent stay with us! We appreciate your kind words about our resort and look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary: Nice landscape & clean ground,but resort does not have any extensive beach, ocean view unless you're at their private beach which is about 15 minutes walk from main hotel area or taking their tram down there.  The room, and hallways in need of updating, outdated and worn carpet. For a name like St Regis, quite dissapointing, perhaps been to too many resorts, by far this one was not impressived, especially for $35 overnight parking, resort fee, internet fee, buffet $35 pp, and the list goes on, you got to be top notch for us to come back. Service was great, but overall having to pay a lot for mediocre facility.  Service was great, friendly service. Yet, the atmosphere was not there for us. RC over in Laguna Beach, much more posh feeling.
Manager Response: Dear znetbabe, Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the service and hotel grounds. We appreciate your comments regarding our interiors and will be sure to share with our Executive and Engineering teams for action. If there is anything further we can do, please reach out to our Executive Offices at (949) 234-3301.

Summary: I went to the St. Regis for a business trip for the first time this December and at first I was upset that I wasn't at the Ritz where I had stayed prior. My opinion quickly changed. My first room was a pool view which was lovely and very spacious. I later got upgraded to an ocean view suite where I had a butler!!! He ironed my clothes and brought me French pressed coffee every morning. They even packed for me! I'm forever spoiled and now I compare everything to this. The coffee shop had amazing coffee and a croissant that was to die for. Me and my coworker wanted to go down to the beach so there's a cart that will bring you down. The grounds are beautiful, the service amazing. I can't wait to come back. Oh yes and then there is the spa which I highly recommend. I got a hot stone
Manager Response: Dear LaurzieB, Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write such a wonderful review! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to experience our wonderful amenities such as our Butler service, Crust coffee shop, Spa Gaucin and our private Monarch Bay Club. Please come back and see us again soon!

Summary Heading: A six-star resort for an all-star wedding
Summary: I was invited to my first same sex wedding which was being held at the St Regis.  The grooms could not have picked a better locations.   The whole staff were incredibly supportive (and excited about the event) and made us feel welcome which only contributed to the wonderful celebration that it was.  The service execution was flawless. The food fantastic.  And the views/sunsets, you have to see them for yourself.  A great wedding which was supported by a great location.
Manager Response: Dear liambuckley2010, Thank you for your recent stay and wonderful review! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our resort, our amenities, and what we're sure was a beautiful wedding. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: As others have noted this is a lovely resort and only a few years old.  The views are stunning, the staff nice and friendly.  My concerns are the quality of the rooms which are not designed for the business traveller. I know that my expectations are perhaps out of place given the type of resort but given the meetings which were ther and the appeal for conferences I would have expected some better room amenities. There were no outlets in the room to charge the devices we all carry.  The desks not truly suitable for work.  The wireless not very fast and requiring several pages jus to connect. No coffee maker in the room; but there was water. The in room safe did not work in my room. The balcony door had a security lock that was more for show and would not have stopped anyone who
Manager Response: Dear Robert J, Thank you for your review and for your recent stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and will be sure to share with our Executive and Engineering teams, as we always strive to maintain a Five-Star, Five-Diamond facility. We hope that you are able to visit us again!

Summary: We are loyal Starwood goers and this hotel reminded us why.  The grounds - amazing. The service - exceptional. The room - fantastic. The location - stellar.  We are SPG platinum members and were treated as such. Cousins staying with us are not SPG members but were treated with due respect. I wish we had the time to try the golf course.
Manager Response: Dear Briansha, Thank you for choosing The St. Regis Monarch Beach for your recent getaway and for taking the time to write a review. We appreciate your kind feedback and are pleased to know that you are a loyal Starwood guest. We hope to welcome you and your family back again soon!

Summary: First, I feel compelled to get something out of the way right up front that could be very important to your stay:  The DO NOT DISTURB is a button on the thermostat!  Ok, I said it and feel much better.  Granted this fact was specifically disclosed on the info they gave us when we checked in (and which we clearly did not read until checking out).  We kept having people come to our door and we kept saying "Where the heck is the DND?"  But since we only stayed one night we were too lazy to call and ask.  With that out of the way . . .   Given that I have reviewed the resort before (and you can click and see my prior reviews) I won't repeat everything again but will try to hit on the new points.  As I mentioned, we stayed 1 night this past weekend in honor of my hubby's birthday.  I

Your comments regarding your tram experience will be shared with our team to ensure that these practices are improved upon prior to your next visit. We hope that to have you both back to celebrate another special occasion soon!

Summary: Pristine Property.  Vista Views are Stunning.  Room was Immaculate.  Grounds were Amazing.  The private beach was truly awesome with spectacular sunsets where we popped a bottle of Dom - which created a timeless memory.  As to be expected, the restaurants are very pricey, so be aware of this factor.    (The only downside was that we dinned 1 evening, which began ok - we were the only ones there - but then a very drunk and rowdy group of 20 men fell in from the golf course and took over the place with extremely loud "conversation" right in the middle of the room.  Then we had the privilege to have a couple with 2 toddlers beside us who screamed, cried and yelled.  So that was a complete disaster, of which the servers then ignored us and fully attended to the main table of golfers

We are pleased to hear that you loved the hotel and all of the amenities which we offer. Please know that your dining experience is not typical of our restaurants and we regret this was your experience while here. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: A well known resort location for a highly regarded chain.    Felt some "attitude" from staff which affected our enjoyment of this hotel.  Certainly, excellent facilities and views.    Rooms are quite nice.  Overall, a high quality resort which could have been much more fun if the staff with whom we interacted had been more welcoming.
Manager Response: Dear GoBills2014, Thank you for your recent stay and review of the resort. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our facilities and resort overall, however we apologize for your encounter with our staff which did not exceed your expectations. This type of service is not typical of our standards. If there is anything we can do to correct the situation, please contact our Executive Offices at 949-234-3301.

Summary: From the service, to the rooms to the overall beauty of the property this is hands down one of the best places we have stayed. They were very accommodating to kids which is always a plus for a luxury hotel, and although I expected a lot from their service they still managed to surprise and delight us during our stay. The food options on property include a wonderful place for breakfast called Motif, and we had a delicious dinner with many extra mini courses compliments of the chef at Stonehill Tavern. There is a relaxing lounge area with a fireplace that was great for grabbing a drink. The property also has an amazing spa and fitness center. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and have a greater affinity for St. Regis as we plan future vacations.
Manager Response: Dear Lailee L,  Thank you for such an amazing review! We are so glad to have exceeded your expectations! Your compliments will be passed along to our team. Thank you for staying with us, and we look forward to welcoming you back to the Best Address soon!

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels in Southern California
Summary: Made an escape to the St. Regis Monarch with the wife.  The pool service was extremely top notch, towel service, punctual, responsive pool service.  sunset view on the bar patio was absolutely amazing.  Breakfast and lunch out in the spectacular courtyard were times that will never be forgotten.
Manager Response: Dear Philp N,   Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write such a wonderful review! We are so glad that you enjoyed the pool and our dining options. Please come back and see us again soon!

Summary: Beautiful resort all the way around!  The grounds were kept perfect.  Very nice pool area.  Rooms were clean and spacious.  Staff was very professional and courtious.  Definitely everything you would expect from a 5 star resort.  Of course, be ready to spend some money while you're there.  It's not cheap!
Manager Response: Dear alwaysreadyfortravel,  Thank you for a great review! We will pass along your compliments to our team and hope to welcome you back to The Best Address again soon!

Summary: My bf came down to visit me for the weekend (long distance relationship) and I wanted to surprise him to a one night stay at St. Regis in Dana Point. This is our first time staying at this property and at St. Regis. Oh boy, it was worth the splurge. Ariel who checked us in was very friendly and professional. She was able to accommodate our early check in and late check out. We were also upgraded to a larger suite (I'm a SPG gold member). The bathroom is super huge especially the tub, shower and closet! We had a butler name William (Bill) and he was awesome (way too awesome!). He's very attentive and charismatic. He told us about the champagne toasting at 4pm I believe, but we just missed it when we arrived. He probably saw us bummed out, so we went out to grab dinner at Eva's
Manager Response: Dear Donna D,  Thank you for such an amazing review! We are so glad to have exceeded your expectations. Your compliments will be passed along to Bill, Ariel and the rest of our team. Thank you for choosing to stay with us; we look forward to welcoming you back to the Best Address this summer!

Summary: I recently stayed here for a quick get away, and really loved the property.  The grounds were beautiful, and the heated pool was really nice.  The staff was very attentive, and the butler service was a nice touch.  We luckily got upgraded to a better "view" room, but since the ocean is pretty distant, I don't think paying for an ocean view room is worth it.  The folks at the front desk were very polite and extremely helpful (even personally escorting me to different areas of the property!).  Only downside was at the restaurant.  We wanted to have a romantic night out on the terrace (where no one was sitting b/c it was too cold) and pop a bottle of champagne that we brought ourselves.  The lady at the restaurant said we could do that, but they would charge us a $35 cork fee -
Manager Response: Dear AtlantaDvd,  Thank you for choosing to stay at The Best Address and sharing your experience with others! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay overall and that our staff exceeded your expectations. We apologize that your experience on the Motif patio was not up to standard; we will pass along your comments to our management team. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary Heading: Average to me feels like a big glitzy Vegas hotel
Summary: To me, this doesn't compare to the ritz which is just glorious or the beautiful montage. It is a big splashy hotel which feels very large and a bit overwhelming and feels "Las Vegas like". The rooms are admittedly large and nice but something left me cold and just not overly impressed. It does not feel five star at all in my estimation....the furnishings lack the refinement I have gone to expect from a fine five star hotel.
Manager Response: Dear fabfinds,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are sorry that your recent stay with us did not exceed your expectations. Please know that we strive to keep the grounds and rooms in five star condition while maintaining a five star level of service. We hope you will consider visiting us again, so we can change your feelings about our resort and truly exceed your expectations.

Summary: This was our 2nd time at this property. We are an East Coast family that loves So. Cal; in particular, Orange County. The hotel and property are excellent. We were here 5 years ago and they have done a great job maintaining the property. Monarch Beach is beautiful and secluded. You do have to take a tram to get to the beach (more on that later) but it's not a long walk considering the great weather. The rooms are not 5 stars but they're very nice. Stonehill Tavern was outstanding and the service was wonderful. I'd highly recommend dining at the restaurant even if you are not staying at the St. Regis.  Now for the negatives. This isn't a 5 star resort in terms of service or attention to details. We have been spoiled at several 5 star resorts and the difference between 5 stars and
Manager Response: Dear Chris D,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to share your experience with others online. We are glad to hear that you enjoy the hotel and the local Monarch Beach area, however we apologize that your entire stay did not meet your expectations. We will share your feedback with our management team to ensure that these areas are corrected. Please know that these incidences are not typical of a stay with us and we hope to welcome you and your family back again to truly exceed your expectations.

Summary Heading: Can't say enough good things about this hotel!
Summary: We recently stayed at the St. Regis Monarch Beach with our kids (4.5 and 1.5) and my parents.  We had a St. Regis Suite which was very spacious for four and my parents were in a standard king room.  We were incredibly impressed with so many aspects of the hotel - the terrific service (everyone was wonderful including valets, bell staff, housekeeping, front desk (Monica is terrific!), pool and beach staff, restaurants (Motif was great for our daily breakfasts and Monarch Bay Club was a really nice lunch on the beach), and also the beautiful grounds and rooms, the fantastic beach (even on a "cold" (70-75) day it was great), and the multiple heated pools that our kids loved (separate toddler AND kids pools in addition to the larger adult pool).  I had a few requests (fridge,
Manager Response: Dear ssschgo,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write such a wonderful review! We are so glad that you could enjoy all the hotel amenities and will be sure to pass along your compliments to Monica and the rest of our staff. We look forward to welcoming you and your family back again!

Summary: This is by far the cleanest hotel I have been to.  I have stayed at many 5 star hotels before, but this one has gone above and beyond when it comes to cleanliness.  The room decorations are a little too old school for my taste, but the cleanliness makes up for it. Room service was also excellent, food was hot when it was served, and they pick up the tray right away when you ask them to!
Manager Response: Dear J W,   Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience with others! We are so glad that you enjoyed your room, dining experience and overall stay at the hotel. Please come back and see us again soon!

Summary Heading: Could have been a much better experience with just a little more humility.
Summary: I'm completing a preferred level # of visits for 2013 and thought this would be a nice treat for my birthday. It ended up being a lesson in lowered expectations. Hotel itself and rooms where as expected for a St Regis. What was severely lacking was the level of customer service and preferred level treatment. Paid a lot & got snobby front desk personnel with no hospitality. I would have been satisfied with the expected basic  level of service at an Embassy suites, which would have beat this "St Regis", If I had to do over again I would have used my time and money ($$$$) at another chain that would treat me better as a preferred frequent client. Disappointed
Manager Response: none

Summary: Visited the last week of 2013 and was surprised by the lack of service and general disorganization of the hotel.  The adult pool has the strong salty taste of urine and the Motif restaurant was poorly staffed.  Birds descended on nearby unbussed tables as we ate lunch outdoors.  It was three-star hotel service disguised as a five-star hotel.  Was very disappointed given the price.  The gym and the room was very nice, however.
Manager Response: Dear asconded,  Thank you for your recent stay and taking the time to post your review. We sincerely apologize that your stay with us did not meet your expectations. It sounds like you ran into quite a few challenges, please note these incidences are not typical of a stay with us and If you feel there is anything we can do to correct this please reach out to our Executive offices at 949-234-3301.

Summary: We stayed at this property on Dec. 24th & 25th, 2013.  Room was excellent.  Really large, and a very roomy bathroom, with lots of storage.  Even had a separate room for the toilet.  Closet space was more than adequate.  Could sit on our and admire the Christmas lights in the evenings and beautiful sunsets.  We had dinner at The Monarch Bay Club on the 24th.  Ambiance a bit lacking, but our waiter, Sam, was one of the best we have ever had!  He was there, but yet not hovering.  And was quick to settle a bit of a problem we incurred.  The food was delish, with a huge piece of prime rib!.  Breakfast in Motif both days and again a wonderful waiter, Dan, both mornings.  Even offered coffee to go when we were finished our meal.  Dinner at Motif on Christmas was a bit loud as they
Manager Response: Dear jstPoway,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review and for choosing us for your holiday getaway. We are so glad that you enjoyed your time with us and look forward to welcoming you back again!

Summary Heading: Mixed feelings: Great property with guest experience misses
Summary: We had two rooms for two nights to celebrate my Dad's retirement.  This property has a lot going for it but unfortunately there were some memorable aggravations.    The good stuff: - Pristine grounds and building - SPG Platinum upgrade for both rooms to side by side Exec Suites - Rose petals, champagne and chocolates setup in my Dad's room when the Butler's assistant learned it was a trip to celebrate retirement (amazing!) - Great fitness center - Monarch Bay Beach Club is a treat and the beach is quiet and picturesque - Valet service, though pricey, is reliable, quick and friendly  The bad stuff: - SPG allows you to book up to three rooms under your Platinum benefits but then dictates that you can only select the continental breakfast as your free amenity for one room. - When I
Manager Response: Dear johnruda,  Thank you for your review of your recent stay with us! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your rooms and your butler’s assistant, however we sincerely regret that the rest of your stay didn't meet your expectations. Your comments will be shared with our Executive Team to ensure this type of guest encounter is not repeated. If there is anything we can do to correct the situation and your feelings about the resort, please contact us at 949-234-3301.

Summary Heading: But nothing to bring us golfers back
Summary: We got what we paid for. 4 nights for the price of three and an upgrade due to SPG card. The extra large room was lovely with a nice big bathroom and walk in wardrobe.     I have mixed feelings about the butler service ...our morning coffee and biscotti arrived on time but on the first night our toilet pump kicked in every five minutes...no sleep there. We mentioned it to our butler the next morning  but by 7 pm it still had not been fixed.  To be fair a second Request fixed it, pronto and thoroughly.  A request for ice another evening took two calls. We were told about the St. Regis sundown champagne (sparkling wine) ceremony ( look it up) but not informed that to taste it you had to be there early to get in the draw to win a taste and contrary to the blurb (which I looked up)
Manager Response: Dear Cassandra595,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review of the resort. We apologize your stay with us didn't meet your expectations. Our team always strives to keep the grounds and the rooms in five star condition, we regret your experience didn't reflect that. We will share your experience with our Management Team so we can avoid these guest encounters in the future.

Summary: Our experience was very bad and the management staff extremely disappointing. My family stayed for 5 days in August as a American Express Platinum card member and we booked through American Express Platinum travel services. We booked a suite for 4 adults $750+ per night and had a room with a butler service. They took us to our one room executive suite and there was one king size bed only.  They offered to give us one single roll away bed but said due to fire code 3 people must sleep in the king bed or one could sleep on the floor but refused to give us a 2nd roll away.  A manager would not speak with us nor was anything done to make up for their mistake. The hotel was booked no other room available so we decided to make the best of a bad situation, enjoy our family time and
Manager Response: Dear Mark F,  Thank you for your recent review of the resort. We are very sorry to hear that you had such an unpleasant experience. Should you choose to return to the St. Regis Monarch Beach, we urge you to call ahead and let us know of your room preferences so we can ensure that you book the best available room type that will exceed your needs. We invite you to reach out to our Executive Office at (949) 234-3301 if you would like to discuss your stay further or if you feel there is something further we can do to rectify the situation.

Summary Heading: Lovely weekend but not five star
Summary: Location is amazing!  Although we had an ocean view room... one of the best ocean view rooms... and unless it was a clear day I needed binoculars to see the Ocean.   We were in a king executive suite; the bathroom was amazing!  oversized tub, large walk in closet, spacious shower.  The room also was beautiful-- although I would have preferred more deck area, with french doors instead of a single door that only stayed open if it was blocked by a chair.   The staff was terrific, very accommodating, anxious to please. We do not consider it a five star hotel because: turn down service never happened, I had to call every night and request turn down service.  We requested two news papers and coffee every morning  (provided complimentary by the butler service) four out of five mornings
Manager Response: Dear mskatia1,  Thank you for your recent stay and your review of the resort. I sincerely apologize for the challenges you experienced - all of your comments will be shared with our management team, and our Director of Housekeeping, to ensure this experience isn't repeated. If you feel there is something further that can or should be done, please reach out to our Executive Offices at 949-234-3301. We hope you will change your mind and allow us to welcome you back again.

Summary: We went just for one night mid-week. We were provided a complimentary executive suite upgrade and the room was just fabulous - much nicer than our stay 3 years ago over New Years Eve. And the suite came with a butler - who was extremely nice and accommodating. We were impressed to say the least. We had dinner at the Monarch Bay Club on the beach and loved it! The food, service and, of course, the sunset were top notch. We had breakfast the next morning at Motif and, once again, everything was superb. We would highly recommend this property - and I suspect we will be returning at least one or two times each year.
Manager Response: Dear JD1946,  Thank you for your wonderful review! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and had a pleasurable experience at both the Monarch Bay Club and Motif. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: The hotel was absolutely wonderful. Our trip included a wedding that was awesome. The staff was especially helpful and great to work with. Nice setting for a wedding and visiting out family. Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear David R,  Thank you for sharing your experience with others online. We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I would like to express how beautiful and magical the St. Regis Monarch Beach is, and how wonderful our stay was from start to finish.   We arrived and Guest Services was absolutely wonderful, Pei Lun Lee was an absolute delight as well as Gundula Reile (Chef Concierge). Everyone was fully aware of our wedding and ensured that we had everything we needed. They went above and beyond what we could have asked for.   Our reception at Stonehill Tavern was absolutely stunning, from Chelsea our Coordinator (which I worked closely with) made it extremely easy and ensured that our room looked magical and everything was placed as I visioned it. From the tapers on the table, to our rose pedals and most importantly, our cake. A special thank you to the Pastry Chef and also a special thank
Manager Response: Dear Virginia K,  We are honored that you chose to spend your most important day with us, and are happy to know that you enjoyed every minute of it! We will pass along your compliments to all of our associates you mentioned. We hope to welcome you back for your first anniversary!

Summary: One of the prettiest hotels I've stayed at, anywhere.  I'm not a golfer,but that course was very impressive.   The Pacific ocean is a short walk away and the adjacent beaches are great.  Sitting on the edge of the pacific makes for some really outstanding sunsets, and we saw a couple.  The resturants were excepetional and the food was five star quality.  The pool and the surrounding grounds are breath taking.  Can't imagine what could be done to make this setting any prettier.  The outdoor bar/lounge is quite nice and the service is expectional.  It seems to be loaded with staff to ensure guests are treated well and the service is beyond reproach.  The rooms are very very nice; however, the open view of the very impressive bathrooms isn't my style - I would prefer a little
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of the nicest places that we have ever stayed.  The staff is excellent.  The rooms are top rate.  The views are absolutely gorgeous.  We loved sitting outside and just enjoying looking out at the golf course and the ocean.  The sunset champagne ceremony was also a highlight.   We were forced to stay an extra day due to bad weather at home and couldn't have been happier!
Manager Response: Dear Jeff C,  We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with others online. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Absolutely worth the extra money!  I'm here on business and have been here twice now.  Service is a+.  The views are breath taking!  I will come back again and again!!!  Golf course, pool area and grounds are perfect.  Close by a lot of shopping as we'll.  they also have a private beach area.
Manager Response: Dear Sondra C,  Thank you for taking the time to review us! We are so glad to hear that you have enjoyed your stays with us in the past. We look forward to welcoming you back many more times in the future!

Summary Heading: Great location views and tree lighting
Summary: 5 star experience. Even tho they could not get the room refrig to work.  Nice beach, However.....silly $25 Day charge for internet, very overpriced food and drink... And an automatic 18% tip with room to add even more if you do not catch the automatic charge. But that may be the reason for the very very empty hotel. Rich people are not all stupid people.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms very comfortable and well appointed. Great breakfasts. Dinner at Stonehill was seriously disappointing with luke warm over cooked $55 steak that had to be sent back. Turkey burger terrible and stayed under the lights too long....very dried out. Coffee shop staff outstanding. Does not have the location or service levels of Montage or Ritz but at $100 less per night it is a great alternative.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The sunday champagne brunch is a must !
Summary: We had our first experience with the brunch today and highly recommend it.  Lot of choice and every thing we tried, from the shushi to the fabulous desserts, was no less than excellent.  We were two couple and had the advantage of a table on the veranda - the view from there is spectacular.
Manager Response: Dear mitaine4,  Thank you so much for your recent visit and for sharing your wonderful brunch experience with others! We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed our Sunday Champagne Brunch in Motif and the beautiful views which the veranda offers. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future!

Summary: My husband and I booked this hotel for a stop over in California for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon in July. It looked so luxurious and grand. However, we were very disappointed for the following reasons: - We had the worst 'upgrade' which was a room on the 1st floor, at the back, in the corner, with a view of a big plant outside - We were gifted with warm white wine in our room as a welcome gift - Parking is not cheap - The daily resort fee is extortionate for what you actually get - The pool was not inviting at all  Overall a real downer to the start of our honeymoon.
Manager Response: Dear PJR1980,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review of the resort. We sincerely apologize your stay with us was not up to your expectations. Your comments regarding your room and welcome gift will be shared with management as to avoid these experiences in the future. If you feel there is anything further we can do please reach out to our Executive Offices at 949-234-3301

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at the St. Regis, Monarch Beach Resort. The scenary is so beautiful it's almost magical. Amazing sunsets over looking a rolling hills golf course then ending with  ocean views as far as the eye can see. Whether you are dressed up in a ballgown to go to a banquet or dressed in shorts and flip flops to go relax by the pool, you never feel out of place here. The staff's service was above my expectations. My daughter and I went to the Motif restaurant and she told the waitress her favorite foods were goldfish cracker's, cookies and apples. The next day, after enjoying a day at the beach, we were surpirsed to find goldfish crackers, cookies and apples waiting for her in the room. That just made her feel so special. The beds were so comfortable it was hard to

Room service food arrived hot and delicious. One down side was the concierge arranging our car service. The car was late at the airport when we arrived and came at 7:30 am instead of 7:30 pm. Additionally, we were able to sneak into Dana Point for a dolphin-watching trip and were able to see just how nice this community is as well. There was plenty to do for couples with or without kids.  This is a must-see place to stay and vacation.

Everyone was so nice from the bellmen to waiters/waitresses in the restaurants.  The property is just gorgeous and well maintained! Down to every detail, it's just beautiful!  The pool is gorgeous with plenty of chairs.   We received a rose, chocolate covered strawberries and champagne in our room one evening b/c  it was our anniversary; frankly I don't even remember mentioning to them it WAS our anniversary. All to say we will be back!
Manager Response: Dear bulldogfan75 Thank you for sharing your special occasion with us! Congratulations! Thank you for taking the time to post your review and we await your return.

Summary: I enjoy the St Regis in New York and while traveling to CA booked a room at this hotel. It is worth every star and more! The rooms were pure luxury!  It is a hike to the Ocean, but worth it! the scenery is awesome!
Manager Response: Dear diann w Thank you for taking the time to post your review and for your recent stay with us. Please come back and visit us again soon! Safe travels!

Summary: We stayed there over Labor Day weekend. One of the finest and most beautiful resorts  ever.  Our room facing the golf course and ocean was spotless with a nice balcony to enjoy the view and morning coffee.  The beach area was lovely.  The staff sets up chairs and  umbrellas and there are drinks and food right there .  The shuttle is a short , pleasant ride through the golf course.  Anyone who complains about that (I read one review that said "I am not a shuttle person ") must be a real snooty sort.  The resaturants Motif  and Stonehill were great and the staff were uniformly nice and responsive.  What's not to like ?
Manager Response: Dear homerluvsduff Thank you for taking the time to post your review of our resort. We are thrilled you enjoyed your holiday weekend with us- including our short ride down to the beach, please come visit us again soon!

Summary: I pretty much live on the road! I have either platinum or gold status at all three major hotel chains. I usually call the platinum reservation numbers and usually speak with nice, helpful people. Christina Boucher stands out amongst the rest! She is above and beyond friendly and helpful, from everything from finding good room rates to booking spa treatments to dinner reservations. I will be staying at the St Regis this weekend and after speaking with Christina, I have high expectations! I will update this review with information regarding the actual stay, but I really wanted to comment on the wonderful first impression that I have with this hotel. :)
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer G. Thank you for taking the time to post this wonderful review of one of our associates. We look forward to hearing your review of your upcoming stay. If there is anything we can do to anticipate your arrival please reach out to our reservations team directly at 949-234-3900.

Summary: All the amenities you can think of in a single property, tennis, golf, pools, private beach, and a variety of dining options that will satisfy the most demanding foodie (watch for your wallet though).
Manager Response: Dear maximosaravi- Thank you for the wonderful review and your recent stay. We look forward to your return.

Summary: Wonderful time. Great for families. Maybe can't handle full capacity as pool ran out  of towels. Rooms are very nice but carpets need refreshing. Have kid programs some evenings.  Need to take a small bus to the beach but it runs often enough.
Manager Response: Dear Bunkbed21- Thank you for taking the time to post your review and for visiting our resort. We do have kids club year round and offer children's activities during the summer months – s’mores and story time for example. Please come visit us again soon!

Summary: First of all this hotel is NOT on the beach.  We booked this trip through American Express Platinum and had all the perks of Amex, however, the hotel did not give us the complimentary upgrade.  Was a bit disappointed.Ths hotel is built into a hill so you enter on a high floor and go down.  A bit getting use to but after a few day you get it. The room was large and lovely but faced a field.  Was disappointed again.  The best view off the hotel is the outside dining area where they serve their breakfast buffet. Actually there was also another area off the back of the hotel that had outside seating and fire pits that was really beautiful.  I believe it was on the floor below the restaurant.  There were at least 4 weddings over the weekend which was why the hotel was so crowded.
Manager Response: Dear charlotte55 Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for your recent stay. You are correct we are not directly on the beach but just a short tram ride away. Thank you for the kind words about the Lobby Lounge Terrace (with the fire pits) and Stonehill Tavern, located on the fifth floor. Your comments will be shared with our team and we hope you will visit again soon to experience our five star spa. Happy Travels.

Summary: I have stayed at this property 3-4 times over the past several years and only have one complaint - check in process.  It seems each time I visit this hotel, I have arrived around 4 or 5 pm, expecting to check in to my room, but each time have had to wait at least 45 minutes to an hour while they "get my room ready".  This is an enormous property, but if you say check-in is at 3:30, all rooms should be available for check-in at 3:30.  If not, it would be nice to get a phone call at the very least, giving me a heads up that we cannot check in on-time and give me a time that the room will be available and stick to it.  It is also frustrating, that while I sit waiting for my room, others who were in line behind me are being given their rooms with no problem.  If management could fix
Manager Response: Dear Katie F. Thank you for taking the time to post your review of the resort, and thank you for being such a loyal guest. Your comments about your delay getting access to your room will be shared with the management team as well as your helpful suggestion for a call if the room will be late. We appreciate the feedback and will consider such a measure for future. Warm Regards!

Summary: Quite an restorative experience for our family  with "at your service" attitude among the staff. We were spoiled by their "can-do" attitude, friendliness and European style service. In the suites, we had butler service who arrived with morning coffees. At the pool, several attendants opened doors, fluffed seats, rearranged guests, etc with a pleasing attitude.  The rooms were spacious and well appointed with luxurious bathrobes, and oversized  bath towels.  Beach was accessed by a shuttle, and gold was located at the resort. It was a relaxing get-way in an easy to get to location.  We also tried the Stone Tavern which had a sumptuous, gourmet tasting menu, featuring organic fresh veggies and locally sourced bites.  The terrace bar gets very hectic at sunset, and service is less
Manager Response: Dear SleeplessinSEA - Thank you for your review and recent stay. We are pleased you were able to relax and unwind. Your comments about the service in the lounge will be shared with the manager for consideration. We hope you come visit again soon - we look forward to it!!

Summary: The resort is breathtaking, the facilities are impeccable, the rooms are heavenly and the service is all that is should be and more.  We came for a weekend getaway from LA and I never wanted to leave.  The beds are so comfortable, the bathtub is my idea of heaven, and every detail has been thought of.  An interesting bonus:  the pool is open 24 hours!  We brought a bottle of Champagne to the jacuzzi one night and we could relax in the heat while listening to the ocean and looking at the stars.  We will DEFINITELY be back.
Manager Response: Dear AdrienneLJ Thank you for taking the time to post your review of the resort. This sounds like a wonderful way to spend an evening - we welcome you back!

Summary Heading: Nice property but service, not so much...
Summary: I went down here with friends for the Labor Day weekend. I get it that the place will be packed, so I will be kinder than I would be on a normal weekend. We were allowed to bring the dog for a hefty fee of $150 but they did bring the dogs some beds and bowls.   The room was spacious and well appointed, BUT there wasn't one hook or towel bar to hang your towels. I guess they aren't interested in saving water, but even still I hate having towels thrown on the floor for the maids that aren't coming. Beds were comfortable, plenty of pillows, and room to move around in. Nice patio. We asked for a room above the first floor, but didn't get it. We moved on.  We wanted to head to the beach or pool. We were told there were no chairs or even towels at the beach. When my friend headed to
Manager Response: Dear Jenbirdistheword- Thank you for taking the time to post your review and thank you for choosing us for your holiday weekend getaway. We sincerely regret that your stay didn't meet your expectation. As a policy we always try to keep our guests with pets on the first floor for ease of entry and exit, we are sorry our reservations agent didn't make this clear when you booked your reservation. Your comments about the pool, beach and food and beverage will be shared with our management team to avoid this type of situation in the future. If you feel there is anything further we can do please reach out to our Executive Offices at 949-234-3301

Summary Heading: Underwhelmed due to Under-Staffing... but Salt Creek Beach is Always Family Fantastic
Summary: Let me preface with the fact that we are local, love the property, have stayed here before, and this is not only my go-to Spa (Spa Gaucin), but one of the best spas I've experienced world wide. Second, we just had an amazing vacation at the St Regis Bahia Beach in Puerto Rico, and so I do not want to poo-poo the chain. But, I also need to let management know that we were disappointed with our stay, and would be hard pressed to return for an overnight staycation as we did this Labor Day weekend. We wanted to have a special afternoon with our son (age 5) and some friends, and so booked a room ($546 plus taxes, resort fee, $35 for valet) for a small king room, ground floor, no view except people toileting their dogs 10 feet from our lanai) so that we could have a casual day at the
Manager Response: Dear Courtney SC01- Thank you for taking the time to post this review, and choosing our resort to spend your special night with your family. As you have requested your review will be shared with management and the General Manager of the resort. Should you feel inclined to reach out directly we encourage you to contact our Executive Offices at 949-234-3301. Thank you for your loyalty to the St. Regis brand and our resort. We wish you well.

Summary: Loved staying here. It was our second time staying at this hotel and we enjoyed it even more than the last time. We were here for our wedding anniversary and had a fabulous romantic dinner watching the sunset over the beach from the Monarch Bay Club. We enjoyed everything about the resort, beach, pool, food and especially the staff. Next time we're bringing our golf clubs and dog. Looking forward to our next visit.
Manager Response: Dear GwendolynP Thank you for taking the time to post your review, and thank you for celebrating such a wonderful occasion with us. We hope you will come back to celebrate again next year!

Summary Heading: The Astor family would be disappointed
Summary: Check-in: I’m here to celebrate our 6-year wedding anniversary with my pregnant wife.  The plan is to stay Saturday to Monday.  I’ve been to several St. Regis properties around the world and they’re all fantastic.  I come in at 330pm on Saturday and find a long line (about 10 people to check in before me).  Finally, I make it to the front of the line after 15 minutes, and upon check-in, I’m basically told that while most SPG hotels have one or two platinum guests per night, this hotel has about 50 at any given moment.  Do you think you’re special for being a Platinum member?  Allow me to confirm that at this hotel, you’re not.  And they’ll remind you of that as you’re checking in.  Oh, and if that’s not enough, your room is not yet available.  Come back at 430pm, maybe.
Manager Response: Dear Joe T. Thank you for your recent stay and taking the time to post your review. We sincerely apologize that your stay with us did not meet your expectations. It sounds like you ran into quite a few challenges, please note these incidences are not typical of a stay with us and If you feel there is anything we can do to correct this please reach out to our Executive offices at 949-234-3301. Congratulations on the new baby we wish you and your family well.

Summary: The facility was obviously great, but the service was really the difference - once the check-in experience was completed.  As one of the critical reviewers noted, we could not check in until after 4PM, but they didn't page or call us, so we only found out by going back to the front desk.  I have little patience, so it wasn't a great start.  After that, though, it was great.  The rooms were what you'd expect in that price range...nothing more, nothing less.  However, the pool service and restaurants were very good.  Michael Mina's restaurant does a fried chicken - no breading or coating - just fried, that was one of the best dishes we've had anywhere.  I'll go back just for that.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place is flawless. Service,food, decor, were spectacular. There is nothing here that needs to be improved . Room is beautiful with such a comfortable bed. Lobby with the view of the pool, fountain and then the ocean beyond.I could go on and on. Could not go wrong here for family trip, honeymoon, business meeting.The coffee shop on property was the best coffee I've ever had. The chocolate shavings are specially blended by their pastry chef, really? This place goes overboard to make you feel like you are the only guest, even though it was full to capacity when we visited.
Manager Response: Dear Lovesbabies- Thank you for the great review, we hope you will come back soon so our Pastry team can spoil you again soon!

Summary: Made reservations 1/13 for a stay 8/13 and booked an executive suite at this resort. Were greeted by an unfriendly, unprofessional, condescending staff. Were unable to get into our room until 5:00 pm but were not notified the room was ready until we made another inquiry. The "suite" was a dark oversized room with few amenities. The next day spent the day at the main pool and returned to our room to get ready for a function at 5:00 pm just to find that the room had not been tidied and there were no clean towels. Upon calling the front desk three times, a curt clerk advised us the rooms could be cleaned until 4:30 and "we should wait for the cleaning staff". Left the resort early the next morning to avoid any further unprofessional treatment from the staff. A glitzy, but not
Manager Response: Dear atmdRedlands Thank you for your recent stay and your review of the resort. I sincerely apologize for the challenges you experienced - all of your comments will be shared with our management team, and our Director of Housekeeping to ensure this experience isn't repeated. If you feel there is something further that can or should be done, please reach out to our Executive Offices at 949-234-3301.

Summary: Just returned from our 5 night stay in Monarch Beach. We absolutely loved it. We traveled with our two young children and had a nice stay. Beautiful rooms, gorgeous grounds, fun pools for the kids (and the big pool seemed nice too) and the biggest surprise of all - an amazing beach. We had fun taking the tram down (only a 5-7 minute ride). You can also walk there if desired (10-12 minute brisk walk). Another big plus - kids under 5 eat free at breakfast and dinner at the Motif restaurant. Awesome!   Make sure you check your bill before you leave. We were charged $150 extra for a refrigerator that was only supposed to be $30 for the entire stay.   Also, I walked to the Ritz one day and it didn't seem as nice as the St. Regis.
Manager Response: Dear Islandhopper14- Thank you for your recent stay and positive review of the property. We hope you will come visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Great Family End of Summer Stay
Summary: Our family of 4 enjoyed a wonderful stay at the St Regis! The adjoining king and double queen rooms facing the lavish swimming pool also gave us ocean views from the balcony.  The rooms were fabulous - very comfy beds and many amenities.  Though the rooms do not have coffee makers, we secured one easily from housekeeping. Breakfast at the lovely Motif restaurant on site was delicious and there was a lot of variety at the buffet. We had a few dinners at the resort and room service - the food and service were all very good. I had a facial at the Spa and Sylvia was wonderful - very informative, gentle and skilled.  The health center offers all the exercise machines and equipment of any modern club as well as saunas and steam baths and jacuzzi and a lap pool.  The beach is accessed
Manager Response: Dear CK10538 Thank you for taking the time to post your review and spending your holiday weekend with us. Your kinds words about the staff will be shared. Please come visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Welcome To The Hotel California. Nothing Short of Luxury
Summary: Just returned home from our family stay for 5 nights at the SRMB. This is a beautiful, very upscale 5 star resort with beautiful grounds and scenic views. Every facet of this hotel is well designed to the very last detail. From the main entrance to the lobby area and bar lounge. The guest rooms are spacious and well designed with all the amenities you need. I recommend you request an interior room with the pool or resort view. Our room was located on the 2nd floor at the far end which is a very long walk down to 2 long hallways off the elevator. We got plenty of exercise. The good news is if you are going to the main pools there is easy access using one of the exit doors on the first floor. It took us a couple of days to realize that.   As you would expect this resort is mega
Manager Response: Dear BAS724-Thank you for taking the time to post this review, we are thrilled that you were able to experience so many wonderful resort amenities. Your kind words will be shared with the team. Please come back and visit us soon!

Summary: Great Room, beautiful site, but service delivered with a smile is not the same as good service.  The waiting line to check in was ridiculously long. The bell hop that took us to our room promised to bring our car up at a precise time. When we went for it, no one had any idea about it and we had to wait 15 or more minutes.  The server at breakfast took 1 minutes to bring us our coffee after requesting it and then brought the wrong breakfast afterwards. Things like this can make a resort stay not restful and relaxing like it is supposed to be.  I would try elsewhere. The dining at the beach front restaurant was pretty decent and the service there very good.
Manager Response: Dear Richard L Brown- Thank you for your recent stay and your review of the resort. We sincerely apologize that there were some uncomfortable matters encountered during your stay. I will share your comments with the General Manager and Management team. If you feel there is anything we can do further, please reach out to our Executive Offices at 949-234-3301.

Summary: Don't stay at a st Regis if you plan on complaining about the bill would be my advice to some people that have reviewed this hotel. Truly enjoyed my stay and I believe it's worth the stars and price. This and the Ritz are the class of the area by far.  Would dr sure come back. Pool was relaxing and not crowded at all.  Grounds were meticulously kept and our room was perfect and luxurious. We had a great seat for the Masters and great food in Laguna.  The terrace was the best place for a coffee and paper in the morning. Really great property.
Manager Response: Dear Traveling M- Thank you for your recent stay with us and taking the time to review the property. We couldn't be more thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and our concierge team was able to set you up with Pageant of the Masters tickets! We hope to see you again soon! Happy travels.

Summary: Just spent one nite. Don't really have anything bad to say.....it was just OK.  $25 "resort fee", ripoff, $35 parking and $24+ tip for 2 well vodka & sodas at the pool. I know it's a 5 star but if being overpriced means 5 star, The Regis is rite there. The staff was pleasant, the room was clean, ground floor looking out at a lawn and parking lot. We walked to the Ritz.......I'm sure it was as expensive, but it seemed much more worth it!
Manager Response: Dear Phil S.- Thank you for your recent response and stay with us. Thank you for the kind words about your room, staff and grounds. Although amenities can be expensive we always strive to add value to every guest interaction - your comments will be shared with our management team and if there is anything further we can do please reach out to our executive offices at  949-234-3301.

Summary: We happened upon the St. Regis in Dana Point by chance.  We are SPG Platinum members so we try to always stay at SPG Hotels.  When we arrived we were greeted by the door men who were so kind and quick with the bags.  We were greeted by David Kerr who asked us if we had ever stayed at this St. Regis before.  We said no, and with a big grin, he said "Oh, you'll be back".  Now I really want to emphasize our care by David Kerr.  This is a man who knows his job and even more important, loves his job.  He bent over backwards to make sure we had the best accommodations available.  Let me tell you, our room was spectacular.  The plush comfy beds, the marble bathrooms with all the fun toiletries, well stocked mini-bar.  It was fabulous.  We had planned to stay just the one night, but
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are Starwood platinum members, and really loved this property.  Fantastic layout, nice pool area, good views and great service.  Played golf twice and it was a fun course, in good shape.  Easy to get to via the tram. Concierge was quite good,  rented car on property and it was a breeze.  The beach is close by and the Monarch Beach Club is a great perk, right on Salt Creek beach, terrific restaurant, with a great sunset.  Service there was really good.  Nice health club at hotel.  Real comfortable room, and will get to only criticism now.  We arranged through the Starwood Concierge high floor room, 4or 5, with a nice view.  This was done several months before our trip. Instead got first floor not so great view.  The lame excuse we got was we checked in llate,(lost luggage ),
Manager Response: Dear Gary N. Thank you for your recent stay and your review of the property. We sincerely apologize for the challenges with your room and your lost luggage! I will share your comments with our on-site concierge team to find out how and why your reservation details were maintained so we can avoid this issue in the future. We hope you will visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Forbes and AAA want their stars and diamonds back!
Summary: I an truly say this might be the worst property we have ever stayed at.  This is anything but a luxury five star/five diamond resort.  It is run by kids who are still completing high school degrees.  We have had managers actually argue with us over things that were promised to us (and never received).  We experienced waiting in a 20 minute long line at the concierge because other guests were complaining about room services that were never received. We were given wrong information about the Pageant.  We were given towels at the beach that smelled like mildew and had actual holes in them.  We were charged for "Service" at lunch when it only consisted of being handed a plastic cup to fill at a water fountain. The manager rectified the situation by giving us a $50 food credit.  When
Manager Response: Dear Lovz2Travel- Thank you for your recent stay and review of the resort. We sincerely apologize that our resort did not meet your expectations - if you feel there is something further we can do to rectify the situation please reach out to our Executive Offices directly at 949-234-3301.

Summary: My wife and I wanted to have one last getaway before our daughter is born in two weeks. So we decided to have a little get away at the st regis in monarch beach. We actually got married here 4 years ago, so this place holds a lot of special memories. The staff here is exceptional!! Bianca was the woman that set up our weekend and checked us in. And she went to every length to make this weekend as special as possible!! she made our weekend just that much more amazing. My wife and I had to personally thank her for everything she did for us, i give her service and this resort the full 5 stars, i would give more stars if i could! .. i want to thank her and the rest of the staff there for just being so nice and helpful in everyway possible. Love the st regis! totally recommend this
Manager Response: Dear Drewguenther333,  We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with us! We will absolutely share you compliments with Bianca, and thank her for making your stay extra special. Thank you for such a great review, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: For our second visit to the St Regis....we knew what to expect.  A georgous property....an amazing welcome from the first rate valets....a line a check in and check out ....a great pool but a shuttle to the breach....never-ending hallways leading to beautiful large rooms...excellent housekeeping service but a lack of service at Motif restaurant.  We got it all and more.  Convention traffic but a quiet and first class spa.  The prices vary by the season. You can have a very special experience here....just know what the hotel is all about and you will enjoy.
Manager Response: Dear Renztem13,  Thank you so much for staying with us, and taking the time to write a review, it sounds like you were able to experience the entire resort while on your vacation! Come back to the Best Address Soon!

Summary: We stayed here to celebrate our five year anniversary this August.  The service was stellar and staff kept up with the high expectations we had upon arrival.  I worked in 5 diamond properties for years and was continually pleased with the name recognition, professionalism of staff, cleanliness and amenities throughout the hotel and Spa.  The room was beautiful but  the real gem was the bathroom!  I loved the view of the pool and partial Ocean view.  The best option for dining was the brunch.  I highly recommend that you enjoy this during your stay.  The Spa's Oxygen Facial was fabulous with real results in one treatment.  We also thoroughly enjoyed the pool area, staff and food options available during our time lounging poolside.  It was an ideal location for our trip!
Manager Response: Ddear KeriQSD,  We are so glad that you spent your Anniversary with us, and were able to experience so many of our amenities. Thank you for such a great review, and we hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Location.....just a couple of gripes
Summary: Stayed at this wonderful resort for 10 days. The rooms are wonderful, but the bathrooms have to be the BEST I have ever encountered anywhere. Service was great and friendly. The two three gripes - The choice of food in the restaurants is limited and overpriced, not worth eating at hotel, when there are fabulous restaurants nearby. The private beach area is poor in my opinion - no sunbeds, no waiter service and no beach bars etc. Lastly, the buffet is superb, however the toaster from 1975 is pathetic, and was laughed at my most guests, even when I complained they brought in another just as poor. The resort is stunning and ideal for a family holiday.
Manager Response: Dear Christian4,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review! We are so glad you enjoyed the guest rooms and bathrooms so much. Come back and see us soon!

Summary: My wife and I are currently at the hotel and checking out tomorrow Simply put our stay has been first rate! Check in was swift and as a SPG gold member reception explained our additional benefits. Our room was extremely comfortable and spacious as we would expect from this location. Gogi at the concierge desk was very helpful with restaurants (my wife is gluten free) and the restaurants she suggested really treated us extra special when a reservation was made by her. I wanted to note that lunch by the beach was very good ( three days of wonderful service) to the extent reception and our waitresses remembered our name. They also remembered (when I didn't even mention )how exactly I liked my fish tacos each day (unblackened)thanks Ashley and our other servers! I played a round of
Manager Response: Dear DGUTS,  Thank you so much for your sincere review! We will absolutely share your compliments with our General Manager. We are so glad that we could help you create so many positive memories at our resort! Thank you so much for staying with us and we hope to see you again very soon!

Summary: The thing that stands out about this property is the layout.  The main gust rooms are below the lobby area and flank it on either side.  Most of the guest rooms are below the lobby level due to the hillside entrance to the hotel.  It has all the usual St Regis quality rooms and service.  If you want to go to the beach, it's a healthy walk down the hill, which isn't marked very well or the valet guys will drive you down in a golf cart.
Manager Response: Dear Sticknrudder47, Thank you so much for staying with us, and taking the time to write a review. Thanks for the honest review, I will share your comments with our General Manager about adding additional signage for the beach, for future visits, see the concierge for a walking trail map. Come back and see us soon!

Summary: My wife and I were here for a 3 day meeting with several hundred other people, and it was great. Excellent service, good value for money, no glitches at all. Great location, lovely room [121, very quiet]. Great meals. Nice walk to the beach, were there were lots of happy families enjoying the surf.
Manager Response: Dear ksmithderm - Thank you for your recent stay and your kind words about the resort! And yes we agree sometimes a quiet garden or resort view room is just the ticket to a nice quiet stay.

Summary: This hotel personifies elegance, in a southern California maner. There is nothing  I would change at this property and not one experience that is less than amazing. You simply must visit this hotel.  From the time we entered the property there was the feeling of being transported to a slower time. The valet was amazing and took exception care of our GT2. The lobby is fabulous, and the desk staff is always attentive and very helpful. The butler helped set up our suite and we were free to enjoy the sunset.  The beach club is easily acceptable by the tram and surfing lessons were great.  The rooms we have had all had fabulous views, and the Sunday bruch is the standard from which others are judged. Sitting on a balcony, enjoying great food, looking out over manicured grounds into
Manager Response: Dear Charles V. Thank you for the review and recent stay. We look forward to your return! Travel Safe!!

Summary: Traveled with hubby to trade show and was fortunate to stay in this fabulously beautiful hotel!  The views from the upper deck towards the water were wonderful, especially with a Bloody Mary...LOL. They had a walking path that took you down towards the beach and was a nice break from working in the hotel room.  We will be back.
Manager Response: Dear karingkare- Thank you for taking the time to post this review. We couldn't be more pleased you were able to take in two of our signature experiences - the panoramic ocean views and one of our signature bloody marys! We await your return.

Summary: Okay, so I'm trying to release my "inner-travel-blogger-wannabe" here. This resort is located right on the cliff of Dana Point beach and is just magnificent! It features that 5-star, white-glove service right from the registration area. With all of the amenities, private beach access, and a host of other services, this place gives The Ritz-Carlton, of Dana Point, a run-for-their-money!
Manager Response: Dear milan_marie- Thank you for your recent review, we couldn't be more pleased in your newly found passion as a travel blogger. We welcome you back anytime! Thank you for the great review.

Summary Heading: Weather be damned, this place is Awesome!
Summary: Heard so much of the St. Regis, brought the Mrs last weekend for our 15th Anniversary. Somehow managed to come here on the only two cloudy, rainy summer days Dana Point has seen in probably 10 years. Although bummed out, we made the most of it.   Valet was very cool and took care of the car and bags. Greeted with Champagne upon entering the lobby, check-in was a breeze and was whisked off to our Ocean View Room. Good space in the room, stocked fridge, ton of amenities.   Bathroom is beautiful. Had a soak tub, sep shower, dual sinks. And a huge thing for us. EXCELLENT TOWELS! Not cheap, thin crap. But nice fluffy, comfy towels and wash clothes. Such an understated amenity.    Had a private balcony which we spent a lot of time on.   Bed was ridiculously comfy. We have a
Manager Response: Dear Bill B- Thank you for your recent stay and kind comments about our resort amenities and staff. We hope you will come back and visit us again soon, and for future the Lap Pool at Spa Gaucin is an adults only pool, no chance of an interruption during your 'kid-free' weekend. Come back soon we hope the weather will cooperate. Safe Travels!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Place with a Glitch or Two
Summary: The St. Regis is a beautiful resort, with luxurious grounds and beautiful facilities. I am here for a meeting and it was well-organized, the food at our private events was great, and overall I would rate this a five-star resort property . . . IF the service could be brought up a notch. I downgraded it to four stars because of a number of experiences with service where it just wasn't at the level expected for this kind of expense. For example, at our dinner party last night (about 200 people), the server forgot to serve coffee at our table of 8 people. Also, each night they put that wonderful little chocolate on the side table, but they would put only ONE candy there, when we had two people in the room! Lastly, when calling the front desk to ask for help with a room problem, the
Manager Response: Dear Lindaj99- Thank you for your recent review of the resort, we regret our service fell short of your expectations. Your comments will be shared with the team to ensure this type of issue doesn't occur in the future. If there is anything further we can do to make your stay more enjoyable please don't hesitate to reach out to us at 949-234-3301.

Summary: We booked our room 3 months in advance and highly anticipated our stay at the St. Regis.  Without a doubt, it was worth the wait and every penny spent.  Service was exceptional right from check in and throughout our stay. Our anniversary dinner at Motif was delicious- try the salmon!  The room was equipped with every amenity you may require-very thoughtful! The room was completely sound proof even with the numerous events right outside in the courtyard. 5 stars!
Manager Response: Dear Laurie L- Thank you for your recent stay and the rave review. Congratulations on your anniversary - thank you for spending your special day with us. Please come back and celebrate with us again next year!

Summary: We stayed here with our two young children, along with a connecting room for our nanny and her husband, who are in their mid-20's.    The Good:  The housekeeping manager was great and went the extra mile to go to the store and get some hypoallergenic was for the kids as my daughter had a skin reaction to the body wash.  The valet guys were extremely friendly and helpful.  The Bad: Our nanny and her husband were constantly questioned if they were staying at the hotel and what their room number was because they were young.  We were embarrassed and had to keep apologizing for the hotel staff questioning them on their behalf.  Ordering lunch at the pool took an hour for delivery and the food was subpar at best.  My wife was talking to the valet guys that we were going to Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear TheEarlOfTravel- Thank you for your recent stay and review of the resort. We sincerely apologize your stay with us was not up to your expectations. Your comments will be shared with our Executive Team to ensure this type of guest encounter is not repeated. It is our goal to make each guest feel welcome, if there is anything we can do to correct the situation and your feelings about the resort please contact us at 949-234-3301.

Summary: Husband here for a conference. Tagged along with our 10 yr old. Highly disappointed that the beach is closed due to a sewage leak!  You can sit on the beach and look at it but you can't swim or boogie board!  300' down the beach you can swim but you can't borrow any St Regis equipment to take down there.  What I am most surprised about is how silent the hotel has been on this issue.  No mention before we arrived, no mention @ check in. We just found out from the cart driver as we. Headed down to the beach.  Plus no one else in the hotel seems to know anything about it.  OC Lifeguards down the beach at Salt Creek are where we got our best info.  There was a definite sewage smell wafting up to the resort last night.  So, no beach, crowded pool, kids under 18 not allowed in mini
Manager Response: Dear s0j0urner Thank you for your post and your recent stay. We sincerely apologize for the challenges you experienced with your room key, and your disappointment with our children's menu. Your comments will be shared with our Engineering team and our Culinary team to see if there are steps we can take to address these comments. Unfortunately, with regard to the beach closure, this recommendation came from the city and it was for all surrounding beaches. The closure was 24-hours in total so some associates many not have been made aware - we regret this information was  not shared with you and your family prior to your departure to the beach, we understand the inconvenience this must have caused for you and other guests of the resort. We hope you will reconsider and return to the resort soon.

Summary: Save up your money or use your Starwood points but visit this resort.  It's spectacular!  Everything is done with class and taste but there are no pretensions. What's not to like?  The spa is first rate!  Private adult pool and spa if you choose - otherwise there are 2 other large, beautiful, family pools. Shops, restaurants, a cafe for snacks and/or coffee in the a.m. A short, nice drive from Laguna Beach, Newport Beach, and Dana Point. The wife and I loved the private beach at St. Regis. An electric cart would take folks to the beach where you could just walk and enjoy the Pacific Ocean.  The wife and I visited an hour before sunset, walked in the warm water, and watched the sun set.  Majestic! If you're a golfer, the course overlooks the Pacific - if tennis is your thing, you
Manager Response: Dear jsilletti- Thank you for the rave review and your recent stay with us. We couldn't be more pleased that you were able to enjoy all the wonderful amenities we have to offer. Your comments about Traci will be shared with all associates and managers. Warm Regards,

Summary: We were visiting Southern California and I thought we would be in for a real treat when we stayed at the St. Regis Monarch Bay.  We were quite disappointed, the service has deteriorated significantly from our last stay.  When we arrived in the late afternoon we were told by the front desk that our room was clean and ready but was waiting for "final inspection" before we could check in.  Two hours later, we were still waiting in the lobby and when I checked back the front desk told us that our room was still waiting final inspection.  At that point I went to the beach with our son and asked the front desk to call my husband when the room was ready. She wrote down his cell phone number and he stayed and waited. They never called him.  The staff left a message on my cell phone
Manager Response: Dear KauaiTeresa- Thank you for your recent post and stay with us, we apologize for the mix up that occurred during your check in, if there is a wait for a room we always attempt to be quick and attentive with our response. We regret that we mistakenly called your cell phone instead of your husband’s, if there is anything we can do to further fix this situation please call us directly at 949-234-3001. We hope you will reconsider a stay.

Summary Heading: Watch your bill for double charging
Summary: We have just spent 16 nights in the St Regis Monarch bay and checked in the week of July 4th. We decided because of the length of our stay to use the self parking so that we could come and go from the hotel at our leisure. How wrong we were. The hotel was understandably busy and car park was full so we used valet parking. After 5 nights I informed reception that I was no longer using valet and wanted to self park. However they started to double charge for both. $24 for self park and $35 for valet. I brought it to the hotels attention on 4 occasions but each time the next day the bill still showed a charge for both self park and valet. It wasn't about the money but solely the principle of being double charged for parking while being assured by the hotel that it would be sorted.
Manager Response: Dear Ciaran  Thank you for your review and your recent stay with us. Although we were able to correct your billing we apologize for the effort and length of time it took to get it corrected. We are in the process of changing our billing inquiry system to fix these issues. With regard to pets at the hotel there is a pet policy that is outlined to guests referencing that all dogs must be leashed. We will reinforce this policy with our associates to ensure they are aware and can correct a situation if needed. If you feel there is anything further we can do to please reach out to us directly at 49-234-3301. Your kind comments about Maria and the rest of your stay will be shared with our team.

Summary: A friend and I stayed at this St. Regis on a weekend when we had tickets to see Pageant of the Masters in Laguna Beach.  The hotel is situated away from the beach (not easy walking distance), but it is on a nice golf course.    I have stayed at St. Regis resorts before, and I was always so impressed by the level of customer service.  During check-in I was appalled at the poor customer service at this resort.  As we walked up to the desk there were two employees standing there.  One briefly glanced at us and left. The other woman was helping a couple who seemed to be having some type of problem, so she didn't address us.  We waited, with no acknowledgement from anyone at that point.  A man came from the office into the lobby and I thought he would address us.  He didn't, so I
Manager Response: Dear Renery- Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review of the property. We are pleased you found many of the amenities luxurious, and were able to enjoy the beach and the Southern California sun. Please except our deepest apologies for your front desk encounter, it is always our goal to make each guest feel special and welcome. Your comments will be shared with management and our associates. We regret we were unable to fix this issue while you were at the resort but if you feel there is anything we can do to correct the situation please reach out to us at 949-234-3301. Warm regards.

Summary Heading: Horrible service. Doesn't live up to the St Regis standard.
Summary: We just arrived at the St. Regis Monarch Beach and have been utterly dissapointed with their welcome. We arrived at around 3 pm and the check in line was  long and messy. Our room wasn't ready and the lady who checked us in was like a robot, not even apologizing once. We went to the beach club to wait for our room which was nice. I liked the beach club. When we came back at 4 pm, only one of the rooms was ready (we booked a suite with a connecting room) and once again, the check in lady did not apologize once. My husband went to the concierge to ask for a golf tee time, and instead of arranging one, she gave my husband the phone and asked him to speak to the golf club himself.  When we got to the room, the 'executive suite' did not have a separate sitting area like we were
Manager Response: Dear Bianca91173- Thank you for your recent review. We sincerely apologize that your stay encountered so many issues, this is not typical of our service standards.
