Your comments about the check in process, room readiness and your associate encounters will be shared with management, however if you feel there is anything we can do to change your mind about a return stay with us please don't hesitate to reach out to our Executive Offices directly at 949-234-3301.

Summary Heading: The views and proximity to Golf get this a 4 Star
Summary: Great views,Nice pool,easy location for golf. Once we get past that there are a few hiccups. The hotel is not easily marked and is difficult to navigate at times. Hotel and lobby staff were super.  We were in a group of 50-- first night 8 of us went to Motif Restaurant --  HORRIBLE service. 1:45 to get salads,3 hours total. One of us told them to forget his entree... We complained and were given a free drink. Later in the trip others had a similar experience. Food was average.
Manager Response: Dear Randy N. Thank you for your review and your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the challenges you faced in Motif. Your experience and comments will be shared with management to avoid this type of guest issue in the future. We hope you will visit us again soon.

Summary Heading: OK, but there are lots better
Summary: We have traveled extensively over the past few years, and have stayed in many top of the line hotels. I admit we are becoming "hotel snobs", but if this St. Regis wants to be compared to the very best hotels, they could be better.  We loved the lights that signal to make up the room or do not disturb - nice touch. The bathroom was lovely, as was the room. However, we were given a room that could not have been further from the desk....the very end of the NW wing, ground floor, no view, and no privacy unless you wanted the black out drapes closed all the time. And while close to the pool, we had to go all the way around to get in, or back in because the gate near our room could not be opened from the outside. That should be changed. Who do they think might go in there...guests???
Manager Response: Dear christineineden- Thank you for your review and recent stay. You comments about the pool gate will be shared with our engineering department, as the gate should allow access from the outside. We apologize for the inconvenience, but thank you for your kind words about rooms and grounds. In regard to the seaweed - the decision to keep it is not ours but is mandated by the CA coastal commission. Again thank you for the review and we look forward to a return visit.

Summary: The St. Regis Monarch Beach is an experience that everyone should have at least once.  The staff at this hotel is the most attentive that I have experienced anywhere.  My room was luxurious, the setting is magnificent and the facilities of the property lack for nothing.  I loved it...but I think you've figured that out by now.
Manager Response: Dear SL-from-IL: Thank you for visiting us and thank you for the review. Come back and visit us soon, as we believe you (and others) should experience our resort and its amenities more once. Warm Regards!

Summary: Like so many of us I am a frequent traveler, Starwood Platinum and have high expectations.  The property is beautiful overall.  The grounds, pools, golf course and views are spectacular.  It needs an update though.  The carpets are worn, doors with too many coats of paint, decor is dated, you get the drift.  I found a bug in my bathroom - disgusting.  Cell phones do not work in your rooms, or mine didin't.  I called to ask if this was normal and was treated so rudely I hung up.  Then I called and left a message to speak to the manager.  NEVER heard from him/her.  That is completely unacceptable.  Food is o.k.  You are paying for the views and grounds. Honestly I don't know the area very well but for this price this got to be something better out there.  I still can't over the
Manager Response: Dear Mcall1234- Thank you for your stay and your recent review. We apologize that your stay did not meet your expectations and would love the opportunity to discuss the challenges you encountered. After reading your review our General Manager specifically looked for your message and contact information but was unable to locate any communication from you. If you feel so inclined please reach out to the Assistant to the General Manager at 949-234-3301 or jamey.pilon@stregis.com.

Summary Heading: Best Family Beach Resort Experience Ever
Summary: Our family of 6 just spent 4 fabulous nights at this truly luxurious resort.  The grounds look and feel like a grand Italian Villa with marble on all sides, corinthian columns, massive flowing fountains, public areas filled with quiet sitting areas providing great views.  The rooms are large and sumptuously appointed -- our suite had a large balcony, marble bathroom and every feature possible.    Earlier reviews had mentioned problems with the shuttle service down to the beach but with one exception our wait time both to and from the beach averaged 5 minutes which to us was fine.  And by the way, Monarch Beach is the best family beach we've ever visited.  Here's why:  1.  The crescent shaped beach has beautiful and stunning rocky cliffs on either end making it very scenic.   2.
Manager Response: Dear Tim P. Thank you for your review of the resort - we appreciate the detailed feedback and look forward to your family visiting us again soon. I will share your comments about the closing time of the fitness center with our Spa Director for consideration. Please come back and visit us again soon. Warm regards to your family!

Summary: This was the second time that I have had the pleasure of staying at the St. Regis, Monarch Beach and I was wowed yet again.    The customer service was impeccable from start to finish and the surroundings were amazing.  As a Starwood Preferred Member, I was upgraded to a pool view room which I really enjoyed.  The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and the remainder of the facilities were to the St. Regis level of quality.    My only regret was that I had to go home.
Manager Response: Dear gbuford- Thank you for visiting us again and thank you for the review. We invite you back anytime! Travel safe.

Summary Heading: "So" different then it used to be
Summary: I write this review as a platinum ambassador VIP guest, I've stayed at this hotel no less than 30 nights in the last years and Mr. So the manager has definitely made alot of very good changes, but recently it seems the hotel has gone a little too far. This year we've stayed here a few times and I believe they've installed a few policies that I'm not so happy with. One and the most important for me is the 4pm late checkout, don't expect it at this hotel anymore even in low season with plenty of availability. This is the 3rd time this year I've not been able to get 4pm checkout, this last weekend I even got a sweet $100 fine letter per hour that I past noon checkout.  Another thing that I find consistent with this hotel is the inability to ever bill correctly, literally every-time
Manager Response: Dear stregis_11: Thank you for your post and your loyalty to Starwood hotels and resorts. Your comments will be shared directly with the General Manager. We do have specific check in and checkout policies to ensure all of our guests have a pleasant experience while they are with us, we accommodate all requests when we can – but sincerely apologize we were unable to do so with your requests. With regard to the beach wrack (seaweed) we are unable to remove or displace any of this natural living ecosystem in compliance with the California Coastal Commission - we are sorry you felt it was a disturbance. We hope you understand and will take these into consideration and visit us again soon. If you feel there is anything we can do to further accommodate a future stay or correct your most recent, please reach out to our General Manager directly at 949-234-3301.

Summary: We have traveled many times to this hotel as a couple and with our children and have loved it every time.  This trip was with children and another friend who came with her children.  We requested connecting rooms and we very glad the hotel could accommodate this request.   It really made the trip fun for the kids.  The adult pool is separate from the kids pool which is great as there was no problem with worrying about the kids making too much noise.  The service around the pool was quick and the staff was attentive.  We ordered room service several times and everything was delicious.  A wonderful top notch resort.  Recommended for couples as well as families.  There is shuttle service to the beach but it was a little chilly so we just stayed at the pool.    It's a large resort
Manager Response: Dear 4sunnyskies- Thank you for your review and your  recent stay with us! We welcome you and your family anytime. And you are correct do have three pools, our Lagoon pool which accomodates families nicely, our main pool for both adults and children and our Spa Lap pool which is our adults only pool for guests seeking a quiet reprive. Please come back soon to enjoy them all!

Summary: Don't get me wrong, the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are comfortable.  But for the money paid for the rooms, The Four Seasons or The Ritz has much better service.  Upon arrival, I was surprised by the amount of dogs on the property.  It must be a California thing.  Our room was lovely, until we stepped in a huge wet spot on the carpeting, and the smell of vinegar in our room.  Our guess was that a dog had an accident and it was tried to be cleaned by the guest before us.  Unless you were barefoot, you would not know the spot was there.  We notified the front desk, and were told there were no other rooms available.  They sent someone from housekeeping and comped us the parking fee and resort fee for our entire stay.  That was kind, but still there was dog pee in our room.
Manager Response: Dear PammyC22- Thank you for posting your review of our resort. We sincerely apologize about the condition in which you found your room. We agree this is not up to service standards for any resort, your comments will be shared with our Director of Housekeeping to ensure this type incident is not repeated. We are a pet friendly facility however we have strict guidelines and policy. If there is anything further we can do to correct this mistake please reach out to us directly at 949 234 3301.

Summary: The St. Regis Monarch Beach Beach is a gorgeous property with impeccable service and amazing rooms.  I was surprised at the extra attention they paid to our children.   Few hotels can compete with the overall package of the St. Regis.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Attended a wedding.  Facilities are gorgeous, but the dinner was so disappointing.  It felt as if the hotel threw 30 waiters into the room and said "serve these people."  The service was horrible!!! 3 - 4 guests at a time were served, then the balance were served in waves stretching 5-10 minutes for the balance of the table.  Awkward, as so many wanted to wait for everyone to be served.  Had to repeatedly ask for water, waiters were sloppy in the service reaching over people and bumping the person next to them.    Shocking considering how gorgeous the facility is.  What happened?  I would not plan a large dinner party here until they correct this.    Also, asked for a king bed, was confirmed at checkin only to discover two queens in the room.  As a result I am giving only 3
Manager Response: Dear Sharedexperiences- Thank you for your stay with us and your review of the resort. We are pleased that you found our facilities inviting and beautiful. We apologize for not meeting your room requirements and neglecting to make you feel special during the event you attended. Please know that delivering five-star service in all elements of the resort is our goal. If you feel there is anything further we can do please reach out to our Executive Offices at 949 234 3301.

Summary: This was my 5th time at the resort and it was my least favorite.  Stay there for a day or two every year when visiting Southern California. I'm giving it lower rating this time because the checking process was messy and long. We were given a lower value room despite booking a high value room and paying for it ahead. I hope next time the will fix the problem.
Manager Response: Dear Mohansen- Thank you for your loyalty to our resort, although we regret we were unable to meet your expectations with your most recent trip and we apologize for the delay at check in. Please be assured we fixed the errors that occurred with our check in process and we sincerely look forward to exceeding your expectations during future visits to Southern California.

Summary: It wasn't perfect, but the location was great and the rooms were huge. Its a nice stay for a family except that you have to walk far to almost everything. We don't mind walking, so that wasn't a huge problem for us. They just do some funny, unnecessary things though. Such as a butler service where a guy comes and gives you a bunch of brochures for activities you never asked about. I expect that in foreign places needing tourism, but not so much at the St. Regis in So Cal...Also, the general manager was there greeting people in the lobby which was a friendly touch, but then it took almost 30 minutes to get an ice tea by the pool...  I really like the beach area they have and its perfect for kids. They set up everything you need right there and the service was super sweet,
Manager Response: Dear Juls254- Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review of our resort. We are pleased you found many of the resort amenities to be beneficial - including Stonehill Tavern and Monarch Bay Club (our beach front restaurant). Your comments about the Pool Bar and Grill service and selections will be shared with our culinary team and perhaps we will exceed your expectations on all fronts for your future visits.

Summary: This hotel could not have failed any further.  From check-in to filthy room to terrible food and awful service.  Truly a bad mark for St. Regis.  Using other St. Regis hotels as a benchmarks - this is not only fair but sad.  Horrid waste of money!!!
Manager Response: Dear Shadas- Thank you for your recent stay with us, although we regret that your visit didn't meet your expectations. May I request that you reach out to our Executive Offices directly at 949-234-3301 so we may assist with your recent issues and possibly remedy any poor experiences you encountered? We hope to hear from you.

Summary Heading: great place to escape east coast in the summer
Summary: Beautiful hotel, the staff bends over backwards to be helpful.  This place is not cheap, but we did the buy 3 nights get one night free, because I always look for deals.  My issues are dumb!  If I pay more than $500 a night in room fees, then I think $35 parking fees and $25 resort fees, plus no coffee (unless you pay $3.75) are stupid.  All the restaurants are do overs,  Monarch Bay Club has excellent cheap fare ( we had tuna sliders, burger , hummus wrap, curry chicken salad,  plus dinner on our anniversary, a great sunset dinner).   Stonehill Tavern's fried chicken is over the top.  Golf was also fun and the hotdog on #5 not bad.  We were here for an anniversary and every time I mentioned we got royal treatment.  GM, my advise to you is replace anything worn (especially those
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were at this hotel for our anniversary weekend.  It is a gorgeous hotel, the rooms and the property are beautiful.  The service couldn't have been better - from the young men and women who served us at the pool, to the waiters and waitresses at each of the restaurants and the bar.  The concierge was extremely helpful, the guys getting our car for us, and the fellow who came to help with our luggage - everyone was eager to help and go beyond their jobs to make us happy.  It was delightful.  The only disappointment was that, in June, it is overcast for much of the morning, and sometimes there is no sun until later in the afternoon.  Of course, this is not the hotel's fault, but I would probably not go here until later in the summer. Also - this is a very busy place!  There was
Manager Response: Dear sharonn64- Congratulations on your anniversary, and thank you for sharing your special occasion with us! In addition thank you for the kind comments about our resort and our associates. It's a shame the weather was less than cooperative - we invite you to come visit us later in the summer or early fall for another summer escape.

Summary: When I go to a st. Regis hotel I expect the best and I wasn't disappointed at this location.  I was there for a short two day conference and everything went smoothly. For dinner I had one of the best steaks I've had in a long time.  The service was perfect and the hotel runs like a Swiss watch.
Manager Response: Dear jayg23- Thank you for your review and your recent stay with us, we invite you to come back for a leisure visit and perhaps stay longer to enjoy all of the amenities of our resort. Warm Regards!

Summary: We had a a really bad experience at this hotel. Reservation was booked five months in advance for our summer vacation. We have three kids under 10 and selection of hotel and room location is very important. When we arrived at 10 pm we were give rooms on the bottom floor at the very end of a long hallway. I requested new rooms right away, but was told hotel was fully booked for multiple weddings. I complained several times over the next two days and the hotel did nothing to fix the problem. Finally, we decided to check out after three nights and move to a real 5 star hotel.   My opinion is this hotel only caters to larger groups, weddings and corporate events. Vacation travels go somewhere else like the Ritz or Montage.
Manager Response: Dear WayzFam- Thank you for choosing us as your summer vacation destination - we sincerely apologize that your room location was not to your expectations. If there is anything we can do to further amend this issue please reach out to our Executive Offices directly at 949-234-3301. We try to attend to the needs of all types of guests, we hope you will reconsider and revisit us soon.

Summary Heading: Almost don't want to say how fabulous it is and keep it for myself!
Summary: We will be back St. Regis! What a lovely property! The rooms are gorgeous and spacious. The bathrooms are huge and the bathtubs are roomie! The little carts down to the beach are adorable. The private beach is SUBLIME! We had a private surf lesson for my daughter's birthday and she LOVED it! The food was wonderful. It's close to adorable Laguna (which we are dying to get back to soon so we can shop more!) The spa was SO lovely and all the staff was exceptional.  Every detail was attended to!  The sweet man who was entertaining at the piano even allowed my daughter (who is an accomplished singer and piano player) perform an Adele song one evening for all the guests!!! So memorable and exciting for her!   Cannot wait to go back!
Manager Response: Dear TexasKiss- Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review of the resort. It sounds like your experience was truly indelible and we look forward to welcoming you and your daughter back very soon. Your comments about the Spa and our Monarch Bay Club Surf Expert will be shared with the entire team. Thank you!  Safe Travels!

Summary: We booked using starwood points. From the minute we got there till the min we left we felt like we were in paradise! Staff A+++ Rooms A+++   we got a free upgrade due to the fact that it was slow.. and the rooms are spacious and home like     So happy we made this choice!
Manager Response: Dear Mo L. Thank you for your recent stay and your review of the resort! We are pleased you were able to experience the benefits of being a loyal SPG guest, please come visit us again soon.

Summary Heading: 4 p.m. check in policy and property thoughts compared to the Ritz
Summary: Booked a stay for a weekend at St. Regis in high wedding season.  Was headed to a wedding nearby after all!  Then, I had issues in advance of arrival with the check-in process.  The "reservation butler" contacted me by email to find out my arrival time.  I wanted to be on property at noon.  I was told that the policy is that check-in starts at 4 p.m.  Then, the day before, I recieved a phone call from the front desk that my SPG plat suite night upgrade would not clear and was told again that check-in is at 4 p.m.--I again said I would arrive at noon.  The delivery of the policy information was not the best.  So, I contacted the GM office to discuss that I understand the policy but that I felt that the staff was not giving the service that should be expected from a St. Regis.
Manager Response: Dear SPGwanderlust- Thank you for your review, your recent stay and your loyalty to SPG. We appreciate your understanding and insight and couldn't be more pleased that we are your hotel of choice during your visits to Orange County. Hotel activities tend to be a bit quieter in the spring and fall if you are looking to come back for another visit - until next time!

Summary: This is a delightful , wonderful , beautiful hotel. One should be privileged to be a guest . If you are the sort of the person who is going to start filing or taking photos of the rooms and the hotel then you really don't deserve to book here at  this hotel. This hotel  is for old money not new. Cant wait to come back.
Manager Response: Dear GavinChambers- Thank you for your recent stay and review of the property, please come visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Lived up to its reputation in every way
Summary: We came the St. Regis for our honeymoon just a couple of weeks before the summer season got into full swing. It was the absolute perfect time to visit as the staff was ramped up for the rush, but the rush hadn't yet arrived. We found a huge staff available at any moment for anything from the pool, to the golf course, to the restaurants.  The rooms are wonderfully comfortable with maid service in the morning/afternoon and then turn down service whenever you'd like. We had a courtyard view with a floor level patio. We ate breakfast out there every morning. The beds are heavenly. The bathrooms are luxurious. And then shined all my shoes for free!  The beach is minutes away. I recommend the tram, since when we walked it wasn't very well marked where pedestrians should go. There is a
Manager Response: Dear Eric T. Thank you for choosing us for your honeymoon stay and congratulations on your nuptials! It sounds like you found the perfect time to come visit, we couldn't be more pleased your stay was flawless. We look forward to your return... Insider tip: September and October are beautiful months to visit as well for the same reasons you stated above and the weather is impeccable!

Summary: An incredible haven of luxury  This property is awesome in location, service, facilities and overall ambiance. So far it is our favourite property in SoCal. We always return with pleasure and expectations. A relaxing place in one of the most beautiful places in USA. Location: incredible Views: stupendous Service: first class Facilities: amazing Spa: great most of the time Food: delicious, brunch unbeliveable  Last time I stayed there we felt the impact of the crisis on the property and all the foreclosure thing in cut-corners, and other small details that were missing comparing with our previous stays.
Manager Response: Dear ToniCTravelAmeniti- Thank you for your honest review of the resort and your recent stay. We couldn't be more pleased that you felt our service standards were five star. Please come back and visit us again soon!

Summary: This is my favorite place away from home. In fact, I love it so much that my SuperDream is to live in this hotel someday. The best customer service in the world, they make you feel like you are the only one in this magnificent hotel. The views, the smell of fresh coffee in the morning, the den with the fireplace...everything is PERFECT here. Forget packing, just arrive and be instantly adored. The beds are so comfortable, the rooms are stylish, the views great, the pool is SMASHING and it is open all night. I just cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel - I mean, home.
Manager Response: Dear Monicaleigh32- Thank you so much for the wonderful review, as a neighbor this means a lot to us! Our doors are open anytime. Hopefully one day your dream will come true :) Warm Regards, and see you soon!

Summary Heading: Nicest hotel I've ever stayed in
Summary: This hotel lived up to my expectations for luxury.  The rooms were clean and full of amenities and the linens were excellent, especially the bed linens...wow!  The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms spacious and clean, the balcony overlooked the grounds, the lobby, bar and restuarant were beautiful, and I can go on and on...this hotel really blew my socks off.
Manager Response: Dear Jennmelzer- Thank you for your review and recent stay with us. Come back and visit us soon - we love that we were able to exceed your expectations and 'knock your socks off'!

Summary: There is a lot of money in Orange County so you better be ready to receive the best.  There are many hotels in that area that are top notch.  SRMB is the leader.  They have the best location, best scenery, outstanding staff, and the beach is full service (like at the pool).  The food, hoever, was par.  It was good but it wasn't great.  Cosmetically, the hotel is emasculate with very high quality fixtures and furniture in the rooms and common areas.  Great place for star gazing.  I saw Heide Klum at the pool and they were filing an episode of Real Housewives of the OC right outside my balcony.  Service and ambiance are important to me and they nailed it.  I will always recommend this hotel.  Good on ya SRMB!!!  I can't wait to see you soon
Manager Response: Dear Modeljedi- Thank you for your recent stay and your great review! We couldn't be more happy that we are your first choice when visiting Orange County, and we agree a pool view or ocean view room are the best for viewing all the resorts activities - however if you are looking for a more quiet secluded visit we recommend a resort or garden view room.  We look forward to having you visit again soon!

Summary Heading: Stayed on Business - A Fantastic Stay, Hotel & Staff
Summary: I stayed here in early May to attend a meeting with business partners from around the world. The check-in process was warm, friendly and painless. I did try for a different room location but I was checking in a bit early so I went with the original location. Walked through the little rotunda area behind reception and enjoyed the weird echo and snippets of conversation that ping ponged around that room.  The room was a standard room with a King Bed but the overall quality of the "standard" would put 97% of other hotels upgrades to shame. Extremely comfy bed with plenty of pillows, a very nice desk setup with plenty of power outlets plus a very comfy office chair or a lounge chair for a bit more relaxation. The room also had a fridge so I could stash a few waters etc. for late
Manager Response: Dear diver90- Thank you for your recent stay and your detailed review of the property. We are pleased you were able to take in so many of the unique attributes of this special resort. I look forward to sharing your comments with our associates. Please come back and visit us soon.  Safe Travels!

Summary Heading: So Many Problems during Wedding Weekend....Avoid!
Summary: I recommend avoiding this hotel. I went there a few months ago with my fiance to celebrate her brother's wedding.   Boy was this stay a disaster...  First, the check in staff member started everything off on the wrong foot. Our reservation was under my future mother-in-law's name (ref. FMIL). FMIL booked several rooms under her name. The staff member called and confirm that we were one of the parties occupying one of the rooms (which is understandable). Unfortunately, Ariel inadvertently deleted the other reservations underneath my FMIL name . Upon my FMIL arrival, they told her and other guests that there were no rooms under the name. It took a substantial amount of time to correct their mistakes. Due to this delay, several key members of the wedding party were late to the
Manager Response: Dear TheGhostHost- Thank you for your review and recent stay, we apologize that your visit wasn't to your expectations. Please know that your check in experience is not consider standard for our resort and we regret this was your experience while on property. It sounds as if you reached out to our resort manager on duty already, however if you still feel there is something we can do to rectify the situation please reach out to our Executive offices directly at 949-234-3301. We hope you will consider visiting us again, so change your perception of our resort and truly exceed your expectations.

Summary: Great place. Never though "interior" resort views could look so good. Staff very helpful, gracious and friendly, from top to bottom. Was there for a large business conference, and the St. Regis team was always on the ball. Ordinarly double bed room very spacious. Huge bathroom. Also liked that there was an fitness pool separate from the regular pool. Also location is just about 3-4 long blocks from the beach. Easy walk. Taxi from Santa Anna Airport was about $90.
Manager Response: Dear GoDucks99- Thank you for your positive review of the resort, and your insider tip on room views! Please come back and visit us again soon.

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for our 29 anniversary. The personal service was the best we have ever had. Dave the butler was very helpful with all are needs. When we went to the pool there was a pool employee named Zack who was extremely polite. He left and when he returned he had a plate that said Happy 29th Anniversary with goodies on it. For him to go out of the way and do this for us was very thoughtful and personal. We would recommend this resort to everybody this place is awesome.......Thank You St Regis for a memorable stay.
Manager Response: Dear Roger B. Thank you for your post and your recent stay with us... and congratulations from the entire team at The St. Regis Monarch Beach on your 29th anniversary celebration. Your kind words will be shared with the Pool Team as well as with Zack.  Please come visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with beautiful suites..... and I love the Butler service
Summary: We enjoyed a beautiful suite with a lovely well appointed living room with a flat screen TV & large balcony looking over the resort. Our suite had two marble bathrooms both with showers.The ensuite in our bedroom with a huge marble bath tub.  Excellent Remede hair, bath and body products (and bath salts).  Gorgeous bedroom with an extremely comfortable king size bed.We also had a balcony off this room. Everything was emaculately clean and extremely quiet.  We we're greeted by our Butler at check in.What a great service, always ready to help, willing to un-pack and pack for you,arrange your reservations and help with directions. In the morning, with a quick phone call, coffee and biscotti's arrive. Extremely pleasant and accomodating Butlers. We went to both the pool restaurant
Manager Response: Dear Laurie M. Thank you for your detailed review and your recent stay with us. We apologize that you had to wait for your room to be ready upon arrival. Our check in time is 4pm, however we always try to accommodate all guest requests for early check in. Our front desk agents should have been more clear with approximate wait time for the room so you and your company could have enjoyed the surrounding area. Your comments will be shared with our Director of Rooms. We hope you will visit again and allow us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.

Summary: I recently stayed at The St Regis for a business trip.  I have to say the place is absolutely beautiful - but its also really huge. Its very easy to get lost and it took me a day or so to figure out how to get around the resort.  It was also fairly empty - which I thought was strange.  The service is absolutely top notch - everyone falls over themselves to help you. The room was beautiful - very tastefully is tcorated and every room has a balcony - which I enjoy. The only strange part is that its a challenge to get to the beach.  When you're in So Cal to be so far from the ocean is frustrating.  You have to take a "tram" which is really a covered golf cart - and the ride takes about 6 or 7 minutes.  If you are looking for a low key, quiet place I would highly recommend it. Not
Manager Response: Dear vacaalotnyc Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review of the resort. Although we are not located directly on the beach it is just a short tram ride away. As a guest you have access to our Private Beach Club while at the beach to eliminate the need to return frequently to the resort. Should you decide to visit with your children - may we recommend the Lagoon (our family friendly) Pool, it is great for children and even has a 1.5 foot deep children's pool.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, great stay, save it for the adults
Summary: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous, the rooms are great and spacious, the food was good, the pool was relaxing, and the spa was the best one I've been to at a hotel.  Outstanding massage and outdoor pool only for the spa.  All of this and my children want to go back to La Costa next year.  They don't mind the insanity of kids running everywhere and crowds angling to get a chair at the overcrowded kiddy pool.  They just remember the waterslide, lots of kid fun and lots and lots of kids.  It's like Disneyland, kids love it and parents tolerate the madness.  My advice is dont introduce your kids to La Costa and your kids will adore the St Regis....otter pops at the pool, s'mores in the evening.  My better advice is to save this resort for a grown up getaway.
Manager Response: Dear AmyG371 - Thank you for your post and your recent family stay with us! Thank you for your kind words about the spa we will share them with the team. And we hope you will return soon - either with your family or without, there are lots of amenities to please either scenario!

Summary: My husband, as a surprise, took me there for our 10 year Anniversary!  It was so posh and beautiful, breath taking and superb dinning, room, pools, cabanas, reasturants and much more.   It has its own private beach and the staff takes you down to the beach. We had room service and it was beyond my expectations, the Chef is well renowned and the food was delightful! The rooms are exquisite and very clean, modern, comfortable and romantic. Golfing and sea side view!  Highly recommend going at least once in your life.....:)
Manager Response: Dear PamF. Congratulations on your milestone anniversary, we thank you for the kind review and allowing us to assist in the celebration of your special day. Please come back and visit us again soon. Here's to another 10 years!

Summary Heading: Horrible Customer Service- Dirty Room- Bad Overall
Summary: This whole hotel stay was a bad experience. It started with problems with the room and escalated. The grounds are beautiful but the customer service was the worst I have ever experienced at a hotel.   We live in LA- so this hotel stay was purely to get away for a few days and enjoy the beach and the area.  We also planned to spend an entire day at their spa. We have a small dog so we made sure we booked at a hotel that allowed dogs. We paid a pet fee and extra deposit as per their requirements. This is all we were told needed to be done in regard to the pet policy. The manager we spoke to gave us details about the spa and one of their restaurants on the beach. She was seemingly very helpful and enthusiastic about the hotel amenities.   When we checked in the room was dirty and
Manager Response: Dear Bebe B. -  We apologize that you received incorrect information about our pet policy. Our complete pet policy can be found on our website (under the overviews tab) for any future visits. We also offer a pet sitter service as well, please check with the concierge for details.  Again we apologize for the miscommunication.  Thank you!

Summary: We've been coming to the St. Regis for years and must say this recent trip was a standout among previous standout trips. My wife and I commented on a number of occasions that it seemed they had "stepped up their game" a bit (possibly in light of the competition in the area). Regardless, we went as a family with six year old children for the weekend. The kids were met upon check-in with buckets and shovels for the beach, offered little treats, etc. Room quality and amenities were on-par with past visits and with what you'd expect from a St. Regis. But the level of kids activities and some of the personal attention from the staff made it seem a step above past trips. Kids activities included story time at 8pm with characters reading various stories followed by S'mores afterwards
Manager Response: none

Summary: What  a great spot to have a meeting or  simply relax !   This is such a wonderful propertery , very  exclusive and very  high end .  The  resturants  were excellant  and the rooms overlooking the ocean are fabulous a nd the sun sets and the surfers are  riding the waves . Golf  course  is challeging and  yet very resort friendly.  Cannot find a bad thing to say !  Looking forward to returing ,
Manager Response: Dear JC/GC- Thank you for your recent stay and review of the resort, we are pleased you were able to take advantage of our five-star amenities. We welcome you back soon, and wish you safe travels.

Summary: We stayed in this hotel for a business conference for my husband.  But we had some couples time as well.  This hotel is very luxurious.  It has a very relaxing atmosphere with nice pool, hot tub, spa and gym.  The restaurants are also good.  The hotel has everything you need.  The beach club was nice, but it is far away and you cannot drive to it, you have to take the tram.  It doesn't take long, but is not super convenient.  The beach area is private and secluded which is nice.  The staff is very helpful and friendly and gave us great advise on good restaurants around and the valet was very quick to get our car each time we needed it.  I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Eveenemean- Thank you for the honest review and recommendation of our resort. Although we are not located directly on the beach our tram service is an efficient way to access the private beach. Should you prefer to stay on the resort grounds we also offer three beautiful pools for fun and relaxation. Please visit us again soon.

Summary: I recently spent 5 days, 4 nights at the St. Regis at Monarch Beach.  It is a beautiful place, far fancier than my usual traveling digs.  What do you want?  Someone will get it for you, do it for you, help keep you being the happiest person on earth.  Be sure to arrive with plenty of $5 bills.  You will need them every time you turn around, but probably most people who stay here have plenty of discretionary income and perhaps they need $10 or $20 bills.  I had a large beautiful comfortable room that looked out on a flowering tree next to a manicured lawn.  I was able to eat my breakfast on the balcony most mornings.  The bathroom was large and luxurious.  I was pretty busy the whole time I was there, but made time for a nice soak in the tub. One oddity is that they did not
Manager Response: Dear Priscilla47- Thank you for your recent stay and your review of the resort, we are pleased you were able to enjoy so many of our five-star amenities.  Come back and visit soon.

Summary: The service was excellent from the Valet, front desk staff, restaurant servers, and beach and pool attendants.  The room was well equipped except for outlets for all our new electronic devices!  It was hard to get to the beach. There was a long wait for the tram at the hotel and the beach. They need more trams.  We liked the lawn and pool areas  and the golf course.
Manager Response: Dear VickiKal Thank you for your recent review and your stay with us. For future visits please note that although not always easy to find the outlets in each room are located on the side of the desk in each guestroom and during the summer when the weather is beautiful and we have a high demand for the beach we do run more than one tram to the beach - we apologize that you had to wait, I will let guest services know about your experience.

Summary Heading: St Regis Monarch Beach...best days are in the rearview mirror
Summary: My husband and I decided to stay at one of your properties this past Memorial Day Weekend, the St. Regis Monarch Beach.  As a bit of background, I have stayed at the resort over the past 10-years when I have been in the Laguna Beach/Dana Point area.  My husband and I were actually married at this hotel and have returned several times in 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011 and then this year.  Our experience this past weekend was dreadful to say the least.     Let me start off by saying we were not informed that you needed wristbands to enter the swimming pool. As you know, the lobby is not even close to the pool and the woman standing guard at the entrance was going to make us go all the way to the lobby to get these. She was very rude and would not listen to us when we told her we were not
Manager Response: Dear Ken M. Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review of the property. We apologize and agree that no one should accuse any of our guests, and please be assured that Ms. Fitzsimons had no prior knowledge of your mother's condition - and for that we truly apologize. We take all resort reviews very seriously, and your comments have been shared with our Director of Rooms.   For future might we recommend visiting on a non-holiday weekend to truly get the full resort  experience.

Summary: We stayed for two nights but in reality we never wanted to leave. This is a truly stunning property that actually does deliver all that it promises. The service is excellent and efficient from the minute you step inside. The rooms are very well appointed and beautifully maintained. This resort is luxury from start to finish and does not come cheaply...however that is to be expected when staying at a luxury resort. The only criticism would be that the breakfast menu can be overly expensive when ordering a la carte ...however a $20 continental breakfast which is excellent is available but is not immediately offered.  We would definitely like o return for a longer stay one day .
Manager Response: Dear jshAdelaide- Thank you for your kind words about the resort, and your recent stay with us. When you come back to visit us, be sure to visit Crust our fifth floor coffee shop for less expensive breakfast options and a la carte items. Safe Travels!

Summary Heading: If only all hotels were as good as the St. Regis...
Summary: ... the world would be a better place.  I had the privilege of staying at the St. Regis a couple of weeks ago for a conference and was impressed by the attention to even the smallest detail by the staff.  The St. Regis staff was first class - from the swiftness of check-in, friendly valets (who didn't give me any grief when I forgot to give them the key fob for my keyless car), shoeshine service that remarkably on-time with my shoes. Even the event staff we had for a private event my firm held on-site was top notch, being nothing but kind even when we went over our designated timeframe while entertaining clients.  The little details are what separates a good hotel from a great one, and the St. Regis did not disappoint. I look forward to returning.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a beautiful property.  The St. Regis is surrounded by a beautiful golf course as well as beautiful high end properties.  It is technically not oceanfront, however if you are lucky enough to stay in any of the suites that are furthest away from the front desk means you are closest to the ocean.  The check-in was smooth and was greeted by our butler in our rooms.  He was well trained and yet not superficial.  This extra perk made you feel very special and pampered.  The butler staff made sure that my coffee service every morning was served in front of the fireplace as I requested.  The front desk met all of my requests with ease and charm. Service is understated - the staff is there without being in your face.    The oceanfront restaurant is the best place to really enjoy
Manager Response: Dear LynnD13travels Thank you for your recent stay with us and your detailed review. We are thrilled  you were able to experience most of the wonderful attributes of the resort. Please come back and stay with us again soon - perhaps you can visit our world-class spa or dine on your own at Stonehill Tavern. We welcome it!  Safe Travels!

Summary: We did a quick overnight stay here. I typically stay here a few times a year because I love it so much and it again did not disappoint. I upgraded to a suite this time and I must stay I didn't think it was worth the extra cost. Aside from our butler greeting us when we arrived, we didn't need his services. I can see it being helpful if you are there for a week or so and need them to help you plan activities. The suite was very spacious and we arrived in time for an amazing sunset. I look forward to my next trip back in September.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The view, the staff, the service, the rooms.  It is all top notch and well worth the price.  I came here for business, but all I could think about was coming back with my wife.  The perfect place to just relax and recharge.
Manager Response: Dear TSPH02- Thank you for your review and your recent stay with us, we hope you come back soon and please bring your wife! We would delight in spoiling you both.

Summary: This was my second stay at the Monarch Beach location and I enjoyed it just as much as the first time.  My husband and I stayed together while on vacation and then I extended my stay for work purposes.  Both experiences exceeded my expectations.  We enjoyed lunch at the Monarch Beach Club and the beach staff was very attentive in getting chairs etc. set up the way we preferred.  The grounds are beautiful and all of the staff were informative and helpful.  I had to laugh when they had our orchid replaced the third night we stayed because it was no longer up to standards.
Manager Response: Dear Stephanie K. Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review, we love sharing great reviews with our associates and will send your kudos with our beach club attendants and housekeeping staff. Please come back and stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: 5 Stars But Could Improve Some Things
Summary: My husband and I recently stayed at the St Regis Monarch Beach for 5 nights.  Overall, this property is lovely.  The landscaping, decor, spacious rooms and amenities are beautiful as would be expected at a 5 star luxury property.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  As others state, this resort does not sit right on the beach, however, I did find the view stunning.  We didn't golf or try the StoneHill Tavern, however the course looked nice and we heard rave reviews about the restaurant.  The Pros:  Beautiful rooms and decor. Highly recommend the 2 hour beach hike!!! Sit on the patio and enjoy the view with cocktails, breakfast...  The Cons:  Shuttle to the beach resort took far too long and would be filled up.  Then you get stuck waiting another 40 minutes.  I missed one
Manager Response: Dear sobemama- Thank you for your recent stay and your review of the property. We are pleased our amenities, surroundings, and expansive guestrooms were pleasing to you. Please come back to visit us again soon to experience Stonehill Tavern our Michael Mina restaurant as well as our award-winning Robert Trent Jones Jr. golf course - as its one of only a few courses with ocean views directly from the holes!

Summary: Ah the benefits of being a Starwood member have been cashed in for the first time here at the St. Regis Monarch Beach in Dana Point. I used points for a complimentary night for my wife’s birthday. I upgraded to an executive suite for an extra $170/night which was pretty cool. We checked in a little earlier that 4pm and received our room without a problem. The valet was very nice and professional; we were greeted with a bottle of water as we waited in line at the front desk. While we were in the check in process the front desk was not aware of our upgraded stay, after a few minutes they had it all figured out which was great. The front desk staff was very nice and professional. The bellman escorted us to our room which was one of the nicest rooms I have every stayed in. We were
Manager Response: Dear ledieff- Thank you for your review of our resort and your recent stay. It was our pleasure to make your stay for your wife's birthday a special one. We apologize for the miscommunication on our part with regard to the hot bath, as this request can absolutely be accommodated. We hope you come back again soon to experience our five-star amenities and give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.

Summary: The hotel and property are beautiful, but when paying these prices for an executive suite I do expect more than 1 bottle of water per day, and for the bath amenities to be replenished during a 3 night stay.  The butler service (Mitch and Alfredo especially) is spectacular,  Ariel at the front desk, and the entire catering staff  were fantastic.
Manager Response: Dear COexec- Thank you for the response and your recent stay with us. It is customary that all of our suite guests recieve a welcome amenity and complimentary butler service - inclusive of morning coffee and tea service, pressing of two garments, shoe shine and your own personal butler. These amenities are reserved exclusively for our suite guests. If you didn't recieve any of these amenieities please reach out to our Executive Offices at 949-234-3301.

Summary: Fabulous hotel with excellent service with everyone going over and beyond to ensure we have a perfect stay, especially Nevine Sadalla, the guest historian, the pool staff and the valets. The pool is fantastic, and the beach is easily accessible via shuttle or a brisk walk. The restaurant, StoneHill Tavern is excellent too. Overall, a great stay! Thank you to the hardworking staff!
Manager Response: Dear: Rbugblatter Thank you for your kind words and recent stay with us. I will share your comments with our staff inluding Nevine, thank you for allowing us to make your stay extra special.  Please come back and visit us again soon.

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here as a "reward" for doing a mud run and it was the one of the best decisions we have ever made!  This resort has breath taking views, excellent service and amazing restaurants.  We were lucky enough to have the butler service and we were treated like stars.  If you are considering staying here, I strongly suggest you book your reservation now!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a beautiful property. The lobby areas, pool, rooms and service are everything you expect from a St. Regis. The property is not on the water but does offer views of the Pacific as well as access to a private dinning club on the water. We ate dinner there one night and had a nice dinner while enjoying the views. We also ate at Michael Mina's Stonehill Tavern and had a wonderful dinner which we also highly recommend. There are great walking and jogging trails in the area and close proximity to the beach. Compared to another high-end hotel just down the street this is the place to stay. The rooms and grounds are much nice and it has more of a boutique feel. We will definitely return.
Manager Response: Dear Ruler61- Thank you for your recent stay and your review of the resort. We are pleased you were able to experience some of our great amenities, including our private oceanfront beach club and Michael Mina's Stonehill Tavern. Thank you for posting the beautiful pictures as well. Warm Regards!

Summary: We just finished a business conference followed by a few days rest and relaxation at the fantastic St Regis Monarch Beach. The hotel is beautiful, well appointed, and serviced by an excellent staff. The location is excellent, scenic and we enjoyed the golf, walks to the beach, and relaxation at the pool. The concierge did a great job in recommending restaurants in Laguna Beach. We would highly recommend dining at the Sunday Brunch. It is terrific. We can't wait to return.
Manager Response: SouBro- Thank you for your kind words and recent stay with us! Please come back and visit us soon, we hope to see you in Motif for Champagne Sunday Brunch soon.

Summary: I had the pleasure to stay at the St. Regis Dana Point during my companies Presidents Club in April for 5 days. My suite was beautiful with two queen beds and the bathroom was large with a huge bath tub that I enjoyed every evening. The hotel staff was very accommodating and the ground were beautiful, clean with breathtaking views. The enjoyed the upscale Spa having one of the best facials ever.   I look forward to retuning to the St. Regis with my family. My only issue with my room was a dripping noise in my ceiling.
Manager Response: Dear Lori C. Thank you for the kind words, about our rooms, grounds and your fabulous spa experience! Please visit us again soon. With regard to the dripping noise should, something like this happen again please reach out to our Manager on Duty as this sounds like a problem we would like to correct.

Summary Heading: Wonderful and relaxing resort with Amazing service.
Summary: Service was just amazing. Prompt. Friendly. Well mannered and polite. Check-in was very easy and helpful. Room was very clean, relaxing and welcoming. The bathroom was my favorite part...great shower and even the tub was inviting. I never take baths but I just had to this time (after cleaning the tub myself again). Turn down service was great after a long day of exploring coming into the room with the relaxing music playing and slippers and robe waiting. Food at the restaurants were great when we ate at the resort. Make sure to go to the beach club for lunch and sit on the deck to enjoy the beach and views. I will be back!
Manager Response: Dear CW22311- Thank you for the great review and the recent stay with us. We are thrilled you were able to experience some of our amazing amenities including our oversized soaking tubs! Hope you are able to visit again soon.

Summary: I stayed here for a friend's wedding. The service was impeccable even though I showed up late, and disheveled in a beat up old car after dropping off some bridesmaids nearby.  I've stayed at a number of beautiful hotels - the Ritz, the Four Seasons in London and other locations, for example.   Anyway, the St. Regis offered true five star service as it is meant to be - attentive without being pretentious or annoying.  The pool was amazing. The rooms are spacious. Don't miss a chance to wander down to the beach from the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I recently stayed at the St. Regis Dana Point.  Upon arrival in our room, two lights were burnt out and one sink had drain problems.  Doesn't housekeeping check those things?  That same evening, after dinner we went to have drinks at the bar, on the outside patio.  My shoe got stuck on something sticky.  I blew it off as a spilled drink that had dried...well, it was still there three nights later..don't they clean the areas at night/first thing in the morning?  The second day we walked the grounds.  I know it is April, the golf greens were gorgeous, but the rest of the landscaping was tired, dated and in need of a whole lot of TLC.  All in all, the rooms are larger at the St. Regis, but the Ritz Carlton across the street is a much better hotel, staff included.
Manager Response: Dear Shari S. Thank you for your recent stay with us and your review of the resort. We apologize your stay with us didn't meet your expectations. Our team always strives to keep the grounds and the rooms in five star condition, we regret your experience didn't reflect that. We will share your experience with our Management Team so we can avoid these guest encounters in the future.

Summary: The service is impeccable from the butler taking you to your room, to room service.The grounds are well kept and the room view is wonderful. (ask for a ocean or pool view)The room was clean, bed is comfortable and the bathroom was big and beautiful. Only complaint was the carpet needed a shampoo job.
Manager Response: Dear ShellyP2 Thank you for posting a review about your recent stay, we are pleased you enjoyed yourself! We will share your comment about the carpets with our housekeeping and engineering team.

Summary: Me and my spouse recently spent 4 nights at St Regis Monarch Beach in Dana Point and all i can say is WOW. I have stayed in other 5 stars and this was by far the most elgant and comfortable hotel i have ever had the priveledge of staying in.  Upon arrival we were greeted by the bellman who took our luggage.  Check in was a breeze and we were given a room on the 6th floor over looking the grand lawn and had an amazing view of the Pacific Ocean.  The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was complete with a his and her sink, large soaking tub, standalone glass granite shower, seperate room for toilet, also came with all the standard shampoos and products and mouth wash, a shave kit, robes, really soft linens and even slippers.  Housekeeping came at least 3 times a day
Manager Response: none

Summary: We attended a wedding at this resort. It is a beautiful property. I enjoyed the pool and watching the sunset over the Pacific from there. Pool and jacuzzi open 24 hours, something I personally liked so you could go swimming after dark. Rooms nicely done and had turn down service. A very relaxing Southern California stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This resort has got a bit for everyone, nice restaurants , well appointed rooms , romantic sunset views , relaxing pool areas and a beautiful beach.  Check-in was so efficient and perfect welcome after a long trip. Our suite was gorgeous with a fantastic bathroom , large and airy with a view to the ocean from the balcony. The butler brought us a lovely tray of coffee each morning and we had sparkling wine and chocolates waiting on the first night. Our teenagers room in another wing was a nice spacious double also with a balcony.  We had lunch at Motif outside and it was very relaxing. Dinner at the same restaurant did however feel unorganised and rushed. Must say the evening-menu felt somewhat strange and we did not really enjoy the dishes but thats all individual taste.   The
Manager Response: Dear Cookie T- Thank you for taking the time to post your response, and thank you for the kind words with regard to our spacious guestrooms and great restaurants. Your comments about the sporadic service at the pool and Motif will be shared with our Director of Food and Beverage.   We hope you and your family return soon, in the meantime safe travels.

Summary Heading: This is what Hotel Service ought to be everywhere!
Summary: The St. Regis hotels are known for their high level of service, but I was really amazed at just how far they will go to make a guest's experience truly memorable.  They really do take care of your needs/desires and do it so very professionally!  Each staff member, from hotel restaurants to valet services, will address you by name and somehow remembers little details about you.  I even had a bad experience on the Monarch Beach golf course (attendant was harassing me unfortunately), and I expected the hotel to do nothing about it, but instead they took care of my complaint above and beyond what I thought would be reasonable, and turned a bad day into a more pleasant one.  Their restaurants' food quality, layout, and decor is also exceptional.  I would highly recommend their Sunday
Manager Response: Dear Marc M- Thank you for the kind words about our resort as well as your recent stay with us. Please come back and visit us again soon.  Warm regards,

Summary Heading: Top Notch Service Only..And With A Smile!
Summary: long Walks   From  Elevators To Rooms..Little  Confusin As Hotel Is Built On Side Of Hill ..Matress Was Just Ok should have been better for a five star hotel. bring your wallet as a beer in the lounge was $7. slippers in robe are nice touch to use. also the chocolates in turn down service each night was wonderful.. grounds are beautiful and they have a shuttle to a private beach.. with free use of chairs and umbrellas.. did not use the restaurants Or ..spa...Staff Was Friendly /Outstanding
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a very nice hotel in a great location.  The facilities are top notch and the service staff is professional and friendly.  However, I think they may be a little under-manned (even though the front desk told me the hotel is fully booked).  There were long lines at reception and the wait staff at the restaurant serviced too many tables.  For a hotel of this price point, they should probably ensure they always have more than enough staff to service their guests.
Manager Response: Dear A K Thank you for the kind review and your recent stay. We will share your comments with regard to the long reception lines with our guest services team. We will see what we can do to alleviate any long reception lines in the future.

Summary: We came to the St. Regis Monarch Beach hotel for a get away weekend near home. I feel like I had been away on a trip somewhere far away. It was fun just to spend time relaxing, in the spa, walking down to the beach, etc  The room we were in was spacious with a view of the grounds. It has a nice bathroom in marble: separate tub and shower, two sink vanity, and toiletries supplied. We laughed at the butlers who came in to greet us upon arrival as they informed us that they would provide two (as I recall) shoe shines and pressings for free as well as bring us coffee to our room for breakfast. We had nothing to press or shine! However if one were attending a wedding this would be very good.   The hotel is large and has an air of openness. The grounds are beautiful. We don't play
Manager Response: Dear Suzanochka - Thank you for your detailed review and recent stay, we made an obvious impression. Your comments about the music in Motif will be shared with management, and your kind words to Lisa at Spa Gaucin will be shared. We hope you come back for another getaway soon.  Warm regards from sunny southern California!

Summary Heading: Gorgeous hotel, luxurious accommodations, friendly staff
Summary: The St. Regis can be spotty (see my review of the Deer Valley St. Regis), but this St. Regis is on the mark!  1. Courteous and quick valet service; 2. Efficient and helpful front desk staff at check-in; 3. Spotless room with plush amenities galore; 4.  Updated marble bathrooms with deep tubs and any toiletries needed.  Our room had a gorgeous view of the pool and ocean without being too close to any noise.  We came for our 4th grader's mission project, San Juan Capistrano, and were treated like royalty.  This is the place to stay in Dana Point, and we'll be back!
Manager Response: Dear Discerning12385- Thank you for the kind comments with regard to your recent stay with us. Your positive comments will be shared with our staff. We hope your mission research was successful! Come back and visit us again soon.  Safe Travels!

Summary: Just the breathtaking views of the ocean and blue sky will immediately transport you paradise but then the gorgeous property captivates your senses.  I just needed to decompress from traveling 300 days since March of last year.  The spa was incredible and oh so welcoming..well worth the expense.  Everyone that works at this property was so kind and helpful.  The food and beverage were 5 star. By far, the finest and most beautiful property that I have ever stayed.
Manager Response: Dear Kellie C: Thank you for your kind response, and thank you for choosing The St. Regis Monarch Beach for your quiet repose. Come back and visit us anytime. Safe Travels!

Summary Heading: Sparkles in some places, surprisingly lacking in others
Summary: I was here for a 4 night stay - all in all in was a pretty good stay.  Things that stood out:  1.  Great butler service, responsive, prompt, and professional, 2.  Car valet:  good crew, zippy and again professional, 3.  Pool:  great poolside service, wonderful that the kids pool is in a separate area, 4.  Beach:  Not easily accessible by foot but a wonderful stretch with an attached restaurant.   Things that surprisingly did not meet the mark:  1. Shuttle to and from beach club:  impossible (45 min) wait on more than one occasion, repeated calls to front desk to no avail, perplexing as the trip takes 5 minutes, no explanations from surly, delinquent-appearing driver, 2. uneven service from front desk:  over-the-top effusiveness when you are dressed to the nines, snooty when you
Manager Response: Dear Hopskipjumper- Thank you for the kind words with regard to our prompt butler service and friendly valet staff. We regret your experience with our guest services staff and front desk attendants was less than desirable.   It is our intention to make each of our guests feel warmly welcomed and to quickly attend to all of their needs. Please be assured your comments will be shared with associates and department managers to ensure this type of experience does not occur again. We hope you will visit us again soon so we may have the opportunity to 'WOW' you within all areas of our resort.  Warm Regards

Summary: We travel all the time and all over the world so we don't easily get impressed.  The decor, service and views were spectacular.  Don't forget to visit the seaside restaurant which a very reliable tram will take you to, running every 15 minutes.  Only downside is that even when it is very cool all the doors remain open.  Bring a jacket Sam M
Manager Response: Dear Sam M. Thank you for the great review of the property and your recent stay with us, and thank you for the feedback with regard to open doors. Although it’s always a good idea to bring a light jacket since we are near the ocean and it can be chilly at night, in an effort to be more energy efficient we try to keep the doors closed as much as possible. We will share your comments with our teams - and keep on top of this initiative for the comfort of our guests and to be more energy efficient.

Summary: We love coming to this hotel – it’s where my wife and I got engaged. Great location and well maintained grounds. We really enjoy hanging out by the pool or taking a golf cart ride down to the beach. We've also had some great meals and the staff is always super attentive and friendly. Great place for a weekend away from Los Angeles.
Manager Response: Dear Stephan W Thank you for the kind words, we welcome you and your fiancé/wife back to the resort anytime you need a getaway from the city!  Warm Regards and Congratulations!

Summary: Had a three day weekend and every part, from check in to check out was five star. This is what service is about. Great employees, wonderful food, great room and great stay. Maid service, restaurant service, front desk service, bell service....just want to thank everyone involved. Stonehill Tavern food was same as Michael Mina's other restaurants in SF and Las Vegas, but our server, Melissa, made it better than both of those. Food in Motif is just as good (highly recommend dinner here...portions twice the size of Mina (almost too big ) but absolutely great! Again, thanks to all the employees who made our weekend stay wonderful.
Manager Response: Dear Donald H- Thank you for the rave review, we are excited we exceed your expectations and look forward to a future visit! We will share your comments with Melissa and the managment team at Stonehill Tavern as well.  Warm Regards,

Summary: This is a beautiful property, and the room that we had (gardenview ) was very clean and comfortable, the beds were very luxurious, and we enjoyed the room and the service very much. My only complaint was that there is no in-room coffee, and no way to request it without ordering a pot of coffee from room service for $9.00. For $25.00 a day resort fee, this option should have been available, even if ionly upon request, likwe som eother high end hotels.
Manager Response: Dear hoffmansrcj Thank you for the great review, we are pleased to know you enjoyed your accommodations and the service. With regard to the in-room coffee pot, it is a St. Regis brand standard that we not offer coffee pots in the room. An alternative to this would be to visit Crust our coffee shop, which opens daily at 6am, to order coffee through in room dining or request a coffee maker from housekeeping for a nominal onetime fee. Please note complimentary coffee and tea service is offered in all of our 75 upgraded suites.  Warm Regards

Summary: I've been to a few hotels in the Dana Point area and this one ranks among the best! Rooms are excellently fitted, with large bathrooms, ample sitting area in the room and a magnificent view of the property, golf course and the Pacific. The service is extremely friendly and helpful. Both the outdoor and indoor pools are nicely heated and the spa is open for reasonable hours up until 8 PM. All in all, I was here on business with a packed schedule and this was a great retreat and place to unwind.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Classic St. Regis...beautiful pool and golf cart transport access to beach and beachfront restaurant.  The service is good, not outstanding.  The rooms are elegant and the oceanview rooms are worth the premium.  Nice proximity to Pacific Coast Hwy and the shopping areas of Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of the resort, and we agree if you want the best view upgrade to an Ocean View! We look forward to your return. Warm Regards!

Summary Heading: This property is not on the beach.
Summary: This is a very nice hotel but the name implies that it is on the beach. You can see the water but you cannot walk to it. You are required to take a continuously operating 8 passenger golf cart through neighborhoods and the golf course. Don't forget something in your room! The rooms are deluxe, the spa is fabulous and the dining service was very slow but quite good. It is about a 15 min drive into Laguna.
Manager Response: Dear TravelAgent01- Thank you for your recent stay and review of our resort, and although our name includes the word 'beach' it implies that we are located in the city of Monarch Beach - or more well known - Dana Point. You can walk to our beach if you are up for a little exercise as it is approximately .7 miles from us - I actually suggest this in fact as the surrounding areas and wildlife are breathtaking. For a walking map please visit our concierge desk. We look forward to your return visit. Happy travels!

Summary Heading: Beautiful Stay But stay out of the Ocean
Summary: We just stayed 1 night at the St. Regis- which was too bad because I could get used to it there!  There were some little things that I didn't like that were a bit of a surprise to me given the status of this hotel but you have to decide do you overlook them b/c of the quality of the rooms/grounds/etc.   We are SPG Platinum guests and we were upgraded to an Executive suite which was HUGE and the bathroom was absolutely like none other I've ever seen!  We had a butler but I don't think the butler service was that good.  He said he would bring us his personal restaurant recommendations and never showed up with them.  When we called about it they just sent up the standard list they give everyone.  We were disappointed b/c he seemed to be so ready to give us his PERSONAL list!  We
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your response Sparky8188, we appreciate the feedback about the areas of opportunity within our Butler Service, but are pleased you enjoyed the room and surrounding areas. Just to clarify, the water running into the ocean is absolutely not raw sewage - it is natural water that runs off of the hill above the beach, please note this water is in fact treated and although it wouldn't hurt you we don't recommend frolicking in it. Especially when there is a large beautiful ocean to take advantage of. We hope you visit us again and apologize you received false information about our beaches.

Summary: Loved staying at the St Regis ----  food was wonderful, the rooms outstanding, the staff impeccable - would stay here again in a second!  Meeting rooms, accoustics, receptions were lovely.  Close to Laguana Beach.  Rooms were gorgeous .
Manager Response: none

Summary: A wonderful hotel for a weekend or a week!  Best hotel staff we have encountered in years--they ALL go out of their way to help you!   The service here is incredible--like stepping back in time!  Had breakfast in our room and it was so lovely.  Lunch and dinner at other locations on the property were equally wonderful!   The sunsets were extraordinary and being able to walk to the beach (or take their trolley) and eat lunch or dinner at their private beach restaurant is a plus!  Want a quick getaway?  This is the place.   Stayed here while my husband attended a business conference.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was a guest at the St Regis at the end of Feb/beginning of March for a business conference, which I bookended with a few personal nights.  This is one of my favorite resorts, anywhere. The property is spotless, staff professional, helpful and friendly, incredible bed and bedding, spectacular bath. Every meal (including the business functions) were delicious, fresh and had a little something extra to have them stand out.  I would HIGHLY recommend this resort over the highly pretentious and overrated Montage. The Ritz Carlton down the street is also wonderful - just different that the St Regis.  I took advantage of dining at the private Monarch Bay Beach Club for on of the dinners and I also highly recommend it!  Pool, golf, spa were all wonderful.  Of course, there is a price
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have travelled extensively and this is the most opulent hotel I have ever stayed in.  It is something out of a movie.  The views are fantastic as are the pools  (which I could not use because the weather was too cool).  The rooms are wonderfully appointed as are all areas of this fine hotel.
Manager Response: Dear LadyLBaltimore- Thank you sincerely for your complimentary post, we love when our guest's expectations are exceeded. Please come visit us again when the weather is warmer and you can swim in one of our three gorgeous pools!

Summary: This resort was entirely uninspiring.  We arrived early at 1pm and were told the room was not ready.  We had booked using the Amex fine hotels program which advertises early check in(12 pm) when available- no such luck.  We were not offered any place to stay or change our clothes while we waited for the room, nor were we're given a resort map.  We were summarily dismissed from the registration counter.  We made our way down to the pool area for lunch.  At the pool we waited a good 20 minutes before our order was taken from a limited and uninspiring menu.  When the food arrived we were given plastic utensils that looked as if they good easily snap with a minute paper towel.  The club sandwich was made of processed turkey and the worst hotel sandwich I have had in a long time.  By
Manager Response: Dear Maxstein- Thank you for your recent visit and for sharing the challenges you experience during your recent stay. We value your loyalty as an Amex Luxury Member and are thrilled to accommodate early check-ins when they are available. Your comments about the lack of turndown, lack of fitness center staff and less than satisfying food at the pool are extremely valuable and have been shared with our team. Unfortunately by law we can only serve on plastic ware at the pool. We hope you will reconsider your feelings toward the entire St. Regis brand, should you decided to visit us again please reach out to our Executive Offices directly at 949-234-3301.

Summary: We booked a large St. Regis suite for 7 nights at a rate of closed to $1000 per night for our spring break vacation.  We are frequent travelers and have stayed at many fine hotels around the world.  As loyal SPG member we chose the St. Regis in Monarch Beach.  We chose the ocean front St. Regis suite.  The suite was supposed to come with butler service as well.  At the time of booking i requested a roll a way bed for my two and a half year old son.  On the day of my check in my butler Steven informed me that he has scheduled for a roll a way bed and to have the room turn over at 6:30 pm each night to allow the kids a chance to go to bed early so they have enough energy for Disneyland and Sea World.  On the first day we asked if they can turned the room an hour later due to time
Manager Response: Russell L-  We are aware of your issues and are taking them very seriously. The butlers will be working to ensure that the remainder of your trip is a flawless one. Thank you for your stay and your loyalty.  Thank you,  The Executive Team  St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Abiding attention to guest comfort and serenity
Summary: St. Regis does it again. Ask and you receive professionally but without fanfare and always with attention to detail.  Magnificent setting and vistas.  A most enjoyable stay minutes from Dana Point and Laguna Beach venues and restaurants.
Manager Response: Jjwaniec-   We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your time at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you can return in the future to enjoy our wonderful setting and great amenities.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I've done some traveling in my days, but I think St. Regis was the fanciest place I've ever stayed in - without being pretentious.  The staff bent over backward to be helpful, the room was not only extremely well appointed, but also very, very clean, and the bathroom was phenomenal.  The location was perfect, with some of the most amazing views I've seen.  There was a cold snap while we were there, and even though the pools were heated, the air was much too cold to soak up some sun by the pool or ocean.  I LOVED the spa.  The only spa that rivals it that I have been to is the Grove Park Inn in Asheville, NC.  And if I'm not mistaken the spa rates at St. Regis are a bit less than Grove Park.  We ate in Motif, the main restaurant, and it was lovely.  We also ate at the beachside
Manager Response: none

Summary: A world class hotel experience in SoCal.  The service was impeccable, the room huge and comfortable and the ocean sounds comforting.  The butler takes care of anything, The bed was cozy and the bathroom is bigger than many hotel rooms I've stayed in while traveling in europe. There are no shortcuts taken in the facility.  work out room great, pool fantastic
Manager Response: OneJimHeywood-   Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We appreciate your feedback about the Resort. We hope that you can return soon to enjoy our wonderful pools and rooms. Thank you,  The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Great place for a romantic getaway
