Summary: My husband and I were very pleased with our stay at the St. Regis. The grounds are beautiful and the room had a lovely view if the ocean. The best part was spending time with my husband walking on the beach!
Manager Response: Tracy G.-   Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear that you and your husband enjoyed your stay at the Resort and your time walking on the beach. We hope that you both will be able to return to the Resort soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Now this is what you call service!   Our SPG assistent helped arrange our stay of 13, upon driving in the staff knew right away who we were, had a team waiting and we were all taken directly to our rooms. The property is vast but we were all given proper orientation, we were advise of available dinner and times.   Most of my team did not speak English and the hotel has a full time manager that speaks Mandarin that truly helped the team enjoy there stay. The hotel manager was at every point to greet us and insure all details were in place and further our enjoyment.   As we were a large team the hotel was kind enough to offer a Chinese style breakfast, but sadly it took more time then they expected, after some delay we enjoyed and were all greeted at the end with the General
Manager Response: Warren K-   We are so pleased that you and your group enjoyed your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. It is always great to receive compliments about our staff and property. We hope that you will be able to return to the Resort in the future.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Great everything ... From the moment you arrive to you check out they treat you like a VIP if you get a chance go down in the Wine Cellar for a drink   ... Can't wait to come back next year for longer stay ...
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed at this property for a conference, and would definitely return for a pleasure visit.  The grounds are beautiful, and I loved the modern decor of the rooms.  I wish I would have lucked out with a view of the ocean instead the bushes and the grass, but there were plenty of places both inside and out to take advantage of the view.  (I stayed at the Montage not too far away several years ago, and if I recall correctly, every room has an ocean view.  I recall it being on somewhat of a cliff, rocky and not being able to get down to the water (or easily)).  From the St. Regis, the beach is about a 10-15 walk, but what a view once you get there.  The food at the bar, at the luncheons for the conference, and at the restaurant were all wonderful (and which is really rare
Manager Response: Luvwatercantswim-   We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your conference at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you can return to the Resort soon to enjoy another strawberry mojito and our wonderful amenities.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Million dollar view...if only we could have seen it.
Summary: Stayed at the St. Regis for 3 nights in February.  There are many things to like about this hotel.  The grounds are well maintained and attractive although not as beautiful as others in the area.  The decor is on the modern side but the furniture in our room was pretty badly nicked and worn...not what I expect from a 5 diamond resort. The most frustrating thing was we were in a second floor room that had as small balcony from which we should have been able to see the ocean except that there was a huge magnolia tree completely blocking our view!  Now why on earth would you have any trees block views of the ocean?? It just is plain ridiculous. Used the spa and it was just an okay experience...when I went to shower at about noon almost every shower had dirty wet towels on the
Manager Response: P C-   Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We appreciate your feedback about the Resort, many of our rooms do offer wonderful ocean views and we have improved the furniture.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: This is one of the most beautiful properties I have ever stayed at!  Truly luxurious; beautiful view of the ocean and golf course, wonderful walking trail down to the beach.  Not cheap, but very luxurious.
Manager Response: Tbmckinley-  We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you will return to the Resort soon.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We stayed for a girl's weekend. Dana Point is a beautiful town. The grounds of the hotel are lovely- great ocean view, 10 minute walk to the beach. Our ocean view room was spacious and you could only see the ocean from the balcony. We had drinks and dessert at the bar, which was yummy, busy, loud. Loved the piano player.  Wished they had a little dance floor. The staff was very attentive, although if they put the effort in to calling me by my last name, I wish they would have a system in place to communicate how to say it and my title (I am a female Dr who was referred to on paper as Mr.)  Saturday, we used their spa. It is a luxurious place. We had a couples Costa Del Sur massage. The massage was amazing. Unfortunately I had some real issues with the masseuse, which after me
Manager Response: Uoprincess-  Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your girl’s weekend at the Resort. We apologize for the issues with your name and the masseuse. We hope that you will return in the future for another great weekend.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Afternoon tea at the hotel was delightful!
Summary: We love a good value and a casual setting with a great view.  You need to make reservations 24 hours ahead and then the hotel will arrange your time with the in house restaurant/carry out "Crust".  Our table was dressed up with a table cloth and nice table settings alongside of a window view of the expansive property, the golf course and of course, the ocean.  We enjoyed fresh fruit with whipped cream, champagne (very good too), choice of loose leaf teas, finger sandwiches and a 3-tiered dessert tray.  It is $38 pp before tax & gratuity and well worth it.  Service was excellent and they went so far as to re-make some sandwiches to omit the salmon that I don't eat.  Only ding was although the desserts were attractive and appropriate, they could have have a better taste.  Scones
Manager Response: Anonymous855-  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your afternoon tea at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope you will return soon for another delicious tea time.  Thank you,  The Executive Team  St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: This beautiful and comfortable hotel, gorgeously set on a hill overlooking the ocean, mostly meets and exceeds expectations. Rooms are large, comfortable, and intelligently laid out, with especially spacious and beautiful bathrooms. The public spaces are notably beautiful, as well. We stayed here during a three-day business meeting, and although we didn't try any of the restaurants, the food at all of the meeting functions was unusually good, from a trio of delicious risotto dishes to the morning croissants (among the few decent ones I've had outside of France). The swimming pools and fitness facilities are fantastic. Nonetheless, I wouldn't call the stay quite perfect. There was a notable snafu at check-in; if you happen to arrive before your spouse, who has a different last
Manager Response: Lit-Traveler-  Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy that you and your spouse enjoyed your overall stay at the Resort. We apologize for the issues you experienced with check in. We hope that you will return to the Resort soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: From the minute you arrive on property, you feel the warmth of the staff. Everyone I came in contact with, remembered my name. When I walked around the hotel the next morning, I was greeted multiple times "Good Morning Mr. Weeks." The rooms are immaculate, and they were nice enough to upgrade me to a corner suite, without me even having to ask. (And I am a base level SPG member.) There are very few 5 star hotels in the world. The St. Regis Monarch Beach provides the service, the amenities, the grounds, and the staff that deliver a 5 Star property.
Manager Response: Matt W-  Thank you for your review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay and the staff at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope you will return to the Resort for the wonderful service and amenities.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Living life from the moment we arrived, until The moment we left! The setting, the service, the swaying of palm trees.....this resort has it all and being in such a beautiful part of Southern California simply added to a perfect weekend....took the tram down to the beach restaurant...now that's a must do...lunch outside watching the waves, the surfers, the whales (well, one whale..way out there). The servers were just delightful....the staff friendly and helpful...breaks from the business meetings were delightfully located in the midst of the beauty.  Receptions were held and the food was out of this world...there was a wedding being held while we were there...imagine dreams came true for the newly weds..
Manager Response: Gail H-  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay from the moment you arrived at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you will be able to return to the Resort soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Service was terrific! Everywhere you look, staff are smiling, cordial and very attentive. Our room was a deluxe king w/ corner location...w/ ocean, golf course & pool views (very nice). I was in meetings, but my family enjoyed the pool and walking trails. The golf course was quite challenging...lots of undulation, beautiful vistas and fast greens. We did have meeting facilities which were very nice & more than adequate for our needs. A couple of evening receptions were great. Good was all good and staff, once again, handled it beautifully. All in all, a very nice business and family friendly property.
Manager Response: Bill A-  We are pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you will return in the future to enjoy Monarch Beach Golf Links and the resort pool.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Absolutely gorgeous property!  The surrounding area is beautiful.  There is a great walking path that goes to the beach perfect for a morning jog or run!  The hotel is gorgeous and the staff is more than helpful.    We stayed for a weekend in June and the weather was great.  This resort has everything, golf, beach, gorgeous pool, wonderful spa and great restaurants.  The property is not directly on the beach, however, just a few minutes on the tram is access to the hotels private beach.   Hope to get back there one day soon!!!
Manager Response: BOD M-  Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Resort in June. We hope that you will return soon to take advantage of the many wonderful amenities we offer.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We had a great stay for a weekend. While the weather was uneven, it was a good time to spend in the spa.  Our service in the restaurant in the evening was a little uneven. It took us 2 + hrs to have an entree and dessert, while we watched others come and go.  We waited 30 minutes for dessert after it took 45 minutes to get our entrees.  That was a bit disappointing.  Otherwise, the property is beautiful, the service was great and the rooms are large.
Manager Response: Mojo8-  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your weekend stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We apologize for the inconvenience at the restaurant and hope you will return to the Resort soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I enjoyed the wonderful service during my stay.  However, I had a suite and with the suite I was to have a butler during my entire stay.  I tried calling the butler and then the front desk for my butler's services and no one could help.  I wanted to get a bottle of butane for my cigar lighter which ran out.  It is a friendly cigar hotel which can be enjoyed on the outside patio overlooking the ocean. The suite was a two bedroom suite with a large bathroom and up-to-date.  It came with a nice large patio on the ground floor located by the pool.  I would recommend the ground floor if you want quick access to the pool on the south side of the hotel closest to the pool, however ocean views are not that good.   Overall, it was a nice property and if you do stay at this hotel, be sure
Manager Response: Utjazz1-  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are sorry to hear about the mishap with the butler service and hope that you will return to the Resort in the future.  Thank you,  The Executive Team  St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Overall, this place was wonderful! Great service,rooms, and the pools were open 24 hrs a day even in february!  The beds are plush and I bet whichever room you stayed in, you would be pretty happy. The one problem would be that the food is overpriced. I ordered an eggs bendict for breakfast (I didnt know exactly what it was) and was I pretty mad! Unless you want eggs, ham, and bread for $20 never order an eggs benedict! Not only that, my family ordered 2 omelets and a fruit platter and we got priced over $100!!!  Another problem to SOME ppl might be that is sort of far from major attractions, such as LA.  It was still a great hotel and I would recommend you go there to 100% RELAX, not to travel around, because you probably want to know the ins and outs of this hotel!
Manager Response: Travelingforever127-  Thank you for your review of the St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your recent stay. We hope that you will return in the future to enjoy our pool and other wonderful amenities.   Thank you,  The Executive Team  St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Just spent two nights here and it doesn't get any better than this. Service, Rooms, Pool, Restaurants are all incredible. The rooms are very spacious and top quality. The bed was almost as comfortable as my bed at home which I paid a lot for.  The grounds are just immaculate. You can walk to Monarch Bay Golf Course and also take a trail throught the golf course, under Hwy 1 and down to a great private beach where you can walk south past the Ritz Carlton property for those who like to walk.  There is also a private restaurant called the Monarch Bay Club Restaurant which is right on the beach and has spectacular views. You have to take a little tram from the main hotel down to the restaurant but it a scenic, short ride through the golf course down to the beach past spectacular
Manager Response: RickFromSD-  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you will return in the future to enjoy the pool, golf course, and restaurants.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Outstanding Service....and the Views are Outstanding!
Summary: From the Front Desk, to Bell Hops, to Bar Tenders, and Restaurant Staff -- 100% Great People.  It's all expensive - but you get what you're paying for. The views are Stunning - it's just beautiful!  Only thing - No Ice Machines. So you have to call room service -- But they don't charge for this service.  It's nice - but I'm used to getting my own ice.
Manager Response: Steak-N-Taters-  We are happy to hear that your enjoyed your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach and were pleased with our service. We hope that you will return to the Resort soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We were meeting a relative who was there on business and just stayed one night on a Saturday.  The service at this hotel is first rate by virtually the entire hotel staff, friendly, professional, but not pretentious.  We had a large comfortable suite with "butler service".  I called up for coffee service early on Sunday morning, and terrific French press coffee was delivered almost immediately.  That's a perk you could get used to.  Food is very good, the caliber you would expect.  The bed was exceptionally comfortable, with soft linens.  Also good bath linens and products.   I was a little worried that the St. Regis might give off that too snooty vibe, but that was not a problem.  From LA you it's a great way to pamper yourself and grab a quick mini-vacation.
Manager Response: Hentschel9-  Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay at the Resort. We hope that you will return in the future to enjoy our many wonderful amenities.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I love this place.  LOVE IT.  Absolutely beautiful property.  AMAZING staff.  Beautiful rooms.  Incredibly comfortable beds.  Great bath amenities.  Lovely pool.  AWESOME gym (especially for a hotel).  Michael Mina's Stonehill Tavern is sublime and deserving of its own review.  I've stayed at this St. Regis a dozen times or so and it simply never disappoints.  You are treated like a valued guest the moment you get on the property.  The reception area is welcoming and open with expansive views of the pool, part of the golf course and ocean beyond.  The front desk staff is welcoming and gracious.  I would highly advise doing what you need to do to get a suite.  As a Lifetime Platinum with Starwood, I have always been upgraded, but I would pay for it.  With a suite you get butler
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was asked to attend a business meeting at the property earlier in the month, and I must say this was a fantastic venue. We were on site for 4 nights and I found everything to be 5 star. The room was spacious, clean and extremely well appointed. The food was not your regular hotel fare, and was presented in a wonderful fashion in wonderful environments with fantastic views of the Pacific Ocean. I was there on on business, so I did not have the luxury of sitting back and relaxing and enjoying the facilities to their maximum potential. That said, the grounds, fitness facilities, restaurants and rooms were top notch. I did not get to experience the golf course, but it looked to be well manicured. The hotel has a great old world charm and really hit the mark on what a traditional 5

Summary: This beautiful hotel was all I could ask for and more... beautifully maintained gardens and golf course, a great view of the ocean and emacculate rooms made this hotel feel like "old money" to me :-) marble everything and delicious food!  And the spa was just perfect.  The best masseus I have ever come across... I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: DizLiz123-  We are happy that you enjoyed your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope you will return in the future to enjoy the golf course, restaurants and spa.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: When you don't have time to go five star in Maui, this is a great in between trips
Summary: I love Maui, and the big Island, and love the five stars they have there...   But I live in LA, so between those trips, I'll check the prices and often this gem has a reasonable rate and I shoot out to Monarch Beach.  The facility feels like the five star hotels in Wailea and Kona, and the gym is amazing, the best hotel gym in many respects I have seen.  The service is outstanding overall, one area that needs improvement is the pool service, while attentive its just a bit of a chore, not elegant, more rushed, and WHERE ARE THE CABANAS, they have only a few for rent.    But other than those nits, the Beach House is amazing for lunch. I love this place, my fav in Laguna, much better than its neighbor across the freeway, the rooms, are spacious and the room service amazing.
Manager Response: Rachel R.-  Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear that you enjoy staying at the Resort and got to take advantage of our wonderful amenities. We hope that you will return to the Resort in the future.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: After my in-laws passed away, we took our children away (we are from NYC) to Laguna and stayed at the St. Regis. It was everything we needed and wanted.  The pool, and beach and activities were wonderful.  My boys brought a football with them and found a group to play with on he beach.  Even kne of he staff joined in!  We loved the sunsets and the concierge found us incredible restaurants each night.  The service was very good, and always accommodating.  Thanks St. Regis.
Manager Response: Michael F.-  We are pleased to hear that the St. Regis Monarch Beach served as a great getaway for you and your family. We hope that you will return in the future to enjoy the pool, beach and restaurants.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Overall nice and great food, but uncomfortable add-on charges
Summary: Staying here (as I type) for a conference, and am moderately pleased with the place. I must admit that I was a bit annoyed off the start when I called to make my travel reservations "at the group rate" and found that I had to bill the first night's stay to a credit card on the phone. Wha?? I mean, even moderately upscale hotels don't require anything more than a credit card on file, not actually CHARGING the room to my credit card. I told them no and decided to look around the area for something more sane. Unfortunately, there's nothing in the area. I called back the next day and had the same rule explained, so I bit the bullet and reserved. I then had to carry around a $200 charge on my card until the conference started. Not cool, St. Regis. Trust me, it doesn't make you look
Manager Response: Zarqua-  Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. I am sorry about the issue with parking, however the prices are listed when you make your reservation. We are happy to hear you enjoyed the food at the Resort and your conference. We hope you will return soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We love the beach. The air is invigorating.  While not right "on the beach" the views from the St. Regis across the golf course to the Beach are breathtaking.  The walking path that winds through the golf course and takes you to the beach is a good exercise.  The trip down is leisurely, and the trip back up hill gets the lungs and the heart going.  The Pool and the Food Service are 1st class.  The rooms are large and comfortable, and have a feature we have never seen before.  When you want your room made up, you press a switch in the room, and light comes on in the hall calling for room make-up.  And, it works like a charm. The grounds are meticulously maintained.  We watched an outdoor wedding from our patio.  Dana Point and the surrounding small beach towns are charming.  Give
Manager Response: Leighton R-  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope you will return in the future to enjoy our pool and wonderful restaurants.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: A beautiful RESORT Hotel, located along the Newport Coast.
Summary: Halfway between Newport Beach and San Clemente is the Laguna Niguel coastline area, which has this Resort, AND the Ritz Carlton, but we chose this one, as it had just opened, and everything was new.  We were not disappointed.  Even though the room rates are "pricy", by the time you leave, you walk away thinking, "Yeah, I'd come back here again."  This is one of the FIVE STAR RESORTS in Southern California.  If you like the Pacific Ocean, you can walk there in 5 minutes from the St. Regis.
Manager Response: Kent S.-  Thank you so much for your review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are so happy to hear how much you love the Resort; we hope you will return in the future.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: The St. Regis Monarch Beach Hotel is an oasis of comfort and luxury in the Dana Point, CA, area.  Having stayed at the Ritz Carlton Laguna Niguel, just up the street a ways, I would say the St. Regis is definitely a step up and it has also received five stars from a national rating agency.    The restaurants, to include Stonehill Tavern, are all great. . . even for breakfast.  They always have my favorite of fresh papaya with lime and berries, canadian bacon & English muffine. What more could you ask for?  This is definitely a hotel worth the price in terms of comfort and services . . . even if it is only once in your lifetime that you stay here.  Can't say enough good things about this venue.
Manager Response: Suddrethks-  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach and got to try your favorites at Stonehill Tavern. We hope you will return soon and take advantage of the many amenities the Resort has to offer.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: My husband and I decided to take a mini-vacay right before Chirstmas to relax and re-charge. The St. Regis Resort is one of our favorite places to stay to relax and we weren't disappointed.  As a SPG Gold Member they upgrade your room (if avail) to an executive suite. Our room was spacious and comfortable.  We enjoyed the beautiful ocean view and had a nice walk on the resort grounds.   We had our holiday brunch at the Motif and the food/service was excellent!  Since it was during the holiday season, there were carolers singing and visiting most tables. Santa made a special appearance at lunch and it was fun to see all the kids excited.      Overall we had a relaxing weekend and look forward to coming back.
Manager Response: SLMcKee-  We are so happy to hear that you and your husband enjoyed your mini-vacation at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you will return in the future and try more of our wonderful restaurants.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Average service, beautiful property - not a star
Summary: We stayed at the St Regis Dana Point over New Years with our children this past year.  We found the hotel to be absolutely beautiful and it could be so much more.    We had disappointing service, food that was sometimes inedible (room service) and worst of all when we complained on day #2 about our previous night's room service they were incapable of sorting through the problems to make amends.  They promised they would remove the meal that was cold and inedible from our bill but they did not.  We called to discuss it with the management two weeks after our return and we are still waiting to hear back from them.  Overall it was a disappointing stay.  I should have trusted the reviews here and stayed elsewhere but honestly we are Starwood Platinum members so I expected better
Manager Response: Kaitraveler-  Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are sorry to hear about the issues that occurred with room service. As far as being a family-friendly Resort we offer many family programs, like a Sandcastle Kids Club and Father Son tee times.    Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: A wonderful hotel with an almost perfect location but  NOT St. Regis flawless service as in other properties. It has opulent public areas, fantastic restaurants and a beautiful pool.    It is a bit disappointing with no direct access to the beach like the Ritz  but the St. Regis  is  a much better hotel by most  measures. Dining in the restaurant was a delight with a few  service failures at the beginning but  greatly improved to a perfect finish. The spa  experience was very good and beautiful but  a bit unkempt and loud with cell phones being used is some areas. Room service was perfect for breakfast but many requests were VERY LATE OR DID NOT materialize at all.  Very disappointing.  Management tried to solve  with little success. Overall service was NOT up to standards. The
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the St. Regis Monarch Beach while attending a meeting down the road at the Ritz.    The rooms and welcome amenities were nice and the pool bar and restaurant was awesome.  The pool is the perfect place to lounge but I have to say that it is a bit of a bummer to be staying at a property of this quality in this location and not have direct beach access.  The property has a bit more of a residential feel as opposed to the more resort like vibe of the Ritz down the street.  While it might not have the fit, finish or service of the Regis the Surf and Sand down the street has an amazing location, right on the beach.    It does have a bit busier location and vibe and I haven't stayed in the rooms but the feel is more local rather than resorty.  Also, if visiting in the
Manager Response: Bmordski-  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach and got the chance to experience a little of what Dana Point has to offer. We hope you will return in the future and continue to enjoy our pool and restaurants.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Somewhat over rated? Or is it just me?
Summary: You maybe thinking..what a 5 star hotel..over rated, well yes! I think most are? I have stayed in better and I've stayed in a lot worst. But to me a hotel is room, with a bathroom, that is clean and tidy-just somewhere for me to sleep that is safe. I can't get excited about a "resort" I don't go somewhere to stay inside a "resort", I go to see the sights, meet people, have experiences. Okay it was some of the finest people watching i have ever had (it was New Years Eve), but the bar servce was very poor! They would be a riot in the UK if you had to wait 20 minutes to get served at a bar on New Year-or on any day for that matter. The real plus was the size of the bath...easy enough space for 2 and you could watch the telly while in it. Food in bar over priced and serviced cold?
Manager Response: Loudnorthernbird-  Thank you for your recent review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. Summary Heading: I'm SPG Platinum and it was great!
Summary: I noticed a number of reviews from platinum members who were disappointed and I think the St Regis has it all figured out now.   The stay was great because of all of the details:  1. Random but we forgot hair gel--the spa gave us a sample because they didn't have our usual for purchase. 2. The bed was insanely comfortable. 3. The towels were amazing. 4. I was worried because the room wasn't ready and I had to come back (often that means a long wait for luggage). They actually followed me to my room from the re-check in. 5. I did get upgraded and recognized for being platinum. 6. All the staff were extraordinarily attentive. 7. The grounds were meticulously kept.  My only concerns were the valet (seems like they need some oversight--we waited over 30 minutes to get our car), and
Manager Response: Hotel Vibe-  We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach and were pleased with our staff. Summary: This place is very special to me and I love everything about it.  I enjoy all the restaurants  here and the outdoor areas are my favorite part.  Classically understated in decor and fittings, the place has all the comfort and style one would expect from a prestigious brand.  and I absolutely LOVE the massages by Lynn at Gaucin Spa....

Summary: We stayed for 2 weeks over the holidays. We thought it was faultless and enjoyed eating in all the restaurants. Our server at breakfast was Cristina who really looked after us. We played golf 4 times on an excellent course with great views of the sea. First time was very slow at 5 hours but got that down to 3hrs when the course was quieter. Thought it was an excellent Resort.

We hope you will return in the future for another round of golf and perhaps enjoy a day at our five-star Spa Gaucin.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Very solid but a notch away
Summary: Several families stayed with us over the New Year's holiday.   Service was outstanding including the room service staff which fetched a lost item left on a service cart for us.  For the price, the hotel is missing a notch - some of the finer details - to achieve a 5-star rating.
Manager Response: Cutterback-  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your New Year’s holiday at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you will return to the Resort in the future.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Beautiful property marred by poor service
Summary: It's a shame such a grand property with beautiful  facilities could be so easily marred by poor service.  We checked in Christmas Eve weekend. Check in was smooth thanks to David, the front desk manager. He took care of us efficiently and was eager to help us find the room we desired.  Our service at Stonehill Tavern was equally outstanding. The restaurant is under new management and it clearly showed. Service approached perfection and was absolutely flawless.  Unfortunately things went quickly downhill from that point forward.  1)  Requested ice for our room, but a full hour went by with no delivery.    2)  Called the resort services number back to check on the status.  45 minutes after that, we finally had ice delivered.  An hour and 45 minutes to deliver ice delivered! I've
Manager Response: Armen-Sarkisian-  Thank you for your recent review of the St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are very sorry to hear about the situation with the ice and your dining experience at Motif Restaurant.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Beautiful hotel with incredible service.  We were really fortunate to get a suite with a butler.  The room came with a large living room, bedroom, two marble bath rooms and a large patio with an ocean view.  The butler brought sparkling water and chocolate dipped strawberries to help us celebrate our anniversary.  After dinner (excellent at Michael Mina's in the hotel) we came back to our room to find real rosé petals leading from the front door to the bedroom.  On the dining table were roses, candles and a sweet note from the butler.  In the bedroom there were two towel swans on the bed, along with rosé petal hearts .... Very romantic!   High quality amenities, I liked the shampoo so much that I ordered it off the Internet.  The spa was very nice with good quality treatments.
Manager Response: Csora2547-  We are so pleased to hear you enjoyed your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you will return in the future and take advantage of the many other amenities the Resort has to offer.  Thank you,  The Executive Team The St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: The is our second stay at the St Regis Monarch Beach.  We do an annual "get away" before the Christmas rush just to decompress and have some quiet time. This property never disappoints.  The staff is top notch. Check in had several people waiting, however it moved along as a smooth and professional pace. As soon as we were checked in, we were in our room in a few minutes. Rooms are immaculate, clean, and quiet.  We almost felt as if we were the only guests at the hotel. We were upgraded to a corner balcony suite that overlooked the golf course and faced the ocean. We left the resort only twice and spent the majority of our time relaxing in our room. Because of the holiday season the hotel was dressed up in its finest holiday decoration.  There was beautiful holiday lighting, and
Manager Response: Traveling_gal801-  We are so pleased to hear that you returned to The St. Regis Monarch Beach and got to enjoy the festive holiday decorations. We hope that you will reach your goal and return to the Resort in 2013.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Luxury Stay.. but not a quiet stay
Summary: We stayed there for a convention for 2 nights. Room is beautiful, nice amenities. Reception staff is very nice and professional. Our room was on the main floor and unfortunately a wedding party was partying it up late that night right above us on 2nd floor. Hardly any sleep that night. My husband had to make 2 calls to hotel staff to quiet them down around 2am. I'm sure another room on upper floor maybe facing the ocean would've been better. For an luxury hotel, the walls are pretty thin. Grounds are beautiful- perfect for weddings. Hotel was bustling with guests and visitors. They do a good job catering for corporate events. Try the hotel bar on upper deck overlooking courtyard and ocean for a sunset drink. Takes a while to get to the beach- you need to catch a hotel shuttle to
Manager Response: MDZair-  Thank you for your review of the St Regis Monarch Beach. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your convention at the Resort. We hope that you will return in the future and take advantage of one of the many rooms with an ocean view.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: The property is beautiful.  The rooms and bathrooms are spacious.  The food at the restaurants was really good.  Most of all, the service was incredible!  I usually don't write reviews but the people at this property were so amazing that I wanted to highlight it.  They made the difference in our trip.  I arrived with a broken ankle.  The bellman, Matt, realized it when he was taking us to our room.  He suggested a room change since our room was so far from the elevator that I would have to walk quite a distance.  Then he went to the front desk changed our room and brought us new keys within minutes so that our room would be close to the elevator.  Then he unloaded our luggage and went to find bags and ice for my ankle that would last me through the night.  Then every night after

We look forward to you returning in the future and hope you can take advantage of the other wonderful things the Resort has to offer.  Thank you,  The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Spectacular property just as described. I love the location, close to Dana Point, Laguna Beach, and the Anaheim attractions, not to mention golf, the beaches and South Coast Mall- I know the area well and this is a great place to be based for a So. Cal vacation. Easy access and a short, easy drive from John Wayne airport (Santa Ana). Gorgeous public areas, all very elegant.  Gardens and pool very nicely laid out - it is 'winter', but still looked appealing. Bedroom was beautifully furnished: linens and  bed were very comfortable. Had a pretty view over the pool towards the ocean. Bathroom was spacious and well equipped. Not really walking distance to the beach unless you want a hike. Is there a shuttle? Staff were v. pleasant. The only issue is the $. The room rate is not

We hope that you will return to the Resort in the future and take advantage of the many amenities.   Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Loved St. Regis Service from the moment we arrived for my Birthday weekend with friends.   We are so looking forward to returning to the St. Regis on another trip soon.  Matt the bell man was so wonderfully helpful and knowledgeable with the resort.  Matt went out of his way for us.  Matt hand delivered ice every evening to our room for a guest in our party with a broken ankle.  Matt also helped to extend our stay from one day to three days.  We loved the hotel and service so much we stayed longer than originally planned.  Michael Mettlille the hotel ambassador was a delight and provided us with white glove service with champagne and strawberries for my birthday celebration.  Michael greeted all guests with was welcoming and positive attitude.  Micahel is a great ambassador and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at St Regis monarch beach overnight since we were there for a wedding. Our room was great, the view was ok so will ask for a nicer view next time. It is a wonderful location for a wedding. Sunday brunch on the patio a must.

Summary: Staff at check in and checkout was great.  Housekeepers were excellent.  Turned down service was good but inconsistent.  Weather card was there one day, loved the candy.  Nice touch. It was tastefully decorated, elegant public area, beautiful pool and fountain, picturesque ground.  Conference rooms, ballroom were elegant except one room on 5th floor on south side had a ceiling tile appeared to be waiting for a fall.  Based on photos and description I was expecting a waterfront resort but ocean was about a mile away. Room was oversize, furniture was excellent, beds were comfortable, HVAC was adequate, TV, Phone, Clock, CD Player was good.  Bathroom was oversized, tub was great and so does shower.  Water temperature and flow was excellent.  Walkway to room between the bath room
Manager Response: UpperCapeResident-  Thank you for your recent review on Trip Advisor. We are pleased to hear that the staff met your expectations and that you enjoyed your stay overall. Summary Heading: An Awful Stay and Whats Worse is that NOBODY Cared!
Summary: Let me start out with the good because there was good.  The hotel is very elegant looking and classy. The Sunday brunch was amazing and the best I have ever seen.  Everything you can imagine was there and not only was it there, it was the best of the best!  Being a St. Regis that is what I expected and what one would expect when paying close to $1000 a night. BUT NO SIR!  The brunch is where the excellence stopped!  The ENTIRE staff of the hotel were rued and demeaning.   I am a member of SPG gold and JP Morgan Palladium which was is suppose to be VIP partner of theirs.  I got treated liked crap at check in and triple talked that I was getting a upgrade.  The host was so glad to tell me a got a 5x upgrade.  BUT, I explained that is the suite I paid for, how is that an upgrade?

Suite Award points are issued by SPG and apply to executive suites and unfortunately in this case the St. Regis suites were not part of the program. Summary Heading: Grandeur and Elegance near Laguna beach
Summary: The St Regis Monarch Beach is a exquisite property in California. It is one of my favorite hotels anywhere. I absolutely love the style and architecture of this property. The hotel grounds and pool with its magnificent fountains and manicured gardens are reminiscent of a Luxurious European Villa. The property has an extreme WOW factor from the moment you pull into the gate.   The rooms are spacious and perfectly appointed. Everything is exactly as you would expect here at the St Regis.The only drawback for me is that its not directly on the beach, however direct beach access is a short stroll through the beautiful property or by golf cart. The hotel more than makes up for its proximity by adding extra detail and luxurious surroundings everywhere you look. I love this place and
Manager Response: Peter F.-  We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach and look forward to you returning in the future!  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: One would not think that a five star resort could be both family oriented and offer adult experiences.  The ST Regis in Monarch Beach is the exception. They treat each guest as a precious pearl.  The restaurant quality is surprisingly good. From upscale to a Starbucks like cozy nook.   the pool and beach attendants are there to make your experience fantastic. To get to the beach one must take a shuttle. At first we thought this was not such a fun thing. It is about 5 minute ride. However, It became an adventure. The beach club dining was great.   We took our married kids and grandchildren. The rooms are pricey but not out of line for the quality, size and amenity of the resort and the room itself was very lovely.  Tip: Try to get a pool facing room as far from the lobby as

Summary: Stayed here for the first time this past weekend with wife and 2 small kids. First let me say this is a beautiful hotel. It feel and looks exactly like the st regis in Mallorca, Spain. Great pools. Especially great kids pools, where our kids played with Torri Spelling and her kids. Anyway.  I wrote them ahead of time to tell them it was my 3-year-olds birthday and to ask for a platinum upgrade -- if available. A very nice "reservation butler" called me and told me they only upgrade Platinums to better views -- not suites, but, she said, they would confirm an upgrade for us ahead of time for the special occasion. A very generous offer. And i immediately saw the upgrade to executive suite reflected in my spg app. We checked in the next day and, of course, i hear "we have upgraded
Manager Response: Mpolatin-  We are so sorry to hear about the few hiccups that occurred at your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach but we are glad you enjoyed your overall stay. We hope you and your family will return in the future.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: This property is set on a hill overlooking the ocean. We enjoyed 80+ degree days in late October! Check in is easy... but no upgrades were available for starwood gold members... which seems to be the norm for this program. Our room was nice and was well stocked with amenities. We overlooked the pool and had a peekaboo ocean view from the balcony. Staff is attentive but not overbearing. The spa is excellent.... clean... very relaxing. Although this is a beach resort... the walk from the hotel to the beach is further than most would feel comfortable with... so they do have a golf cart type shuttle service to transport you back and forth. We did encounter a bit of a line (and some rude line cutters) which translated to a 30 minute wait. We tried 3 different restaurants on the
Manager Response: Brad L.-  We are so happy to hear that you got a chance to come out to The St. Regis Monarch Beach and enjoy the sunny California weather. We are glad you had a pleasant stay and got a chance to take advantage of the many wonderful amenities the Resort has to offer. We hope you will be back again soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Great honeymoon at a beautiful resort
Summary: This was one of the most impressive resorts I have been to. My husband and I spent half of our honeymoon at the St.Regis Dana point, and everything was amazing. It was definitely an off-peak time, as the resort seemed quiet aside from hosting some meetings and events during the week, but when we arrived Saturday night, the bar was crowded, there was free live music & everyone, us included, was having a great time. It was also very nice to share the private beach with only 1 other couple. I felt that the staff were all super nice & helpful, and it seemed like they thought of everything. We were upgraded to a pool facing room with a balcony, which was a must- having a view of the courtyard, pool and ocean was one of our favorite parts. I hope that we will be able to visit again,
Manager Response: Kcasey6-  We are so happy to hear that you and your husband enjoyed your honeymoon at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope to see you again in the future, congratulations on the wedding!  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I like this hotel. Theres a beach area for the hotel guests. I like that they set up everything for you. Our room is very clean and I love the remede bath products.  The room service food is delicious! We also enjoyed the monarch butterfly release. The jewelry shop there has good quality stuffs and the staffs are very nice and helpful. The spa was small. The butler service was good.  Pool attendants needs better training.
Manager Response: Mercedesgl-  Thank you for your recent review of the St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and took advantage of the many amenities the Resort has to offer. We hope that you will return in the future.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Nice family vacation with some hiccups
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and 2 yr old son. The resort is pretty big but the pool area for guests with families is a bit tight and small. But because we were there off season it wasn't a real issue but I can see it being too crowded in the summer months. Husband and I took turns having "alone time". Husband played a round of golf and I went to the spa. I can probably write a separate review for the spa but the spa was also very small and the area where you get ready after taking shower is connected to the area with the hot tub, sauna, and steam room, so you can imagine how hot it got trying to get ready. i had to pack my things and go to my room to finish getting ready b/c i couldn't stop sweating!  The biggest issue I had was that when we returned to our room
Manager Response: joolee501- Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. We regulate the temperatures in the Spa as best we can to 68 to 70 degrees. We hope you enjoyed your treatment and the rest of your stay at the Resort.  Thank you,   The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort with a few issues...
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the St. Regis for two nights in September as part of a driving tour of California.  Our room was great, on the same level as the lobby so we never had to wait for an elevator; because of the building layout we were actually several floors up and had a nice balcony.  We used the spa facilities - yoga and massage - which were very nice but had limited hours (closed at 8pm); as I'm used to going to the gym at night this didn't work out for me.  Also, we had dinner at the signature restaurant the first night we were there as we arrived late and found it a bit dark and empty.  The food was fine, just the atmosphere left something to be desired as there were only two other tables of diners...  The breakfast coffee shop was great - our AAA rate included a $50
Manager Response: Rolleicord-  We are pleased to hear that you and your wife enjoyed your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We hope that you will visit again and will continue to take advantage of the many things the Resort has to offer.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Platinum Starwood Guests... don't expect special care!
Summary: Very disappointed in last stay at the St. Regis. As a platinum starwood member... not impressed with the service at all. No suite upgrade even though they had suites available on their website during our entire visit . I even had 10 suite award nights to use and were rejected. I will be following up with the Starwood loyalty executive staff on that one.  What is the point of being a loyal starwood guest if they don't honor their commitments.  We also had a very poor room location actually about the worst location in the entire hotel. Even refused 4pm checkout even though they were half full. Humiliating experience and not interested in ever returning. If you are platinum stay away. They only want your $$$$ and unfortunetly status means nothing there and they make you feel like
Manager Response: Businesstraveler486-  We are sorry to hear about the issues that occurred on your recent trip. Suite Award points are issued by SPG and apply to executive suites and unfortanetly in this case the St. Regis suites were not part of the program. As far as check out times, not all rooms are available to late checkout and it really comes down to what type of room was booked. We are sorry for the confusion and will try to make this clear in the future.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: After reading much reviews of this resort, I was half hesitant to book my weekend staycation here.  It seems most of the gripes are the "expensive" valet fees of 35/night and the 25/night resort fee.  The other half of the gripe stems from the cold and tip-demanding attitude of the staff.  Although I was able to deduct 10 / night due to my SPG status, even the 50/ night added can be a financial pain.  However, I knew this upfront and it is what it is.  Many other hotels / resorts charge this and more.  BUT, I believe the hotel should be more proactive in informing their customers instead of burying it in the fine prints and having the back lash of negative feedback as a result.  The attitude of the staff, was friendly.  I know that many of the staff lean upon the support of
Manager Response: John K-   Thank you for your review on Trip Advisor. I am sorry to hear about the issue with the fire alarm we will take this up with management to make sure this does not happen again. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your trip as a whole and look forward to you returning in the future.   Thank you, The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Georgous Resort and Oustanding Room and View
Summary: I attended a conference at this resort.  It is elegance and opulence personified.  The resort is beautiful and very well maintained.  The main area were clean and up-to-date.  There were several restaurants on premises which made it very convenient for a conference attendee without a car.    I had the "basic" room.  It had upscale fixtures and features.  The bed was extraordinarily comfortable.  The bathroom was large and well designed.    The only challenge was during check in.  It took longer than expected.  Also, I was asked which paper I wanted delivered (complimentary) every morning.  I selected the Wall Street Journal.  It did not arrive either of the days.  I called both days and received one only on the first day.  I found out that they did not include the Journal as an
Manager Response: Satxsptsfan-  Thank you so much for your review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are thrilled that you enjoyed your time here, we are sorry that there was some confusion with the morning paper. We hope you will surprise your wife with a trip!  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Lovely stay; it helped to have read reviews here first
Summary: We had a great time here.  It is a fantastic property.  All the things I care about -- exquisite bedding and linens, quiet rooms, beautiful grounds ... were present.  I appreciated all tips from prior posters, especially about the no coffee makers in rooms, and we planned accordingly.  (Nothing as sad as someone on east coast time seeking coffee at 4 am.)  The HUGE extra benefit at the St Regis was the Monarch Bay Club -- with an amazing ocean restaurant & complimentary chairs and umbrellas. Also, wonderful fitness classes and a great gym --also complimentary.
Manager Response: Pvbbeachgirl-  Thank you so much for your review about The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and got to take advantage of the many amenities the Resort has to offer. We hope you will come back soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Great Property, Nice Rooms and Location
Summary: My wife and I just returned from a trip at St. Regis Monarch Beach.  The property is absolutely beautiful and is well maintained.  We've been to the St. Regis in Princeville, HI and this one does not disappoint.  The service was excellent, the rooms were nicely decorated and had all the amenities we expect at a 5-star resort.  We used the pool and hot tub which overlook the Monarch Beach Golf Course and have a great view of the Pacific.  We did not eat the restaurants in the resort.  They seemed extremely expensive relative to the area.  I would recommend driving into Laguna and going to Nick's!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review about your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay, and look forward to having you and your family as a returning guest.  Thank you.  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Amazing resort...  Frustrating how dependent they make you on their services.
Summary: Beautiful resort.  Amazing service.  BUT and this is a big but, they make you dependent upon their staff to the point where you feel like no matter what you are doing you are being put in a position to tip.  A lot of people with their hands out in my opinion at this resort.  Example - no ice machines, you want ice you are calling room service oh yeah and tipping them.  Ask for two buckets and they still do it in two trips, so guess what two people to tip.  Kind of the same with the parking, yeah you can self park, but there are ZERO in out priveledges, which means every time you want you car you are paying AGAIN!  They even tell you it is done that way to incentivize you to do valet, where tipping is expected lol.  The tram driver to the beach, yup he waited for a tip...  It was
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. The Staff at the Resort does not expect tips, and you do not have to tip each time. We hope you enjoyed your stay and will stay at the Resort again soon!  Thank you,  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I brought my friend to Southern California for their first trip, and this was our first stop!  I could not have planned a better location to start our journey!  An amazing property, with the nicest staff I've ever come across!  Can't beat the location or the atmosphere!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was upgraded to a suite and truly enjoyed it and the view.  I spent 4 days here and would love to go back to explore the area. The service and food was great. I couldn't ask for a better trip. The price was what I expected considering it was a 5 star property, however  the fees were just a tad bit pricey considering the proximity to the beach. Overall it was very memorable and I plan to visit again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After deliberating between the Montage and St. Regis in the Laguna Beach area, 'cause we already stayed at the Ritz Carlton Laguna Niguel in the past -- we chose the St. Regis. It's a true 5* property on a stunning golf course, which we unfortunately didn't play. Our room entitled us to a 'butler service' who brought coffee to our room daily. The pool area feels luxurious and has a beautiful view with fountains. Prices for cocktails are $15 -- pretty steep! This property isn't right on the beach and you need to wait for a shuttle to take you to the beach. There was only 1 individual who greets you there and sets you up with chairs & towels. My only complaint was $25 resort fee and $35 valet parking daily. These additions and taxes add up to a hefty daily rate. The drive into
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great turndown, staff, bed, property. Montage is better.
Summary: This is a solid property with great service. The team members take proactive approach to service (for example, a valet brought the house car around rather than make me wait for the golf clubhouse shuttle).  The bed was blissful and the grounds are in great shape.  The fitness center hours were a bit limited (6am - 9pm if I recall).  The spa facilities were good, but I think they would benefit from an additional spa staff member as there were some items in the men's locker room that needed attention and I didn't see anyone around.  Turndown service was top notch.  At one point while I was working in the room midday, two team members came in to take care of the life plants.  They were thorough.  Lots of attention to details!  The Montage surpasses the St. Regis in my book, though.
Manager Response: John- Thank you for your review about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We appreciate your positive feedback, and sharing your photos. We hope you can come enjoy the Resort again as a SPG guest.   Thank you.  The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Beautiful property.  Paid for room using Starpoints but they still charged me 60$ for valet and a "resort fee."  Such a nice hotel but left feeling very disappointed with the bill.   Other starwood hotels I have stayed at waive these fees and St Regis should extend the courtesy as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent post on TripAdvisor. The St. Regis Monarch Beach values our SPG Members, and offers the following:  - Late Check-out (4pm) - Upgrade to Suite (All Platinum SPG members) - Complimentary Breakfast - Complimentary Welcome beverage - Complimentary Internet  We hope you can stay again with us soon. Thank you.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Overall, I have to say, the St. Regis Monarch Beach is a beautiful hotel - the grounds are lovely, the staff is nice, and the rooms are well appointed (what an amazing bed!); however, this past weekend when staying there for our anniversary, my husband and I encountered the following service issues that we don't generally experience at 5 star properties:  1. Room Location:  When we checked into the St Regis we were told that we "might have the pool to ourselves" since most of the rooms were being occupied by guests attending one of the three weddings happening on Saturday night or a medical convention also happening on the grounds.  That sounded great to us...until we were arrived at our room and found our balcony was located right next to one of the hotel's main patios/decks.
Manager Response: aussiegwp- Thank you for your recent review about your stay at the Resort. We are sorry to hear you encountered some service issues, and we wanted to let you know we are working on those issues internally.   Thank you for choosing to spend your anniversary at The St. Regis Monarch Beach.   The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Greeted at the lobby door and in my room within 4 minutes.  Small, but very well appointed rooms.  Lower priced rooms have quiet garden views.  Food offerings are surprisingly good.  Internet prices are outrageous, as is valet parking, plus you are coerced by the check-in clerks into agreeing to housekeeping gratuities in advance (I suspect you get the room next to the kitchen, otherwise).  Nonetheless, the bar offers good values.  The spa is excellent and very well maintained.  Not my favorite location, but would stay here again if business took me here.  Just be careful when booking because the final nightly rate (room+gratuity+parking+fees+internet) will be well above what you anticipate.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lawyer Meeting Dana Point in October
Summary: For luxurious rooms and public areas to outstanding service  St Regis is a standout. The staff is courteous and efficient, the Butler service overwhelming. It It is expensive , especially when you add in $25/day resort fee and $35/day parking.The food was somewhat of a disappointment although served beautifully. I'd go back anytime.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very disappointing for a hotel of this caliber
Summary: Front desk staff needs better training in how to be nice to their guests. It took about 3 hours from the time we checked in until our room was ready and there was major confusion about the room we were supposed to get based on our confirmation. Staff in other areas (valet, bar, maid service) was courteous and professional. Stone hill Tavern is having issues as well. The food is good albeit slightly expensive. When they get too crowded, the kitchen self destructs and the food takes an hour to come out. This place has definitely gone down hill in the last few years. It's too bad.
Manager Response: orah423- Thank you for your review on TripAdvisor. We are sorry that you had issues checking in and a long wait time at Stonehill Tavern. We hope we can have you stay with us again soon so you can enjoy a more positive experience at the Resort.  Thank you,  The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel with access to a beautiful beach
Summary: The staff is super friendly and helpful and the restaurant super yummy. We received sand buckets and shovels for our children at checkin - a really nice touch. The beach is a short and pleasant shuttle ride away. Even if you're only staying for one night, you can enjoy the beach all day!
Manager Response: Thank you for your postive review about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our private beach.   Looking forward to having you and your family at the Resort again soon.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Stayed here for a friend's wedding and really enjoyed the stay. The property is large and beautiful. We stayed in a suite and it was large and had a wonderful beach view. The room featured nice toiletries and plush bath robes.   The service was on par for a luxury hotel and all of the staff was attentive and friendly. Of course this hotel costs more but it is to be expected with this type of hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the St. Regis Monarch Beach for a conference.  Two days is much too short.   Great golf course, pool, spa (so I've heard from colleagues).  If only I'd had time to venture down by the beach even  :-(.  I hope to return for pleasure.  Beautiful hotel.  The one flaw I found was, after I checked in, the terrace in my room was not cleaned.  I suspect it was a one-off - but reported it none-the less.  They immediately offered to switch my room, which I declined, assuming I'd have no reason to be on the terrace.  It was cleaned immediately and I was fine.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Valet parking returned my car with a dent. I asked the valet, the front desk, and security personnel to have the general manager contact me personally to discuss the issue but was told that the general manager doesn't deal with these type of issues. I insisted to talk to the general manager and left my business card, but almost a week has passed and I have yet to hear from the general manager. The security person and manager on duty, who did show up, seemed more concerned about hotel liability than damage to the car. And while the manager on duty said he would follow up with me - he never did. Needless to say nobody offered a refund of valet fees or anything else for the fact I almost missed my flight on the day of checkout having to deal with this issue. This is a nice hotel
Manager Response: DrDanM- We are sorry to hear about the issue with our valet and your car. Please email Chelsea Allen directly at Chelsea.McFerran-Allen@stregis.com to resolve this issue.  Thank you,  The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Stayed for two days on business and wish it could have been longer.  The check-in process was very smooth and the young man who brought my suitcase to the room was very helpful in showing me some of the features of the room: door lock for patio door, do not disturb button, handy outlets for chargers. The room and furnishings were all beautiful and immaculate. Everything looked brand new!  The bathroom was my favorite part of the room - huge, luxurios and spotless. Great towels and toiletries, also.  The common areas were beautiful inside and out. Every detail was well tended to. Food and drinks were all very good and the staff was friendly everywhere : wait staff, gift shop, coffee shop, concierge desk, housekeeping - couldn't ask for a nicer group of people! Made my stay a
Manager Response: Ann- Thank you for posting your review on TripAdvisor. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, and we hope next time you can stay longer.   Thank you, Ann!  The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: great food at stonehill tavern and poolside restaurant. Very nice staff.. Nice romantic getaway.. The pool was nice and serene but no separate pool for family/kids, so it got quiet noisy when the kids showed up... would be nice to have separate adult pool and kids pool.  Access to monarch bay beach club was nice and all the staff who drove us there and back were very nice. Stonehill tavern staff were nice and accommodating to our special occasion.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review on TripAdvisor. We are pleased to hear you had a great trip and enjoyed our friendly staff.  The St. Regis Monarch Beach has three swimming pools for spa and hotel guests to enjoy. The Main Pool is outfitted in luxury cabanas for your leisure, along with a Lagoon Pool, perfect for small children and families.  Thank you.   The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: First rate luxury! Prepared to be spoiled!
Summary: We loved our recent stay at this beautiful hotel. It is absolutely gorgeous! Kudos to David, our butler, for taking such good care of us during our stay there. Concierge desk staff & staff at reservations desk were so friendly & helpful.  Be sure & eat dinner at the Stonehill Tavern. Excellent food! Their pool area at hotel is simply beautiful! We only spent one night but definitely want to return for a one week stay. The town of Laguna Beach is charming & fun to visit. What a lovely part of our country! The rooms are a wow!!!! I am a complete hotel snob & this hotel completely pleased me!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I thought the property itself, location, rooms, and everything about the resort was top notch.  The attention to detail and cleanliness is literally second to none.  The ocean views, pool, common square, golf course, and grounds are incredibly beautiful and breathtaking.  I live in Southern California, and mostly get to see the ocean daily.  I was still taken aback by the beauty of the resort.  The service is "very good," although probably not quite as personal as some other St. Regis resorts.  The only thing I was disappointed with was the butler service.  There was none.  But I would definetly highly recommend a visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we booked the st Regis on the advice of our agent Rob M at smartflyer dot com (St. Louis division). He arranged an upgrade with extensive amenities include ocean view suite. we are well travelled professionals and this may have been the nicest hotel room we've seen in the US. the lobby, dining facilities and pool area are similarly elegant.  the hallways probably need a slight update. we travelled off season so the common areas were quiet but always well staffed and maintained. although I wasn't golfing this trip, I am a reasonable golfer, the course viewed from the hotel looked well manicured and technically interesting. service was also quiet good. i emailed with the concierge prior to arrival and had great service from the onsite "butlers"  we had a late breakfast daily which
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Gorgeous stately hotel with excellent service and views of the manicured golf course and Pacific Ocean
Summary: Unfortunately only stayed one night. Had to tear myself away. Beautiful and large suite with incredible views of the manicured golf course. Service was outstanding everywhere. Would jump at the chance to come back. One night is not enough.  Friendly and accommodating staff.
Manager Response: Ann F-  Thank you for your review on The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are thrilled that you enjoyed your short stay with us and will look forward to your return as a repeat guest!  Thank you,  The Executive Offices The St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: It is a beautiful facility at best setting in California. But it has worst staffing and service in the world.  My golf bag was missing  every time I play and didn't even made to my trunk when I check out from the hell. My family was harassed by  drunks no staff came to help and when I complained about it they were all about defending themselves. Not to mention the humiliation I had to take in front of my friends and family. I don't think this overpriced so call high end facility does not deserve the name St. Regis . And totally unsafe for your family.  Oh almost forgot the below average food and beverage totally over priced. I am a respectful architect from San Francisco and I spend more that 200 days in five to six star hotels all around the world so don't take my advice
Manager Response: Chuck K - Thank you for your response on TripAdvisor. Our management team is looking into your issues right now, and making sure these events do not occur in the future.    We apologize for the events that took place during your stay. The St. Regis Monarch Beach is a safe place for families, and we strive to make sure our guests feel comfortable during their stay.    The Executive Team St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: This is our first stay at Monarch Beach but it certainly won't be our last stay.  The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are very spacious and the decor is lovely. The food in the restaurants is definitely five star.  But the very very best thing about this hotel are all the people who work there. The staff is efficient, non-intrusive and very welcoming. They go out of there way to provide great service. We were amazed that the bartender at the beach club and the waitress in the lounge remembered us by sight and by name after only having seen us once before. Housekeeping provides outstanding service both during the day and in the evening with turndown service.   If you are looking for a very special place to go for any occasion, you can't go wrong by planning a trip to the St Regis,
Manager Response: Rivahgirl68-  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your visit and that our staff left a lasting impression on you. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices The St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: My wife and daughter spent a day here in August.  Rooms are nice, but condescending attitude of much of the staff was a big disappointment from previous stays.  The superiority attitude of the Reception front desk was only outdone by the "I'm very important" attitude of many of the guests parading around the pool midday in High heals, makeup and jewelry.  I'll be sure to stay elsewhere next time in the area!  Notwithstanding, the Conscierge desk was very helpful.
Manager Response: davidanddottie- Thank you for your review on TripAdvisor. We are sorry to hear you had issues with the front desk. Your concerns have been voiced to our management staff. However, we are happy our concierge team was able to help you.   Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Opulent property, great location, get out your Amex
Summary: Overall, amazing property.  I had a good room rate because I was there for a conference but everything else was ridiculously priced...ie, wireless Internet, bottle of water, coffee at shop.  Which brings me to my next point, there was no complimentary coffee in room.  You had to pay $25 for a coffee maker or order room service.  This was annoying.  However, the staff was polite and unpretentious and very very eager to help.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel continues to impress with its consistent service, spotless rooms and gorgeous location.  We enjoyed our 25th wedding anniversary and other than a really loud and obnoxious group getting drunk near our table (thankfully, the waiters helped scoot them away), the evening was perfection.
Manager Response: LReego- Thank you so much for your positive review about your recent experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. Congratulations on your 25th Wedding Anniversary, we are so pleased you choose to spend it at our Resort.  Looking forward to having you back again soon,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: This was one of the most perfect first time experiences we've had in traveling.  My husband and 2 children, booked a last minute trip to California. I researched southern Cal. hotels and decided to go the Laguna Beach area. It was a toss-up between the Ritz and St. Regis. After reading 20+ reviews... the choice was St. Regis. I read more positive than negative. And it seemed as if the Ritz got more negative. When booking our 5 night getaway I booked over the phone with St. Regis. I suggest booking this way, because we got a great deal on our room. Breakfast included for 2.  The valet was great. The front desk was courteous and very helpful. The concierge was helpful. When we needed directions, everyone was willing to print out a map for us and direct us to the best locations.
Manager Response: MoA- Thank you so much for your positive review about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are thrilled to read about your great experience at the Resort, and we hope to have you and your family back again soon.   Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Gorgeous views, very helpful staff, yummy food.  The pool are is lovely and relaxing.  You can see the ocean.  Nice areas to walk around the property.  Beautiful and spacious marble bathrooms.  Very comfortable beds also it was quiet.  I wish they had coffee/tea makers in the room ---otherwise it was great.  They also offer self parking for those of us who do not like to valet.  I like to have the option and appreciate them offering both.   We spent one afternoon at Universal Studios Hollywood---it's only a little over an hour drive.  That is if the traffic is good.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best hotel I've ever been to
Summary: Upon arriving to this hotel, I noticed that this was easily the nicest resort I've ever had the pleasure of going to. When we went to check into our room, they only had a king size bed available instead of two queens. This was frustrating as it was about 8 in the evening and we were coming from a very long day of traveling. We did end up complaining and they gave us complimentary coffee and desserts. Since the room we had requested wasn't finished in an hour, they offered their sincerest apologies by giving us the presidential suite. When we walked in, we were shocked. This "room" had a giant living room with a grand piano, a huge balcony with multiple lounge chairs and a full sized table, 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a full sized kitchen, a dining room, the master bedroom had a
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review on TripAdvisor. We are so pleased to hear our staff was able to accomodate your requests and upgrade you to the Presidential Suite - what an experience! We hope to have you back to the Resort again soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I didn't stay at the hotel, only stopped by during the late afternoon to have a drink at the outdoor bar with my husband to enjoy a beautiful day. My husband ordered a vodka collins and I ordered a madras, neither of which the bartender had heard of. I said, how about a sea breeze? Same blank look. These are very common mixed drinks, and have been for many years. I can't believe the hotel would have a bartender that has no clue how to make a mixed drink. My husband and I finally ordered a beer and then left. I also asked about the parking ticket - where to have it validated. Again, she had no clue.
