I don't think it is too hard of a stretch to expect the hotel to hire staff that are not only knowledgeable of their profession but also of the hotel and its workings. If the hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on TripAdvisor. We are sorry to hear about your issue with the bartender. We have let management know, and will take necessary steps to correct this issue.  Best,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Where to start???  From the check in experience, to the pool staff, the awesome rooms, and glorious warmth and luxury of this place...I cannot begin to express how terrific this place is!  Did not try the golf course, but it looked challenging enough...the spa is terrific.  Great workout facility too!  We planned on touring around the area, but honestly, once we arrived here, we never wanted to leave.  We did venture out on the FREE Laguna Beach Trolley for dinner two night in Laguna...very touristy, but we found 2 great restaurants...the concierge can help you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I feel compelled to write this having seen some of the negative reviews. I just stayed here for a conference my company hosted, and the hotel got absolutely every detail right this year, from the friendly welcome at the reception desk, to the spacious room, to the conference food, which was better this year than last year. I had no trouble catching the tram to the beach and that setup is one of the huge pluses of this resort. Just a lovely stretch of beach, and so convenient. True, this resort is pricey and there are add-on fees, but if you know that going in, I don't think you'll be disappointed. Additionally, every staff member I interacted with was genuinely friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review about your positive experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, and were able to make it down to the beach.  Looking forward to having you at the Resort soon.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I was invited to attend a meeting at the St. Regis in Dana Point for work and when asked I responded yes and went to work on extending the trip for 3 extra nights and brought my wife.  When entering the property I was immediately impressed with the property as the grounds are beautiful and the hotel is impressive.  Unfortunately the St. Regis did not live up to it's first impression.  Upon getting to the room I was disappointed.  The deck was very small and was not private at all and had no view of the water.  The bed was too firm and the pillows were a discount version of down.  There is a clock radio, but not the type you can plug in your ipod.  Unfortunately they put us close to the restaurant bar and it was noisy until 1 am.  When I called to ask for something more quiet and
Manager Response: Kelp-Cod- Thank you for your review about your recent stay. We are sorry to hear you had problems with management and your bill. We have taken these matters to our executive team, and will make sure they are addressed.   Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Luxurious but expensive hotel with a fantastic location.
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel in a beautiful location. It is an expensive place to stay but there isn't much that is inexpensive in this neighborhood.   The service is top notch and the location, view and accommodations are hard to beat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We selected this hotel because it was close to friends and wanted to play the golf course.  We stayed for two days over Labor Day weekend and were very disappointed in the total experience.  Positives: 1.  Check in to the hotel was excellent - good greating, room was available, Bell staff was very efficient. 2.  Room was very well laid out, comfortable bed and good view from the balcony. 3.  Delivery of the paper everyday was efficient. 4.  Staff at pool were very friendly. 5.  Service and food at golf course was excellent - ate breakfast there two mornings - good waitresses and prompt service and excellent food.  Best part of visit.  Negatives: 1.  Went to the main pool - pool was shut down for one-two hours - this was on the Friday of Labor Day. 2.  Went to the smaller pool -
Manager Response: SueTexas- Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear you had some positive experiences at our Resort. Unfortunately, we are sorry that the pool was closed for some time and that the wait time at the valet was long. We are constantly making sure these issues get handled in a timely fashion.  Thank you.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Great hotel just lacks understanding from management and ownership of its potential.
Summary: Great experience however seems to lack identity management don't seem very understanding to modern way of guest relations. Staff were superb. Too many kids at pool they should have a adult pool only. Overall restaurants are amazing great chefs. Stone tavern manager is very friendly and made our experience perfect.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here on August 24 for three nights prior to working in LA the following week.  After a long flight and arriving around 10:00pm on Friday night I stepped up to the front desk and was greeted warmly by David Kerr.  He apologized that as a Starwood Gold he wasn't able to upgrade me, because they were completely sold out.  I was pleased with my pool view room with the large balcony that I had booked.  The fitness center / spa was great - plenty of good equipment and super clean.  The spa wasn't overly large as compared to others, but still very nicely appointed.  I was prepared for poor valet service from what I have read on previous reviews and on flyertalk.com.  I had excellent care!  I always called ahead and my car was always waiting for me.  The bellmen and valet guys
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: FILTHY OVERFLOWING ASHTRAY ON DIRTY BALCONY - POOR RESPONSE
Summary: We booked St Regis after many divine hotels in California such as Pelican Hill, Ojai, Montage and were bitterly disappointed.  The bedrooom was situated a very very long walk from the lobby.  On the first morning, we went onto the balcony and were horrified to discover filthy ashtray overflowing with cigarette butts, ash on balcony floor, together with dirt and hair. We called David Grocott who said this was not acceptable.  We insisted balcony be 'fumigated' as we could not be bothered to change rooms and that we wished financial compensation.  After a few hours, he made us a meagre offer of free valet parking and free resort charge.  We felt this was particularly mercenary as hotels such as Pelican Hill, which is ten leagues above this one and not much more expensive, include
Manager Response: Marsha- Please contact Chelsea Allen at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. Her email is Chelsea.McFerran-Allen@stregis.com, and she can explain the prices quoted in this review - which are incorrect among other things.  Thank you.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Had the pleasure of staying at the St Regis, Monarch Beach for one night early September. The property is gorgeous! What I really liked is that it was classy and luxurious without being overly opulent.   The rooms were fantastic with amazingly comfortable beds (not sure if they use the Westin Heavenly beds since they are part of the same chain. Whatever they were, we did not want to gget out). The bathroom was also gorgeous with great amenities. Everything was spotless.   The pool was the main reason we chose to stay here and it  did not disappoint. We were staying with family / friends and wanted a day to just relax by ourselves at the pool. It was gorgeous and peaceful.   We had lunch poolside, breakfast at Motif and cocktails on the terrace. Service was great! Everything was
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was here in February 2011 for almost 2 weeks with work, I had arranged a Commercial Conference for 115 people from all over the world. It is safe to say that the attendees still talk about this event becasue the hotel completely made it for us.  There is nothing negative I can say about it apart from that I did not want to leave.  Its an excellent hotel for conferences and also personal trips.  The staff and team here made the whole experience extra special, towards the end it felt like we were a family, I was getting known with all the staff and also the hotel regulars.
Manager Response: Mandy- We are thrilled to hear you had such a wonderful stay with us for two-weeks. Thank you for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor, and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Thank you!  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: In all my travel...over six continents, The St. Regis is one of the best EVER!  When and where can you have a butler make french press coffee for you in the room in the morning and have a shirt pressed that it look brand new...nowhere but here!  Everything about this hotel defies all standards that you may be accustom to...!  Worth every penny!  This was my third stay here...already wanting to plan my fourth!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here over Labor Day Weekend! If the weather is nice stay here. It was around $410 a night for a 5 star resort with the ocean and golf course in backdrop. The pool is open 24/7 with music lightly playing late. Spa facility is included with stay. Pool Bar Grille had a good outdoor brunch and good drinks. Other then the amount of kids in the pool all day it was wonderful. Great for families. I loved Fashion Island shopping!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for posting about your recent Labor Day stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are happy to hear you enjoy our spa amenities, pool, and brunch.  Hope you and your family stay with us again soon.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I stayed here for a week in August with my husband and 19 month old son.  We loved everything about this resort and our vacation in general.  We were visiting family in the area so during the day we were quite busy.  It was so nice to come home to a clean and comfortable room.   We booked a standard guest room.  I was a little nervous at first because our son isn't the best sleeper.  (Usually when we travel, we book either a suite or adjoining rooms, but neither was possible at this location.)  I had read other reviews where families had put the crib in the bathroom, and that's just what we did, too.  The guest room is slightly larger than most standard rooms, and the balcony was a huge plus.  (While the baby napped in the room, we could sit outside and enjoy a cocktail.)  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we arrived our ocean view exec. suite included breakfast daily and valet parking.  The room was clean & at the end of the hall so quiet also.  Shortly after we got to the room our Butler!!! came to help us unpack, get us a list of activities and restaurants nearby.  Then, a lady came by with a tray of chocolate and macaroons!  All this in the first 2 hours of our stay.  The resort is beautiful and the pool enchanting.  The beach club has great food - the best in the hotel. It is a short shuttle ride through the golf course but well worth the 5 min. trip.  Only two minor complaints - the room was warm so we asked for a fan (and got one) and the pool was full on Sat. of Labor Day weekend. Compare rates with Montage and you get value here!
Manager Response: Thank you for posting about you recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We apologize for the large crowds over Labor Day, but hope you can come back and stay with us during the fall/winter season, too. We are glad to hear overall you had a wonderful time!  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, as expected (but you pay for it!), incredibly family friendly.
Summary: We are starwood platinum members and were upgraded to a very large suite, upon arrival which we weren't expecting.  It was a nice stay for our family for nine days.  The kids dining packages were a good deal (free for under four at Motif).  Some drawbacks, however:  - wifi is pretty spotty - rooms are large, clean and nice, but not as immaculate as we would have expected. - motif service was awful and slow (after a couple of times there we just ended up eating at the ritz' raya restaurant which is a close walk and terrific food/wine list) - beach is ten min tram ride away, and there isn't beach food/drink service similar to many other beach type hotels - very militant about 12pm checkout rules as they were full the day we checked out - crust cafe was very expensive ($6 for a
Manager Response: Thank you for posting you review about your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. Overall we are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. We apologize for the delay in Motif, but happy to hear you enjoyed Stonehill Tavern a few times during your stay.   The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: The St. Regis Monarch beach was a beautiful property. It was very kid friendly which was nice. Trip to the beach is via a little cart for which they have a station to wait right outside the lobby. Close to Laguna Beach. Great time
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in August and the hotel was packed - two weddings and numerous other events.  We are Starwood members and were upgraded to the next suite level.  The room was very spacious - the two bathrooms were a plus.  Everything looks like the pictures on the website.  The grounds are spectacular.  There is access to the beach, but you have to take a 10 minute tram ride to get there.  The Michael Mina restaurant at the hotel was very accomodating with modifications and the food was great.  The restaurant at the Monarch Beach Bay Club was not as great, but the view of the sunset was really nice.  There are two reasons that the rating is 4 instead of 5.  First, there is no adult pool although you are led to believe there is because there is a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great resort but artificial and too expensive
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for a short week and liked it very much. Down side are the high rates and the extra charges for every single element you can possibly imagine. Also the beach is not that great (dirty and smelled badly during our stay). But for a family still a great place to be at. It is a great hotel - with very friendly staff, amazing bedding, very well decorated rooms and a true resort experience. The pools are a bit dirty at the end of the day which is something the hotel mgt could be more alert on. What is interesting is that 90% of guests seem to be locals. A clear prove that the hotel is amongst the better places to stay in the Dana Point area. Would return.
Manager Response: FlyingPlatinum- Thank you for posting your review about your recent stay. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our staff, rooms, and overall Resort.  We have let management know about the pool tidiness.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: first trip with the new girlfriend to a resort.  could not have asked for anything better...
Summary: i travel a fair amount for business, and i have stayed in a lot of very nice places.  after a week of meetings in LA and staying at the london west hollywood (a great hotel in its own right), i was looking forward to starting the weekend in the st. regis.  i had heard so much about the place, and was very much looking forward to arriving.  (my old employers from almost 10 years ago had a retreat there when it first opened, which i was unable to attend.)  i'll cut to the chase.  the st. regis was everything i expected it to be and more.  i have a new favorite high-end luxury resort/hotel chain, and it's st. regis.  from the moment we pulled up in the rental car to when we checked out and headed back to LAX to fly back to NYC, my girlfriend and i were treated like valued guests.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lavish and You'll Pay For It!
Summary: The room rate is just the beginning.  If you can't afford the room rate you'll not be able to afford all of the 'extras' that just keep adding up.  The valet or self parking were expensive as were the nightly resort fee and the butler fee/tip.  In the end I think we spent as much on the extras as we did on the room.  That said, you get what you pay for.   The place is on a stunning location overlooking the golf course with a distant ocean view.  The property is vast and well maintained.  The rooms clean and well appointed.  The staff, especially on the reception and "front of house" were on their game.  Our butler, David, was refined, helpful and discreet.  Loved the morning beverage service!  Overall, beautiful place when in sunny SoCal.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful facilities but poor service for hotel of this caliber
Summary: We stayed here as a family of 7 in three rooms from August 19 through 25, 2012.  The resort is beautiful, however we were repeatedly disappointed and frustrated by the poor service at a hotel of this caliber.  The facilities were very nice and clean and the rooms were very comfortable.  The pool was also very nice with comfortable chairs and lots of shade.    The service was the main disappointment.  First of all, 2 of our 3 rooms were not available until 5 pm even though our confirmation letter said "12 noon early check-in when available."  We received not even an apology (much less fruit basket).  We had repeatedly long waits for service when no area we were in appeared crowded and staff appeared inattentive.  At the pool, we had trouble getting a waitress to order lunch.  At
Manager Response: LMSChina- Thank you for posting your review about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are implementing new programs to make sure check-in runs smoother and more efficiently. We are sorry to hear about the wait for ordering lunch. Our summer months are very busy and we try to serve everyone as quickly as possible.  Thank you,  The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: This hotel boasts some of the most beautiful views, from several different terrace levels and patios. The pool is very nice, thought the poolside service was pretty slow. Overall, the service of the hotel was great, people were very friendly and helpful. One thing to note, while you know you're going to be paying a lot for a St. Regis, be aware that they also charge a mandatory porterage and housekeeping gratuity on your room bill. I feel it is terribly wrong to put a gratuity on at the end of your stay, considering we tipped the bellman and the housekeeping staff during our stay. Also, the breakfast buffet was $33/person, and was no different than any other hotel breakfast (omelette station, mass produced eggs, bacon, sausage, and fruit).
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband found an incredible price for the hotel, so we jumped at the chance to get away without the kids. The hotel was beautiful, our room was well appointed, spotless and had a gorgeous view, despite its designation by the hotel as not having one. the bathroom was large and really beautiful - always a big plus in my eye. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful, particularly the concierge desk. We came without any particular plans for our time there, and they had some great suggestions of local activities. The grounds are lovely to roam, and the private beach was quiet and very relaxing, and we enjoyed some great cocktails at the bar on the water.  All in all, it was a superb vacation!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife, two children and I spent 5 nights at the St. Regis.  The experience was fantastic.  When we checked in and were briefly waiting in line, we were greeted by a very nice staff member who got buckets and shovels for our children.  A blue one for our son and red one for our daughter.  Upon checking in, our room was ready even though we arrived a couple hours earlier than check-in and our bags were promptly brought to our room.  The hotel is super kid friendly.  For a $25 per day charge, the children could eat whenever and whatever they wanted at the main restaurant which worked out quite well.  The hotel has a nice adult pool and two great children's pool (one for infants and one that is 4 feet deep) with a spacious hot tub.  It was great to have a kids area as the children
Manager Response: none

Summary: My best friend booked a room at the St. Regis because she wanted to stay somewhere special with us bridesmaids the night before her wedding. She was also having her bridal photos done at the hotel the day of the wedding so we got the room so we would be able to have the hair and makeup artist come in the morning before we went off to the venue.   Check in: we were immediately put off by the hotel and their rude staff. Normal check in time for the hotel is 3pm and we arrived at 7pm. When we arrived, we were greeted by the cold front desk agent, Bianca and she did not even apologize for the lack of our room being ready. They said it was being inspected and would be a few minutes. About 20 minutes later the room was ready and there was still no apology from her. We would not have
Manager Response: Natasha-  Thank you for your post on TripAdvisor. We have shared your review with management and they will be taking next steps to ensure this does not happen again. We are happy to hear your enjoyed our restaurant and that your friend was able to celebrate her upcoming wedding.  Thank you,  The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: This I would have to say was potentially the best 24 hrs. ever. My wife and I booked a night here as our first night away together from the kids since having them. We live local so it was a nice get away without being too far away.  I originally booked the stay to plan on having dinner at Stonehill tavern. After making my reservation at the hotel (redeemed starpoints) I got a greeting from the concierge. I asked for reservations at the restaurant and was unfortunately told they were closed that night (in preparation for valentine’s dinner service the next day). The hotel went out of their way to accommodate me elsewhere which I appreciated. We ended up eating at French 75 in Laguna which was phenomenal.  Upon check in we were delightfully surprised with an upgrade to a signature
Manager Response: heils- Thank you for such a wonderful review about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. It sounds like you were able to enjoy everything our five-star Resort has to offer. Hopefully next time you can try Stonehill Tavern at The St. Regis Monarch Beach - a foodie favorite!   Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: St Regis Monarch Beach- great weekend getaway
Summary: Overall a great stay.  The staff was always polite and helped out whenever possible.  The spa overall seemed ok.  The massages was fine, but I had a great pedicure.  The private beach was great.  Loved being able to go to the beach with nothing in my hand and being able to just sit down.  The pool was fine, but the staff was attentive.   Overall the food was ok and expensive.  We only had breakfast or lunch on the property, not of it will be a stand out.  I would stay there again just to go to the private beach.  Worth the tram ride.
Manager Response: cktravelerla- Thank you for your recent review on The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are glad you enjoyed the Monarch Beach Club and had a good experience in our Spa Gaucin. Looking forward to having you back to the Resort soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: St. Regis is a gorgeous property that knows how to treat their guests. The private beach club on their own slice of the Pacific ocean is worth the stay alone. There is a club with indoor/outdoor dining, attendants to put up your beach chairs and carry towels, and grassy area outside the club to relax. There are two pool areas - adult and kids. Both with plenty of chairs and umbrellas with pool side food and beverage service. The rooms are spacious with a fabulous bathroom set up. Each guest either has a patio or balcony. The beds and towels are comfy, too. The spa is a must visit to help with relaxation. The gym has everything you would want to work out with. Overall, the property is cleanest place I have ever stayed in. No dust or sand anywhere. No mold smells. You can eat in
Manager Response: Wifeola- Thank you for your recent review on The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are glad you enjoyed our Monarch Beach Club - it is heavenly, as well as our pools. Sounds like you were able to enjoy everything our Resort has to offer.   Thank you, The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Simply outstanding property, views and service!
Summary: From the moment we valet parked, the caring staff made sure we were relaxed and able to enjoy a little family time.  The resort property is beautifully landscaped and every attention to detail is noticed.  The views form the some of the best in Southern California with an unparalleled convienient location.  Minutes from Laguna Beach and Dana Point makes the location perfect for all your beach combing activities and as a jumping off point for all the best of Southern California.  I highly recommend reserving at least an executive suite so you have access to the St. Regis butler service.  Our butler, David was outstanding in every way and ensured that we stayed relaxed during our entire stay!  Simply stated....my family and I love the St. Regis Monarch Beach!
Manager Response: 3fortheride- Thank you for posting your review about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are happy to hear your enjoyed the Butler Service and we are looking forward to having your family back to the Resort soon.  Thanks again,  The Executive Staff St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: To begin, I should point out that we stayed here on points.  Taking into account that the room was free, save for the resort fee, I set the bar much lower than I would for a paid room.  Despite this the room was great.  We got an entry level room with two queen beds facing the back of the property.  The advantage with these rooms is that you're not exposed to the noise of the main garden and pool in the front of the hotel.  With two kids in tow, quiet trumps a view any time.  The room and bathroom is well thought out,  the bathroom not only has a nice sized tub and a walk in shower, but t also has a nice cabinet area for storage.  Everything seemed new and fresh, the only complaint I have is that the beds are a bit too soft for my taste.  The resort is large, but not too large.
Manager Response: Daniel- Thank you for your review about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. It sounds like your family had a wonderful time enjoying our pools and beach. We look forward to having you all back to the Resort soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: St Regis Monarch Beach on July 20th through 23rd
Summary: We came back for the 2nd time to St Regis Monarch Beach on July 20th through 23rd.   The gym is fantastic, they offer complimentary fitness classes that were awesome. I did a YOGA class. The SPA was wonderful. Nicole the receptionist was a pleasure. There is water, snacks, towel service, great fitness equipment, and very neat.  The pool was fun, with water complimentary. The bathrooms were very neat. There were a lot of kids, but you did NOT hear them, not even see them. Everything was peaceful.  Justin, the technical support, was GREAT !!  Our room 352 was great.  We had a small issue with a bathroom light, and the manager, PAI, called me to verify if everything was OKAY, and was extremely sweet, and took care of the manner Promptly. She even gave a nice gift. Nick was great at
Manager Response: Nellg- Thank you for staying again at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear your enjoyed our complimentary fitness classes and were pleased overall with the Resort.  We are looking forward to having you and your family back to the Resort soon.  Thank you for posting,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Dear Mr. So GM at the St Regis Monarch Beach:
Summary: You must be very busy doing office work rather that taking care of this "5 star" property. I have been here for a couple nights and I have to say that I am not impressed. Here are some reasons why: 1) My room has obstructed views of bushes and trees. Its dark and dingy. For a hotel of this caliber and the per night price, this is unacceptable.  2) It took 30 minutes to get my luggage delivered to my room. Thats after calling 3 times to ask where it was. I volunteered to go grab it myself.  3) The furniture in my room is scuffed all over. Paint chipped off.  4) Burned light bulb in one of the lamps.  5) I asked for turn down service every night at 7:00pm  - its 8:30pm and still waiting. (Called and asked about it 20 minutes ago and nothing)  6) The adult pool is full of kids,
Manager Response: Lory - We are very sorry to hear about the problems you have encountered while staying at our Resort. We have sent your review to management and they will be addressing these issues immediately.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: My general experience with high-end resorts, hotels and restaurants in Southern California is that they are impressive on the surface.   But when you go deeper, beyond the overly ornate decor and overly friendly (but insincere) staff, things fall apart.  No break in the pattern here:  1) The wi-fi didn't work throughout the hotel and 3G didn't work inside either, so I had to go outside to use my iPhone/iPad.  2) I had to run the shower for five minutes to get hot water every morning.  3) Every time I went to the coffee bar, the antique pewter half-and-half pitcher was empty.  One time I asked for it to be refilled and the cashier stood with it in her hand while talking to someone for 5 minutes about their muffin choice.  I finally had to walk over and take it from her.  4) I
Manager Response: Joe- We are sorry to hear about your experience at the St. Regis Monarch Beach. We have complimentary wi-fi in our Lobby Lounge. We have expressed your concerns about the spa, water heat, and room charges to management. .   Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We were so lucky to stay the last week at the St Regis for an event....even my husband was very busy with the conference during the day, I was able to enjoy this paradise.Living in Fort Lauderdale I am already " spoiled" when it comes to beach places and also traveled to a lot of other beautiful places worldwide.But I must say that this place exceeded my expectations by far. Everything was 6 stars and more, the location,the service, the food and the wonderful beach which you can reach within a couple of minutes via a small tram.I really don't understand the people always complaining about rooms at the first floor ( which we had and the room was amazing), frigid hallways, and and and.........well, I guess some people love to complain and put the search engine on only to find
Manager Response: Claudia- Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear Marco Henn took good care of you and your husband, and you were able to enjoy everything our Resort has to offer. Thanks again and we hope you have you and your husband back to the Resort soon.   Thank you, The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I have stayed here couple of times now. This is a beautiful resort. This is not right on the beach and it is a golf cart ride down past the golf course. Great Service and polite staff! We did not eat dinner here but ate lunch at the restaurant right by the beach couple of times.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your positive experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are happy to hear your enjoyed our polite staff and dining options. We are looking forward to having you back at the Resort soon.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I want to give you our opinion of the "5 Star" St. Regis. It was really a disappointment - especially at over $700 a night once taxes and fees are added.    Here are a few highlights ....   The suite "upgrade" was to a first floor, bush obstructed, non-view, next to the pool bar accessible room.  They did eventually move us the next day, but still. What a hassle.   It took 30 minutes to get ice from the butler one day.    One of my kids' inflatable beds deflated in the middle of the night.   Worked out at the gym but had to call each time to request towels that should have been supplied. Also, dirty towels and cups were left in the gym area.   Cheerios were left on the carpet in the hallway for an entire day right in front of the elevators. No one cleaned it up - seems hard to
Manager Response: John W. Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are sorry to hear about the service issues you had at the Resort. We will reach out to the team at Stonehill Tavern, and make sure that charge was removed from your bill.   Thank you, John.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: The St. Regis Monarch Beach property is absolutely amazing overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  We stayed there for 1 night.  Our room was safe, clean and comfortable.  The bathroom is superior.   The staff were very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your room, and next time hopefully you can join us for longer!  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: My family stayed for a few days for my birthday. It was a great two day and wish we were to stay longer. Every encounter with a staff member was top notch. We were treated the way you would want in such a great hotel. The grounds, pool, architecture, and the overall resort were well kept and inviting. The food and the cocktails were delicious. Especially the bloody Mary. We will be back for our next romantic trip!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review about your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We appreciate you selecting our Resort to spend your birthday at, and glad you enjoyed our signature Bloody Mary!  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: This is NOT a 5 star hotel! There is absolutely no commucication, attention to detail or clear on site management at the St. Regis.  The problems were evident upon our arrival.  We went to check-in (we arrived at 5:30 pm on Sunday) we were told that our two rooms were not ready.  The larger “suite” would be ready in an hour, but the other room would not be ready until after 7 pm.  After a lot of talking to personnel, we went to the “suite” (both rooms were booked with pool views) and it was located on the first floor overlooking a parking lot.  They tried to convince us that this was one of their “best suites”.  Finally after many phone calls and complaints, we were able to check into our other room after 7 pm.   Everything from cleanliness at the restaurants, dirty dishes,
Manager Response: Ticder- Thank you for your review about your experience at our Resort. We have made changes to make sure that check-in times are shorter and that rooms are ready when expected. We have noted your cleanliness complaints, and taken it up with management.   Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I've got to give to management, I'm a local and we stay here a few times a year for a local getaway. They really are doing a great job here best it's ever been from a service level. Mr Suh keep up the good work,  we will be back soon.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear you have seen the Resort improve over the years. We are constantly trying to improve and better serve our guests!  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We were lucky enough to enjoy a 3-night stay at the St. Regis this past weekend.  In short, we had a fabulous weekend and definitely recommend the resort.  I will try to keep it short, but we used just about every amenity so thoroughness may kill brevity.  The Reservations Team: This is not something I normally comment about but I had such a positive experience I wanted to give credit to the reservations team.  We had purchased our stay at a charity event so could not book online.  The poor reservation person (Sandy) was thrown just about every possible curve ball – a gift certificate with less than clear terms, guests with two different last names and two different SPG numbers.  She was incredibly friendly and helpful, booked exactly what we wanted and even was able to arrange
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive review of your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. It sounds like you were able to enjoy everything the Resort has to offer- including our famous Sunday Brunch! We look forward to having you back again soon. Enjoy the rest of your summer and safe travels!  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Great room and maid service, but front desk service was horrible
Summary: My husband and I checked in on Thursday afternoon with our 3 young children.  The front desk woman was not at all friendly and did not crack one smile.  My husband called ahead and inquired about early check in and was told that it was not guaranteed but was very possible.  We arrived at around 3:00 pm when check in at St Regis is at 4pm (Nevermind that most hotel check in time is at 3pm).  My husband was told that his reservation could not be located!  What?!  He reserved several months in advance!!  The front woman did not apologize for failing to locate the reservation at all nor did she seem at all distressed at this fact.   Finally the front desk woman located the reservation and told us we would have to wait until 4pm.  Fine.  My husband asks the front woman for a possible
Manager Response: Cklee73- Thank you for posting your review on TripAdvisor about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. First, we are happy to hear you enjoyed your room and maid service. We have currently implemented new programs to make check in and check out run smoother, more efficient, and faster. Thank you and we hope to have you back to the Resort soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: SPECTACULAR !!!  This resort is good for the soul...i rejuvenated there and feel as I was in another part of the world., like living in fantasy land...Excellent service from the moment you drive In. our room was fantastic with a great view of the pool, so relaxing to seat and have some wine on the balcony. The evening service is fantastic, they turn down your sheets, leave chocolate, water, slippers and bathrobe ready for you by the bed..WOW..I have no words to explain the experience we had at this resort. I just have to tell you..to GO.GO.and GO....short drive to Disneyland........THE SERVICE, AMBIANCE, GROUNDS, FOOD..ARE A 10+..LOVE IT...!!
Manager Response: morena v- Thank you for posting your positive review of The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are thrilled you are encouraging others to have the same great experience you had at the Resort! Thank you again and we hope to have you back to The St. Regis Monarch Beach very soon.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: After much consideration after reading some of the many negative reviews on tripadvisor from previous guests I gave this resort a try and let me tell you with great confidence it was an AWESOME stay. First of all to all out there who are SPF. Gold and platinum members, my status was recognized at checkin and I was upgraded to a suite for a 7 night stay. We got an amazing corner room on the fist floor facing the gardens, very quiet, very picturesque. I would highly recommend room 164. The room was huge and the bathroom was even bigger. Amazing Remede products in the bathroom, a St. Regis tradition. The staff were amazing and very hospitable with us. Service is top notch. The butler service in the suites was also amazing. You can order complimentary coffee, tea, drinks, to your
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review on The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are happy to hear you had a great time and enjoyed every aspect of our five-star Resort. Looking forward to having you back to the Resort very soon!   Safe travels,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: For our fifth anniversary we returned to the St Regis on Dana Point, where we were not disappointed!  The service, ambiance, and setting are all terrific - and worth the price!  Our room was perfect, with a super-comfy bed and large bathroom.  The refrigerator was able to accomodate some wine, beer and cheese left over from the prior night's cocktail party (on a Dockside B&B boat, "Perfect Landing").  We enjoyed a fine lunch at the "pool bar" - which had no view of the pool.  After lunch we took a tram down to the private Monarch Beach and enjoyed a breezy, sunny day.  That night we ate at "Nirvana" (prior to the Pageant of the Masters in Laguna Beach), which I reviewed separately.  The next morning we enjoyed a delicious (but expensive) breakfast on the main terrace, followed
Manager Response: Thank you for your review about your recent stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear you chose to spend your 5th anniversary with us - congratulations! Looking forward to having you and your wife as a guest again.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We spent a week at this hotel with our whole family. The service was fantastic and the rooms are really well done. We didn't have a great view, but we spent most of the day at the private beach! The kids had a blast and the hotel was pretty close to Disneyland. We really enjoyed the hotel grounds especially the pool. Great Hotel.
Manager Response: Mordy- Thank you for your review about your family's week long vacation at The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are happy to hear your enjoyed your stay and our private beach -  and made it to Disneyland, too. Hope to have you all back again, soon!   Thanks again,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Heavenly and Decadent Vacation at the Beach
Summary: This was the most luxurious hotel experience I have ever had and we loved every second of it. We went as a family and were so comfortable and there was so much for the kids. We spent most of our time at the pool because we have an ocean where we live, so the pool was more novel. It was also cloudy at the beach when we were there. The kids loved Otter Pops on the hour and nighttime story telling with dressed up characters and s'mores roasting and chocolate butterflies on the white linens every evening. I loved the spa and found it to be excellent. I took a pilates class and it was great. The service was excellent as it should be at a property of this rating. We only stayed two nights and I wish we could have stayed more to have taken advantage of all of the amenities. Just dreamy!
Manager Response: rklace- Thank you for your review on your family trip to The St. Regis Monarch Beach. It sounds like you and your family had a lovely time. The St. Regis Monarch Beach aims to please families with the pool time treats and S'mores and Storytime. We are glad you got some time to enjoy the Spa Gaucin as well.   Hope you can join us for longer next time!   Thanks again,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: One of the most beautiful places that I stayed
Summary: I spent 4 nights in the hotel last week and I thought the hotel was absolutely gorgeous.  The grounds and vicinities were kept immaculate.  The hotel is not "on the beach" unlike Ritz Carlton or Montage, but it makes up for it by the daily shuttle and the beach club.  I used the shuttle to go to the beach and take a walk every morning.  The ocean is just absolutely beautiful.  We had a special rate because we had conference there.  The room and the bathroom were very spacious, and tastefully decorated.  Housekeeping does excellent job in the morning and in the evening turndown as well.  The food for the conference (we had continental breakfast every morning, one dinner reception, and one working lunch) was not exceptional nor bad.  I was told that they were charged top dollars
Manager Response: alshin- Thank you for your great review about your group travel experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are happy to hear you enjoyed the Resort to the fullest - walking the beach, fitness center, lobby bar, and restaurants.   We hope to have you and your group back at the Resort soon!   Safe travels,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I'm sure if I looked hard enough I could find fault with the St. Regis, but let's be honest - this is a gorgeous luxury hotel a stone's throw from a private beach. Yeah, it isn't cheap, but you generally get what you pay for. The room (resort view king) was huge and perfect, the restaurants, beach, and pool area were all great (had a wonderful meal at Monarch Bay Club). Above all, the staff was amazingly friendly and helpful at every turn. I don't think I had anything less than 5* interaction with a staff member. Sure it's expensive, but for a special few days, you can't beat it.
Manager Response: dyrewolf-  Thank you for your great review on your experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are happy to hear you had many great interactions with our staff and were pleased with your room. Looking forward to having you back at the Resort soon.  Thanks again and safe travels,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We stayed at the St. Regis for 2 nights this past weekend.  We were disappointed that we were not upgraded for our SPG Platinum status.  Besides that, we felt that the service was not up to the reputation of the St. Regis.  The service was mediocre at best from the front desk, concierge to the wait staff at the MOTIF rest and valet.  Paying $35.00 to valet the car and having to wait over 30 mins. for the car was absurd!  The General Mgr., Mr. So, was out directing the cars!  We were driving a rental Chevy Impala and the BMWs, Mercedes, Jags, etc. were brought out before our car even though we were waiting longer!  Then the rooms although nicely decorated... we heard the noise from the rooms above and outside clearly.  Smoking rooms (!?) down the hall permeated the hallways.
Manager Response: Wendy- Thank you for voicing your concerns about your visit to The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are sorry to hear the valet line took 30 minutes - our valet gets very busy during these summer months. We have told management about your customer service complaints, as well.   Thank you.  The Executive Office St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We stayed here on business in one of the signature guest rooms and found everything to be perfect. The property is beautiful and immaculate. The beach is a short walk down the hill and was very nice also. The golf course was pristine and the rest of the grounds were gorgeous. We had a great time and hope the company will hold another function here. This is a jewel in sunny southern California.
Manager Response: Broughton_11- Thank you for your review on The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are thrilled to hear you had a great time during your stay, and enjoyed our beautiful Resort. We hope your company will hold another function here in the near future.  Best, The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Great rooms and service.  The butler service serving morning coffee and tea was an added perk that we truly enjoyed.  Beautiful property and the weather was perfect on the days we stayed so we were able to enjoy the balcony.  I think we got upgraded to a King suite the last time I stayed and the bathroom was magnificent.  The property is out of the way if you were planning on visiting the rest of southern California, but definitely a good place to get away from the city and congestion.  Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Mr. Luu- Thank you for your great review on your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are happy to hear you enjoyed the Butler Service, added perks, and the great weather! We are looking forward to your return visit to The St. Regis Monarch Beach.  Sincerely, The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: The best hotel we have ever stayed at!  To start we came to Dana Point with the intention of staying in a condo we rented.  Upon arrival at the condo it was filled with ants and not what we expected.  After we got our refund from the condo owner, we had to scramble for other lodging.    From the time I called St. Regis reservations to the time we checked out (5 nights over one week) it was the most incredible hotel stay we have ever experienced!  We loved it so much after 2 nights we added a 3rd night, then went to San Diego for 3 nights then made sure we came back to the St. Regis for a our last 2 nights in California!  Our rooms were spacious, the bathrooms very well appointed, the balconies relaxing and also spacious.  The beds and showers were great - this is the first trip
Manager Response: Kathy- Thank you for your great review on your stay at The St. Regis Monarch Beach! We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your 5-night stay, and we were able to accommodate you and your families needs. Looking forward to having you all back at the Resort soon! Enjoy the rest of your summer.  Sincerely, The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We spent our "babymoon" at the St Regis this past weekend and I wanted to write a review while the experience was fresh in my mind.   I picked up a lot of tips and set some of my expectations based upon the reviews of the seasoned travelers. Also,  I am SPG gold so I was entitled to some perks that really enhanced my stay (late checkout of 4pm, option to upgrade to a St Regis suite for $200 a night, welcome gift of reduced resort rate from $25 to $15 per day). So I'll start with check-in...My room was not ready at 4 pm, the standard check-in time.  I had tried to check in earlier at 2:30 but the room was not ready (which is fair) but I did expect my room to be ready at 4 pm.  I went to the front desk at 4pm , my room wasn't ready and they couldn't give me an estimate of when it
Manager Response: PwCTrojan-  Thank you for your review on The St. Regis Monarch Beach, and congratulations on your pregnancy. We apologize for the late check-in, and the customer service at the front desk and butler service. New systems are currently in place that will fast-track check in and make sure rooms are available at the check-in time. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your time at the pool. Best wishes on your pregnancy. Sincerely,   The Executive Offices The St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: There are far better choices at this price point
Summary: Don't waste your time at this very disappointing establishment.  Check in time listed as 4:00 on their literature but our room was  not ready for hours after that time.  Nothing like paying a ridiculously high room fee for deplorable service.  Stay at the Ritz - you'll be much happier.
Manager Response: Funinthesun922- We are sorry to hear about your long wait time when you were checking in to the Resort. We are currently working on new systems to expidite the check in process, and make sure the rooms are available promptly.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I had a bad experience with this hotel about 3 years ago and decided to give them one more chance. I wrote review recently on the SPG site but surprise, surprise, the didn't post it!!!! So here I am on TA to give the true scoop about this hotel.  1) Check in had a lot of confusion and not enough people working. I waiting about 15 minutes just to get to the front desk and I was the only person in line besides the people at the counter!! I also got a trainee to help check me in who had . I am a frequent traveler (100 nights annually just at SPG) and my room wasn't ready until after 3p.   2) The rooms are very exceptional and comfy. This is the only 5 star rating of the enitre hotel.  3) Butler service (for guests with suites). Initially this visit the butler service was very
Manager Response: travelpro7672- Thank you for your detailed review of your experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach. We are currently working on new systems to make check in and check out move much faster. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your room, and apologize for the time lapse with the coffee order. We make the Monarch Beach Club aware of your issues during dinner.  Thank you,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: My company stayed at St. Regis for a corporate event. We were under the impressions that Spa services were going to be provided for by corporate. Two weeks before arriving we scheduled spa services and discussed with spa consultant that corporate would be taking care of services, and could they please verify this,otherwise we would not have services done. We were assured this was going to be fine. We had services booked for the day we arrived. Once at the spa, I clearly asked the spa manager if he could verify that Corporate would be covering the cost of the services. His response was" Yes thats fine, everything ok". Upon checking out we were billed $793 for spa services, which have been disputed with American Express, a waste of time. I am on the hook for these charges simply
Manager Response: Lon M- Thank you for your post on TripAdvisor. We would like to apologize for the unnecessary charges to your account. That is unacceptable, and we have taken this issue to management so it does not happen again in the future. We hope you can join us again at The St. Regis Monarch Beach.  Sincere apologies, The Executive Offices The St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: It's the little things that make the difference.
Summary: For the price on of the most inconstant service I have ever recieved. Bright spots were tee food, and over all facility. The people impressed and also thoroughly let me down. I had concierges with attitudes, but a nice one ( tall gal, Suzanne? ) who help save the poor communicator. I had pool guys forget my water and others who completely met e wry expectation. I had people on the phone tell me that I needed to create an additional account to log on with different device, and only one charge would apply, and a argumentative person check me out Nd tell me that's not how it works. To sum it up I would reccomed a different place to stay.
Manager Response: TGH09- Thank you for your post on TripAdvisor. We are sorry to hear you encountered some customer service issues while staying at our Resort. We are currently in the process of addressing these issues, and we hope you can come back and experience the Resort again.   The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Definitly not a five star hotel.
Summary: This property is not what it used to be in the past, not even close.  Definitely not what a five star hotel should be, nor it compares to the other two five stars hotels in the area.  The grounds look tired and lacks maintenance especially the herbal and citrus garden.  The service is lacking in all areas.   The spa had towels with holes in it..need I say more?
Manager Response: Good day, jewel52 --  We are always very appreciative when individuals select our resort for their accommodations, and our goal is to provide the finest service and facilities possible. Rest assured, your comments have been shared with the appropriate management so we may address your concerns.  As the resort does have many various types of foliage, some remain dormant at certain times of the year.  Thank you once again for staying at the St. Regis Monarch Beach.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.    Best regards, Executive Offices

Summary Heading: A nice place to celebrate special occasions!
Summary: Positives:  Spent this past weekend at the St. Regis Monarch Beach.  The check in was fast and courteous.  The nice gentleman asked if we are celebrating anything special and we told him we were celebrating our 1 year anniversary.  He automatically called room service and sent us a nice bottle of champagne.  He advised us about attending the champagne sabering which is a St. Regis tradition.  It was nice.  Had dinner at Stonehill Tavern.  The service there is great.  Our waiter knew we were celebrating our 1 year anniversay and they put in some extra nice touches to the meal.  The staff signed a card congratulating us.  The restaurant is quite pricey though but I expected that.  We spent around 500 dollars for the dinner.  We both had the tasting menu.  The spa was awesome as
Manager Response: Greetings Jack L, Thank you for your compliments of the St. Regis Monarch Beach and our staff. We thank you for selecting our resort to play a small role in your one year anniversary celebration! Our staff has a commitment to each and every guest to create a discreet experience of bespoke service.   We look forward to welcoming you back to the best address in the near future!   Best regards, Executive Offices

Summary: We had a wonderful experience at this 5 star hotel.  The staff at all areas were extremely friendly and provided top notch service.  Everything you expect from a St. Regis.  The grounds and pools were very well maintained.  While not cheap, the room rate was reasonable given the type of hotel/location, etc.  The pool is great and the spa is excellent.  The beach is okay--you have to take a shuttle tram.  The beach  at the Ritz Carlton seemed nicer.  You may want to just head out to Laguna or Newport beaches when you want a beach day.  Otherwise great resort.
Manager Response: Greetings wdy301, We strive to make our resort more of an experience than a place and the genuine care and comfort of our guests is our most important concern.  Thus, it is very reassuring to receive gracious compliments from such a valued guest.  We are hopeful that you will continue your relationship with us.  Thank you again for your considerate comments.  Best regards, Executive Offices

Summary Heading: 2012 Dana Point Concours d'Elegance Host Hotel Fantastic!
Summary: Came down from Northern California as an exhibitor at the Dana Point Concours and had a terrific stay at the St. Regis from beginning to end.  It was an extremely busy weekend for all of the staff at the hotel, but we were very impressed by the caring staff here, from the valets upon check-in, the front desk staff, and all of the people that worked so hard to make this a special weekend of the Concours.  The rooms are luxurious by anyone's standards, the beds and linens white and soft, marble and granite bathrooms, and the restaurants and bars first rate.  However, be prepared to spend $14 for an Angus burger, $14 for a margarita, and restaurants that, while very good to excellent, are quite expensive.  I paid $35 a bottle "corkage fee" for a couple of bottles of wine we brought
Manager Response: Good day porsche74s, Thank you for your kind compliments of the St. Regis Monarch Beach, and especially our valet and front desk teams. Your feedback and endorsement is a true honor as our staff truly takes pride in providing service that is beyond expectation. We look forward to welcoming you back to the best address.  Best regards, Executive Offices

Summary Heading: Another Fabulous Stay at St. Regis!
Summary: A wonderful stay from the moment we arrived!  Now I will admit that we are Starwood Preferred members, but they treated us like royalty.  Everyone from the check-in, bell man, concierge...extraordinary service.  Wonderful room service, maid service and staff throughout our stay.  The rooms are luxurious, the beds so comfortable and very nice bathroom amenities. The food delicious - which is saying a lot since I was there for a business conference!  Beautiful grounds, well kept property, right on the beach...highly recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am really surprised with all the positive comments on here as we experienced sheer disgrace! From the moment we checked it up to the point we checked out, a comedy of errors ruined our stay. Our check-in did not go as smoothly as we could have hoped for. Staff is too busy up selling suites and the manager told me it is so common to up sell in the industry. One front desk manager when asked if i could go to a different room or a different hotel , he just laughed and said go ahead but we will charge you for the full stay.. Not good for a luxury 5 star hotel.  Sweet sleeper bed at “Starwood”, well, My back is still hurting.   . The one Duty Manager was trying to justify that the up selling rooms was standard to any 5 star establishment.  The decor was like a storage room with too
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We will provide your review and comments to our staff and also to our General Manager.   The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: We stayed a day and night here after a long but very fun day at Disneyland with our grandchildren.  The resort was gorgeous and the kids loved the ride to the beach and the the day they spent playing on the beach.  The bathrooms are luxury to the max.  A little bit of a mixup at check-in, the key cards did not work for the room number noted on the card, spent 20 minutes in the hall outside of a room with luggage and 5 year old grandson waiting for my husband to return with correct key card.  But once we got past that everything else was perfect.  Would love to go back with my husband and I for an romantic getaway.  :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Mother's Day at the St Regis
Summary: My wife and I snuck off for a night away and brunch to celebrate Mother's Day. The Monarch Beach/Dana Point area has some fabulous resorts, and between the Montage, the Pelican Hill, and the Ritz, it would have been tough to pick a loser between them.  First, the negative: Although the resort is on the wrong side of the PC Highway, they have a semi-private beach and restaurant beside the ocean. At best, the restaurant is average, and I have to admit that they simply don't take care of the beach. For this quality resort, one would expect them to periodically use a tractor and comb through the sand, rather than leave all the "stuff" that washes ashore day after day. It was, to say the least, disappointing. The positives: We were upgraded to an executive suite, and the room and
Manager Response: Steve:  Thank you and your wife for joining us for Mother's Day! We are thrilled that you enjoyed the Five-Star, Five-Diamond experience at The St. Regis Monarch Beach, and especially pleased that you were able to join us for our famed Chef's Tasting Menu as well as our renowned Sunday Brunch. As part of our ongoing commitment to ensuring our guests' stay is of the highest quality, we wanted to respond to your concerns regarding the dried kelp on our beach.  The rules of the California Coastal Commission prohibit the resort from using any mechanical equipment on the beach (including tractors) and we also are prohibited from removing organic materials from the area, including seaweed.  That said, we are pleased to report that, as of June 14 of this year, we have been approved by the Coastal Commission to improve the burm directing Salt Creek to the ocean - this will improve the condition of our beach. We look forward to you and your wife returning to enjoy our resort and the beach again soon.   Best,  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: Hotel is as nice as the other hi ends in the area.  Staff was all over us.  Meeting facilites and staff top notch.  Had a reception on the deck overlooking the pool at sunset...very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a weekend in May and this property reminds me of why its my favorite resort to stay at time and time again. Check in was prompt, we had a fabulous pool view room with a private balcony. We rented a poolside cabana for the day which was nice, the only drawback was the somewhat accusatory remark from the girl working the pool area "did you reserve this"? I expect a little bit more refinement in guest communication for a St Regis property. Stonehill Tavern was amazing- Pallava, the GM, made sure our Mom was happy with custom made chocolate gelato!!! It was a nice touch to a very extravagant dinner worth every penny. The Monarch Bay club was nice- aside from the loud group next to us we enjoyed our dinner there as well. Overall a great stay, a few slips in
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Reminds me or why I love Starwood Properties so much
Summary: Now this is a luxury hotel.  I booked my wife and I in here while on a second honeymoon.  The property is luxurious and grounds immaculate with superb staff, drop dead gorgeous rooms and bathrooms and massively comfortable beds..  What more can you ask for?  Well how about one of the nicest salt water pools you will ever have the joy of sliding your body into for a start.    Impressed and will return without hesitation.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: overpriced and extra charge for everything
Summary: I was really excited at staying at this property with my 2 sisters.  We arrived at check in time (4:00) and room was not ready; had to wait about 2 hours.  The manager did buy us drinks and appetizers, though.  The next day, after our return to the room it was still not cleaned at 3:00.  don't pay for an upgrade to an "ocean view" room.  Ocean view means a tiny slab of the ocean if you stick your head out far enough.  valet parking (only kind I could see) was $15.00 each time you remove your car.  Grounds were lovely, though, and good restaurants   It's just for a 5 star I expected more.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love the St. Regis, although this resort is a bit less "exclusive."  Mainly, due to the size of the resort.  Both times we have stayed there, they hotel has hosted very large events/parties.  With this being said, the lobby bar was over run!  I also did not like having to wear "wrist bands" to go to the pool!  This is a St Regis and not a Vegas scene.  Workout room is great, and there is also a nice pool there...which also serves as a quite spot to lounge in the sun.  But there is no service there.  Outside the workout room, there is a nice offering of fruit, nuts and chilled fruit water...complimentary.   We had an Executive Suite, room 566.  It was on the quiet side of the hotel with a nice view (not overlooking pool and ocean.)  Butler service was wonderful.  The complimenary
Manager Response: none

Summary: I spent two nights St. Regis, Monarch Beach Resort for a business conference in May.  Flew into SNA and took a taxi to the hotel ($60 fare).  The resort is impressive upon entering.   Team outside immediately offered to help me with my baggage.   As we had a conference, we had a dedicated separate check-in area.   The team was very professional with bell staff waiting to help take luggage to the rooms.   The staff explained my room rate and gave me a quick layout of the hotel.  My room faced the south side of the property overlooking the beautiful grounds.  The room itself was spacious and well stocked.  I always worry about wifi, electric plugs and a work station which this room had.   Wifi worked great on the grounds (even by the pool).   Desk and chair were comfortable.   I
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I were able to spend two nights down at the St. Regis, Monarch Beach Resort in Dana Point.  It was our first time at this resort and we were very pleased with the results.    The resort and grounds are magnificent.  One can lay out at the pool and see the ocean just blocks away.  They have a private beach and provide a shuttle service to those that wish to venture down to the beach.    I can't say enough to the valet service (a little expensive being $30.00 per night to park your car), but the attendants are very friendly, helpful (can't do enough for you) and one never had to wait long for their car.    The front desk staff and bell desk are very accommodating.  I wanted to take my luggage up myself as we only had one bag, but there policy is to take you up to your

Summary: Very helpful staff, from top to bottom.  A smile from them all. They actually  say, "My pleasure" instead of the overly casually "No problem." Lots of over the top luxury. Beautiful views.Be sure to an  "interior view" so that you can see the resort in the best setting. Not quite a mile walk to the beach. But an easy walk.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Reminded me of why I remain loyal to Starwood
Summary: Used my Resort Night Awards at the St. Regis Monarch Beach and I was not disappointed.  This property does a great job upholding the St. Regis brand name.  Service was excellent, the scenery was beautiful, and the property is close to the Pacific Coast Highway.  Not to mention that they have their own private beach where you can enjoy the sun and sand without having to deal with the crowd.  And you don't even need to walk there because they have bell hops driving golf carts that will shuttle you to the beach and cut through the property so you can enjoy the scenery and fresh air in the process.  Being a SPG Platinum, I did get some additional perks such as Free WiFi and an upgraded room.  However, they ensure that every guest feels like they are the most important guest there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If I have one complaint it would be the absence of early morning coffee options.  When I stayed last month I was up early (east coast body clock!) and the cafe opened late.  The host in the restaurant brought me a free cup from the kitchen, even though they were setting up the restaurant for a function.  Simple but effective in diffusing my frustration.  Rooms are very comfortable and spacious, bath products are terrific.  Overall I think the service, accommodations, and overall experience was excellent.

Summary Heading: The worst "high end" property I have ever stayed at.
Summary: This place has seriously deteriorated from what it used to be.  I stayed there multiple times 7-10 years ago and was looking forward to a nice weekend break at the property.  It used to be so beautiful and the service was great.  What a disappointment!  This was the worst "high end" property I have ever stayed at!  Please don't waste your money here!  From the unfriendly front desk personnel, to the inattentive food servers (who left dirty plates on our table for twenty minutes and never refilled water or asked if we needed more drinks), to the restaurant where they say they are booked and yet there are always plenty of open tables, to the food quality, to the bar tenders who care more about talking to each other than serving the guests, to the carpets with smashed cookie crumbs

If you do not have young children, then go to the Spa where they have a smaller quieter pool with healthy delicious meals made to order. The classes, such as the beach walk and yoga, are great. In addition, our room was noisy. It sounded like the people above us were doing gymnastics. The restaurant the Monarch has close to the beach offers great food, views to die for, and a staff that waiting to help.   Without a doubt, I'll stay @ the St Regis Monarch again in the near future. (the hosekeepers use tassels on the door handles to indicate what room they are cleaning, you won't see a big cleaning cart in the halls!)   Turndown service was great. Service was flawless. Summary Heading: Decent ammenities, upscale decor, excellent staff.

It is HUGE and I needed help getting from place to place initially.  However their staff is A++ on customer service, availability, curtious and very nice.  Everyone from Management to Bell staff and servers.  I tried their new "Earth Day" cocktail that was made with fresh sliced cucumbers and vodka and it was so refreshing.  The bed is very comfortable and the bath tub is deep and inviting.  Would visit again.

Summary: I brought my mom out to SoCal to visit her 1st cousin who lives in Laguna Niguel.  This was her first time to Cali.  I used some points and free night awards with SPG on this trip.  We absolutely loved the St. Regis.  What a gorgeous resort.  The staff was welcoming and warm.  I do agree with other reviewers that the place is a bit large and somewhat confusingly layed out.  Still, the grounds, service, and room were wonderful.  Our room was quite large with a nice balcony overlooking the pool and golf course.  We loved the comfy beds and huge bathroom.  The cafe was nice for a quick bite in the morning before heading to the pools.  Our tram ride down to the private beach was great.  We loved the beach club and beach butlers.  I've stayed at most St. Regis properties in the US

We were always warmly greated when we arrived at the hotel and everyone we encountered went above and beyond expectations to make us feel at home.  The bar is a great place to relax and even grab a quick bite to eat.  The hotel's restaurants are all fabulous...especially Stonehill Tavern.  The spa is excellent....ask for Colleen if you are interested in a wonderful facial.  We were so sad to leave and look forward to returning in the near future!

The service is the highlight, which is saying a lot given the amazing grounds and views. Every person at the hotel offers friendly, helpful, warm service. They make you feel as though you might be the only person on the planet. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with excellent amenities. The pools are great and they have a private beach club. This hotel is amazing. I can't wait to go back. Service for which all other luxury hotels should strive.
Manager Response: Wow! Thank you for such a fantastic review. We are pleased to hear you are enjoying your visits to the resort and feel right at home. Thank you for sharing your feedback, we really value our guests comments.  Thanks again, The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Beach not near hotel and need cart or 15 minute walk. The staff was very helpful. Also, took two cool showers due to hot water not making it to our level. Need a jacket/sweater in late March.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review on Trip Advisor. We are disappointed to hear you did not enjoy your massage. We had a living area and a balcony. Bed was firm and comfy and the butler unpacked for you if you so desired. He also brought you coffee each morning. Heaven!  We visited the pool for some sun and sat down on the patio for lunch.  This is a five sta hotel in every sense.

The Ritz(which is right on the beach and has beautiful grounds as well) is just a whole lot better.  We actually went to the Ritz for dinner both nights and lunch one day because the quality, service, and food options were just better. It felt crowded - from check-in, valet, to the restaurant for brunch (there was a 20 min wait) to the beach.  They have carts to drive you to their private beach - loved the beach.  But getting back to the hotel, the wait was 15-20 min.  The room was very spacious and extremely nice, with a very nice bathroom as well.  Again great time, but may venture elsewhere next time.

We thanked the Maitre and took the beach shuttle to the beach.  The shuttle was prompt in arriving and the driver could not have been nicer, chatting with us on the way down and giving us a nice overview of the property. The beach was beautiful for the sunset, but there was no place to comfortably sit as the seats by the fire

Summary: Stayed here for business and pleasure.  Rooms very comfortable.  Staff friendly and helpful.  We used pool two days.  Bar/food service at pool was spotty both days which is probably our only complaint.  Great view of ocean and enjoyed walking path that runs down by ocean every day.  Be sure to grab a water from the valet area or concierge.  Also ate at the Stonehill Tavern restaurant.  It was pricey but amazing!  Hands down best meal we have ever had.  Only other complaint was that bar drinks were crazy expensive.  Would definitely return if I could get good deal on room again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: All I really expect is a good night's sleep, so when checking in I specifically asked for a quiet room.  The noise started at midnight, when the people above took a bath and it sounded like I was sleeping under Niagra Falls.  Then a half hour later I had to listen to the water draining out. From 1-3am the noise came from very drunk, rowdy people attending a convention at the hotel and mistaking the hallway for the bar.  Then, the crying babies started up at 5:30am.  I don't mind paying $550 a night, I just want a good night's sleep.  I ask for nothing more.  I did take the time to relate my experience to the manager, who listened politely, smiled, and had the gall to hand me his business card for my next visit.  Wishful thinking...next time I'll stay at the Ritz or Pelican Hill.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear about the noise complaints you had while staying at the hotel. We will let management know about your situation again, and try to make changes so this does not happen again. Thank you.  The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: I stayed at the St. Regis in Dana Point for one night in mid December for an annual holiday gala that was held at this beautiful resort.  The St. Regis is by far one of the most elegant hotels that I have ever stayed at! The property is simply stunning, with gorgeous grounds, pool area and view.  Our pool and ocean view room was divine in all aspects, and I regret not having more time to relax there.  I especially enjoyed the comfortable bed with luxurious bed linens! The hotel was all decked out in holiday decor which made it even more warm and inviting.   In my experience, the only flaw with this hotel was with some of the service that we received.  I was disappointed with our wait staff at breakfast that took ages to take our order and even to get coffee.  Not the 5 star
Manager Response: Hi 1GraciousTraveler- Thank you for your review. We are glad you were able to relax and enjoy all of the luxury The St. Regis Monarch Beach has to offer. Hope you come back and visit us soon.   The Executive Offices The St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Other than Il San Pietro di Positano, Italy, we have never stayed at a more wonderful place!
