Summary: Just spent the long weekend down at st.regis.  The last weekend wasn't so great but this trip was a delight - thank goodness.  All in all the rooms and location was great as we had three all next to each with amazing views.  Service was very good on this trip especially the spa and bech club.  This resorts beach club is the best as its private, excellent restaurant and amazing ocean views.  The Sunday brunch is one of the best in southern Cali.  I was a little hesitant to go back but after some strong arming it proved to be great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is incredible and incredibly expensive.    The hotel is beautiful, as is the landscaping and grounds.  The pool is great with excellent service.  There is a great shuttle that takes you back and forth to the beach which is also great with exceptional service.    The rooms are impeccable.  Very large and very nice linens, huge bathroom, and great snacks.  The restaurant food is top notch; however, you definitely pay for what you get.  Drinks are extremely overpriced.    Overall the hotel is amazing but you better be ready to pay the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We're local and spent a night away at the St. Regis over President's Day weekend 2012.  It's a nice hotel with good service, even over a busy weekend.  The grounds and pool are nice.  Although not ocean front, there is a sweeping ocean view from the back of the hotel where the pool is.  The golf course looked very nice, but we did not play, so I cannot comment on the quality.  For activities, we did the 3 mile loop to the beach and back, which was actually quite nice.  We also enjoyed the spa facilities.  The spa is very nice and being a hotel guest allows you full access to all facilities (unlike the Montage, where you have to be a spa guest in order to enjoy the spa pool).  The gym is excellent and includes treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, machines, free weights and an activity
Manager Response: Dear sdfamilyof4- We are thrilled to hear about your great trip to The St. Regis Monarch Beach and how you were able to use all of our wonderful amenities. We hope you and your family return soon.  Sincerely, The Executive Offices St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary Heading: Penny penching should not be a trait of 5 star hotels
Summary: I was concerned with the resort fee, as the only thing worth having for us on the list was the wireless internet, which was very spotty and I lost connection several times during our stay. We went out to the pool and we were a little disturbed by the old nasty towels they have for there guests to use, along with the plastic lounge chairs. With two kids in tow we headed up to the room, my wife to do the kids baths and I to make the coffee. I looked everywhere for the coffee pot. I could not find it, so I called down and they informed me that they do not have one in the rooms, but they could bring me one up for $25.00. I worked out at the gym and I was very happy that their equipment was all new.  They also have a lap pool right outside the gym.    The guest rooms were okay.  Nice, but very basic. Summary: This is my 5th stay at the resort and each time I end up liking the place more. We checked in early morning and stayed on a ground floor pool view room. I visited the spa to use the fitness facilities and steam room, your resort fee allows you use of these facilities and they are well worth it. Also, take a look at the fitness class schedule- I was lucky enough to take the 2 hour beach hike on a Sunday morning and it was a fun way to talk to other guests and enjoy the ocean air. We played golf and our instructor Corrie was great! Another do not miss is the St. Regis bloody mary, they invented it and they make it best. Breakfast at Motif was impressive- the Huevos Rancheros were nearly a work of art. The service, surroundings, and location of this resort are simply put- perfect.

Summary: We stayed here in August 2011 for 3 nights. Beautiful property! We had a great room with an ocean and grounds view.  The staff was friendly and helpful. The food at poolside was lacking any excitement. The hotel restaurants were good; better wine list than taste of the food in the property restaurants. We were with our 10 yr old son and felt very comfortable.  The gym was very nice. The shops in the hotel were very nice. Dana Point was about 5 minutes from the hotel and we ate in nice and delicious restaurants in town. You take a 7-10 minute shuttle ride to the beach. The beach was very nice with chairs and wait staff. We wanted to eat at the beach restaurant, just missed our timing, but it looked tasty and a great view. We recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Summary Heading: They cannot do too much for you...

They offer a shuttle to the beach, not private in that all Calf. beaches are public, but still very limited access for the public. Pools are nice and well kept, gym has enough to offer, and a good variety of places to eat.Although a bit pricy for some, well worth it. Make sure you get reservations. Turn down service each night, and they take good care of you... I would definitly go back and recommend to anyone.

Summary Heading: Diversity does spend a lot of money but not at the St.Regis anymore!

Service has Slipped – Check in is now more McDonald’s drive thru, Valet is timeless as in 45 min to retrieve a car, billing was a mess and still not resolved. The golf course is challenging (unfortunately I played during fairway aeration) and the greens ran true. The three holes that run along the Pacific are beautiful, to say the least. All in all a wonderful experience and we will be back.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotel I have ever been

Bed very very comfortable. Room service, Restaurants, bars, and SPA just excellent. We had several buffet lunch and the food was delicious.  Also getting in your room with classic music setup as default is priceless...

The room was a standard Starwood-type hotel room with nicer finish and appointments -- a cream, tan, and white color scheme with marble and leather. Summary Heading: Just what you hope for in a 5 star resort
Summary: From the moment the valet welcomes you by name to your departure they treat you as a special guest.  The front desk welcome you, and all the staff are gracious and caring.  The hotel sits on a bluff overlooking the ocean and you take the elevator down to your room.  I received a complementary upgrade to pool view and the room was great: spacious, well-appointed, quiet, all the necessaries, big bath with separate shower, plenty of marble counter space and separate WC.  I appreciated the morning coffee from the lobby shop that also had bagels, juice, etc for the guest on the run.  There were several restaurants and we chose the private (guest and member only) Monarch Bay Club for our business meeting dinner.  We were taken in a private tram across the links and down to the beach
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at the St. Regis, Monarch Beach on an annual basis for the past few years. The rooms are beautiful and are very comfortable. Unfortunately, it seems if service has deteriorated a bit over the past few years. Service is certainly very good, it just lacks some of the polish that other hotels in this category offer. Additionally, the gym has limited hours (closes at 8p), which is a bit surprising for a resort of this caliber. Both the Michael Mina and the casual restaurant are very good.   In the area, I would prefer to stay at the Ritz-Carlton or at the Montage.

We regret falling short on these aspects during your most recent visit, and hope to have an opportunity in the future to meet and exceed your expectations. Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, amazing grounds, decor, rooms
Summary: one of the most beautiful hotels i have visited.  the hotel is so well appointed and grand.  you feel like you are in the middle of a tropical resort in some far away location.  the rooms are so comfortable and beautifully appointed.  my room faced the gardens and not the pools or beach but it was wonderful.  the bar/restaurant was excellent for a late night snack. and glass of wine.  i was there for work, but cannot wait to go back for a vacation when it is warmer.  perfect for a romantic weekend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The St Regis was a great little getaway and has all of the luxury amenities you could want.  They have an incredible spa with complimentary fitness classes, gorgeous grounds, excellent food (at Motif!!) and great service.  It is truly all one can ask for.  We were bummed that Stonehill Tavern was closed during our stay (Monday and Tuesday nights) but Motif had great food for breakfast/lunch.  The rooms are clean and well appointed with everything you could need or ask for.  I forgot my toothbrush and was going to call down to housekeeping to send one, and noticed they had them right there in the room already.  We also left our cell phone charger at home and they had a ton to choose from to use that they lend out to guests. The only complaint I have is that the hotel was not even
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: LUXURY LUXURY LUXURY with a first-rate staff and wonderful array of amenities
Summary: I love staying at the St. Regis Monarch Beach whenever I am in the area on business or pleasure.  Everything about the St. Regis is designed to make guests feel like they are royalty.  My stay this past weekend proved this yet again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved it!  Often, stunning properties have forgettable rooms.  Let's face it - how many different ways can you dress up a bed, bathroom and closet.  Our room at the St. Regis was equally as spectacular as the grounds.  We had a large bathroom tastefully clad in travertine with separate toilet room and soak tub.  The room was well appointed and has a felt luxurious.  Sadly, I'm not a fan of the Heavenly Bed ...much to soft, and you can feel the coils.  The Hyatt Grand Bed is much more comfortable in my opinion.  Turn down service was also exceptional.  Robes, slippers, chocolates all thoughtfully placed.    Breakfast in the Motif was excellent as was the service.  The restaurant has a large terrace with ocean view.  The valet and bell staffs were the most efficient I have ever
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Look no further than the St. Regis, Monarch Beach
Summary: If your travel plans take you to Laguna Beach, the St. Regis Monarch Beach should be your choice.  This is one of the most beautiful hotels you will ever see. The pool, garden areas and walks down to the beach are amazing.  The restaurants are all fabulous and the staff is more than just efficient.  My husband and I have spent our anniversary at the St. Regis the past three years.  I don't think we will change this in the future!  Truly a wonderful full service hotel!    Don't miss this gem!

Summary Heading: Great hotel but the Ritz is better
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel a dozen times over the last few years and it's a great hotel. The Sunday Brunch is the best in orange county PERIOD! I recently stayed at the Ritz and we enjoyed it better than this resort, the location is right on the beach for the same price. We were upgraded to a very nice suite but we  we were looking at a mountain.  You can't go wrong with either hotel but if you're from out of town the view from the Ritz in my opinion is one of the best in california.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments about our incredible Sunday Brunch, offered weekly in Motif! I will be sure to share your comments with our executives and associates. We look forward to another visit from you soon.  Best, Executive Offices  The St. Regis Monarch Beach

Summary: When I last stayed at the St.Regis the experience lacked the 5 star feel as my review attests.  We were invited to have dinner at the Stonehill Tavern and decided to give the hotel another shot.  I was rather apprehensive given my prior experience but two years later things are vastly improved.    Check in smooth despite having a "trainee" handling things.  SPG Platinum status recognized, a warm welcome, "Executive Suite" upgrade and every courtesy extended to myself and my partner (well done, Bryan).  The "suite" was really just a very large room but it had a nice balcony and butler service.  This included welcome perks such as pressing and morning French Press coffee. The butler called to offer and list his services which was a nice touch.   Lovely (and abundant) toiletries,
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the kind words, and allowing us a second chance to make your stay with us truly 5-star. Your encouraging words will be shared with our executive staff and managers.   We hope you will revisit the resort soon! We look forward to your next stay. Summary: My husband and I were married here a year ago and returned for our first anniversary last weekend.  We had a suite that was to die for!  The butler service brought us french press coffee every morning and also pressed our dress clothes that were a mess from traveling.  The grounds here are perfect, nothing out of place and so beautiful!  Because it was our anniversary both the butler and concierge sent some champagne and chocolates to our room which was very appreciated!  The turn down service is great!  Sounds like a small thing, but truly, they thought of everything!  We had so much fun, we decided we would return every year!    The beach house was a fun place for a dinner with a great view of the sunset. The filet here was really awesome!    Can't wait to go back!

Summary: Stayed 4 nights at the St. Regis in October and had a wonderful time. The room was impeccable, I had my own balcony and loved having the doors open to let the fresh air and sunshine in while I worked. The bed was super-comfortable and I loved the modern room design. The bathroom was amazing, with a tiled shower and the best soaker tub ever. The room had shutters between the bedroom and the bathroom and they had a CD of lounge music playing on the audiosystem when I came in, so I had a few relaxing baths with the awesome mood music  (um, how about every evening, heh heh) housekeeping was impeccable and the turndown service is divine - what a pleasure to get in from my conference sessions dead tired and have a turned down bed, chocolates, bottled water and fresh flowers in the
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words and review of our resort. Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary!  It was a wonderful hotel and we enjoyed it!  The beach area was beautiful as well and everyone we encountered was very friendly and accomodating.  We were upgraded to a suite which was amazing!  They also surprised us with a fruit tray and wine because of our anniversary.  It was a great stay and it is definitely a place I would love to go back to again!

Summary: I attended a business conference at the St. Regis and was impressed with the hotel, grounds and golf course. The hotel is beautiful and upon arrival, I found a short wait (3 people checking in) and the concierge was right that apologizing for the delay. The wait was less than 2 minutes, but it was nice to have the attention.   Checking in was a breeze and since this was my first visit, the young lady at the check in desk walked me to the elevators to ensure I found them okay.   The room was spacious, bed comfortable and the balcony with two chairs was a nice change from normal hotels. Too bad I hit Dana Point during a winter storm, but I enjoyed leaving the door open to get fresh air into the room.  On down side to the room was it did not have a coffee pot. I am up early and had

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Uber expensive and odd beach setup
Summary: Stayed 3 nights in mid-October with my wife.  Huge Starwood fans, been to many Starwoods in Europe and Hawaii and annual visitors to the St. Regis Aspen.  The hotel is grand and luxurious; typical St. Regis.    Pros: The pool and surrounding grounds are beautiful.  Watched 3 weddings while we were there and were upgraded to a "pool/ocean" view.  Room was very nice.  Staff was gracious and friendly as usual.  Cons: Prices have gotten ridiculous ($300 for a bottle of Grey Goose vodka when you can buy it for $20 at CVS) and no free coffee, which is standard at all other St. Regis hotels.  Hotel appears to hold you hostage since "town" is a few miles away.  The $30/day to park is understandable...the $25/day "resort fee" is ridiculous.  The beach was a TOTAL DUMP!  There was a gross

Summary Heading: Relaxing weekend at the St. Regis
Summary: My wife and I were looking for a relaxing local weekend getaway with our 5 month old son and found the perfect place!  The hotel grounds are gorgeous, rooms are spacious and comfortable and the pool amenities luxurious.  The gym is one of the best in any hotel as well.  We especially loved taking the hotel shuttle (golf cart) down to the private beach club for brunch.  Although not located on the beach, this gorgeous property is located a short 5-10 walk away from PCH and beautiful public walking trails along the ocean.  The only negatives I would add are the exorbitant parking and resort fees.  Despite this, we will absolutely be returning someday soon.

Summary: I must preface this review by admitting that being part of a wedding party that had reserved a large block of rooms, we didn't pay the full price for our room.  The advertised rate is $450+, we paid $250...  Let's start w/ the negatives:  the walls are thin.  You don't hear voices as much as you hear plumbing:  If your neighbor runs a bath it sounds like the subway taking off in your room.  That's pretty much it for negatives.  Yes they have a resort fee, yes you pay for valet parking, yes the food is pretty pricey, but we've seen worse (hello Wynn & Encore...).  The bathrooms are fabulous, our bed was great, the rooms are large and tastefully decorated, and the service was outstanding (coming back from a jog, a bellman ran me down to hand me a water...).  The spa is quite large
Manager Response: none

The hotel also sent up a bottle of champagne and a long-stem rose to help celebrate the occasion. The employees we encountered were all very friendly and helpful. The spa was extremely nice, and both the treatment rooms and the common spaces are well above average, even for a high-quality resort.  All in all a great experience.

Summary: My husband surprised me with dinner at Motif for our 27th anniversary on 9/18.  To say it was the most amazing dining experience is an understatement.  I'm not the easist person to please (as my husband will attest...ha ha) and in this case I have nothing but positive comments.  The starter, entrees, wine and dessert were all five star.  Our waiter, Mark attended to our every need and made excellent recommendations on pairing starters with entrees, etc.  We can't wait to return (and I told my husband I'm not waiting a year to come back)!

In the last couple of years however, it dwindled down to just plain bad value, service, etc.  However, this most recent visit, we did notice a definite improvement in the service offered up at the outdoor lobby lounge.  We received probably the best service there this last time in a while.  The service was very good at Motif too, but it takes a little too long for the food to come out which doesn't work well while dining with young children.  The Sunday brunch was amazing, I highly recommend that.  The in-room dining has improved since last time, it was pretty good too. In regards to the rooms:  The rooms at this property

The pool in particular is very large and fitted with lounge chairs and cabana's.  Furthermore, it overlooks the Pacific and is very relaxing. Upon arrival, it was a cold hello & we arrived @ 3 30PM & the concierge said the room was not available w/ no remorse or water or a normal fruit basket how is always @ check in. We book through Amex, and all the other hotels always offer free upgrade. Also, through any Amex booking, they offer 100 credit at least towards a nice lunch or spa, BUT THIS St Regis Monarch Beach, towards a mini bar. We open the mini bar, I AM DISGUSTED. Summary: The hotel has gone way down hill in the last two years.  Here are just some of the things that are wrong:  They don't heat the little kiddie pool.  The beach is disgusting.  They don't pay to have the seaweed removed like a public beach does and so there are literally swarms of flies everywhere.  That combined with the cesspool of runoff water directly behind where the beach chairs are set up make the beach pretty foul.  There is also trash everywhere.  The Stone Hill Tavern has changed the menu and chef and as a result it is not even half as good as it used to be.  They charge you 30$ to park your car and another 20$ resort fee for things like internet - the latter  fee should just be included in the room price since you have no choice but to pay it even if you are not using

Summary: The St. Regis is a lovely, elegant hotel that is still great for kids. The property is gorgeous.  We live near by but decided to stay it so my husband could play golf. HERE IS MY TIP....book through Whatahotel.com.  They have the best rates and awesome perks.  A late check out was not one of the perks listed by Whatahotel, but I sent them an e-mail asking if one could be obtained. The best on the coast! Thanks to all the staff for the extra special attention. Margaret & Robert Kostka

Summary Heading: High expectations - poor experience - they do NOT deliver
Summary: I just checked into the St. Regis Monarch Beach... I had high expectations, and was excited to be here... I am a frequent traveler and booked this trip for my wife and me to get away for a week. I consulted with the Starwood Platinum Concierge, and the St. Regis in Dana point was described to me as a perfect hotel for my wife and me to really get away. I reviewed all the room types in detail with the Concierge and on the St. Regis Website, and settled on a St. Regis Suite because it offered 2 private balconies and lounge chairs. No complaints there. Our issue is that this is considered a five star hotel and this time they were lacking in a few areas.  We booked a pool view room and could not even see the pool from our room, but were told anything on this side of the building was considered "pool view".  That is a little deceiving if you ask me. Also, we booked a cabana and requested a certain location.  It was documented in the book, but the pool attendants didn't read the book and gave our request to someone else. Also, the last day, there was a very large event at the hotel for a surfboard company and the

Summary Heading: Another Great Vacation at St. Regis Monarch Beach
Summary: Doesn't get any better than this hotel!   1. Hotel is Beautiful 2. Staff is UNBELIEVABLE 3. Monarch Butterfly Release on Saturday night was breathtaking 4. Food is GREAT 5. Beach is pretty though lots of seaweed 6. This was our 2nd trip here and can't wait for our 3rd! 7.  Hotel sent fruit trays to our room one day and cookies another day. Love, love, love this hotel!

Summary: What would you expect with St. Regis.  The hotel ground and rooms were beautiful and service from everyone was impeccable.  They have a restaurant on the beach to dine as well as a full bar to have drinks on the beach.   But unfortunately  the beach is full of seaweed which attracts millions of flies.  We didn't stay long since the flies were all around.  Stick with the pool
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Unexpected Dog Waste on Grounds for this upscale hotel
Summary: Pets are allowed at the St. Regis Hotel.  But I was thoroughly shocked and utterly disgusted to have sighted dog waste on the lawn.  It was very unexpected for this caliber of a hotel.  I tried to look past it and had hoped that at least - those who do bring pets to the hotel, would at least pick up after their beloved pet or that the hotel maintenance would have picked it up.  When my husband and I took another walk the following day, it was disappointing to see that it was still there.   However, with all that said,  the St. Regis is grand in its own way.  It does have a good view of the ocean, even though it's not an oceanfront property.  You can hear the Pacific Coast Highway when you're sitting on the terrace or on the balcony. We had a room facing the Ocean Pool.  It's

Summary: This was our 2nd trip and will come again. Food pricey but expected. The check in was frustrating and expensive (for me). We called ahead (7 rooms) and were assured that we could get early checkin (2 p.m.) for a couple of the rooms. None of the rooms were available and I took 14 family members to the terrace for drinks and snacks (yikes!) where the service was poor (took 45 minutes for drinks and 75 minutes for the food). The rest of the trip was great - even with overcast. Highly recommend the Monarch Bay Club for dinner.

Summary Heading: Very nice stay. Staff very helpful.
Summary: We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary. Check-in was fast and pleasant. They delivered a bottle of bubbly to our room, and made our dinner (in the Stonemill) special. We had breakfast in the room and there was a mix-up, but it was sorted super fast and with the minimum of fuss.  The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was nicely appointed and always clean, and turndown had nice touches. The staff were all really helpful, especially down at the beach. We had a very nice relaxing stay and would recommend the hotel. The only thing I'm sorry we didn't do was pay for an ocean view. Definitely considering coming for another event.
